Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Plavlopetri are important. Some of the things we use today have been created by these three cultures. These things help us in our daily lives. Also, the things invented have helped change the world.            Discoveries that have been made by the Inca are important because they created a quipus to record the calandar and keep track of livestock. The Inca also left behind clues such as portraits that displayed their religion, art, architecture, agriculture, government, transportation and way of life. Lastly, the Inca were buried in caves in cliff faces so looters couldn't easily get to them. These discoveries that have been made of the Inca are important.            Discoveries that have been made by the Puebloans are important because the skills for basketmaking are still used today. The Puebloans learned how to make pottery and weapons by using their skills in basketmaking. The Puebloans also invented kivas. Kivas were underground chambers that were ceremonial rooms. This was similar to a church and helped Puebloans gather and make places to weave baskets. These discoveries that have been made of the Puebloans are important.            Discoveries that have been made by the Plavlopetri are important because without these discoveries, nobody would know about how a sunken city may have submerged. Archaeologists have discovered that the Plavlopetri had created over 9,000 square meters of new buildings. This suggested that the town had been used by an elite and raised the status of the settlement. Also, the settlement might have been sank by sea level changes, ground subsidence; earthquakes or a tsunami. These discoveries that have been made by the Plavlopetri are important.            These discoveries that have been made about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Plavlopetri are important. These discoveries have helped archaeologists make assumptions of the lives of these three cultures. These discoveries have also shown archaeologists how the lives of these three cultures were lived. This is why discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and the Plavlopetri are important.

Item_Response: We today often are learning things about history on a regular basis, but you may think, how do we know these things? It's simple, we learn things by either kept records, passed down stories, or in older cases, archeological discoveries.  Archeologists go to many ancient civilization settlements and make new discoveries almost everyday.  While some discoveries seem boring and not important, archeological discoveries are one of the main things that shapes the way we see the past and how we are now in the present.  These discoveries have given us information about a few specific civilizations, the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.  Foundings on these ancient civilizations are some of the very things that have created the way man-kind is today.         Many artifacts found in ancient civilizations show records; perhaps of stories or just some sort of writing.  For example, the Inca had no alphabet or form of writing, but they kept track of their livestock and made a calendar all using different colored string called quipus (Ancient Inca). The development of today's language could have very well started with strings the way that the Inca did.  Records about the Inca were also kept by the Spanish, who came to the empire in 1532; they wrote about the Inca in their language and much was learned about the Inca from just that.  To justify what was learned by the spanish cam from artifacts found such as pottery and textiles (Ancient Inca).  These artifacts could very well also show the development of tools and art throughout history and how we are today.        Discoveries about civilization can also effect how we and why we build houses and buildings the way we do today.  The Puebloans were ancient settlers in Mesa Verde, and were well know as skilled craftsmen and basket makers.  The Puebloans made certain types of houses called pithouses.  These houses have support beams and a fire pit with an air deflector (Mesa Verde).  In today's world we have kept a similar method of having good support and fireplaces and chimneys in our houses.  These pithouses later evolved into Kivas, these were very similar but a better design.  Both of these houses had a symbolic hole in the ground called a sipapu, that represented a passage to the underworld (Mesa Verde).       Much like how the symbolic passage to the underworld for the Puebloans, Archeological discoveries can explain myths and legends that we learn about in today's world.  For example, the discovery of the Pavlopetri perfectly explains the legend of the under water city Atlantis.  The Palvlopetri is a sunken settlement off the coast of Greece.  This settlement is likely to be one of the oldest sunken cities their is, with ceramics dating back to the stone age.  We have all heard the stories about a mythical Atlantis and this discovery explains why those stories came to be, just like many archeological discoveries guide us to how today's world is.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are so important because if we don't know anything about them then we wouldn't have some of the modern things we have today. We also wouldn't have some of the modern architecture because some of the buildings we have today are based off of the buildings they had.       The Inca were a very large empire. They rivaled the the expanse of ancient Rome. Some of the clues that the Inca left behind are a big 'window' to their lives. Stories were also passed down by the Europeans who took over the empire. The Spaniards were not very fluent in the Inca language so they may not have been very accurate with their stories of Inca history. Artifacts left behind are something else that give us some history. Pottery made of stone, silver, and gold lasted hundreds of years buried under ground; some were even found in graves for the dead to use in afterlife. Inca textiles and clothing also shockingly lasted just as long. Ancient cloth usually gets ruined by dampness, but these survived in the dry deserts of Peru or the cold Andes mountains.       About 1,400 yeas ago, Mesa Verde was chosen to be home for a group of native American peoples called the Puebloans or 'the ancient ones'.  For over 700 years they flourished in this area, building elaborate stone communities in the cannon walls. The Puebloans were known as basket-makers. Beginning as nomads they started to lead a more settled life. they replaced hunting with farming, and lived in small one room houses called pit-houses. Thel later began to build houses above ground out of poles and adobe. The baskets that they made show a decline in quality stating that the widespread use in pottery means less attention to the craft.       In the waters of Southern Grese a sunken settlement is thought to be the inspiration of the myth Atlantis. This site straddles 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor. the findings surpassed all expectations; there were buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures as well as thousands of shards from pottery. Then after exploration there were 9,000 more square meters of new buildings. Marine geologists have no idea why the city could have sunk: earthquake, tsunami, or just a rise in sea level. It is the firs sunken city discovered in Grece that predates the tale of Atlantis.

Item_Response: Museums today have the replicas of artifacts, information, and scenes in which historians have conjuered up to this present day about many different civilizations. Everybody learns about them and how they lived, more than one time. It starts out in elementary school, and the basics are taught. The men hunted, and the women sewed, because women were considered not as superior as men back then. In middle school, you get into a little bit more depth on how those people lived, and what they did in everyday life. In high school, you go deeply in depth on the ancient civilizations of America, that started out our country. Learning about these ancient civilizations are very important, because life today is very similar, but with more technology. People farm, cook, sew, ect. Some do it everyday, depending on the living. All 21st century kids should and do learn about the ancient civilizations of our country. All discoveries are important because they have led us to believe what we do believe today.       The discoveries of ancient artifacts on the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have shaped today's life as we know it.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri
Item_Response_Tag: DT NNP , NNP , CC DT NNP

Item_Response: Archeologists are people that study ancient things including    civilizations. Some important civilizations are the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. They are all important archeology sites.   Inca was one of these important places. Incas had no system of    alphabet or writing. They made quipus, knots made of colored string, that were used to record the calender and keep count of livestock. No one in the present knows how to read the  quipus. Some of what we know about Incas comes from stories passed from generation to generation. Some things we know because of the Europeans who visited the Inca empire in 1532, they described the Incas in letters and diaries.   Inca textiles and clothing have also survived. Other Inca sites    have been disturbed by looters that took anything of value. Looted sites don't offer much to archeologists.   Another important civilization was the Puebloans. They lived in   Mesa Verde , they lived there for 700 years building elaborate stone communities. They were skilled at making baskets and pottery. They farmed instead of hunting and gathering, and lived in small villages. They used alot of sand stone shaped into rectangular bricks. They deserted Mesa Verde by about 1300 AD. No one knows the reason that they left, but there are many theories.   The last important cililization was the Pavlopetri. This lost city that might have inspired the myths of atlantis. It was sunken 5000 years agoo, and it is the oldest submerged town in the world.

Three main civilazations were the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri civilations. Many things have been dicovered. I will now explain the civilations grew into the world we have today.         I will first begin stating facts about the Inca civilation. The Incas had no form of alphabet, and they loft no writings for the future. The Incas used colored strings as a calendar for their life stock proportions. Many grave sites were left for the dead to use in the afterlife. The Incas lived in the Andes moutains, which could be a problem for archeologists, because dampness could ruin the artifacts.         Next I will tell you about  the Puebloans. The Puebloans lived in Pithouses, which had some of the first chimeneys. They also had many forms of weapndry, like spears, bows, arrows. Also, many Puebloans lived in Kivas. Kivas were homes built with the overhangin of cliffs. This civilaszation used many natural resorces like: forests, soil animals, ect.         Last, but not least the Pavlopetri civilazation. This civilazation, was found sunken is Grease. Archeologists found that there were many courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structres. Also they discovered thousands of shards of pottery. The Pavlopetri was the real life insparation for Atlantis.         Many ancient worls have been discovered, and there artifacts have shaped our world today. The Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri civilazations have advanced our world. Item_Response: Ancient Civilization       Incas lived in ancient Peru during the years of 1438-1532. They had no writing system or education like we do today. They some left clues for scientists to discover. The clues left behind form their religion, art and architecture, government, agriculture, transportation, and ways of life. We know some stories from writings by the Europeans. Spanish soilders and priests also described the Inca in letters and diaries. The rest of our knowledge comes from artifacts discovered. These treasures have led to the facts we know about Incas.       Another group of people we know about are Puebloans. The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They were skilled in craft making. They were forming a more settled life style. Farming replaced hunting and gathering. They lived in pit houses clustered into small villages. By A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonary. Ancestral Puebloans lived in the cliff dwellings for less than 100 years. They migrated out of Mesa Verda due to drought and crop failure. The Pueblo people of today are descendants of the smart and strong Ancestral Puebloans.       A team of geologists have found an under sea city in Greede called Peloponnese. They had found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age. Their investagations also revealed over 9000 square meters of new buildings. They still haven't figured out why the settlement sank. The team says, 'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going. Less than 1 percent pf the world's ocean floors have been surveyed. This is an extraordinary find but there is still a lot more down there that has to be found.'       If it wasn't for these teams for discovering and testing out these lost places we would know nothing about. Anicient civilization is very interesting. Finding more and more never explored places is fascinating and scary. That's what keeps them going and trying to succeed. Their hard work is what educates us today. Also our Ancestrys' hard work led us to the technology we have today.

Item_Response: Ancient Archeology   On Source #1 it says, 'The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing.' It talks about the systems the past had. They did not leave any form of history to study. 'The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calender to keep count of livestock.' The first Europeans were so amazed that the Inca could  run a large empire using strings to keep records. Today no one knows what the knots meant. 'Some of what we know about the Inca comes from oral history...'        The reason we know some of the old stories, because they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. 'The Inca lived high in the Andes and may even have worwshiped some mountain peaks. Many of their sites are in remote, high places. Some Inca were buried in caves in cliff faces, for example, or on mountain tops. This has helped to preserve the sites, because looters cannot easily get to them. But it also makes the job of the archaeologist more difficult. High-alltitude archaeologists are expert mountaineers. They have to carry all their equipment up a mountain before they can start work. Anything they find has to be carried down the mountain for study. The cold mountains act like a giant freezer. Bodies found in the icy Andes are in such good shape that experts can use modern edical scanning equipment to learn about how the people died. The bodies also reveal information about how they lived.'       Section #2 says that the first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. There were people that lived in pithouses from about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750, as settled agriculture began .        'Ever since local cowboys first reported the cliff dwellings in the 1880's, archeolagists have sought to understand these people's lives.' 'Fires built in summer were mainly for cooking.In winter, when the alcove rooms were damp and uncomfordable, fires probably burned throughout the village. Smoke-blackened walls and ceilings are reminders of biting cold these people lived with for several months each year.       Section #3 is about exploring the underwater worlds. The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myth's - The fable of Atlantis - have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Grrece. The seas have been explored by many people. ' There is no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' Said Dr Jon Henderson

Item_Response: The Disccoeveries that the Inca, Pavlopetri and the Puebloans have made are very important to our ancient past. They all made great inventions and this is how we can learn where our inventions today came from. In these next paragraphs you will learn how we learned so much about these ancient Civilazations even though they did not even have a written language!                 The First topic I will be talking about is how we learned so much about the ancient Inca. The Inca didn't even have a written language or any archives for historians to study from. Some stuff we learned by stories getting passed down from generation to generation.  Also there were pictures that the spaniards could predict ver y well what they meant. Unfoutunatley the Inca empire vanished in 1532 because the spaiards killed the Inca king. Now it is very hard to trave what happened after words. Item_Response: The discoveries about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavloperti are so important because it tells us about how they lived back then and what they did for food or for war. The studies in the article at the right talk about archaelogists have found there house and dead bodies that are still in good shape and also about how the lost greek city isnt lost but is found.             The Inca had no formal alaphabet when they wrote or no system of writing. They made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calender date to keep the livestock. The spaniards didnt speak the inca language well, they may not have understood there discriptions making them un-accurate. The rest of our knowlege comes from acient Inca artifacts left behind in the civilizations. There bodies have been said to be found in good shape, and the archaeologists revealed information about how they lived.             The Puebolans first settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages bulit on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. They were basketmakers and their population multiplied because they were to prosperous. In about A.D. 750 they started to begin buliding houses above ground with walls make of poles and mud. Ancestrial Puebloans lived in the cliff dwellings for less than 100 years. By about A.D. 1300, Mesa Verde was deserted. This was because of drought and crop failure.               Finally, the Pavloperti were located in the acient city of greece. The sunken settlements dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heros and in term size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts say. This is the oldest submerged town. The site which straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor southern the Peolponnese, is believed to have been comsumed by the sea around 1000 BC. It is the first time a sunken city has been founded in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken conitent of Atlantis.               These three groups of people are important about the discoveries by the archaeologist because they all had to do with history and how they were all discoverd and discovere by.

Item_Response: Some children these day think they have life rough. Well try living in a agricultural town where there is no power, no cars, and no elctricity. The archeologists and historians are working hard to figure out the ancient Inca tribe of Peru. What these scientists already know is that the inca doesent have an alphebet system. They also don't have any archives for historians to use.       Understanding the Inca is kind of like a mystery. There lives on earth are nearly impossible to know of because there are hardly have any records. They survived nearly one hundred years on there own and ruled over the south american empire. With that one hundred year domaine came religon, art, agruculture, goverment, transportation, and a new way of life.       As some of you may know, the Inca people were very creative people. Most of the antiques left behind are old artifacts, and objects mostly made out of items like gold silver, and stone. These very rare artifacts were mostly found inside anceint Inca buildings, and inside of the dead poeple grave to carry with them to the past life to play with.       The archeologists work effortlessly each day to find out more and more about the Inca tribe. The archeologists keep careful notes, and take photographs of every thing they see and write down the exact same spot they found it. They learn as much as possible so they can be able to understand the Inca tribe. They also Read  ancient drawings and try to see if that is how the inca communicated.       Finally, the most inportant thing about the Incas is what happened to it. In fifteen thirty two the spaniards mudered the last Inca king, and took over his empire. This is why the incas are so hard to trace. The area where they lived had long been inhabited by many different people. And the Inca tribe will be no more.       In conclusion, There are many different cultures and cities that once lived in the ancient world, but by far the Incas are the most unique. The are also the hardest to record because they couldnt read or write. There culture and art surpases all others who came before and after. the Incas left behind a great legacy. Item_Response: The inca of peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing.They did not leave archvies for hitorians.The first europeans to meet the inca were amazed that they could run  ah uge empire using strings to keep a count of livestock.Clues left behind by the inca form an amazing portrait of their religion art and architecture agriculture government transportation and way of life.By  studing these clues archaeologists and others can piece together details of inca life.               They are known as the basketmakers for their skill at the craft.Formerly nomadic they were brginning to lead a more settled way of life.Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood.They lived in pithoues clusted into small villages usually bulit on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses.They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower.These were fairly prosperous times for the basketmakers and their population mutiplied.They built the houes one against another in long curing rows often with a pithouse or two in front.           The sits which staddles 30000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern peloponnese is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 bc.Although dis covered by the british oceanographer some 40 years ago it was only this year that the marines archaeologists aided by the digtail technology were able to properly survey the ruins.What they found surpassed all expections.Thanks to shifting sands and the settlersments enclosure in a protected bay, the explortion revealed a world of building, courtyards, main streets ,rock-cut tombs and religious structures.In addition the seabed was replete with the thousands of shards of pottery.

Item_Response: Have you ever realized why the discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important? They are important because they make things we use today.

Item_Response: All of the discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri people have been very important to our world geography history. It teaches us about what the people before us did, and maybe, we can learn just a little from them. I've learned a lot from my research, and I hope you do too!            The discovery of the Inca people wasn't very surprising, but it was very important. We know about their past because of the weather, believe it or not. Peru's dry coast or the cool mountains of the Andes preserved any artifacts that were left behind for archaeologists to find, and Spanish people passed down information of the Inca people's oral past. Nobody can really rely on it, though because the Spaniards did not speak the language of the Inca. Some Inca sites have been disturbed by looters, though. All in all, despite some setbacks, the Inca sites was a fantastic discovery.            The Mesa Verde National Park preserves amazing, ancient information that happens to be quiet important. The Puebloans lived in tiny pithouses that were clustered into towns, and they relied on farming. From what any clues that were left behind tell us, the Puebloan people were formerly nomadic, and they were looking for a more settled lifestyle. The Puebloans were important to history because they made numerous weapons that seemed to be very useful. Do you know anything about the Puebloans?            Last, but certainly not the least, the Pavlopetri people were, in my opinion, the most interesting. In Greece, a submerged city was found by Pavlopetri people. Without them, this sunken Greece city wouldn't have be found when it was. I always thought sunken cities were just a myth. Maybe Atlantis could be real!            All in all, the findings of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri people have been an amazing discovery. It's just one more thing to add to the history book. Finally, answers were found. We don't have to worry about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetris people's history any longer.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations       Ancient Inca   The ancient Inca, found in Peru, doesn't have any formal system of writing. Instead they use colored strings and knots to communicate and keep records. Today nobody truly knows about what these quipus, colorful strings and knots, mean. Even though we don't know what the quipus means, we do know other interesting information about the Inca. We know things like religion, art, agriculture, government , transportation and way of life. We know some of the information we know from the Europeans who had written down stories in letters and diaries of what the Inca were like, when the Europeans first arrived in the 1532. Historians had to be careful when reading these letters and diaries because the Europeans did not speak the Inca language and may have misunderstood what the Inca had said. Other knowledge about the history of the Inca comes from artifacts, and other objects that they left behind. Most of the Inca textiles were preserved int eh dry deserts on the Peru coast or in the cold Andes mountains. Some of the Inca sites were ruined by treasure hunters or looters, who take anything that they might think is valuable. Looted sites do not tell archaeologists very much, because non-looted sites give the best idea about the life of the Inca, because nobody has moved or touched anything. This is also why when archaeologists study sites they photograph and write down the exact position in which they find artifacts. Artifacts from the Europeans shoe that the Inca fell in 1532 when the Spaniards murdered the Inca king and took over the empire. Other artifacts that were found are harder to trace to the Inca because after the Inca had fallen to the Spaniards many different peoples had lived in the same area as them. Archaeologists do know that the Inca lived high places like the Andes mountains and the Inca even worshiped some mountains peaks. The Inca were also buried in high places such as, cliff faces, caves, and mountain tops. Because the Inca liked to live in high elevated areas, this actually helped archaeologists because looters cannot easily get to the sites and also because the mountains like a big freezer. Any body that was found was in good shape that they could use modern medical scanning ans equipment to learn how the person had died, and how they lived daily. This also made the archaeologists jobs more difficult because archaeologists would have to carry all their equipment up to the site before they could start to work, also anything they found would have to be carried down the mountain so it could be studied closer.       Ancestral Puebloans   Close to 1,400 years ago, people that were living in the Four Corners region moved to Mesa Verde. For about 700 they lived and flourished here. They built stone communities in canyon walls and beneath overhanging cliffs.Which is now preserved in Mesa Verde National Park. Archaeologists have called people who lived in these communities Anasazi, which is Navajo word for 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies' and are now called Ancestral Puebloans. A Puebloan is a Spanish word for village dwellers. These people were also known as the basketmakers because of their skill and craft for basket making. They aslo had skill for making pottery and acquired the bow and arrow. They farmed, hunted, and gathered as a way to get food for their families. They lived in pithouses that clustered into small villages that were usually built on mesa tops and in cliff recesses. In 750 A.D. the Basketmakers started to build houses above ground. These houses were agianst each other in long, curving rows. They usually had one or two pithouses in front of their actual house. By 1000 A.D. the Mesa Verde people had advanced to stone masonry. Walls on buildings were thick, double-coursed, rose two or three stories high and joined into units of fifty rooms and sometimes more. These walls are regarded as the finest ever built by the Mesa Verde. During this time, pottery also changed. It changed from smiple designs and gray background to black drawings on a white background. Farming was big during this time as well. Farming accounted for more of their deit than ever before and much of the mesa-top land was cleared for farming. Baskets declined in quality, possibly because the use of pottery was higher that meant less interest in baskets at the time. In about 1200 A.D. the people of the Mesa Verde moved back onto/into cliffs alcoves that homes the ancestors many centuries before. The structures of the cloff dwellers are evidence of a society that over centures gained many skills and traditions and passed them through the generations. By the Classic Period the population reached several thousand.  This is also whent he accomplishmants of the Mesa Verde had among the finest expressions of human culture in North America.   In the beginning the basic material for construction was sandstone. They shaped the sandstone into rectangular blocks, the size of a loaf of bread. In between the blocks were a mixture of maud and water. They stacked these block on top of each other, and aside each other to make rooms. These rooms averaged about six feet by eight feet, there was room for about two or three people. In the upper levels the generally stored crops. The underground rooms were ceremonial chambers, and eventually front rooms. Their roofs created open courtyards where daily routines took place. In the summer, they built fires to cook. In the winter,  fired burned throughout the village. Smoke from the fires blackened walls and ceilings.   Around 1300 A.D., Mesa Verde was deserted. Theories why they moved were: migration,  drought and crop failures, land and resources were depleted, and social and political problems took place. When the cliff dwellers left they traveled south into Arizona and New Mexico.       Lost Greek City   The lost Greek city is located of the waters of southern Greece and known as the oldest submerged town int eh world. This sunken settlement dates back to 5,000 years ago and consumed by the water around 1000 BC. It has artifacts dating back from 2800 to 1200 BC. The lost Greek city lays on 30,000 aquare meters of ocean floor. The shifting sands and the settlement's encosure in a protected bay help to save most buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, pottery and religious structures from being destroyed. Many think that this cite sank because of sea level changes, earthquakes, or tsunami.

Item_Response: I believe that learning about these ancient civilizations is important because we can study how people lived then, compared to how people live now, and the millions of advances humans have made over time.       Not much is known about the Inca's, but we do have some clues about their art, religion, architecture, government, transportation, and way of life. An example of this would be the Inca way of keeping records by tying knots in colorful string. This is a very advanced way of keeping track of things for such an ancient civilization. Another clue we have about the way these people lived and how they built things out of stone, pottery, gold or silver. Scientists have also found remains of clothing that have survived remarkably well because they were preserved in the deserts of Peru, or in the high altitude of the Andes mountains. After the Spaniards murdered the king in 1532, the Inca's became more hard to trace. Even though the Inca's lived a long time ago, they were still very advanced for their time, and we can learn a lot from the, about how humans developed strategy and learned to make life easier for themselves.       The Puebloans are known epically for their talents in basket making. They were nomadic but over time started to settle and farm. The Puebloans were very skilled and learned to make pottery and the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting. Their populations multiplied quickly, and they learned to make houses and walls out of poles and mud. The Puebloans however never left any written records of their life, it is epically hard for scientists to learn about why they moved around so much. The Puebloans were also good at building, such as their famous Kivas, which were used for religious purposes and rituals. The Puebloans were extremely advanced in their building techniques and we can learn so much about how they came up with ways to improve life for themselves.       As you can see, it is very important for us to learn about how people lived in ancient times, and how humans developed over times.

Item_Response: In ancient times, people had some strange ways of recording their lives and history. Many people, such as the Inca's, used things called quipus to record their way of life. Now, this may have been alright then, but now, we can't read their quipus and archiologists have to rely on the artifacts that had been left and well preserved so that we can understand how they lived. Many places all over the world have lots of artifacts that have been preserved in ice, water, and even the dry deserts.       Archiologists have found artifacts all over the world from Greece, to South America. In Greece, in the past 40 years someone has found a lost city sunken off their southern waters. This city is home to remains dating from 2800 BC to 1200 BC. The whole city covers 30,000 square meters of ocean floor! Its crazy that archiologists can tell all these things simply from the way the artifacts have been preserved.       Another place that archiologists have found artifacts was in Mesa Verde. In Mesa Verde archiologists have found little houses called pithouses that the Puebloans used to live in. These, like the lost city, have been preserved by the desert. Along with the pithouses and remains of the city, archiologists have found weapons, pottery, baskets, gold and silver, buildings, and even bodies! It is extremely fortunate that these have been preserved because without them, we wouldnt know exactly how these people lived or even if they ever existed, but with them so well preserved we have been able to find out so much about them.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the ancient civilizations have been a great importance. They were a great importance because we can learn all the ways they were able to stay together as a civilization.       The Incas were a very great empire that lasted for about a hundred years. For that time most civilizations did not last that long or joined another people. The Incas though, did not leave writing for historians to research. This makes it difficult for us to know much about certain events that happened to them. Because of the way they did things, like living in mountains, their bodies get preserved and sometimes we find them and can find out what happened to them. We also found out information about the Puebloans at Mesa Verde National Park.       The Puebloans were an ancient people that were settled in North America but then later moved to another part of the world. These people seemed to be a farming people which took much of their time instead of gathering and farming like most ancient people.These people also were able to make the bow and arrow which shows there great minds and intelligence. They would use nature to their advantage, too, by building their houses on the tops of cliffs. Though people don't know why the Puebloans left, scientist have theories that they tried to find new opportunities elsewhere.       The last ancient city, or civilization I will talk about is the lost city of Atlantis. Most people would think that this is a myth but scientist now have new light on the subject. A team of Anglo-Greek archaeologists have found some sunken settlements that have proved an underwater civilization. The city is believed to have been consumed around 1000 B.C. All there buildings, streets, and religious buildings are show under water which can tell us today how we could build certain things to help our cities. This also gives scientist an idea of how waters affect the land.       These discoveries give a very great importance. They give us information on how we could or shouldn't do things to help us. They also give scientist a pretty could idea of how the Earth can change and how humans have evolved over the past years. Sites like these are very good places to remember how far we have come in society and they show how lucky we are today to have these things.

Item_Response: Have you ever wondered how archaeologists find out about ancient civilizations when ancient civilizations didn't even document their life? It is quite challenging for archaeologists because sometimes there isn't another person alive who knows the languages of these people or there isn't a language for these people. So how do you suppose archaeologists figure this out? There are a couple of way that they do this. The ways aren't always simple but they are very effective.            In the ancient Inca civilization, there area couple of ways to figure out how they lived.  One way is by these colorful knots they left called quipus. Archaeologists have yet to figure out what they mean so this part is a bit of a puzzle to the archaeologists. Art is another way to figure out how they lived. The Inca were very big on forming portraits on religion, art, agriculture, architecture, government , and how they lived. Also, the Inca told stories among themselves and in 1532, Europeans came and wrote down the stories. Unfortunately, the Europeans didn't speak their language very well so not all the stories were correct. The final way archaeologists found out about the ancient Inca was artifacts. Artifacts made from stone, pottery, gold and silver have been found.            The Puebloans were another ancient group that archaeologists have a had a bit of trouble finding out. They were easier to figure out than others. The Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde, or the green table, which was in the Four Corners area. They also didn't write any records so its hard to figure out how they lived. Archaeologists have found ancient Puebloans' kiva. A kiva is a ceremonial room that they used to use as churches. They were places to gather and also places for weaving. Archaeologists have also found that ancient Puebloans lived under overhanging cliffs. These had an advantage for every season. Studies show that today's Pueblo people may be descendants of the ancient Puebloans.             In conclusion, archaeologists have a very hard job, but they all do it fairly well. They use all their resources and usually figure out the puzzle. Even if they have one little clue, they are still able to figure it out.

Item_Response: Archeology Unlocks The Secrets                         The ancient Inca of peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing,  and they do not leave historians to study. The first Europians to meet the inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Archoelogists have found many ancient quipis but today no one knows what the knots mean. Passing on the stories was an important way to peserve a community's history. Historian have to be careful when they interpret these account.the spaniards did not speak the inca language well. They may not have understood what the Inca told them, so thier descriptions might not be accurate. Some of the Inca stories were legends rather than history.                            The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts, or objects that they left behind, and from the sites where artifacts are found. As many ancient civilizations, Inca artifacts might be objects made from stone, pottery, gold, silver. Materials last a long time, even if they have been buried for hundreds of years. Artifacts turn up in the ruins of buildings. Others are found buried in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife.                      Some treasure were taken centuries ago, but looting still goes on today. Looted sites often do not tell archeologists very muvh. Sites are reported to archeologists, who can dig them up carefully. They provide the  best idea of all about life in peru before and during Inca rule. Archeologists  who study these sites keep careful records. They write down and phtograph any artifcats they find, and note the exact position in which they find them, and they need to learn as much information as they can from every single piece of evidence. An Archeologists can compare what they learn from the artifacts and sites with the spaniards account of the Inca. Archeology confrims historical  records. The most important things to learn about the civilizations are where it came from and what happened to it. The fall of Inca is easy to date because the spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire. The orgins of the Inca are more difficult to trace. The area where they lived had long been inhabited by different peoples. Archeologists have to be careful to make sure  exactly which people built which site.                       An Archeologists use some of the most advanced techniques in the world to discovered more about the Inca's predeccessors. Photography can help them find patterns in ancient monuments that they canoot see from the ground. The Inca lived high in the andes and may eve have worshiped some mountain peaks. Many of their sites are in remote, high places. Some Inca were buried n caves in cliff faces, for example, or on mountain tops. This has helped to preserve the sites , because looters cannot easily get to them, but it also makes job of the archeologist more diffucult . high altitude archeologists are expert mountaineers. They have to carry all their equipment up a mountain before they can start work. The cold mountains act like a giant freezer. Bodies found in the icy andes are in such good shape that experts can use modern medical sacnning equipment to learn about how the people died. The bodies also reveal information about how they lived                       In the future archeologist will use more techniques in the worl to discover more about the Incas predeccessors.

Item_Response: The discoveries made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri civilizations were very important discoveries. These discoveries were made for our benefit. One reason why these discoveries were important was so we can learn more about our past history. Another reason is so we can learn more about the past and how things have advanced since these ancient civilizations. My last reason why I think these discoveries are important is because we can learn how to make our society better so we do not become like these ancient civilizations and die out.                My first reason why I think these discoveries were important is because we can learn more about our past history. We can learn about their way of live like how they lived, what they did, etc. So this way we can have more knowledge about the past and learn form it. And if more discoveries are made about these civilizations, then we as people will have endless and more knowledge about the Inca, the Puebloans, and Pavlopetri civilizations.                My second reason why I think these civilizations are important discoveries is so we can learn from our past and how we advanced since then. We can learn about how things have changed and how we advanced since these civilizations died out. We can learn about how inventions during that time period have been improved and how we use these inventions now. We can also learn about their inventions that we do not use today and see if there is a way to make that invention better and see if there is a way we can use it today in our society.               My last and final reason why I think these discoveries are important finds is so we can learn how we can make our society better than the Incas, the Pueoblans, and the Pavlopetri civilizations, so we do not die out like their society. We can learn from their mistakes and make sure that our society do not make the same mistakes and die out like theirs. For example, if they make a bad choice and that is the reason why they died out, then we have to be smart and not make the same choice as they did. Lastly we can build off of their bad choices and mistakes so our society can grew and not die out like theirs.               In conclusion, the discoveries made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri civilizations were important finds. I think these discoveries were made so we can benefit from them. I have reasons why these were important discoveries. My first reason is so we can learn more about our past. My second reason is so we can learn from their civilizations and how things have advanced since these time. My last reason why i think these were important discoveries is so we can learn form their mistakes and make our society better.

Item_Response: When you think of ancient civilizations, what do you think of? Do you picture a Native American setting, or do you think of some indigenous tribe? Today I will be writing about some ancient civilizations and how they are important to today's life. I will specifically be writing about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.        The Inca are a very intelligent race. They have been credited with creating a system of counting by tying knots on a string, growing crops on terraced mountains, and building roads in the sides of mountains. They left behind many clues of their legacy, and archaeologists have been studying them for a long time. Some of these discoveries include descriptions of the Inca by European soldiers and priests, Inca pottery and gold, clothing, and building structures. This is very important because we discovered a whole new way of life: a whole new government, transportation, art and many other things. This could influence how we think, and how the human race slowly became more civilized with the ideas of great people.        The Puebloans are known as great architects who built ingenious buildings on top of mesas. They lived by farming and hunting, as many Native American tribes did, and recorded their history through drawings. The discovery of these people are very important because it introduced new ideas of how to live. We learned how they built their homes, and the meanings of their pottery. We still have much to learn about them, like why the left Mesa Verde, but we have learned so much from what they left. They also showed us that living in a rough terrain is definitely possible.                                    Probably one of the most advanced civilizations known to man is the Pavlopetri. Although the sunken city of Atlantis was most likely a myth, a discovery of an underwater city could prove that this is true. The Pavlopetri have been discovered to be very intelligent in their architechture. They built many buildings, streets, and religious structures. This shows that they had their own way of life. I think it is a very important discovery because it could prove several myths true. I also think it could lead to new things being discovered like a different way of life or new ideas that have been buried under the water for centuries.          All of these discoveries are very important. They show patterns of how their life could slightly influence how we live our life. It is amazing to see the different ideas and ways of life are all connected if we look at it the right way. Thank you for taking the time to read my paper.

Item_Response: The discoverys made by archaeologists are so important to our world and everything that we know today.The reason for all the knowledge we have learned are from three key civilizations the Inca,Puebloans and pazlopetri.These civilizations have helped us Americans learn what it is like to be an artist , a constructor.                   The Inca have helped us out in a lot of ways. They were the artistic type of civilization that struck rich with its makeings. The reason we know this is from all the looters that have raided there tombs and have found art work that should go to the after life. We also know that they were a civilazation that was also dominate and did not trust anybody thats why they lived in the  Andes.They lived in caves in side of the mountain becuase we have found bodys that have been preserved their for more than a century.               Puebloans are a civilazation of movement and like to make change in day to day life. We have found out that they use to live in a type of house call pithouses. A pithouse is a really small house it consits of a 'living rom sunk a few feet in the ground.Four corner timbers supported the roof, and had a firepit an air deflector .' They used these types of houses becuase they were easy to pack up and go when it was time to. We also know that they loved to develop new creations or make an upgrade to an old. When they made a Kiva it took the same old idea of the pithouse but remodeled it to make it fumction better than the old one did. We have found this out through the types of writing that they have left behind. We also can tell 'they lived in the cliff dwellings for less than 100 years.' After that they moved south to Arizona And some to New Mexico settling among their kind who where already there.           We also know about the loss city of Atlantis that is on the bottom of the ocean floor. The way we learn from this not to have a city that is basicly floating on top of water because it can erode away the most part of the foundation that is sitting their. We can also learn about the way 'The  city looked like by finding peaces of the town pice by piece left behind that we could pin together that we found on the ocean floor'.       This is important to us becuase it gives us some ways it was like back then. Even though we will never know exactly what happend or the journey they alll took by finding new information about them we can learn alot about there past and the way thre Civilization worked

Item_Response: nnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO                                                             nooot

The Inca left some clues behind show amazing portraits of their lives like their religion, art, architecture, agriculture, transportation, and their ways of living. Studying these clues some archaeologistt are able to piece together some of Inca life.Some old stories are told about the IInca, by Europeans who arrived in their empire in 1532 and described them in their diaries and lettters.       most of our knowledge  about the inca come from artifacts, or objects that they have left behind. In many ancient civilizations the Inca artifacts might be objects that are made from stone, pottery, gold, or even silver. Even though they have been buried for hundreds of years some of these magnifacent artifacts turn up in the ruins of buildings. Others are found buried in graves of the dead for them to use in their after life.       Some ancient textiles and clothing have also been found and havbe survived remarkably well. Some materials like cloth were usually destroyed by dampness, but these items were preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coast or the cold mountains of the andes.But sadly some inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters. they will take anything that is valuable.Most of the treasures were taken centuries ago, but looting still goes on today.       The fall of the Inca is easy to date back because the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and then soon after toook over the empire. The origons of the Inca however are much more difficult to trace because the area where they live had long been inhabited by many different people.They lived high in the Andes and may have even worshiped some mountain peaks.Many of their sites are in remote , high places. Some Inca were buried in caves in cliff faces. But ths has helped preserve the sites , because loooters can't easily get to them.       The high mountains are vey cold, so cold that they act as a giant freezer. Bodies are found in the icy Andes are in such good shape that experts can use modern medical scanning equipment to learn how the people died. the bodies also reveal information about how they lived.                Long ago about 1,400 yaers ago Europeans explored North America. A group of people lived there in the Four Corners religon chose Mesa Verde for their home. For over 700 years they and their decendants live and flourished here,eventually building building elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. Then, in the late A.D 12000s, in the span of a gereration or two, they left their homes and moved away.       Mesa Verde national park preserves a spectacular reminder of this ancient culture.Archeologists have called these people Anasazi, from a Navajo word sometimes translated as 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies'. We now calll them the Ancestral Puebloans, reflecting their modern descendants.       The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They are also known as 'Basketmakers' for their skill at crafts.Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pithousees clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. they learned to make pottery and acquired th bow and arrow, a more efficient wepon for hunting than the altatl , a sper thrower.       About A.D. 750 they began building houses above gorund, with up right wallls made of poles and mud. They built the houses one against another in long, curving rows, often with a pithouse or evn two in front. From here on these people are known as puebloans, a spanish word meaning 'village dwellers'. 1000 A.D the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Walls of thick , doubled-coursed stone often rose twoor three stories high and were joined together into units of 50 rooms or more. Pottery also changed , form simple designs on a dull gray background to black drawings on a white background. Farming accounted for more of their diet than before, and much mesa-to land was cleared for agriculture.       A.D 12000, another major population shift saw people begin to move back to the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors centuries before. Why did they move ? we dont really now why. Perhaps it was for defence; perhaps it was a religious or psychological reasons.Or whatever the reason or reasons, it gave rise to the cliff dwellings for which Mesa Verde is mot famous.       When the clifff dwellers of Mesa Verde left, they traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona, settling among their kin who were already there .       .    The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the most enduring myths- the fable of Atlantis- have been brought to light beneath the waters off southern Greece. this site, which strattles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Pel0oponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 B.C. What they found surpassed all expectations.       Thanks to the shifting of sand and the settlement's enclousure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world. A world of buildings , court yards,main streets , rock-cut ombs and religious structures. In addition, the seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery.       Marine geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank.Theories include sea level changes , ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami.       'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps under water explorations going ' said Sakellarious. ' this is and extrordinary find but there is still alot more down there that has to be found'.

Item_Response: Importance in Discovery               The discovery made in the ancient civilizations of the Inca, the Publoans, and the Pavlopetri are so important beacuse they can tell us whether they had believed in a god or in many gods. they can tell us how they lived either as slaves or as kings. We need to knwo whether they were a real ancient civilization or just a myth.                Some archaeologists who study special places find many different things such as the things that belonged to Inca civilization who's remains and artifacts were found in Peru. Form some of the artifacts the scientist have found, they have concluded that that the Inca had no formal alphabet or any system or writing. Scientists were amazed when they had found out that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Some of they Inca textiles and clothing have survived remarkably well concidering all the time that has passed and all the weather that has probably erode it a bit. From just the Inca we have learned so much in how people used to live back in that time.                 Another civilization that has helped us understand more anout the past is the Puebloans. The Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde (Spanish for 'green table') on 550 A.D. They lived in pithouses from 550 A.D to about 750 A.D. By 1000 A.D they had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Between 1000 A.D and 1300 the population had reached several thousands, that helped us understand that they had reproduced pretty quickly making it into a pretty big civilization. Using nature to their advantage they had built the dwellings in the sides of clifts. This shows us that they we pretty advanced in intellegence. Puebloans were pretty advance as a civilization also helping us more in understanding the life of the past.                   One more civilization that helped us understand the past are the Pavlopetri. The investigations that the archaeologists have made is that there are over 9,000 square meters of new buildings but what really surprised them was  hte discovery of a possible megaron, a monumental  structure with a rectangular hall, which suggests that the town had been used by an eite. Scientist have yet to discover why  the settlement had sank  but it might be one of the oldest dating back 5,000 years. Item_Response: Archaeologists today know that the Ancient Inca Peru have no formal alphabet or a system of writing. The Inca of Peru people did not leave any archives for the people who study the Inca of Peru. The archaeologists say that the Inca of Peru people made kntts in colored strings called quipus to recored the calander to keep a count of there livestock. The Europeans that were first to meet the Inca of Peru people were amazed that they could run a huge empire just using colorful strings to keep records. The people who study the Inca people found many ancient colored strings (quipus)- but he people who study the Inca people stil do not know what the knotts on the quipus means. The people who study the Inca people say with out any one who knows what the knotts and the strings on the quipus mean, then it is like solving a big mystery.       How do we know about the civilization that is nearly a hundred years (1438-1532) ruled a South American empire that rivialed the expanse of ancient Rome? There was clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of there religion, art and architecture, agiculture, government, transportation, and the way of life. If the people who study on the Inca's study there clues, archaeologists and other people can piece together details of the Inca of Peru people.       The things that we know about the Inca people comes from oral history, or stories passed down through generation to generation. Passing down stories was important to the Inca people because it was a way to preserve a community's of history.       The way we know about some of the stories of the Inca people is because the stories were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The people who visit were Spainish soldiers and priests. They explained the Inca people by writing letters and by diaries.       The people who study things have to be careful when they interpret these accounts. The spainish soldiers did not speak the Inca language as well as the Inca people did. The spainish soldiers may not know what the Inca people were saying, but they understood wht the Inca told them, so their descriptions might not be accrurate. Some of the Inca people's stories were legends rather than history.

Item_Response: Inca, ancient Inca of Peru is a mystery to mankind. This article will take you on a journey to explore the wonders of Inca. Know their alphebet, their calendar, and their religion.        The Inca never had an official alphebet or system of writing at all. They left nothing for modern historians to study or read. So that means they really did not have documents either. They left nothing!        Ancient Inca did have a calendar though. They made knots in various colored strings called quipus. That was used as a calendar and also to keep track of their livestock. Many historians and Archaeologists have found quipus but they can not seem to find out what they mean.        The Inca left many clues that can open up a window to their religion. But so far, Archaeologists still does not understand much about their religion.        The Inca is a very mysterious civilization today. Still many people know little facts abaout the Inca. Maybe someday researchers will finally uncover the real truth about the Inca.

Item_Response: Acient Inca:                      Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past                               What do we really know about the Inca?                  The acient Inca of Peru had no form of writing system so they had left no files or documents for historians to discover so they kinda had to go on about with the idea of how things happened. It was like a puzzle with no picture but they still put together the pieces. The Inca made knots in colored string called quipus, to record the calander days and to keep cout of the livestock. We have found many acient quipus but people today do not know what the knots mean. The europeans that met the Inca were very shocked that they coold keep a huge civilazations running on knots in string! Understanding acient Inca is like solving a mystery.        The civilization for nearly 100 years ruled a South American empire. Clues left behind by the Inca show us about their government, transportation, and way of life. By studing all of this we can piece together the way of like by the Inca. some of what we know comes from the oral history, or stories passed from generations. Passing on the Inca's stories, preserving the communitys history. Some of the old stories were written down by the Europeans. The Europeans arrived in the empire in 1532. The visitors were Spanish soldiers and priests. They mostly described the Inca in letters and diaries.       Historians have to be carful when the interpret the language because the Spaniards didnt speak the Inca language well. So some of them may have not understood what the Inca were telling them. So they might not all be accurate. Some of the Inca's stories were rather ledgends then history. The other things we know comes from artifacts that the Inca left behind. Most of the things that we have found are made from pottery, stone, gold or silver. Those types of materials last a long time even if they have been buried for a long time. Some artifacts are dug up in the ruins of buildings and others are found burried in the graves of the dead to use in the afterlife.        Some of the Inca textiles like clothing also survive well. Materials like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness, but they have been preserved in the dry deserts on Puru's coasts or the cold mountians of the Andes. Some sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters, who take anything that might be valuable. Some of the treasures were taken long ago but some of them still get taken today and if there is a site that people have looted on are not a very good searching spot for historians and if there is a site that hasnt been searched the historians get to it as fast as they can and search it slow and carefully.        Archaeologists who study these sites keep careful records. They write down and photograph artifacts they find. They also note the exact position they find them in. they try to learn about every single piece and they try tolearn as much as they can. They can compare what they learned from the artifacts and sites with the account with the spainardas and Inca. Sometimes they confirm historical mysteries.

Item_Response: The lost civilizations that we have found bring many unknown mysteries to us today.   Like; How did we get here? What was it like a billion years ago? And the biggest, how are the civilizations here today different from those of what we are finding and how did we even get to where we are in the first place?            Well the civilizations we keep finding that we never even knew exsisted could uncover the mysteries we have come to want to know but just cant find the answers to.   And here is how we can do that; you see all the things we are finding in these 'lost civilizations' and we always say, 'We are looking at this very closely to see what we can find.' but are we really looking close enough?            First we found Pithouses; and what these are is little houses that are sunk into the ground a few feet--they look sorta like a livingroom-- and the only thing holding up this roof on the top is four corner timbers. there was also a firepit, this had an airdeflector, who knows what they used this for! maybe the mothers used these to cook vension or other foods they ate back then. this Pithouse also contained a hole for passage to the underworld, storage bins, etc. people lived in these from about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750.            we also found many other things such as Kiva;   what this is, is what we call today, a church. back then they might refer to it as obviously a Kiva, or a ceremonial room. here we found underground chambers also comparable to our churches today. these were most likely used for healing rites or for praying for rain or luck in hunting or maybe even good crop growing seasons. Kivas were used for many different things most likely but we can never be sure of what exactly they were used for.            these things are very important because now we know part of what it was like living back then, and how its comparable to todays society and how we live. also now, we can uncover more legends and stories and see those to come.

Item_Response: The Inca discorvery was important it informed us of how the incas lived, and how they began and  ended. Achaeologist found quipuses that kept records which this was probably one of the first new ways to have a record. We know know about their amazing portraits of thir religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. All of that helped us learn and put together details of Inca life. We also found some letter and diaries that Europeans who arrived at the empire wrote but they did not preack Inca language very well. They have also found graves and burial places most places have been looted though.        The Puebloans discovery was important because we found new weapons that they invented that are now used today, and we have learned so much from them they were practically the inventing discovery. We found some of their weapons that tehy made, they made pottery and acquired the bow and arrow. For hunting they made a more efficient weapin the atlatl (a spear thrower). They had underground chambers which later they found out they were like churches. They had all of their religious things in there.       The Pavlopetri Discovery was important because it showed that Atlantis could be real not just a myth! It was the first planned sunken town. It was underground for almost 5,00 years. This discovery showed what the ansisters are like, proves under water towns do exist, and it brought logic.

Item_Response: Lost Civilization       Archaeologists have researched a empire that existed thousands of years ago called Ancient Inca.Inca did not have an alphabet or a writting system.They made knotts in colored strings called quipus to record the calander to keep a count of livestock.Quipus keeped the empire running.    The first europeans to meet them were suprised on how they can keep a empire so big with just a bunch of colored strings.       Some of what archaeologists know comes from stories passed on from generations.The rest of what they know comes from things they left behind like art, archetecture and way of life.They also know many things because of what the Inca people wrote down.Based on all of these clues on how the Inca people lived archaeologists study them and can  piece together details on their way of life.       The first Ancestral Pueblans settled in Mesa Verde.They lived in small little tents called pithouses.They were usally built on mesa tops or cliffs.In Mesa Verde they learned how to make pottery and weapons such as bow and arrows, and spears.They were also known for their skills to make baskets.   Around 750 A.D they had advanced alot more on how they would builed thier hoses.Their houses were now built above ground, with upright walls made of poles and mud.By 1,000 A.D they advanced even more.Pottry went from simple designs on dull gray back grounds to black drawings on a white background.       Alantis  was inspiered by the secerets of a lost city. it was brought to light beneath the waters of southern greece.Anglo-Greek is  a team of archaeologists who have explored the waters of southern Greece for the so called myth Alantis.They revealed over 9,000 square meters of new buildings.Marine geologists have yet to figure why it sank.Theories have been made that the sea level might have changed wich made the settlement sink.

Item_Response: The articles I had read were interesting because as much as we know about the past the more we want to know about these acient empires, but we will never fully understand there civilization because we were not their when this all happenned. The Incas of Peruha had a very interesting way of how they controled their empire. The Mesa Verde were very good craft people. The Lost City of Atlantis was their such a city or is it just a myth?                The Incas never had no writing system instead they use colered strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep count of livestock. Their whole empire ran on these quipus ( colored strings). Archaeologists have found so of these quipus andthe still do not know what they mean or how they used them.It should be really interesting how the mangeged to controll their empire off of these colorful strigs               The Mesa Verde lived in pithouses. These pithouse were very strudy, their roofs was a float area. Their houses were in the shape of a table. They lived in these houses for about 200 years. Farming replaced huanting in the year 550 A.D. They were very skilled in crafting. The Incas were also know as basketmakers.When they moved near cliffs there they learned how to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow. they used these bows and arrows for a more efficient haunting weapon than the spear. In around 750 A.D the Incas began to build house above the ground. These houses were made of poles and mud.                Many people are on the hunt of finding the Lost City of Atlantis, but no one till this day knows for a fact that their really was a city call Atlantis. Say if their was a city called Atlantis would it be as amazing  as they say it would be? They have found a ceramics dating of the stone age. it settle ment was 5,000 years ago. That is at least 1,200 years earlier than they had originally had thuoght. It was over than 9,000 square feet. Marine geologists are still trying to find why it sunk in the frist place. People say that the sea level changed.                All of these citys has something in comman. The thing that they have in comman is that we hummans want to fully grasp how live was for them. How their personality was. How their every day live was for them. What they ate? What they would wear as clothes.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca are important to science as well as to history. It is important to science because it shows how ancient civilizations were so far ahead to their time that they were able to adapt to a climate that was harsh. The Inca city in the mountains was an idea that probably took years to build. This discovery is also good to the advancement of history because it shows the way the Americas were before Europeans came.                      Mesa Verde national park also helps science and history. It helps history by showing us a picture of what a common pit-house looked like and describes to us the name and a idea of what their weapons were. It also helps science by showing us a machine built for people being allowed to breathe in their climate. This may have led to the advancement of today's modern heaters an air conditioners.                      In lost Greek city we get the idea that most myths might be just rumors. By using modern technology the divers were able to find Greek ruins under the water. The divers helped history by giving us an idea how cities can 'sink'. This is not a thing that happens on its own but by natures creation. Throughout the world more divers may find different submerged cities which may benefit science and history.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations of the Ancient World                                                                            There were many civilizations of the ancient world that archeologists are finding today. Some include the Incan civilizaton, the Pueblos, and the lost city of Atlantis. Without these civillizations we wouldn't know how ancient people have lived long ago.                                   The Incan civilization was a civilization in present day Peru. They lived high up in the Andes Mountains. They were a thriving civilization until the Spaniards captured them and since have been a colony of Spain.                                                          The Pueblos lived in present day Mexico. They were nomadic but began to settle down in 500 b.c.
