Item_Response: Lost Civilaizations Explanatory                 There been a lot of facts that people are starting to discover about the old lost civilizations because of old artifacts that they have been discovering. Archeologist got more fasinated by these myths they were hearing about, they got courious and wanted to discover if these myths were real or not. Archeoligist have learned things by reading books about Ancient Incas, Ansetral Pueblanos, and Atlantis City.                  First I an going to talk about Ancient Inca's lost civilization. The Ancient Inca's were from Peru. Archeologist have been trying to look for Ancient Inca history. The Inca did no leave behind any archives for historians to study on.  Archeologist have found may ancient quipus. Quipus are knots in colored strings to record the calender to keep a count of livestocks. Quipus have many knots on them but no one know what those knots mean. The Inca did not have any formal alphabet or system of writing system. Without anyone knowing what these knots mean the Ancient Inca's history remains a mystery. Some Inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looter. The treasure hunters or looters took anything valuable that they found. Now archeologist have nothing they can study on all they can do is look for clues and take pictuers to look for things they can find or discover.                  Next I am going to talk about Ancestral Pueblanos lost civilization. Archeologist have called these people Anaszi, from a Navajo word sometimes translated as 'the ancient ones' or' ancient enemies.' We now call them Ancestral Pueblanos. The Pueblanos lived in pithousees that they built them selves. Ancesteral Pueblanos also lived in the cliff dwellings for less than 100 years. The material they used to built their dwellings are sand stone that they shaped in to rectangular blocks the size of a lof of bread. The motar between the blocks was mix of mud and water. Roos averaged about 6 feet by 8 feet, space enough for two or three persons. Isolated rooms in the rear and on the upper levels were generally used for storing crops. The kiva roofs created open courtyard where many daily routines took place. When the Pueblanos left Mesa Verde they travled south into New Mexico and Arizona, settling amoung their kin who were already there.                  Last I am going to talk about Atlantis the   lost civilization. 'There is no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' said Dr jon Henderson, associate professer or underwater archaeologist of the University of  Nottingham. It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of classical Greece. The site, which straddles 30,000 square meaters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. It was discoverd by a British oceanographer some 40 years ago , it was this year that marine archaeologist, aided by digital technology, were able to properly survey the ruins. What they found surpassed all expectations. thanks to shifting sands and the settlement's encloseure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. They also found thousands of shards of pottery the pottery might of been stone, silver, or gold. Atlantis was occupied some 5,000 years ago. Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploring going.                           This was a very interesting report on lost civilizations. With the the help of archeologist and new technology theses lost civilizations are know. They are known by people that had no idea that these civilizations even existed. One of the lost civilizations that I thought was the most interesting is Atlantis.  I would recomend to people to research about  Atlantis City. I thought that Atlantis City was a facinated place to research on.

Item_Response: The Past                     The discoveries they've made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavolopetri are important because it helps people dicover the past. Scientists want to learn and study about the past so that they could share it out with the people. Archaelogists are fascinated by the civilization of the past because you get to learn and see how it was back then.                                                                                                                                     The Pavolopetri are an Anglo-Greak team of archaeologists and marine geologists, which expolore the sunken settlements of the Lost City beneath the waters off southern Greece. The archaelolgists are inspired by the Lost City because it's one of the worlds most enduring myths. The Lost City is an important find because it's one of the oldest sumerge town in the world, which is underwater. The Lost City has been dicovered fourty years ago, it's been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Archaelogists had tooked notes and studied it for a long time so that they could share thier information with us.                             The Inca were studied  because archaelogists want to learn about thier past and to see if the legends that wrer told of them are true or if thier just legends. All of the archaelogists knowledge from the Inca comes from artifacts, or things that were left behind, also from the places that were left behind. The've learn that the artifacts might be made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. They study the past so that archeology comfirms historical records.                        The Puebloans are North American group of people that lived in a region called Mesa Verde. Archaelogists called them Anasazi from the Navajo word times. Archaeologists have learned alot of the Puebloans. They've learned how they lived, were they lived, their resouces, and how some had crop failures, and also were have they traveled.               Archeologists learn all of the past so that they could inspire the past, and know how they lived, and how they have disapeared. They study so that they could share thier information all over the world and to know about back then, the people's life and to confirm historical records.

Item_Response: I believe the discoveries made from the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri were very important. The discoveries made from the Incas were very incredible. The Incas left many clues behind that form an amazing portrait of their art, religion, architecture, transportation, government, and their way of life. Archaeologists studied all these clues left behind and were able to put them all together and see how the Inca lived. Also, by finding bodies they found out how they died. From the clues they found, they know now many information about the Inca life.            In Mesa Verde, Pluebloans lived there for about 700 years and settled there in A.D. 550. Pluebloans lived in pithouses which were a few feet underground. As the population multiplied, they built more pithouses. Pithouses included many things inside. For example, it had air deflector, storage bins, or living room. I think pithouses are the reason on why we have houses today. Their architecture influenced us to making better, bigger, and stronger houses. Ancestral Puebloans accomplishments were ranked among the finest expressions of human culture in North America.            I believe the discovery of Atlantis was the most important one of them all. Atlantis is located beneath the waters off southern Greece. There were many myths of Atlantis, but nobody knew exactly if it existed or not. Thanks to the archaeologists and marine geologists they were able to prove that Atlantis did exist. It wasn't until this past few years that we were able to survey some of the ruins. Archaeologists and marine geologists were able to see a whole different world underwater with buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. Conclusively, all this discoveries made from the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri were important and very fascinating.

Item_Response: The discoveries made by the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, are important. These discoveries help us find out information about the past. It helps us uncover the cause of their effects. We learn about how they functioned in the past, both labor wise, and person wise. Without these, we wouldn't know the where's, when's, why's, and how's of our ancestors.      To begin with, the Inca made knots in colored strings, quipus, to keep count of livestock, and to record the calendar. Quipus could be one of the components to our now a day calendar. Also, the building of objects from stone, pottery, gold, or silver, could be one of the reasons why today we know that they do not last little. Puebloans aren't left behind. They too, helped with our current 'civilizations.'      Puebloans were known as 'cliff dwellers' because of where they lived. They built a civilization on cliffs. These 'cliff dwellers' could be the foundation to what we have today, houses in rare places. ' 'The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths...' This is the Atlantis myths, a lost Greek city.      Atlantis, is a very well known ancient civilization. Item_Response: They were artifacts almost every where, but now there are only few important ones left in the world. In the article Ancient Inca, by Beth Gruber it talks about the Ancient Inca, and how they can run huge empires and how they lived throughout those empires.                  In the Incas way of life they had to run huge empires and watch after everyone. The civilization that ruled for nearly a hundred years in South American. They have left behind clues like amazing portraits of religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and their ways of life. Archaeologists can put together the Incas way of life from these tiny pieces of evidence's.               Another great civilization was the Puebloans who lived in 550 A.D. In the article Ancestral Puebloans and Their World, by Roy Anderson it talks about how they lived and the economy. They settled in Mesa Verde, they were known as basket makers for their skill at crafting. They replaced hunting with farming. They lived in pit-houses clusted into small villages, usually built on mesa tops and sometimes on cliffs. They learned how to make pottery and bow and arrow a better hunting weapon. In time their population multiplied. In  750 A.D they started to build homes above ground.                  In about 1000 A.D they had advanced from pole and adobe construction to skillful stone masonry, they were three stories high. They joined together for about 50 rooms. By 1100 and 1300 A.D the population reached several thousand. By 1200 A.D they lived on cliff alcoves. Then they reached to cliff dwellings it was most famous. Cowboys reported them in about the 1880s. Puebloans lived on them for about less than a hundred years.             Both the Incas and the Puebloans were both very intelligent for their time period. They were both good in running empires and farming and crafting. They were personally the smartest of them all. They both made a change to their economy.

Item_Response: There are many reasons why discoveries about the Inca's, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have made them so important. Their culture was different than us. For the Puebloans their culture interests us because we do not know why they migrated even though there are seven theories. The Pavlopetri culture is interesting since they lived in one area for more than 700 years which turned into elaborate stone communities.     Depending on what happened to them it can interesting to know. The Inca's left in a sad way but it also interests people cause you think of how someone can kill a entire civilization. For the Puebloan's they just left then centuries later they came back. The Pavlopetri for reason that we don't know is under water in really good condition and we don't know what happened to the people in it even though there are artifacts. But we do find out information about other civilizations telling us that this is what happened to them.     I would be interesting if one day we could go back in time and see what ancient civilizations did or might of done in their everyday life. Inca's everyday life might of been worshipping, gathering or hunting food, making types of art and other things. For the Puebloans I think almost everything is the same except they lived in cave dwellings unlike the Inca's who live in the mountains mostly. Pavlopetri had a whole different thing since they lived in a planned town. Even though we don't know much about them I can infer that they lived a fun,most of the time relaxed life without having to do to much depending on the jobs they had. The artifacts are important since they can tell us those things.    Those are the three things that make discoveries about the Inca's, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri so important. Item_Response: Throughout the past, many ancient civilizations have rose to power just to be destroyed by the climate, geography, or other power craving humans. Today, we try to solve the mysteries of who lived on this Earth before us. There is no main reason for our obsession with the past other than utter curiosity. It is human nature to want to know where we have come from and to find connections between now and previous societies. Perhaps it is necessary to know what has already happened so we can change the outcome if the same circumstances occur.                         Three major ancient civilizations that connect us to our past are the Incas, from what is now Mexico, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. Because of our natural curiosity to know what came before us, archeologists have dug up and studied these ancient civilizations and have used artifacts, items found in the ruins of past civilizations, to piece together the mystery of who they were, what they did, and how they ended. From the Incas, we learned that they kept track of live-stalk, citizens, and calenders with knotted strings called quipus. We also have journals and records from the invading Europeans that explain the invasion then downfall of the Empire.                 Another lost settlement that we have recently discovered and studied is a civilization found underwater off the coast of present-day Greece. There, divers found ceramics almost as old as the stone age and other interesting artifacts to help us learn about the mysterious city. Their downfall is extremely self evident as the entire city is now submerged underwater.                 We can learn many things from these past civilizations. For example, with the clues archeologists have found, we now know how the civilizations were destroyed. The Incans were attacked by Spanish and other Europeans who wanted power and were just greedy for land. On the other hand, The city that used to be in Greece wasn't invaded but ruined due to the climate and geography. Because it was so close to the ocean, the waves engulfed the entire city and has hidden it under the sea for over 5,000 years.                 It is important that we know what happened that ruined these ancient civilizations so it wont be repeated. Eleanor Roosevelt once said, 'learn from other people's mistakes for you wont live long enough to make them all yourself.' This holds very true to how we should live our lives today. As we have learned from the ancient Incas, it is necessary to have military protection to keep greedy power craving societies away. Also, we have learned by example to never build a society near the ocean because unlike placement of our homes, the weather is uncontrollable. As help from past civilizations guides us and the curiosity to know our origins drives us forward, our society will always be interested in studying and piecing together the mysteries of the life that came before us. However, we must be careful about not dwelling on the past because what has happened is over and cannot be changed. We must use the knowledge gathered from previous events to lead us into greater things in the future.

Item_Response: Discovery of Ancient Civilizations           Did you know there are three lost civilizations and many more in counting. One of the three most popular is Ancient Inca, Ancient Puebloans, and the lost Greek City that inspired Atlantis. Each one of these discoveries of these civilizations help dramatically throughout world history.                     First of all, the discovery of Ancient India was very important to Historians for a lot of important reasons. One reason is that  they had a early  number systems using only knots on a rope, this was called a quipus, it also kept a calender. Another good reason is how the Incas lived, which was very interesting. They were very religious people and did many cerenomies, traditions, etc. But this isn't the only civilization that was very important throughout our history.               Secondly, the Ancient Puebloans were also a very sacred, ancient civilization. By the time of 1000 A.D. they were masters in stone masonry. They built villages out of many rooms, with kivas built inside. The Puebloans also built cliff dwellings but no one fore sure understands the peoples lives. All they know is that it takes great skill to build such buildings without modern technology. The end of them was most likely crop failures or intensive depletion of resources. Many known things are a mytrh about them, similar to the historical lost city of Greece.               Lastly, the lost city of Greece inspired many people to come up with the story of Atlantis. Since it is so difficult to explore a lot of fables have sprung up, but recently due to the increase of digital technolgy archaeologists are now able to survey the ruins. Biologist found over 9,000 square meters of buildings and possible megaron.                All in all, the discovery of these lost civilizations are very important to our world history.                                                       YOLOOOOOOOOOOOOOO

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphebhet or system of writing. The Inca made knots in coloredstrings called quipus to record the calender to keep a count of livestock. Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus, but today no one knows what the knots mean. Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and artitecture, argiculture, government, transportation, and way of life. By studying these clues, archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca life.         Some of what we know about the Inca comes from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation. Passing on the stories was an important way to preserve a community's history. Some Inca textiles and clothing have also survived remarkably well. Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness, but these have been preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes. Archaelogists who study these sites keep careful records. They write them down and photograph any artifacts they find, and note the exact position in which they find them. They need to learn as much information as they can from every single piece of evidence.        Archaeologists can compare what they learn from artifacts and sites with the Spaniards' accounts of the Inca. Sometimes archeology confirms historical record. Amoung the most important things to learn about a civilization are where it came from and what happened to it. The fall of Inca is eay to date because the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire. Archaelogists use some of the most advanced techniques in the world to discover more about the Inca's predecessors. About 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verda for their home.   Mesa Verde National Park preserves a spectacular reminder of this ancient culture. Archeologists have called these people Anasazi, from a Navajo word sometimes translated 'the ancient ones' as 'ancient enemies.'          Between A.D. 1100 and 1300, during the Classic Period, the population may have reached several thousand. It mostly concentrated in compact villages of many rooms, often with the kivas built inside the enclosing walls rather than out in the open. The stone walls of the large peublos are regarded as the finest ever built in Mesa Verde, with their straight courses of carefully shaped stones. Using nature to advantage, Ancestral Puebloans built their dwellings beneath the overhanging cliffs. Their basic construction material was sandstone that they shaped into rectangular blocks about the size of a loaf of bread.

Item_Response: The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because scientist can know how they lived, how they lived and what happened to it. These civilizations lived in different locations and lived different life styles.    The Inca stories were legends rather than history. Inca artifacts might be objects made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Their materials last a long time, even if they have been buried for hundreds of years. Others are found buried in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife. The bodies that scientists find also reveal information about how they lived.The Puebloans flourished for more than 700 years and built elaborate communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. The Puebloans population multiplied. They built houses one against another in long, curving rows, often with a pit house or two in the front. Baskets show evidence of decline in quality, possibly because widespread use of pottery and less attention to craft. Also, scientists have found buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures in the Pavlopetri. The seabed was a replete with thousands of shards of pottery. They also found ceramics daring back as far as the stone age, which suggested that the settlement was occupied for some 5,000 years ago, at least 1,200 years earlier than originaly thought. Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploring going.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important for several reasons.  First off, the Inca were important because they started recording things like the calendar to keep track of their livestock.  They did this by using quipus which are knots in colored strings. Also they are important because the artifacts and things they left behind when they died help us to learn about what civilizaton was like in Peru.  Archaeologists record everything they find and compare it with the stories that the Spaniards tell to see if they match up so they can record it for us to learn about our history.  Then there is the Puebloans.What's important about them is they started to replace hunting with farming and they also started to make pottery.Another thing that's significant about tham is that since they started to farm they started clearing land for agriculture and a new way of life.  The structures they built are evidence of how civilization started to evolve.  Then there is the Pavlopteri, which is one of the oldest submerged town in the world.  This sunken town is unique because of how it was discovered that it was a very planned out town.  The shifting sands and water preserved everything down there better than they had hoped and they found a world of structures!  This captivating underwater world represents a frozen moment of the past.  All of these past cities are so important for us to learn about today because it teaches us about the mistakes and sucesses of the past and how to learn from them.

Item_Response: When archaeologists discovered about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri it was merely because there were clues left behind of civilization. Archaeologists have studied these lost civilizations with advanced technology, but they still do not understand how they spoke their own language.   When scienctists found the Inca's homes they found how the government, transportation, and the way of life worked. Some of what we know about the Inca comes from stories passed down from generation to generation. When we found the first lost town of Inca, they were written down byt Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The rest of our knowlegde comes from artifacts.   About 1,400 years ago a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. For more than 700 years they and their descendants lived and flourished here, eventually building elaborate  stone communities. The first Ancestral Puebloan settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. They are known as basketmakers for their skill of craft. They lived in pithouses with a sipapu, a hole for passage to the underworld.   Divers explore the sunken settlement of the Pavlopetri. It dates some 5,00 years ago. The town is found in Southern Greece today. It was the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis.   This concludes how archaeologists discovered thes tribes way of lief.

Item_Response: The events, culture, and history of our past civilizations contribute to the importance of the present, because they set the foundation and basis for our future.  The civilizations of the Inca, Ancestral Puebloans, and Ancient Greece, were some of the most important contributors.  They left behind clues that tell the story of how they lived, their culture, traditions passed down from generation to generation, their government and politics, the practice of their religion, the beauty of their art, and the planning of their architecture.  Studying these clues lead to a gateway of understanding for how our culture and way of life developed over hundreds and thousands of years.           The Ancient Inca            The Ancient Inca ruled a Southern American empire during the years of 1438 to 1532.  Since the Inca had not created an alphabet or a writing system, there were no written records to inform archaeologists on life of the Inca.  The only records we have are quipus, which the Incas tied knots into a various assortment of different colored strings that kept records.  However, the significance and what they symbolize are unknown to archaeologists.  We must rely on the comparison of ancient artifacts with the historical records of Spaniard's to find evidence of their daily lifestyle and routine.  Although, there is another way to discover this.  The tradition of passing down stories by mouth from generation to generation is another method.  These methods can have flaws though.  Stories are warped over time and can become a false version of the original.  Also, many of the stories of the Inca people were not history or facts, but  it was legends and fables.            The artifacts and corpses of the Inca people may also provide clues.  The position, location, and age all give necessary evidence to discover their meaning to archaeologists.  However, looters and changes over time can tamper with the accuracy of the artifacts.  The archaeologists will collect whatever information they can from the site.  Mountainside sites in particular can harbor a lot of information.  The extreme cold preserve the bodies in the frozen ground.  These specimens can then be X-ray to discover the life they led and cause of death.  But to get to the site is difficult.  Expert mountaineers can reach these high-altitudes with all of the needed gear and return the body to be examined.           The Ancestral Puebloans            The Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde finally stopped their lives of being a nomad, and settled around A.D. 550.  Their former lives of hunting with atlatl and gather transformed to the tradition of farming.  Villages were built and the land on mesa tops were cleared for agriculture.  The new area inspired innovation in their tools, creativity, and architecture.  The Ancestral Puebloans were avid basket makers.  They also created unique pottery and more efficient weapons.  The earliest houses were called Pithouses, which later became Kivas.  These Pithouse were clustered into villages, and communities were formed.  By the year A.D. 750, the population of the Ancestral Puebloans had multipled massively.           The City of Atlantis            The infamous city of Atlantis was rumored to have sunken in the waters off of Southern Greece.  Underwater archaeologists have found it in excellent condition.  The 'Lost City' is more than 5,000 years old, and one of the oldest sunken sites ever.  With the aid of new digital technology, they will be able to explore it.  The city was supposedly sunk by either sea level changes or ground subsidence.  Considering that only one percent of the ocean floor has been explored, this is a major discovery for oceanography.  This was one of the most extraordinary finds.

Item_Response: Lately in our generation, archaeologists have been discovering more and more about the ancient civilizations of this planet.  Some of these are the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.  All of these three civilizations were present a long, long time ago.  The Pavlopetri was even in B.C. Archaeologists have found the remains of these and many more and are studying the artifacts to learn as much as possible about these societies that we hardly know anything about.  Each and every piece of information helps us know that much more about these people and their lifestyles,  The discoveries of lost ancient cities has helped us improve our knowledge of history and the particular ancient civilizations.       Archaeologists have found out an abundant amount of information on ancient civilizations and what they were like.  In every lost city, there are tons of aritfacts for archaeologists to collect and study so they can gain a lot of information about the city and the people who lived there.  These artifacts are able to give archaeologists information about these people's lifestyles, everyday hobbies, and even their religious beliefs.  All of this information helps the archaeologists get a larger sense of what the civilization was like and how it functioned.  This knowledge helps us know more about our past generations.  Also, building structures of ancient civilizations can help archaeologists have a better understanding of how their constructions knowledge was.        All of this can give us a better idea of how peple have evolved over the generations.  We are able to look at how we used to be and then look at how we have become over the generations. The discovery of these civilizations has helped us have a better knowledge of our history and ancient civilizations.

Item_Response: The discoveries about the Inca, the Pueboloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because it shows us the way people lived and survived before us. In this section, it will show you evidence on why the Inca, the Pueboloans, and the Pavlopetri are an important discovery.        'Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, are and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and the way of life,' says Beth Gruber in the selection Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past. With all of the oral history, or the storeies passed down from generation to generation. Can be somewhat true but we only know that from which it comes from. The stories passing down brought us to preserve the history of the community's history. When historians are carefully studying the accounts, the historians have to stay very careful on the way they interpret of judge something. Any misunderstanding would change the discovery made.             The way that the Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde shows us the way that they adaptive to their living. 'They are known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft,' says Source #1, Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Pueboloans and Their World. During A.D. 750, they began building their homes against one another and above ground. Which gave them the name 'village dwellers'. On the time A.D. 1300, Mesa Verde was deserted. Many historians have a prediction on why the Village Dwellers desereted their home. Some people say it was crop failures, saw drought, social and political problems. What ever it was, they left amazing artifacts for scientists to study.         With the discoveries of the Inca, the Pueboloans, and the Pavlopetri. The discovery has inspired one of the world's most enduring myths - the fable of Atlantis -. Marine geologists have yet to piece together the facts of the sunken boat. Many theories left... but none prove yet wrong. Sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami. 'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going,' said Sakellariou. 'Less than 1% of the world's ocean floors have ever been surveyed. This is an extraordinary find but there is still a lot more down there that has to be found.'         Therefore, the discoveries about the Inca, the Pueboloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because it shows us the way people lived and survived before us. With all the architeture left for us to investigate we can use these ways for our own being as well.

Item_Response: The Importance of Finding Artifacts                                                         Finding artifacts are really important to many people, and can really teach you about ancient civilizations. Some ancient civilizations that scientists have been studying are the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. The artifacts are great discoveries that are very important.                Finding the artifacts of the Inca was hard for the Archeologists to do. The Inca lived mostly in the Andes Mountains, and were frozen into them. Archeologist had to dig their way into the ice and climb on the Andes just to find the artifacts. They could have lost their lives doing this, and it took a lot of time and effort. The scientist discovered a many thing when they were climbing the mountians. Some of the things they discovered were that the Inca had no formal aphabet, they made knots in colored strings as a calendar, some of the objects they made were mad from stone, pttery, gold, or silver, and Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532. We know and learn everything from the artifacts, so the discoveries that the archeologists find are very important.                We have also learned about a lot about the Puebloans from discoveries. Some of things we have learned is how they built their cities, and their population between 1100A.D. and 1300A.D. These are some of the discoveries from the artifacts they found.                The Pavolptri are also very interesting to learn about now that we have discovered things about them. One thing that we have learned is the theories of how the settlement sank. The marine geologists think it sank because of the sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami. Another thing we have learned is where the city was. It was near Neapolis. We really can find interesting discoveries.                The artifacts are great discoveries that are very important. I am really glad that we found so much information on the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavolptri. Now that we have more technology I hope we can find more discoveries and learn more. Discoveries can really help you learn a lot.

Item_Response: Do you ever wonder about what life was like in the past. What they ate, how they communicated, or what life was like in general? You might think that these questions are impossible to answer because nobody from the past is alive to tell us what life was like back then. That is not true. An archaeologist could probably answer these questions. Archaeologist, find and interpret information from the past, they study our past life. They travel, dig and search to find old remains. With these remains, such as old clothing, artifacts, and other things they find valuable information and with this information they discover things about the past that no one ever knew about, which in this story was information about the Inca, Puebloans and the Pavlopetri.            Information about the Inca, Puebloans and the Pavlopetri is so important to us because in some cases it teaches us how they communicated or what language they spoke in their day of life. In source 1 we learn that the Inca lived in Peru and they didn't have a formal alphabet or system of writing. So if they didn't use an alphabet or didn't use writing to communicate, what did they use? Archeologist found that the Inca used 'quipus' to keep track of days and to keep track of their livestock. Quipus is simply the knotting of colored string. So before our time where we have, electronics and paper and pencil to communicate, you now know that people used to use knots to communicate. One may not think that this information is important but it shows us how our world is changing.       Although this was the past, it really could affect the way an individual might act. Knowing that life wasn't always easy and and everything was always there we now know that people in the past communicated in many different ways. This is why information about the Inca, Puebloans and the Pavloptri is so important.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations           The Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetris were all apart of the search for lost civilizations.           The Incas               The Incas date back to the time frame of 1438 to around 1532. They were known to have ruled a southern American empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome. Historians know some of the olden stories because of the writings of the Europeans. They had left behind journals and letters. As in many ancient civilizations Inca artifacts might be of object made from stone, pottery, gold, and even silver. Some artifacts are buried with their owner to be with them in the afterlife. The fall of the Incas was easy to date because the Spaniards murdered the Incan king in 1532 and took the Incan empire.               The Puebloans           The first Peubloans date all the way to A.D. 550. They were known for making baskets and for their skills of crafting. They lived in pithouses that were clustered into small villages usually that were built on mesa tops. When it was about 750 A.D. they began to make their houses above ground. During the Classic period (1100 A.D. and 1300 A.D.) the population reached several thousand.   Cliff Dwellers were first reported by a cowboy during the 1800's. They left no written records, yet for all the silence these structured speak with a certain eloquence.               The Pavlopetris                The Pavlopetris city was lost under the waters off of southern Greece enduring myths know as the lost city of Atlantis. The sunken settlements dates back about 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes. Dr. Jon Henderson says 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world.' He then stated ' It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of classical Greece.'The site which straddles around 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor is believed to have been swallowed up by the sea some time around the date of 1000 BC.

Item_Response: Ancient Cities               The ancient cities that have been lost over the years are a great mystery to all of mankind. We find ourselves intruiged to know more about the wonderful civilizations that lived before us so we strive to find little things that connect the puzzle. All of these little things add up to one big thing. That big thing is the lost citie's secrets that people have been awaiting for years. We can find these secrets through curiosity, wonder, and amazment.            The lost city of Inca is a very fascinating place to discover. The Incans had no formal writing system or alphabet. They kept track of livestock and calendars on knotted colorful strings they caled quipus. On the quipus, there are symbols, but because there is no alphabet we know of, we cannot understand what is written on them. There is little left for historians to discover about the Incas. One contribution to this problem is looters. Looters are people who hunt for treasure that may be valuable to them. The only problem with looters other than it is wrong to steal is that they are taking away pieces to a puzzle that we are struggling to understand. Some of the things that we know about the Incas come from stories that we have heard from the spaniards through letters. We have to be cautious though when interpreting these letters because they cannot speak the language well so they may not actually be telling what is written. The other part of what we know comes from objects they left behind. They left textiles and clothing which was mostly preserved becuase of the hot weather, they left bodies on the mountain tops which are frozen becauase of the weather and we are able to bring the bodies down and study them using advanced technology which helps tell us when they died and what happened to them. Though we may not know much, the Inca's way of life is an extraordinary mystery just waiting to be discovered.            Another city waiting to be discovered would be the Puebloans. About 1400 years ago, a civilization of Puebloans flourished for abut 700 years.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans and the Pavlopetri are extremely important. These discoveries tell us a lot about the cultures, discoveries, religion, and disappearance of these people. We know many things about each civilization. We know that the Inca have no system of writing or archives for history. They recorded everything in knots in colored strings called quipus. Too record everything in such a way makes some of our accomplishments obsolete. Even now we cannot figure out what the quipus mean.        We know exactly how the Puebloans lived. We know that they lived in pit houses and used atlatl. We would not have known that if we did not discover these artifacts. We also know that some of them were amazing stone masons because they carved their houses into side of the mountains. We have not yet discovered why they made the move into the mountains. We also know that they were very skilled with pottery through the shards that we have found.        We know that the Plavopetri lived in a planed city. This is significant because this is the first planned city that archaeologists have found to date. It was found 40 years ago by a british archaeologist. If he did not discover this then we would not have the wealth of knowledge about the Greeks that we do now. It also offers insights into the Mycenaen society which disapeared without a trace...or so we thought.        These discoveries have added to our stores of knowledge and made us curious. It makes us wonder what else is out there. It makes us ask 'What else could be burried under the sand, or the ground, or in a mountains?' Without asking questions we would know a lot less about the world. Discovering new things leads us to asking new questions. Asking new questions leads us to new answers.

Item_Response: Exploring deep dark caves, playing in the dirt, and searching underwater is an acrcheologists normal day. They learn about the history of civilizations that have been gone for centeries. The ancient Inca of Peru, the four corners region of North America, and the lost Greek city are places an archeologists would love to uncover the mysteries of their history.       The Incas had no alphebet or system of writing. This makes it hard for historians to learn and study. Art, architecture, religion, argriculture, government, transportation, and way of life still lives on. This has helped them learn about the Incas who have been gone for almost a hundred years. Old stories were also written down by the Spaniards and Europeans. Ancient Peru's textiles and cloting did survive the rain and sun. Archeologists did learn that the Spaniards did kill of the Incas.       Mesa Verde national park  is by the four corners of New Mexico, Utah, Colorado and Arizona. These people were the Anasazi, which is translates into 'the ancient ones' from the still thriving Navaho heritige. Puebloans were the first to settle in Mesa Verde. The were known as basketmakers because this was their talent. Faming and pottery was also their spelilty. The modern mavahos still keep this terdition going. Their poplulation incresed during A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300 called the Classic PEriod. Later the cliff dwelers moved into New Mexico and Arizona.       The lost city of Greece have given us many secrests. Archeologists spend their life searching for the awnser. But he secrets of Atlantis still hasn't been found. Marine geologists found the 'sunken settlement' a while back. 'There is no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world.', quotes Dr. Jon Henderson, a professer of underwater archeology at the Universtiy of Nottingham. It is told to be a myth but acheologists want to find the awnser. Is Atlanits a real forgotten Civilization?       Archeologists devote their life to finding the mystery of ancient civilizations arouond the world. The ancient Inca of Peru,the cliff dwellers city of Mesa Verde, and the lost city of Atlantis are places where archeologists would dream to learn the secrest of. Archeologists are devoted people who are seeking information to incite people around the world on ancient civilizations.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca people,Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because they show what life was like back when they were alive and how it was like to live there. the Inca people kept records by using string. That shows how people used to keep records and how smart people were. They ruled part of South America at one time. Archaeologists found ruins of buildings, and gold and silver, pottery, and artifacts made from stone.         The puebloans for more than 700 years lived in Mesa Verde. Instead of hunting the puebloans farmed and gathered food. they lived in pithouses clustered into small villages built on mesa tops or in cliff recesses. the people learned to make pottery and how to make bow and arrows, and more efficient weapons for hunting than a spear thrower.          The Pavlopteri were important because they found a underwater city. They found buildings, courtyards, main streets, and rock cut tombs, and religious structures. they also found shards of pottery. They found ceramics dating back to the stone age. That is important because you can study the ceramics to see what the tools were like back then and learn some things about them.the site of the city takes up 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor. Dr. Jon Henderson says that there is no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world. It was discovered by a british oceanographer about 40 years ago. It was only this year that marine archaeologists were able properly survey the ruins. They say that the site was never reoccupied. They said that only about one percent of the ocean floor has been explored. That is why they are so important it helps us learn about the past and how it was to live during those times and what they used.

Item_Response: Dear People,              Today I will tell you the importance of these new discoveries. These discoveries have a lot to learn from. It tells you how the people lived and what the enviornment around them was like.               First I will tell you about the Inca. The Inca were people who lived near the Spaniads and lived in Peru. They had no formal alphabet like us today. When the first Europens saw their strings to keep records, they had no idea what they were meant for. The Inca had a very different way of living than the Europens. The Inca couldn't even clearly communicate with the Spaniards because they couldn't understand each others language. But they would figure out what they were trying to tell each other. The rest of our knowlage behind the Inca were from their artifacts.                Now I will tell you about the Puebloans. The Puebloans were a group of people who lived in North America before the Europens discoved that land. Archeologists called these people Anasazi which meant 'the ancient ones'. The first Puebloans setteled in Mesa Verde. They lived in pithouses, in very small villages. They learned a lot of things like how to make pottery and how to use a bow and arrow.                I will also tell you about the 'Lost Greek City'. The Lost Greek City is a site of 30,000 square meters and was consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. It was discovered by a British oceanographer some 40 years ago. This site is near Neapolis in Greece.

Item_Response: ' Pithouses, Pithouses, Pithouese' Pithouses you say... what are they? 'pithouses.. the most relaxing thing you can every be on, or better yet the bestest house you can ever live in.' ' Not.. i shall not let you take his offer!' a voice from a distances. ' The best house you can every have is Cliff dweller' said a coyboys. ' But you have misktaken here this is no cowboy sir.'                           PITHOUSES       Pithouses are just dug up pits that is transform into a house, most likey to care care of a family, this pithouse was invented when from people skills and crafts. This houses has a opening on its top for the smoke from you fire to go out, this house is also very helpful for you nd youe family, this house my look small but it is very likely to get everything in go shape. People lived in Pithouse from about A.D 550 to A.D 750, as settled agriculture began. The pithouse is design by a few feet sunken into the ground, and it also has a four corner supported the roof. Pithouses are los similar to kiva, nother type of house.                  CLIFF DWELLERS      Cliff dwellers are specially made for coyboys. Ever since local cowboys reported the high cliffs in 1880s, some of the archealogist have understanf why these cowboys live on the high cliffs. The structures are evidence of a society that, is over centuries, accumulated skills and traditions and passed then on to generation to generation. This houssing design was used from A.D 1100 to A.D 1300. Ancestral Puebloan were heirs of a vigorous civilizations, whose accomplishments in community living and the atrs rank among the finest expressions of human cultures in North America. This house was most used for the people who like traveling a lot.               KIVA      A kive is somewhat similar to a pithouse, The thing is that the house is mostly above ground level. The kiva was specially builded for the church people. The kiva contains 1 ventilator, 2 bench, 3 air conditions, 4 fire-pits, 5 sipapu, 6 pilaster. This type of house is like a get together kind of thing, this house is also used for rich people in there time, and the houses is very uesful. Kivas were gathering places and sometimes also places to weave. Pilasters supported a beam-and- mud roofs. Entry was by ladder through a hole in the center of the roof. The small hole in the floor is a sipapu, or symbolic entrance to the underworld. For the Puebloans may have used kivas fro healing rites or to pray fro rain, luck in hunting, or a good crop, so a kiva is mostly a church.             ' Ahh indeed' said the cowboys   ' So you sir should try and get a pithouse for you young looking family' sid the man   'Yes... indeed you should get the pithouse' sid the cowboys   As I walked down the dirt road and started to dig my pit for my family.

They lived in pit house usually built on Mesa tops, and sometimes in cliff recesses.They use pottery to make weapons like an bow and arrow.They left no written record about how they lived.About by the 1300 Mesa Verde was deserted.There was droughts and crop failures.Most of the traveled to Arizona or New Mexico. In the second source, the Ancestral Puebloans were examined. Long ago, before european people came to morth america, the Puebloans lives in the four corners of america.            In the third source, the Lost Greek City was examined. Divers explore the city that lay under the waters of southern Greece, maybe a city that inspired Atlantis. Item_Response: Archeaologists have discovered alot of important facts about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.       The inca lived up high in the andes mountians in peru until about the early 1500's. In source you, it tells you the historians learned alot about the Inca from artifacts. It also says that archeaologists discovered the perserved bodies of some incans in caves, in cliff faces, and in mountian tops. With that being, it is very dangerous to investigate those places. Another thing that source #1 says is that the fall of the Inca was in 1532, when the spaniards murdered the Inca king and took over the empire.       Puebloans lived about 1,400 years ago in the four corners region, Source #2, tells us that they lived there for over 700 years. It also says that they built 'elaborate stone communitys... in canyon walls.' Puebloans were very good at pottery, and used a bowrow for hunting, rather then throwing a spear. The people lived in Mese Verde until about A.D. 1200, when many people moved back into the cliffs. It is unknown why they moved there.       Pavlopetri is a sunken settelment that dwells on the ocean floor. Archeaologists belive that this settelment dates back about 5,000 years... thats around the stone age. In the underwater ruins, they found pottery and building also dating back around 5,000 years ago. This town that was found is believed to be greek. Archeaologists are still investaging it.                                                                                   - Abby Bay

Item_Response: Some times people forget about where they came from, but you always have to remember you wouldn't be where you are now with out them. The Incas had a huge deal on where you are now. They lived a very long time ago, dating back to 9,000 years ago.       We don't much about the Incas because we don't have any clue in how to read there language or data, but there are legends, and artifacts. All though some is not easy to get because the Incas were very smart. They didn't want any looters to come so they buried their things on top of moutains.       The Mesa Verde were the first ones to build the modern house. .The houses they made were extraordinary for their time. The house had a firepit with a air deflector. They had a living room with sunk in a few feet under the ground. And they lived in A.D. 550 to A.D.750.       'Atlantis,' Does that name sound familiar? Item_Response: The discovery of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the pavlopetris history is incredibly important. They tell us about are past and how we evolved into the society we have today. we need to be able to know about are past and are past mistakes if we don't want to repeat those mistakes. we can learn so much from are past. by discovering the history of these three ancient cultures we can learn more about how we can improve and move forward.       Finding the history of the Incas can tell us so much. They had no alphabet and no form of writing. yet they managed to survive and thrive. and there empire was so vast it rivaled ancient Rome. so how did they do it with no form of writing or an alphabet? they used quipus. quipus where lots of colorful string with nots in them. that is how they kept track of materials and goods and live stock. and the date. that was how they kept things writin down. the Incas feel when the Spanish murdered the incan king. they where a great agricultural society and we can learn a lot from that and we have. we discover the ways that they farmed and it has helped us improve are farming and learn better ways to farm.        Discovering the history of the Puebloans is also very important. they where once a nomadic people but then the decided to settle and develop a community. learning about there history show's us that evolution is very important and change can be good.they evolved their small houses called pit house into above ground homes with upright walls.they then upgraded there homes again from mud and pole walls to stone.they made better pottery and better ways to farm. looking at what they did can help us move forward too.       And last but not least the discovery of the pavlopetris is important because it is the oldest and biggest submerged site ever to be found. and because it is submerged it hasn't been used by any other culture but the one that made it. this can tell us so much about the people that made it. how they lived and worked and there whole history.       To conclude finding about about the history of all of these different culters is incredibly important because it can help us today in many different ways.

Item_Response: Taylor Locklear       WEST HOKE MIDDLE SCHOOL ARTICLE                                                                      Ancien Inca:                  Archaeology Unlocks the Secerts of                                      the Past       The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or systemof writing.They did not leave archives for historians to study.The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock.They were amazed that they could run a big empire using strings, so they can keep there records. Without any one who can read thier stories tied into the colorful strings they have now. Nearly a hundred yaers (1438-1532) ruled a south america empire, that also rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome.   Some of what i know about the Inca comes from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation. Passing on the stories was an important way to preserve a community's history.I know some of the old stories because they were written down by the europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The visitors were Spanish soldiers and priests. They described the Inca i n letters and diaries.                       Mesa Verda National Park Ancestral                       Puebloans and thier World                      About 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored NC, a group of people living in theFour Corners region chose Mesa Verda for thier home. For more than 700 years they and their descendants lived and flourished here.then, in the late A.D 1200s in the span of a generation or two,they left their homes and moved away.                                            Pithouses       People lived in a pithouses from about A.D . 550 to A.D. 750, as settled agriculture began.

Item_Response: Making discoveries is important. You may be discovering something small like a   bug nobody has ever seen. You might find a rare artifact from long ago or maybe even a lost city. If we didn't make new discoveries we wouldn't be as advanced as we are now in this day and age. In the next paragraph I will explain why I believe discoveries about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important.       The Inca, who hail from Peru used colored strings tied into knots to keep track of   things.They didn't have an alphabet to write so you may wonder how we know so much about them. There were many things left behind by the Inca which included artwork representing their religion, transportation, government, way of life, and many more things. We know more because of stories passed down from ancestors, generation after generation. It's important the we know how they lived, why they died out, what they were like so archaeologists go to where they inhabited and take notes/pictures of anything they see.   Another group of people called the Puebloans inhabited Mesa Verde which is now   a national park. These people were also known as 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies'. The Puebloans advanced in many ways when they came to their new found home, an example would be that they made bow and arrows instead of having spear throwers. This invention made hunting easier for them. They were also getting into farming, this made them hunt less because they spent more time in the feilds.       The last group of people I'm going to mention are the Pavlopetri. Long ago their   city sank. This city was in ancient Greece, not the ancient Greece we all know of but even longer ago than that. Recent discoveries with hi-tech underwater equiptment made it possible for archaeologists to dive down and see what life was like there. Although we have no idea why it sank, we have many theories.       The art, the architecture, the way they lived is something we can use now so we   don't make mistakes that they may have made. If I do say so myself, I find this interesting. Honestly, where would we be today without learning this, without making discoveries? Probably living in caves wearing animal fur to cover us up.

Item_Response: Ancient cilivilizations of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri  are important to our world's history. They contributed culture, language, and acrchutechture into our modern day society.                               The Inca had no official language or alphabet but they used methods of knotting strings called quipus to record the calender and to keep count of livestock. The Inca had left clues of religion, art, agriculture, government and transportation. How do we know about the Inca? We know most of what we learn about them from stories or legends being passed down. Some of the stories we know of today come from the Spaniards who did not speak the Inca language but described what they saw. Some artifacts we know of come from the ruins of buildings and graves of the dead. The Inca had lived in the Andes mountains where it was difficult to reach. From what the Inca had done in their civilazation, has contributed to the future. They lived in the mountains, later on, other uses for protection has been used. Language has devolped differntly, art has evolved, transportation and our calender may had follewed a pattern of the Inca as well. Therfore, Inca society has influenced modern day as well.                   The Publoans had influenced society as well but in different ways. The Puebloans lived in pithouses from A.D 550 to A.D 750. Agriculture then began for their civilization. The mesa-top was suitable for farming. They were known for bascket making  and their skill for that craft. From beind nomadic they began to have a more settled life style. They farmed, hunted and gathered. They created weaponds such as the bow and arrow, and for more accuracy the atlatl, a spear thrower. Later on, their population multiplied. They have contributed alot to society by having agriculture, hunting and weapondry. Inconclusion their life style had been used later on as well, people created more advanced weaponds, farming and crafts.                   The lost city is more seen as a lovely scenery to live in. There were courthouses, gardens, courtyards, main streets, shards of pottery and religious sculptures were discovered. Marine geologists are still trying to determine why this city sank. Theories want to show that it sank due to earthquakes, or a tsunami. The site stretches 30,000 square meters above the ocean ground. The sight was founded only forty years ago by a British oceanographer. Therfore, the Lost city had contriuted architecture, landscaping, and crafts to society.                   In conclusion, the three civilizations of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavopetri have influenced the modern day culture of farming, architecture, and crafts. Without these civilizations we might not have had the arts and buildings we have today.

Item_Response: The Past       Have you ever wondered what the past was like? How we       developed into what we are now? Well I have, and that is why I       am typing this report so I can tell you all about it.       To begin with, I would like to tell you about the ancient       Inca of Peru. Surprising, they did not have a formal alphabet or       system of writing. Instead they made knots in colored strings to       record the calendar and to keep count of their livestock. The       first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed at their system of        quipus. How did they run such a large empire with just strings to       keep records. No one today even knows what the knots mean.       Since we have little record about the Inca most of what we       know comes from stories that were passed from generation to       generation. We only know some stories though because the       Europeans who arrived in the empire described the Inca in       diaries and letters. The rest of our knowledge comes from       artifacts and other things they may have left behind such as       pottery, gold, silver, or clothing.       Secondly, I would like to explain to you the history of the       ancient Puebloans. Mesa Verde National Park has a great       reminder of the culture. These ancient people have been called       the Anasazi or 'the ancient ones', Puebloans or 'village       dwellers', or Cliff Dwellers. They are also known as       Basketmakers because they have a skill for crafting. Agriculture       began to replace hunting and gathering and they lived in small       villages and sometimes in cliff recesses.  Also Pithouses       became very popular buildings and their population multiplied.       These people were excellent at building, they were very crafty,       and they were skillful.       Lastly, I would like to inform you about the Lost Greek       city. The secrets of this lost city may have inspired one of the       world's most enduring myths.  The fable of Atlantis has been       brought to light beneath the waters off southern Greece. It has       been explored by many archaeologist and marine geologists.  It       dates back to 5,000 years. It is thought to believe that is is the       oldest submerged town in the world and it was there long before       the classical Greece. Atlantic takes up about 30,00 square meter       of ocean floor and was consumed into the sea about 1000 BC.        Well I told you that I would tell you about the past and I       have. No longer do you have to wonder what it was like and       how we got to where we are. This report told you everything       you needed to know and more. Did you learn as much as I did?

Item_Response: During our discoveries of other ancient civilizations, there are three in particular that were important.These three are the Inca civilization,Puebloans, and the Mycenaean society.            First, the discovery of the Inca civilization was important because it helped us learn about their history and preserve it.It also tells us or explains how life was back then for these people and what they did during the time of 1438-1532.Not only does it provide us with information on their way of life, it gives us a way to preserve it through stories and even maybe art.Although getting the information was a hard task, it was well worth it.            Second, the discovery of the Puebloans was important because it tells us about their culture and what they did about 1,400 years ago. It gives us insights on what they did to flourish here and their techniques on surviving.We also learn how they built their houses and what they used for their crafting.From these information, we can probably even use some of their ideas to help us invent or come up with other things that'll help us in life.            Lastly, the ancient city of the Mycenaean city was an important discovery because it helped us with many things.It gave us something very big to discover and learn about the under water city that was once a settlement.With the discovery of it, we made new technology for underwater discovery and learned about how the city probably sank.We also learned what they built and what they used in crafting pots,buildings,statues and many more.Most importantly, we learned how they lived and what they probably did during the time before the city sank.            In conclusion, the discoveries of these ancient civilations were important in our lives and maybe even in our histories

Item_Response: The first Eropeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run huge empire using strings to keep records . The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing . By studying these clues, archaeolojists andothers can piece together details of Inca life . Some of the old stores were written by Eropeans who arrived in the empire in 1532 . The ones that would go visit were Spanish soldiers and priest . The Apaniards did notspeak the inca language well . They may not have understood what the Inca told them, so their desacriptions might not be accurate . As in many ancient civilizations, Inca artifacts might be objects made from stone,pottery,gold or silver . Some artifacts turn up in the ruins of buildings . Some treasures were taken centuries ago, but looting still goes on today . They provived the best idea of all about life inperu before and during Inca rule . They write down and photograph any artifacts they find, and note the exact positions in whick they find them. Sometimes archeology confirms historical record . Tell fall of the Inca is easy to date because the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and tookover the empire . The area where they lived hadlong been inhabited by differnent peoples . this has halped to preserve the sites, because looters cannot easily get to them . But it also makes the job of the archaeologists are expert mountains . They have to carry all their equipment up a mountain before they can start to work . Anything they find has to be carried down the mountain for a study . The coldmountains act like a gaint freezer .   Then in the late A.D, 1200s, in the span of a generation or two, they left their homes and moved away . They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow,a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower .   They built the houses one against another in long curving rows,often with a pithouse or two in frint . Farming accounted for more of their diet than before, and much mesa-top land was clearded foragriculture .

Item_Response: The explorations of the Inca , the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri have made an amazing impact on the life of today. They have made an amazing impact on life as it is today. Without these ancient civilizations , our world today could have been very different.                The Inca have done a good job with conserving their artifacts by chosing what type of material they used. If they wanted something to last a long time , they chose rock material like gold, stone, etc. They also used some knot technology. This helped them predict the weather for their crops and their harvest. As they lived in the high mountain area , they also had to adapt to the extremely cold temperatures that were handed to them in their daily lives. This  meant that they had to kill animals with fur and skin them to use their fur as a  , what we call today , sweater. The high mountain areas also helped them by adapting to lthe liow amount of oxygen that was presented into their everyday life.                 The puebloans also built many good homes as well. They built their homes underground about 4 feet below the surface. This meant that less heat could enter in the hot sunny days in mid-August. But when the heat went away in the winter they use the fire-pit as warmth. Although this was a smart idea, it also had its bad times. In august   this would be to cook their meals. When winter came, smoke filled the village and left some habitants walls on their homes charcoal black.                  The sunken city also has a great impact in our lives today. It shows us that although we can live by the sea , it can be unpredictable for us to know when the city will submerge underwater. These people's acietn artifacts showed that they lived in a big city habitated by many. Their artwork shows how their lifestyles. Along with this shows how they made ceramics. Many people have tried to guess how the city was submerged. Many have guessed that a giant earthquake hit the city which caused a giant tsunami to hit the city and make it look like the ocean's snack.                 All of these  have made in impact on today's world. We have taken notice of these cultures and their rulers behind it. Many arts today have also had smiliraities with the art from back then. They've made an amazing impact on today's world and will also make an impact on the future.

Item_Response: The Inca explorations is a very big impact on our lives. The Inca civilization might have been vary different in some ways like how they lived and how their survived. They might have known about some things that we may not know like on things that they used in their regular lives.                   Today we still don't know on how they spoke or communicated because they had no system of writing or no formal alphabet. This left historians questioning themselves because they made knots and we still don't know what they mean or what they symbolize.The civilizations  left behind art, architecture, transportation and their ways of life. Some of the things that they left behind answered some of our questions.                   All civilizations have made good homes. For example,the Pueblonians made and lived in cliff dwellings for less than 100 years but later their home became deserted. The Inca civilization had to be careful because they lived in high ground close to mountains. The people that lived in Atlantis were very close to the sea. their climate might have been warm, but it was a dangerous place to live in the middle of the sea.                 The sunken city has been one of the worlds greatest mysteries because it has gotten all of us to wonder what really happened and how it all went down. Some people have dedicated their lives to try and explore and to try and answer unsolved questions.Some people say that the lost city of atlantis might have been swallowed by the sea by like tsunamis and never to be found.             These great finds are good for today because it can show us if these were a myth or something that really happened and that have been passed down by generation to generation.  I think that eventually we will be able to answer all of these questions and once we do it will it will be a big impact in our lives

Item_Response: Archaeology                 There have been many import discoveries all over the world. There are three important discoveries on lost civilizations. Those are: The Incas, The Puebloans, and The Pavlopetri.Each civilization is important in their own way.             The Inca discovery was important because we can learn their ways of life. It is important to know their ways of life because we can use their mentality of union to unify ourselves. We can also learn how the Incas died. It is important to learn how the Incas died because we can prevent our death by eliminating the possibility that we will die like they did. We can learn about the rules they used to control society. It is important to know the rules they used to control society because we might be able to use the same rules.              The Puebloans civilization discovery was important because we can learn from their skill and craft. It would be nice if we could establish their skill of crafting because they aquired the bow and arrow. Their civilization discovery is also important because we can learn, but improve, their architectural ways. The Puebloans were great architects. They had great buildings that we could use now. This discovery was also important because we could use nature at our advantage like they did. If we used nature better we might be able to get more out of it.             The Palvopetri discovery was important because it was the oldest submerged town in the world. There were older sunken sites but none were so pre-planned. It was also important because of its uniqueness. In terms of size and wealth it was extremely unique. It is also important because it was most likely to be considered a a planned civilization. The fact that this was a planned civilization explains that the Palvopetri people were smart perfectionists.               All discoveries have been important. These three are some of the most important discovered civilizations yet.The Incas Civilization was important for its ways of life. The Puebloans was important for its skill and craft. The Palvopetri was important for being the oldest submerged civilization.

Item_Response: The Discoveries of the Civilizations                  Throughout the years, many discoveries have been made about the ancient Inca, Puebloens, and Pavlopetri civilizations. The discoveries range from the discoveries of ancient temples to pieces of broken pottery. These can portray ideas of religion, government, languages, and ways of lifestyle. These items can help archeologists to learn about their life, and in turn, our past.                 The Incan civilization has many different artifacts which have helped archeologists learn about our past and attract tourists alike. The scientists can use the information collected from the artifacts to learn about other civilizations as well. Tourists can improve a country's wealth and cultural diversity. The Incas and their architecture, art, and government system can draw tourists and archeologists alike.                                                                                                                                                                  The Pueblo civilization contains many important artifacts. These range from primitive pithouses to weaving tables. The weaving tables can show us how clothing looked and was made during that time. The pithouses showed us that they should not take over makeover jobs. These people have many different interesting ways of life, and their artifacts help us to learn more about them.                  The Pavlopetri people had many interesting artifacts in their sunken city, the fabled 'Atlantis.' Its remains show the architecture, arts, tools, and lifestyle of Greece before the Classical Era. These include pottery, temples, tombs, and more. All of these different items make up this fascinating archeological dig.                  The different items in the three civilizations varied widely, but their purpouse to us was always the same; to help us learn of our past. From the pithouses of the Pueblo to the Pavlopetri pottery, each artifact tells a story. Every arifact is unique, and they are truly really neat.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca was such an important civilization because it told about the life of them and what you need to know such as their quipis, their stories and letters, objects made of stone, pottery, gold, or silver, and clothing. Their sites were remarkable.        The Mesa Verde National Park was a home to many settlers. They built their communities amongst the canyon walls. The first Puebloans that lived there were know as the basketmakers. They lived in pithouses.        The lost Greek city was also very important to discover. It remained from 2800-1200 B.C and covers 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor. The exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, and religious structures. They found a possible megaron, and that suggests that the town was a previous elite. Marine geologists thought the settlement sank because of an earthquake of tsunami.
