Item_Response: Over the years, many ancient civilizations have been discovered. All though they may not be the same group of people, or have the same story, they all have one thing in common- they all contain important information on why we are who we are today. These civilizations contain facts about how we as humans have grown physically, and mentally. Although it may not be easy to find, these ancient cities have more information than we can see.                                    First, much of what we know about the people of these ancient cities had been found in simple pieces of clay, stone, or even rocks. For example, the Incas people left some pieces of stone, pottery, gold, and silver. They also found these items in the graves.  This might tell us that they used those items daily, so they possibly made their homes out of them. Also, finding those items in the graves could mean they believed in an afterlives. For another example, the Puebloans were found to have houses of stone, discovered with ruins of stacked stone. Also, some baskets that were found reveal that because they did not use pottery, they did not pay much attention to craft. There are so many things found in only a piece of stone sometimes.                                                                                                                                                  Secondly, a large portion of what we learn from past cities is from stories and sights passed down through the generations. For example, the Puebloans were the first cliff dwellers, but we know this because the cowboys told stories of them to the people. For another example, archeologists often check with the Spaniards for what they know about the Incas from their ancestors, possibly by telling stories or myths. Also, the Lost city has always been known as 'Atlantis', and this was a story that has never been confirmed until recently. Stories and myths play a large part in unlocking the past of ancient civilizations.               Finally, sometimes geography helps us learn more of the cities we know little about. For example, the waters surrounding the lost city in Greece have helped to move the sand and reveal artifacts. For the Inca, the cold mountain tops and cliffs have prevented the looters from taking and ruining history to be discovered and preserving the information for archaeologists. geography plays a large part in our history that is being discovered.               Lastly, it is all because of these many things that we know where we come from and how we have learned to adapt and grow. Without the information we have learned from ancient cities such as the Puebloans, the Inca, and the Lost City, we would not understand why things are the way they are today. We cannot learn anything more without the help of our past relatives.

Item_Response: Why were the dicoveries that have been made about the Inca,the puebloans,and the pavlopetri so important.And how to the affect us today.        The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabrt or system of writting.They did not leave archives for historians to study.The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to recrord the calender to keep a count of livestock.The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could have a huge empire using strings to keep records.Archaeologist have found many ancient quipus,but today no one knows what the knots mean.        The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D 550.They are known as baskrtmakers for there skill at the craft.Formerly nomadic, they were beginning to lead a more settled way of life.Farming replaced hunting and gathering as ther main livelihood.        Explored by an Anglo-Greek team of the archaeologist and marine geologist and known as the pavlopertri,the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of homers heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented.        The site,which staddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern pelopronnesse is belived to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC.Althogh discoverd by british oceanographer some 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine archaeologist,adided by digital technolagy,wre able to properly survey the ruins

Item_Response: Why discovering lost civilizations is so important           There are many reasons that discovering lost empires and civilizations is important.For instance, they could learn some possible battle strategy's , learn about the past, and it might solve our economic problems.       The Incas had been defeated by the Romans in 1532. We would be able to figure out the Romans battle strategy and plans. we would be able to use there battle formations in our own wars. Not to mention that the Romans took over most of Europe at one point.       Wouldn't you be interested  in learning the past about your country. learn what your ancestors did back in the day. You would know the Incas lived in the same places as monks. That the Puebloans fled mesa Verde to be with there own kin. Or how about a lost Greek city that has been submerged underwater for more than 5,000 years!       Now think about our economy, Global Warming. back then , they did not have to worry. they did not make carbon footprint. No, they did everything the old fashion way. By hand, not by robots and machines. People are just getting lazier in the years.       older civilizations will always be important to us. we will not always succeed  but we will learn from our mistakes. we can leave a message so others wont make the same mistakes. Like getting beaten in battle because of a strategy. Or learning something new can make changes. These discoveries could possibly help our economic goals. That is why discovering older civilizations is important.

Item_Response: Old sights have now been found in different places all over the world. The Ancient Inca have been found in Peru, Ancestral Puebloans have been found, and most excitingly a new sighting of the lost city of Atlantis was found off the coast of Greece. Recently archeaologists have may discoveries of these sightings.                 First off there are the Inca found in Peru. An ancinet sighting has been found in Peru but archeaologists are having trouble learnign about their way of life.The Inca did not keep any records in a form of alphabet or writing system but only knots and colorful string. Archeaologists know that these were used to record crop growing. There is knowone that we know of that can translate these knotted strings. Other ways we know about the Inca is from some of the stories passed downfrom older generations. Some of these stories were also written down by Europeans who had arrived. Sadly, some of these stories were rather legends than history. Another problem archeaologists face is that this sighting, as well as many others, have been looted long before. The ancient Inca still lay as a mystery in our hands.                 A group known as the Ancestral Puebloans lived in North America before Europens had showed up. They lived in the Mesa Verde for over 700 years. This group was known as 'Basketmakers' for their skill and and weaving. They were once nomads but soon became farmers and begn to settle. They lived in houses called pithouses. They aslo have found out about bows and arrows which quickly replaced throwing spears. After their population grew they began to make mud houses with walls above ground. Even later after that theyu began to make stone buildings up to two or three stories high. The Peubloans later moved back to the cliffsides. knowone knows the reason for sure about why they made this move.                 The last source is about the Greek city which is most commonly known as 'Atlantis'. Atlantis has been mentioned many times in different books, but recently archaeologists have found an underwater settlement that has most likely been identified as Atlantis. This settlement dates back about 5,000 years ago. Divers have found buildings, courtyards, sidewalks, and religious structures. There are many different theories anout why the city sank but the most agreed on theory is that a sea level chango occured or ground subsidence. It was also predated about the same time Plato wrote his book about Atlantis.                  These three sightings bring up interesting and important event changes in our modern day archeaologists lives. This has been a great find and can reveal old myths and legends from the past. I think the significant finding of Atlantis is the most interesting find of the three.

Item_Response: Have you every herd of a lost city? Or even the thought of having mysterious places tell you their secrets? Well the Ancient Inca, Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World, and the Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets are all mysterious in their own ways. they are all different in their own ways and yet equally interesting. In the following paragraphs I will give information of all sites and answer some educational questions.      The Ancient Inca of Peru, had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They also didn't leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots with colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of live stock. Since now one knows how to read the yarn patterns that they used, we don't really know exactly what they mean. Understanding the Ancient Inca is a lot like solving a mystery. The rest of the knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts, or objects that they left behind. Yet some Inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters. Some of the Inca's lived high in the Andes where looters couldn't reach. Which was goof for the historians.      About 1,400 years ago, before Europeand explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home.

Item_Response: The Inca people had no formal writting system so they had to make colored knots in strings called quipus to record the calender and keep track of livestock. Clues left behind by the Inca have told us all we know about there way of life. Artifacts and clues are the most reliable sourses but stories that have been passed down from generation to generation have been somewhat of a help.     The Mesa verde people lived about 1,400 years ago in North America. Some lived in little hut things that they made and some were cliff dwellers that lived in the cliffs and hills. They had fire in the summer that was mainly for cooking and in winter it helped them through the harsh cold weather.      Archaeologists have discovered some lost ruines of a city lived in long ago. The city is located in Neapolis, Greese. They found lost artifacts like ceramic pots, walls of buildings, and other things like that. Item_Response: Discoveries made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important for the following reasons.       Knowing the difference between ancinet civilizations are important. Characteristics of civilizations vary depending on where they live. Its important to have a general idea on how they lived at the location they were found. You can tell a lot about a civilization just by the region they live in.       Its also important to know a little bit about every civilization so you can compare and contrast others. Such as how mountain civilizations vary from mountains from one country to mountains from another. This way you can tell if those two groups were similar or even the same.       Another important thing is to know where it came from and what happened to it. Knowing what happened to a dead civilization would make it much easier to find the remains of a city or remains of the people themselves. Discoveries like that could tell archaeologists all about them, without having to do very much.       The last great reason to know about these civilizations is artifacts. It is very important to know what these ancient civilizations made, and how they influenced the production of materials today. Such as how the Puebloans weaved baskets and how they made their houses out of stone. These ideas had to come from somewhere. The regions in which they lived may still look similar to how they did back then, just because their ideas and beliefs have been passed down.

Item_Response: Why the discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important you ask? In this article im going to be telling you exactly why they are, Using these three sources: Source #1 'Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past,' Source #2 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World,' and finally Source #3 'Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets.'            Archaeologists learned alot about the history of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, by finding artifacts and historic sights. In Source #1 'Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets oth the Past,' There were some examples on why finding and learning these things are so important. Without knowing these things we wouldnt know how the way of life was back then, and how much weve changed since then, we have something to compare us to. In the passage it says, 'Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art, and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and the way of life.'            In Source #2 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World,' there were examples on why finding artifacts, and history about the tribes are important also. In the passage it talks about how Puebloans florished in there village as basket makers, and hunters. We wouldnt have known that if archaeologist had'nt of studied them, and found artifacts. 'Ever since local cowboys first reported the cliff dwellings in the 1800s, archaeologists have sought to understand these people's lives.' Wiht that said even if you arent an archaeologist you can still help of give information you found to help.            Source #3 'Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets,'  Is a great source for examples on this subject. With most if not all of this civalization under water, it is quite hard to learn, and see to find different artifacts to tell the world about. In the pasage it talks about how without this we wouldnt have very much prrof to back up the myth Atlantis which very much of the world has been going on about for years. here is an example from the passage, ' The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths - the fable of Atlantis - have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece.' Thats a big discovery if you ask me.            All of this said, The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are all very important to students, techers, and even the world.

Item_Response: Discoveries made by archaeologists about the Inca, the  Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because it is useful to know about other civilizations. Making discoveries about civilizations helps us understand how and when things happened a long time ago. Because of these discoveries archaeologists found safer ways to get to them, how to excavate the places, and better awareness of dangerous climates.       An example of finding safer ways to get to a spot where there is artifacts is in source one 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks Secrets of the Past', there is a spot where the Incas could have been buried but it was up in a cave on a mountain and the archaeologist found a safe way to get there. Also there is more technology that is forming that is helping archaeologist get places and find them. Another example is in source three, 'Lost Ancient Greek City that may have inspired Atlantis myth give up secrets' where the city is underwater and archaeologists have to use a submarine to get to it or they have to use scuba gear.       Archaeologists also are more aware of dangerous climates where the spot where they are finding their artifacts are. In section two, 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks Secrets of the Past' there is a quote 'Many of their sites are in remote, high places.' This quote means that the archaeologists have to make a good plan on how to get there, how to get out and what to do if they are lost.

Item_Response: The Inca are very important because they had no formal alphabet and no system of writing, And they were the only ones to use knots made out of colored string to record a calender. They also did not leave any archives for historians study, and no one today knows what their knots mean, and without understanding what they mean the Ancient Inca is a like solving a mystery.               The Puebloans were a tribe that settled in Mesa Verde they were very good basketmakers and were known very well because of their skill. They were really good at hunting also and farming.They were very talented people they knew how to make pottery and also how to make bows and arrows. The houses they lived in were called Pithouses, these houses featured a living room and also had a air deflector and storage bins or they might of had pits.               The Pavlopetri is an underwater town and is one of the oldest towns on earth the dating is about 2800 to 1200 BC, it is a very unique and old town. it is about 30,000   square meters on the oceans floor. The secrets of a lost city have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths, the fable of Atlantis it has been brought to light from under the ocean of southern Greece. Item_Response: Information from the past to learn about how we are affected by it now.  If we do not have our facts right about the past we cannot advance toward the future.  We absorb this culture to learn about what we could use to advance now.  We can use this knowledge to learn better ways of surviving and living.  With their information we can use it to plan our future, and how Earth has changed.  With this we can see how we have changed and can change.       Ancient Inca:  Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past   The Inca was a tribe who inspite having a weird way of running government and economics they survived.  Their artifacts that were left, had barely been damaged due to their environment.  This helps us learn how our environment has a great effect on us.  The Spaniards came and wrote about them.  These newcomers to this land they have never seen before was odd, because they could not understand the Inca.  These two types of people were different from eachother and on two different levels in technology.  Stories about the Inca were passed down from generation to generation.  The stories lived on and on, even after the loss.  The Inca were took over by the Spaniards.  The Spaniards killed their king.  We now know how we have advanced from doing things like that.  Killing enisent tribes would now be thought of as 'not right'.  This shows how we have changed to more civil people.       Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World   Before the Europeans came their were different people living here than we have today.  They were called Ancestral Puebloans.  They are knowns as Basketmakers.  This is different from how it is today, because we mostly have machines do all the work.  They lived on mesa tops. They have pithouses, it was a house that sunk in the ground and was almost like our houses today.  The houses evolved to kivas.  That shows how much change is happening and how it is forming to today.  They later started building them above ground just like most people today.  Their population was increasing and they were evolving in technology as well.  They went from pole-and-adobe construction to stone masonry.  The population was getting out of hand so some people were moving back to the place that sheilded their ancestors.  Researches may use this information to help deal with problems of today like immigration and other problems that may cause population issues.  Then drasticly almost all of the Ancestral Puebloans moved back to the place where their ancestors lived.  Soon the place was deserted and almost no Ancestral Puebloans lived at the place they left.  Researchers could not find the information about why they had left that place.  They guessed maybe it was resource, social, political problems, or maybe they look for new opportunity.  We could use this information to stop things like this from happening in the future.  Information like this could help with this if something like this ever happened again.        Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets   Their was a fable of a sunkin city.  They found something that may have started the fable and are now excavating it.  It is said to be the oldest sunked city in the world.  It is said to have had people in it about 5,000 years ago.  This tells us how much has changed over the years.  A whole town was put under water.  This can give us later information about how the ocean will effect our environment.  It was nearly untouched since it has been isolated.  The town was big and suprised them.  Some say it was either earthquakes or a tsunami that put it underwater.  Some say both.  The story was passed down from generation. This tells how we can provide information for future people.

Item_Response: Explanitory Article: Why were the discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri so important?       By Clay Martin       Over the years, archaeologists have made several amazing discoveries about our world from the past. Some of these discoveries, for example, are the discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri civilizations. We can learn and discover many things about ourselves and these people from the artifacts we find in their homes. These civilizations are obviously very important. In my opinion, the reason that they are most important is that they can teach us about both ourselves and them.       The Inca are one of these amazing civilizations. Through artifacts, we have learned that they used colored strings called quipus to record things. We have learned that they were defeated by the Europeans in 1532. We have learned that they had one of the largest empires ever. All of these facts were discovered because of artifacts.       The Puebloans are another great civilization. They lived in Pithouses. They invented the bow and arrow. They were known as the basketmakers. We have learned all these facts because of artifacts.       A third civilization in this group is the Pavlopetri. Archaeologists have discovered that they lived in Atlantis. They've discovered that Atlantis is the oldest planned town ever. They've been able to come up with theories of how Atlantis was destroyed, such as sea level changes, an earthquake, or a tsunami. Again, these discoveries came from artifacts.       There is a lesson to be learned from these artifacts and discoveries. Although these civilizations were amazing, they all have one thing in common: they made mistakes. They weren't perfect. There isn't, never has been, and never will be a perfect civilization. But if we learn from the mistakes of those who came before us, we will be able to become more perfect. There is only one way for us to become more perfect: if people work together and honor and respect one another.

Item_Response: Lost Civilazations       Part 1.   Source #1.   The ancient Inca had no formal alphebet or system of writing. The Inca made knots in colored string to record the calender to keep count of livestock. Today no one knows what the knots mean. A lot of the knowledge comes from the artifacts left behind, and from the sites in which the artifacts were found. Archeologists found stone, pottery, gold, and silver. They also found Ince textiles and clothing. Some Inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters. The Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire. The Inca lived high in the Andes and may have even worshipped some mountain peeks.   Source #2.   About 1,400 years ago a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. For more than 700 years they and their descendants lived and flourished here, eventually building elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. Then, in the late A.D. 1200s, in the span of a generation or two, they left their homes and moved away.Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. they lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. They used bow and arrow for hunting.   Source #3.   The sunken settlement dates back some 5000 years ago. The site is believed to be consumed by the ocean.       Part 2.   Archeologists find artifacts which help them to discover what happened to the lost civilizations. But sometimes the artifacts dont always survive.

The site, which staddles 30,000 spuare meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Item_Response: The Inca are importent because there are many ways you can find out how they lived.          You can find how they lived by how they dressed, or by the pottery they used, there household supplies, or by the religous artifacts.Among the most important things to learn about a civilization are where it came from and what happend to it.          The ancient inca of peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to recored the calendar to keep a count of livestock.          Some inca textiles and clothing have survived remarkanly well. Ancient materials like cloth are usually desroyed by dampness, but these have been preserved in the dry deserts on perus coasts or the cold mountions of the anders.          Archaeologists can compare what they learn from artifacts and sites with the spaniards accounrs of the inca. Sometimes aecheology confirms historical record.         There are so many ways to find out about archerology wether its what the ware or what they eat or any type of writing.

Item_Response: The Ancient Inca Of Peru Had No Formal Alphabet Or System Of Writing.They Instead Made Knots  In Colored Stirngd Called Quipus To Record The Calendar To Keep A Count Of A Livestock.They Were Amazed They Could Run A Large Empire Using Strings To Keep Records.Till This Very Day No One Ever Knows What The Knots Were For.Historians Have To Be Very Careful When They Interpret The Accounts.Their Descriptions Might Not Have Been That Very Accurate,And Some Of The Inca Stories Were More Like Legends Than History.The Rest Of Our Knowledge Comes From Artifacts.                                                                                                                                                                                               In Many Ancient Civilizations,Inca Artifacts Might Be Objects Made From Stone,Gold And Many Other Materials.These Such Materials Last A Very Long Time,Even If They Have Beem Buried For Hundreds Of Years.Some Artifacts Turn Up In The Ruins Of Buildings.Others Are Found Buried In The Graves For The Dead To Use In The Afterlife.Some Inca Textiles And Clothing Have Also Survived Remarkably Well.                                                                                                                                                                                                              Ancient Materials Like Clpth Are Usually Destroyed By Dampness.But These Have Been Preserved In The Dry Deserts On Peru's Coasts.Some Inca Sites Have Been Disturbed By Treasure Hunters Or Looters,Who Will Willingly Take Anything That May Be So Called Valuable.Looting Still Goes On This Very Day.                                                                                                                       Archeologists Can Compare What They Learn From Artifacts And Sites With Spaniards'Accounts Of The Inca.Sometimes Archeology Confirms Historical Record.Among The Most Important Things To Learn About a Civilization Are Where It Came To Happen.

Item_Response: THE DISCORVERY OF THE ANCIENT         These dicovery of the Inca,Pueblons,and the Pavlopetri are important to our history.I'm going to explain the reasons they're important and what they have done to become important.These people were on the earth way before our time.      To start off the Inca.They were from Peru and which they had no formal alphabet of system of writing.The way you would know the date is if you spoke thier language and knew what the different colors in the knots meant.That was a way to tell stories too.Life remained there from 1438-1532.The way you would be able to know about the civilzation from thousands of years ago was because clues were left by the Inca portraits of thier religion,art,agiculture,government,and ways of life.      Next up the Pueblons.About 1,400 years ago long before the Europeans explored North America a group of people living in the Four Corners claimed this as thier home.They stayed there for more than 700 years.But in the late A.D 1,200 they moved.Pueblons were called Anasazis which translated to 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies'.They are now called Ancestral Pueblons reflecting thier modern descendants.      Last but not least Pavlopetri.The marine geologistists or Anglo-Greek team or archaeologists.They explored the sunken settlement of Atlantis whick sunk about 5,000 years ago.It was known as the most submerged town in the world.The dates went from 2,800-1,200 BC long before the glory days.      In conclusion these people are important to our history  even though they are from the ancient times.For more information look on the internet or in the libary to find facts about the Inca,Pueblons,and the Pavloptris.

To this day, know one really knows what the colored strings mean, orhow they work. Incas made almost everything out of silver,gold, stone, or pottery, which made things last longer. Some artifacts are found buried for the dead, so it can be used in the afterlife.            All of this really shows how Incas have left many great artifacts and monuments for us figure out where our ancestors come from, and how they lived in a time of survival. All of this is really improtant because, it gives us a sense of how different people were back then compared to now and that artifacts have trully given us a sense of the kind of people they were back then. Archaeologists have found that some ofthe artifacts date back some 5,000 years ago or more. Item_Response: Long ago the ancient civilizations of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri bustled with life. Now as archeologists take a closer look inside the lives of these people, we could learn more about these people than we ever imagined we would.        First, the archaeologists climbed high up into the Rocky Mountains so that they could explore the ruins of the Inca. They found that to keep records they tied complex knots, no one know exactly what they mean though. They also found old cups, bowls and other stone or metal objects like jewelry. These findings help one to try and understand how these items were made and what they might have been used for. They also discovered bodies that are so well preserved that they could use modern medicine to figure out how that individual died.        Then, archeologists traveled to Mesa Verde, the ancient city in which the Puebloans used to exist. They found odd huts, called a pit house. These houses where supported by four corner timbers and had a fire pit with an air deflector. The people then graduated to adobe house, which were stronger. Their pottery also changed, instead of having dull gray pots, they used elaborated black and white drawings.          The archeologists then went to Greece, just off the coast to explore the sunken settlement of the Pavlopetri. It is said that the civilization sunk about five thousand years ago and no one is absolutely sure how it can to be under water. While there, archeologists explore a world of buildings, from courtyards to tombs. This city was covered in shards of broken pottery. This civilization is a wonderful mystery that no one is quite sure about, but if we keep searching we might find an even bigger surprise.        Exploring ancient civilizations like the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlovian is important because it teaches one about the history of these amazingly smart people.

Item_Response: The discovery of ancient civilizations have served as a key to understanding the human race's past.  The findings from the Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri, give archaeologists an idea of their lives and culture.  The discoveries also show how far in relation we are with our past brethren.  Archaeological findings are doors that lead us into the past.       One civilization was the Incas.  The Incas were natives to Peru, and lived high up in the Andes Mountains.  The artifacts found have allowed us to see the Incas culture.  We learned that they worshiped many gods, practiced blood sacrifices, and had a craving in poetry.  Archaeologists have learned another civilization through the mere discoveries of artifacts.  The Incas however, are considered a lost civilization.  There demise  is apparent through the findings of a hand full of Spanish records.  The Spaniards over all led to the ending of the once great civilization.  This shows the the finally to the the Incas.       The Pavlopetri's town is what must have inspired the myth of Atlantis.  The town is submerged in the waters off the coast of southern Greece.  The city is still intact, as if it was built underwater, and artifacts still remain.  This shows how real life events can be transformed into a well known myth.  There are many theories that surround how this city came to be underwater.  The main theory seems to be that the change in water levels is what lead to the town's condition.  The Pavlopetri were a distant group that inspired the myth of Atlantis.      The Puebloans were a group of native Americans who lived in the Four Corners Region.  The civilization created well designed stone communities in which they could keep cool within their houses.  This shows the innovation within the past humans.   The Puebloan had a huge change within their lifestyle. They went from nomadic to living in small villages.   This shows the major change.       The findings from archaologists help us lead into the past.  The Incas, the Pavlopetris, and the Puebloans all consist of this group.  The inovation of our past can easily compare with the technology of today.  We can better understand the pats through the discovery of acient artifacts.

Item_Response: The Incas, Puebloans and the Pavlopetris all had important discoviers that impact the world we live in today. Without many of these discoveries the life we live in today would be extremely different.              Even though the Incas did not have a formal writing system or alphabet they still found different ways to live there life. They made different colored knots called quipus which recorded the calender to count all for the livestock. Archaeologist found this amazing that the huge empire the Incas lived in was organized by these color strings. Still to this day nobody has figured out what these knots mean. Many other objects where left behind such as, amazing portraits of there religion, art, arcarchitecture, agriculture, government, transportation and also their was of life. There are many different ways to find out about history but one way historians found out about the Incas history is from oral history which is stories passed down for generation to generation. The Incas story and history is an amazing thing to learn about but, they aren't the only group of people that lived around that time.             The ancient Puebloans of Mesa Verde lived 1,400 years ago before Europeans explored North America. Mesa Verde the home of the Puebloans means 'green table' in SSpanish. In 550 A.D the Puebloans where known as Basket makers because the where skilled at a variety of different crafts. This amazingly interesting group of people lived in a home called pit houses these homes featured a living room which sunk a few feet into the ground. In 750 A.D they began to build houses above ground  that had upright walls which where made of poles and mud. The Puebloans built the houses one against another in long and curving rows. They had many different skills that not everybody had.          Beneath the waters of Greece there lays a sunken settlement that inspired the fable Atlantis. Anglo a Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists known as Pavlopetri explored this settlement back 5000 years ago. The most interesting fact about this settlement is that it was a planned city filled with buildings,courtyards and streets. Not too long ago many archaeologist where finally able to explored this sunken settlement.       In conclusion, the Incas, Puebloans and the Pavlopetris had many different skills but without archaeologists finding these amazing objects our world wouldn't be the same today.

Item_Response: Many people have wondered how the people survived back then. Nowadays you don't have to worry about survival that much. But back then for the ancient Inca they had to do things different ways then we do. For instance, their calendars aren't on paper, their calendars are strings that are called quipus to record the count of livestock. Some Inca textiles have been preserved over many years because the Inca lived in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts and the cold mountains of the Andes. Bu some artifacts have been taken by treasure hunters many years ago. Some treasure are still out there for archaeologists to find.Archaeologists are good at keeping records of what they find and where they can find something. Archaeologists have more of a job than just finding artifacts, but they also have to get as much evidence as they cand to get information from the artifact. They lived in houses called pithouses that later evolved into kivas. A kiva is a Hopi word for ceremonial room-- here underground cahmber comparable to later churches. Many people have also discovered the Lost Greek City. They find many artifacts that were covered by the ocean floor. Some of the settlements they found date back to 5,000 years ago. One of the sites they found is 30,000 square meters of ocean floor next to the southern Peloponnese. They also found artifacts that dated bacl to the stone ages. All together many archaeologists have found many artifacts in the past years. But there is still many more out there probably.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Incans, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because once we learn about them we can see the mistakes and the flaws they made and prevent that from happening to us. One thing in common between them was they had troubles. The Inca were killed off by the Spanirds, the Puebloans ran their resources dry, and the Pavlopetri's community sank to the bottom of the ocean.There are many things we can do to prevent that from happening to us.              The Inca were attacked and killed off by the Spaniards. The passage states that the last Incan ruler was killed in 1532 by the Spaniards. In order to prevent an attack everyone needs to be prepared. The Incans left behind a lot of art and architecture, religion, agriculture, government, transportation, and their way of life. One thing they did not leave behind were a lot of weapons.              The Puebloans used up all of the resources in the area where they were living. The passage states that they had to go to New Mexico and Arizona. They accumulated many skills and traditions, but were not conservative enough with their resources. To prevent this happening to us we need to be more conservative with our natural resources. Just planting one tree for every tree that we cut down prevents the same thing from happening to us.              The Pavlopetri's community sunk to the bottom of the ocean. People belive this was because the sea level changed, there was an earthquake, or there was a tsunami. The way to reduce the risk of an earthquake is to be careful when building a city on a fault line. The way to reduce the risk of a tsunami is to keep cities a fair distance from water. The way to reduce the risk of the water level changing is to kepp buildings near water higher up.              If we do all these things we will reduce the risk of ending up like the Inca, the Puebloans, or the Pavlopetri. These things are not very hard and can save many lives. Many People die of hunger every day. any people also die of drowning every day. Even more people die of natural disasters of all kinds every day though.

Item_Response: I have read multiple articles from National Geographic about past civilizations ranging from Peru to the lost city of Atlantis off the coast of Greece. There were three different civilizations all in different part of the globe. The Inca in the Andes mountains of Peru. The Greeks in the underwater city of Atlantis.  Each very diverse.           The city of Atlantis has been a myth for as long as time has existed but with new technology they have discovered it is real. Dr Jon Henderson says 'There is no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in history.' The underwater town reveals that it was a world of tombs, buildings, courtyards, religious buildings and shards of pottery. The town also has a megaron which it was run by an elite which raised the status of the town. The town was never reoccupied so everything is untouched as if life was frozen in time preserving everything as it was thousands of years ago.       The Inca were another fascinating civilization. Located in the Andes mountains the Inca were able to preserve many of their artifacts because of the desert and the high mountain ranges of the Andes. The Spaniards eventually conquered the Inca and put out the civilization.       In conclusion their are many fascinating lost civilizations. From Greece to Peru   there are keys to the past everywhere.

Item_Response: The discoveries of all these different settlements are importand because they teach us a part of history that is long forgotten. The Inca's history may of been confusing but it still teaches us what they did back then. Like how they used special strings to tie knots in called quipus to keep track of different things. The Spanish sent soldiers and missionaries over to study them and teach them about christianity. They wrote diaries about what they did and tried to interpret what they said in their language. Now when archaeologists try to go to the sites where are buried they have to be careful of which one they go to because some of them are robbed by looters and other people. There are still many sites that are left unharmed like the ones in the moutains where most of the bodies are well preserved and looters can't get to.        There was another civilization that is gone now but excisted. The archaeologists call them the Anasazi whis is translated from a Navajo term meaning the ancient ones. Now we just call them the Ancentral Puebloans. The first ones lived in a placed called Mesa Verde around A.D. 550. They were famous for their backetry. They were very nomadic before settling at a city they started farming more and hunting less. They also learned to make pottery and made the bow and arrow which was a better hunting tool than their atlatl or spear thrower. In two hundred years they started making their houses above ground instead under ground. These houses were usually made out of sticks and mud. Later they stopped using this method and started using masonry. They made connected houses out of stone with over 50 rooms and 3 stories. When the cowboys told some people that there were houses in the cliffs archaeologists tried to seek the answers about their lifestyles there. When they were building their houses they started using nature to their advantage and built houses in overhaning cliffs.         Finding a city underwater can be unusual but the one that can be linked to the Atlantis myth is an awesome discovery. A team of archaeologists and marine geologists started exploring the old city. One of them said that this was the oldest city ever to be sunken because the remains that date back to 2800 BC to 1200 BC. This is before the days of the famous Greece we know about. This finding finds the possible history of the Mycenaes people. The geologists haven't yet discovered why this city sank but they think it is because of a tsunami.         This is why I think that these findings are important for the world's history so we can learn more about these ancient civilization and what went on there. This also helps us learn more about the real stories behind the myths and less about the stories they tell us.

By containing this interesting information we are able to understand our history and the people in it. We are also able to relate it to our everyday life and see the imporvements we have made. Item_Response: During the early ages people lived in thriving cities. These very powerful cities soon became deserted or invaded by Spaniards who had a growing greed of wanting to demolish ways of life. We have found the forgotten civilizations on the coast of mexico very intruiging. Some are very hard to learn about due to the fact they speak a completely different language. Some artifacts found let us know how people lived and what they did. In other places it's hard to find artifacts that let us know about a civilizations past because they had been looted. It is still going on today.       Archeologists are constantly running into risks when they excavate and building that is in ruins. They could easily fall and die because of the slippery, or crumbling of the old; still aging building.       For the places that kept articles, like the incas, it is very hard for us to understand exactly what the knots in their quipus. Today, historians are still unsure of what they mean and what they stand for. Trying to understand and gain a little more elaboration from the Inca tribe is like trying to solve an unsolvable mystery.       Clues that have been left behind by citizens are constantly being found and interrogated by historians in order to predict what may have happened to someone or a whole tribe. It is important to know where a civilization came from and most importantly what happed to it. By doing this we know what their cause of scattering or what epidemic swept across the city.       People lived in very simple house structures. Well, they were considered simple unless you were from the Inca's who had very complex structures. In Mesa Verde, adobe and mud, was used to create houses and other needed buildings. From there they went from using pole-and-adobe construction to building something somewhat similar to those of the Incas.       These people have left behind artifacts to a different world we still have yet to discover. There are many things that will sometimes remain hidden until the end of time because we aren't looking hard enough. Or maybe a civilization's secret will stay a secret, leaving us in the pit of our grandest curiousity.

Item_Response: The Inca was a tribe that made a bunch of stuff that we use today. Like pottery and ways to hunt animals and use them for food or clothes. We have discovered a bunch of artifacts. This also teaches us what they used to do in the before time. They didn't have a formal alphabet or system of writing. To keep track of the calendar, they made knots with colorful strings called quipus. But nobody today knows how to use those strings.        For more than 700 years, the puebloans lived here at mesa verde national park. Then, in the late A.D. 1200s, they left their homes and moved away. Mesa Verde National Park reminds us a lot about this culture. The first ancestral puebloans settled at Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They are known as basketmakers for their skill at the craft. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pithoises clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses.        By A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Pottery also changed, from simple designs on a dull gray background to black drawings on a white background. Between A.D. 1100 and A.D.1300, during the Classic Period, the population may have reached several thousand. It was mostly concentrated in compact villages of many rooms, often with the kivas built inside the enclosing walls rather than out in the open.

Item_Response: The discoveries that Archaeologists have found about the Inca, the Ancestoral Puebloans, and the lost greek city are important. They have learned many things about these ancient cultures. For instance, they know that the Inca kept records by using quipus, the records the Inca kept by tying knots on a string. The historians also have a basic understanding of some of the stories the Inca told. Another example is the Ancestoral Puebloans, historians understand that they were skillful builders who liked to use stone. They also know that they became skilled basketmakers, and were exeptional at making pottery. Finally, the lost greek city, since their was a large amount of pottery on the ocean floor, people can infer that their art culture focused on pottery. it is also known that the city is exeptionally large, since it stretches 3,000 meters along the ocean floor. Our curiosity to find out how people lived before us has lead us to find some important things.

Item_Response: Discoveries made at archaeological site are vital to the human species because we have a thirst for knowledge, and with that comes the need to know what happened before us and before written records. Sites like the Inca villages in the Andes Mountains, the cliff dwellers in Mesa Verde, and the sunken city of Pavlopetri all give historians clues to our unknown past and the secrets of yesterday's world. These discoveries are important to us for many reasons, and to feed our natural curiosity, we have traveled the globe, searching for long lost clues to our past.            The artifacts discovered at Inca sites are vital towards finding out the truth of our history. The resources the Incas had at their disposal, such as gold and silver, tells us how they viewed precious metals. The abundance of the metals in Inca society made them less valuable almost, and that viewpoint changes the way historians portray ancient Inca.            The Ancestral Pueblo-ans, who lived in Mesa Verde about 1,400 years ago, originally were nomads, but settled down along canyon walls for about seven centuries. Archaeologists know they flourished, due to the way the soil and ground around the abandoned homes is. The Pueblo-ans show historians how people lived, worked, and died in North America in a portion of the Four Corners.            The Pueblo-ans also resided on cliffs, and soon became known as cliff dwellers. Their advanced masonry told historians that there were some advancements in their society that we did not know were there at all. The remains of both of the Pueblo-ans dwellings exhibit their way for life, the resources they used, how they used those resources, advantages to their territory, and disadvantages to their homes.            Once the lost Greek city of Pavlopetri was found off the coast of southern Greece, archaeologists were all over it, claiming it to be the largest planned submerged city to be discovered so far. The artifacts found on this huge, sunken site are important for our search for the truth. It not only raises more questions on the myth of Atlantis, but it also answers a few too. Archaeologists have been able to date Pavlopetri back to around the time Plato described Atlantis, and the architecture and advancement in buildings and artifacts fits in almost perfectly with Plato's observations of the fabled Atlantis. Some wonder if Pavlopetri is actually the sunken city Plato was referring to, and if it is, what happened? Once again, our natural curiosity and thirst for knowledge takes over and we must know what actually went down at that time in history.           Human beings have a natural hunger for knowledge, and knowing how things happened, why they happened, when the happened, and who they happened to in the past has lead the way for our brains and instincts to find the answers. the discoveries made in the ruins of ancient Inca, the remains of an abandoned civilization in Mesa Verde, and the subterranean mystery in southern Greece all contribute to our understanding of the past and, in some ways, our future.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Incas, Puebloans, and Atlantis have been of great importance because they have affected the way society is today.  These civilizations have left clues that have led historians and archeologists to piece together the lifestyles of these three ancient societies.             The ancient Incas had no formal writing system which made it quite difficult for archeologists to study.  Still, archeologists  were able to learn about their culture through the artifacts found such as textiles and clothing that have survived for the long lengths of time. To learn as much information as they do, they need to keep careful records.  To learn more information,  archeologists can compare with other scientists and come up with an explanation.  It is important for scientists to study the history of this civilization so our society can learn from it and not repeat it.            Discoveries from the first ancestral Puebloans in Mesa Verde make it possible to improve our society's skill and craftsmanship.    Archeologists have learned much about their tools and livelihood.  Production factories can make improvements of these tools and therefore advance in technology.             The secrets of the lost city of Atlantis has allowed scientists to research the field of natural disaster and Earth's movement. The myths of the city have sparked archeologist's interest and now they have been able to research the sunken settlement and find that it was once possibly a lively city.  This extraordinary myth has been able to keep underwater exploration going and has given archeologists the opportunity to survey the rest of the ocean floor.           The findings of the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have been so important as to exploring the old civilizations and improving new ones.  Archeologists have reasearched artifacts, structures, and stories that allow us citizens to think of our daily lives and work to advance in society.

Item_Response: From today, many archaeologists are most curious on the following events or places that happened in our world from out past that lead to the future of the present. Through many researches, there are still following discoveries of the past that give a huge impact to the present of today. Like for example, three discoveries that were important was the lifestyle of the Incas, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. During their time, there were truely remarkable artifacts that were created and unknown items that some scientists just cannot seem to figure out. In other words, as many people seeked more into the facts they soon discovered a whole lot more to it.   In Source #1, the first lifespan that effected our present today was the civilizations of the Incas. During the Inca past time, it was very much important to learn more about their survival skills. One reason is because the Incas lived in a type of climate that was atleast below room temperature and that there was not that much food on the mountains. Another interesting fact on why they were so important is the way the Incas had left behind several pottery made out of silver or gold. Not only did their artifacts gave the humans something to learn more about, but it got more humans involved in the Inca's past.   Then in Source #2, a second civilization that effected the present was the Puebloans. For example, the Puebloans brought a lot of change to our land by creating beautiful baskets as they were mostly known as Basketmakers. Even though they were skilled craft makers, they would usually farm instead of hunting or gathering like most other culturals did. Mostly the real interesting thing they did was build small houses called kivas. Soon their culture impacted greatly on us, but not like the Pavlopetri have.   At last, a final group that influenced out time period is still the Pavlopetri. The Pavlopetri were a group of researchers that wanted to be more fascinated with the lost city of Atlantis. In other words, Atlantis was a city that sunk under the ocean which was told by legend. From that point, people believed that Atlantis could have been a city as more clues were found when some divers found left behind pottery or other artifacts. Next thing, people start commenting about how Atlantis was either sunked by an earthquake or tsunami. Soon, there was not enough facts to prove that Atlantis was real, but it still remains a legend.   After detailing every fact, it is to now on know there were some very important discoveries that not many people get in to. While people out in the world are just minding their own thing, they do not stop and realize how interesting it would be to know what theses discoveries were. As time goes by, more people will soon see the beauty of what the past could be as they listen to hear the most various stories they have ever heard in their life. So the discoveries that involved the Incas, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are just as much important than ignoring the looks of it all. Without these discoveries, there would not be as much for the world to talk about.

Item_Response: The Inca are important because we can learn from their civilization. Inca made knot in colored string called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. Also, their artifact might be object made from stone,pottery, gold, or silver. The Puebloan are also important, that we could learn from what they do on their daily life. They lived in pithouses clustered into small village usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. Also, learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting.Their building and wall of thick, double-coursed stone often rose two or three stories high. Basket show evidence of decline in quality, possibly because widespread use of pottery meant less attention to the craft.The Pavlopetri are important because of the sunken settlement date back some 5,000 years. The site, which straddles 30,000 square meter of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea. They had founded settlement such as building, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs,and religious structures. Many geologist had theories that the sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquake, or a tsunami.

Item_Response: Can these lost civilization help us unlock the past? Throughout history there have been unknown civilizations that haven't been found yet. That is why lost civilizations are an important key in figuring out about our past. They have helped us figure out how and where these people lived, how they kept historical records,and what type of advances they had during their time period.          One important discovery about the lost civilization of the Inca,Puebloans,and Pavlopetir was where and how they lived. These civilization helped archaeologist find out what types of locations they lived in and how they adapted to the environments. For instance, the Inca lived in the high Andes, the Puebloans lived pueblos(villages) in the dester or cliffs, while the Pavlopetir live near southern Greece. These civilizations would have not been found if people had not left any evidence of historical references.          The second wave of discovery from the three civilization were historical records. Without these artifacts, archaeologist would not be able of find bigger discoveries within the civilization. For example the Spaniards that had vistied the Inca wrote down what they seen or heard in their time with the Inca.As for the Puebloans, they had knotted stings that held record keeping, and or certain events, while the Pavlopetir had ruins that held artifacts that helped prove their new advancements during that time period.           Another important discovery about these civilization was that they had an advancement in technology. For example the Inca used materials that would last for a long time, up untill today. While the Inca had lasting materials, the Puebloans had a new advancement in their way of living, such as creating new homes that would be away from danger. Although they all have an amazing advancement, the pavlopetir civilization had a great advancement in their city.           although lost civilizations may be boring, they can tell us about their way of living, historical events, or maybe even their new way of making daily lives better.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important. We learned many thing about the Incas, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetris by observing everything we find at the sites their town/ cities were at.       In the Incas sites, they did not have any formal alphabet or writing system. 'Some of what we know about the Incas comes from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation.' Most of the Inca stories were just mythes or legends rather than history. Still, the historians had to be cafeful when they interpret these accounts because the Spaniards did not speak the Inca language well. 'The rest of our knowledge of the Incas comes from artifacts, or objects that they left behind, and from the sites where artifacts are found.' Their artifacts were made out of stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Archaeologists use some advanced techniques to discover more about the Incas. 'You'll see how aerial photography can help them find patterns in ancient monuments that they cannot see from the ground.' Looters cannot reach some of the sites because they are in high, remote places which helps preserve the sites. That only makes it harder for the archaeologist to his/her job of find information or more artifacts for reseaches. Inca was a great discovory, but there may have been a few bumpy path that led to its discovery.       A group of people, Puebloans,but archeologists call them Anasazi, who lived on North America about 1,400 years ago before Europeans explored it about. They first settled ther about A.D. 550. They were known for their skills of basket making so they were called Basketmakers. They began to make houses with straight walls made out of poles and mud, but instead of in cliff recesses, the house were above ground. ' From here on, these people are know as Puebloans, a spanish worn meaning 'village dwellers'.'They started to advance instead of making pole and adobe construction; they started to do skillful masonry which were walls of thivk, double-coursed stone often rose two or three stories high. The population reached up to several thousand during the Classic Period which was between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300. ' Baskets show evidence of decline in quality, possibly because widespread use of pottery meant less attention to craft.' People began to move back in to the cliffs for some unknown reason. Many archeologists thought maybe it was for defense or a religious or psychological reasons. The structures in the cliffs sre evidence of a society that accumulated skills and traditions and passed them on from generation to generation. 'By the Classic Period (A.D. 1100 to A.D. 1300), Ancestral Puebloans were heirs of a vigorous civilization, whose accomplishments in community living and the arts rank among the finest expressions of human culture in North America. The findings of the Puebloans was a amazing discovery.       'The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths  - the fable of Atlantis - have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece.' An Anglo-greek team of archaeologists and amrine geologists explored Pavlopetri, the suken settlement that dated back some 5,000 years ago.The 30,000 square meters site is believed to have been swallowed by the sea around 1,000 BC. It was discovered by the Britian first, in 2009 the marine archaeologists were able to reach to site, but wuth the help of technology. ''We found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age, which suggested that the settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago, at least 1.200 years earlier than originally thought,'' Marine geologists still do not know what the cause was that sank the settlement to the ocean floor. 'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going,'. Atlantis was the most greatest discovers because it keeped the underwater exploration going and it proved one of the myth about Atlantis true.       All of these discoveries were amazing with the Puebloans and why they went back into there cliff and the Incas and the Pavlopetri and why their city sank. These are all good question, but they are not answered yet because the marine geologist and archaeologists still have not figured them out and are pondering just like we are.

Item_Response: The many dicoveries that have been found about the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavloperti are very important to help us learn about their society and cultures.The clues help us piece together the life they lead. These finds also influence our lifes today.             Archeologists use artifacts they find to tell us more about past civilizations and if they were andvanced. Some artifacts such as Incan clothing and textiles show us the type of weather they endured and what resources they had to make their clothing. Also, archeologists have found objects made from gold and silver. This shows us that Incans had these objects which are now found very valueable today.           Many interesting artifacts have been found about the Puebloans that help archeologists learn more about their daily life and how they lived within their communtiy. Puebloans, also 'known as Basketmakers,' as stated in the article 'The First Ancestral Puebloans in Mesa Verde'. They were called Basketmakers because of their skill at making baskets. Because of this archeologists have found baskets and pottery. Basketmakers also lived in pithouses in small villages. These houses showed us how they lived and what their daily life was like.

Item_Response: Archeologists have found many different artifacts and ruins from the ancient times. Each piece of evidence fitting into the puzzle. Their discoveries have led them to theories about the civilizations that thrived thousands of years before them.          Each artifact has helped archeologists figure out partly what was happening during those years in our history. Some quipus that were found have led them to think that the knotted string was used for counting something, perhaps livestock,or was used as a calendar. Some artifacts were oral, such as stories and legends that were passed down from generation to generation.Some stories were passed down by being written.They were written down by the Europeans who arrivedin the empire in 1532. Things like that can suggest that the Inca were friends with Europeans.          Archeologists have found some of the early Puebloans' pithouses, their homes. They were known as great basketmakers. Maybe that skill got them making their own homes out of straw. As they learned to make pottery, and learned about the bow and arrow, they made a better weapon for hunting. As the Puebloans learned to build, they started making their homes from poles that stood upright and mud. Later on, some stone homes were found suggesting that the were advancing in technology. It also shows that they were constantly finding something better to make their homes out of.          The lost city of atlantis has been found. Since it was found beneath the waters of southern Greece, archeologists have inferred that the city, when still up, was near southern Greece. The sunken civilization dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes. Their are some remains that date from 2800 to 1200 BC. Archeologists have also found that some ceramics date back to the end of the stone age. It suggests that the settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago. The lost city of Atlantis is definitely one of the most interesting underwater ruins yet.            Of all the artifacts and ruins mentioned in the text above, the lost city of Atlantis is a favorite for archeologists. They have found out many interesting theories and suggestions about a lot of  the amazing stuff found on land and underwater. Each artifact is as fragile as a feather and each tells its own story.

Item_Response: Many important discoveries were made during different time periods that have benefited us in the present time. We are grateful for many of the ancient civilizations that have provided us with advice on many different topics but especially on survival. A few of those civilizations such as the Inca, Pueblo and the Pavlopetri, have left many important artifacts from their time behind. These artifacts were very important had have helped or modern society to this day.           For example, The Inca discovered way to survive in the wilderness of modern-day Peru by using nature's materials. They used the quipus ( a string with many knots in it) as a tool to pass messages, record livestock and create a calendar. The quipus was very efficient because they had a very big empire and had to control everyone in it. there was only one capitol and one king but many Incas held a big part in their way of life. They had a very big messenger system that was soon developed using quipus. They used this system to pass quick messages from one end of the empire to the next especially if it was a decree from the king. This system has now led to what we used to call the Pony Express which was postal mail and served exactly like the quipus. This then led to email and text messages that wee use today. If this discovery was made the mail would have taken a long to time be made and now we know the origin of this idea.             Another civilization called the Pueblo were also very important. Their way of living centered on hunting and gathering but they soon started to farm. They had made weapons such as the bow and arrow and spear that have been improved over the years. We don't use weapons like those anymore but in the past wars, they were highly appreciated by soldiers. The were mainly known for their homes, though. Their houses were built of red clay and structured in an organized way. they lived in villages or on cliffs. These architectural structures were beautiful to look at and provided archaeologists with information about the way Pueblos lived. We sometimes build our homes with the same or kind of the material they had. The structure of their homes were so complex that we use the same ones sometimes for own. The Pueblos showed us architecture the nature shows it to us.             The last civilization is a mystery, the underwater civilization of Atlantis. The Pavlopetri found pottery and architectural structures of what seemed like a community that was built underwater. Even though not a lot of information has been found about Atlantis, the sudden discovery of an underwater city build curiosity which keeps up underwater exploration. Through this, we might not find anything about Atlantis but we might know more about the deep blue sea. As we try to keep searching, we have known more things about the sea than we have known before.               All of these ancient civilizations and many more have provided us with history of the past. We have learned from that history and continue to learn, so the many discoveries that were found about each civilization are very important and we should be proud of the archaeologists that use their time to dig up the past and learn from it.

Item_Response: Archaeologists study historical artifacts in order to learn of Earth's past. By studying ancient artifacts, archaeologists have discovered signs of ancient civilizations. Three major discoveries by paleontologists are the Incas, Puebloans, and the lost Greek city.             The Inca civilization lasted from 1438-1532. The Incas lived in Peru and had no formal alphabet or writing system. The only way we reason we know of their existence is through artifacts and oral history. Archaeologists can piece together details of Inca life by  studying the Inca artifacts left behind. The Inca civilization isn't the only civilization historians know about.            The ancient Puebloans lived about 1,400 years ago. They were formerly nomadic, but they began a settled life. Their old hunting and gathering ways were replaced by farming. They lived for more than 700 years in Mesa Verde.  They are known for their skill at the craft of basket making. For an unknown reason, they migrated to cliff alcoves.            Beneath the waters off southern Greece, divers discovered a sunken settlement. The settlement dates back about 5,000 years ago in Homer's heroes time. According to Dr. Jon Henderson, this is the oldest submerged town in the world. The site is 30,000 square meters large, and it is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Many theories of how the city sunk include sea level changes, tsunami, and ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes.             Archaeologists have discovered many artifacts of Earth's past, but there are still numerous more things to be found. For example, less than 1% of the world's ocean floors have ever been surveyed. The Incas, Puebloans, and the lost Greek city are only a few discoveries in the large Earth.

Item_Response: Our world is a gigantic place, with only a small percent of it that has ever been explored. Knowing about the giant civilizations of our past helps us with the search of our world, and our everyday quest for knowledge. It is only logical that we continue to do so, because the benefits of exploration are astronomical.Many of the great civilization of the world did not have a reading or writing system. They didn't really care if future historians and archaelogists found their ruins. What mattered to them was the state of the empire, and what they could do to benefit it. This is why we know so little of a empire that ruled nearly all of South America, or a gigantic underwater city.           What we know of ancient civilizations changes our world today. we need to learn more to know more. We can learn from them, learn about their way of life, and how that could possibly help us today. What if we were to find a ancient technology that produced 10x more energy than it needed to run? This is why the discoveries we find today of ancient civilizations will help us.

Item_Response: How are the discoveries of Incan, Pueblano, and Pavlopetri artifacts important? There are many different traits about the daily life of these tribes that archaeologists discovered at different locations. There are lots of differant objects that the archaeologists such as textiles, pottery, gold, and silver. The Incas were one of the three tribes were talked about in the passage.             The Incas were a Peruvian Empire that ruled for almost one hundred years. Archaeologists have found many differant artifacts on Incan land. one artifact that was found was pieces of string with knots in them. the only thing that archaeologists cant tell about these is that the were most likely to have been used for keeping track of the quantity of things like crops. This would have been important for daily incan life. Another tribe talked about in the article were the Puebloans.             The Puebloans were a group of people who lived in Mesa Verde. They were farmers who lived in small homes known as Pithouses. A major population shift showed that some of the Puebloans beganm to move back to the cliff alcoves. archaeologist dont know the reason for this move. the only thing that they can say for sure is that it had a large impact on the life of the Puebloans.The lat tribe talked about were the Pavlopetri.             The place where the Pavlopetri lived is now submerged underwater. The site is 30,000 square meters of ocean floor. This is thought of to be like an atlantian city. No one can say for sure if this city is Atlantis or if it is just a city that was submerged over time. The only fact that can be drawn from this is that this a a mistery.             There were three main tribes talked about in the passege and these tribes all had some important artifacts or facts about them that most likely had a large impact on life in these reagons.

Item_Response: lost civilizations                   The ancient Inca of Peru was one of the lost civilizations. It had no formal alphabet or system of writing. in order to to keep track of their callender and care for their livestock they made knots in colored strings called quipus. Europeans were amazed that they could run a huge empire useing strings to keep records. Archaeologists have founf many ancient quipus, but today, No one understands what they mean. the civilization lasted for nearly a hundred years (1438-1532).                             Long ago, before Europeans, a group of people living in the four corners region choose Mesa Verde for thier home. Eventualy building elaborate stone communities in the shelterd alcoves of the canyon walls. In the late A.D. 1200s, they left their homes and moved away. Mesa Verde National Park preserves a  spectacular reminder of the ancient civilization. Archeologists call these native people the Anasazi.                   The secrets of the lost city that may have inspired on of the worlds most enduring myth, the fable of Atlantis. many beleive is located beneath the waters off southern Greece. It has bean explored by an Angelo- greek team of archeologists and marine geologistsand known as Pavlopetri. it has been dated all the back from 5,000 years to the time of Homers heros.
