Item_Response: Ancient Inca and the Puebloans are important today because they unlock secrets of the past.  Archaeologists have been studying how Inca and Puebloans have been discovered from different clues left behind and different kinds of research.  Inca left clues about their art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Puebloans have been famous for their skill at the craft, they were known as Basketmakers.           Ancient Inca used quipus to record calendars to keep a count of livestock.  The world know some stories about Inca from the passing of stories from generation to generation and also because of the old stories written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532.  Inca artifacts have been discovered from the ruins of buildings and others are found buried in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife.  Inca textiles and clothing have been preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes.  The Inca sites were disturbed by looters or treasure hunter, who take anything that might be valuable.          Puebloans were also called Anasazi also known as 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies'.  Like most civilizations, hunting and gathering were their main livelihood until it got replaced with farming.  Puebloans lived in pit houses that were usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. Pithouses didn't last long until A.D. 750 that evolved into kivas.  Puebloans use of baskets declined because of the widespread use of pottery.  A major population shift was when the people began to move back into the cliff alcoves.  Kivas were used for healing rites or to pray for rain, luck in hunting, or a good crop.  Mesa Verde was deserted due to drought and crop failures.  Pueblo people, and maybe other tribes, are descendants of the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde.          Archaeologists studied these ancient civilizations not only for the enjoyment, but for the history of it.  Today we the people would know nothing about our the past life of how people lived without all this technology and advancement.  Both of the civilizations used their natural resources to uncover their daily life.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri's artifacts are important in many ways. The Incas controlled an empire using knots to keep records, and the others did a big thing too. Puebloans were basketmakers, and the Pavlopetri had discovered the underwater city, Atlantis.       Now today, no one knows what the knots mean. If someone could decode it, it would be a huge discovery. Clues left behind from the Inca help archaeologists find out how the Inca lived their life. Some information archaeologists know come from oral history, o stories passed from generation to generation. Passing stories was a very important way to preserve a communities history. Other ways archaeologists know information is from artifacts. Some Inca artifacts may be made of stone, pottery, gold, or silver. These materials last for a long time, even if buried for years. They can be found in the ruins of buildings, or in graves for the use of the afterlife. Some information may be hard to identify because of looters. Looters rob the artifacts from places, making it hard for archaeologists to study the life of the Inca.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations Found       How do we learn what we know about the past? How do we even know about Ancient Inca? The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of wrting. That makes it hard for historians, or people like us who want to learn about history, to learn about something you can't read. Archaeologists have found quipas but do not know what they mean. To this day, no one knows what it means. A lot of people want to know how we know anything about Ancient Inca if we cant read anything. Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, trancsportation, and way of life. This makes it easy for archaeologists to piece together details of Inca.  Sometimes we learn about things from stories passed down from generation to generation.   What about the civilization Mesa Verde National Park and their world.   About 1,400 years ago, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. They built elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. Archaeologists have called these people Anasazi for 'the ancient ones.'

Item_Response: The discoveries  that have been made about the Incas, Puebloans,and the Pavlopetri are important. The reason the discoveries about the Incas is so important is because the archaeologists learned more about the terrain they lived on such as mountains and coasts could damage artifacts. Another reason the discoveries of the Incas are so important are because people start to learn more about how big their empire was and it rivaled the expanse of the roman empire. The final reason that the discoveries about the Incas are important is because we learned how they governed their empire on a system of colored knots.       The discoveries about the Puebloans are important. The reason the discoveries about the Puebloans are important is because we learned that they lived in Mesa Verde. Another reason the discoveries about the Puebloans are so important are because we learned they lived their 1,400 years before European arrived to America. The third reason the discoveries about the Puebloans are important are because archaeologsts   know how the Puebloans built houses.

Item_Response: Ancient History           By: Chas Dowtin       Throughout history humans have passed down information about the time that   once was in the form of stories, pictures, and relics.  Some people say that discoveries made about that time are irellevant as now us in the modern era have no need to study these primitive civilization, but these people have not thought to consider the benefits.  These ancient civilizations can help us to piece together the history of our world.  With this information we could improve our world and the lives of the people in it. These civilizations should not be taken for granted because of their major contribution to the world.       An excellent example of a civilization like these is the Inca.  The discoveries about   this civilization  have helped expand the world's knowledge of exploration in South America.  We learned of the type of clothing they wore, what food they ate, and where they lived. Using the knowledge we can figure out what was the lifestyle of the Inca was liek before the Spanish invaded.  Most of what we knwo about the Inca we had learned from spanish accounts as the Inca had no written language and kept track of all their data using colored strings alled quipis.  By cross refrencing the remains of these places with their oral history and written accounts Archeologists have been able to find mout new information about the Inca. These new facts have helped weave together the Inca's part in the tapestry of history.       Two other important civilizations are the Puebloans and the Pavlopetri. These both   provide information about their homelands. The Puebloans are a North American civilization that lived in the the south west deserts. This civilization has helped us learn about the cliff dwelling civilizatioon which are the descendants if the Puebloans. This has solved a mystery people have been trying to answer for years. The Pavlopetri were a Greek civlization which was submerged under the sea. This city can explain the rumors of the mythical city of Atlantis. This also solves a large mystery in recorded history. Both these civlizatiosn have helped to clear the fog of history so that we can see the truth.       All civlizations discovered have donated to historians world wide helping them fill   in the blanks in history. The Inca, Puebloan, and Pavlopetri all have made major contributions to world hsitory. We should protect and study these sites along with others to protect the tales that they hold.

Item_Response: The discovery of these ancient civilizations is so important because people need to learn about the ancient cultures and their way of life. And most of the things we learn from ancient civilizations will give us a better understanding of what they ate and did for fun or for military. Knowing their way of life will let us understand their language and other means of transportation and most of that can be used on modern day building and/or transportation systems. Just like knowing their military tactics it can also be used in modern day use.            The Peubloans and Pavlopetri gave us a better under standing of craftsmanship and how we can use their techniques to make our own pottery, weapons, and houses even. It doesn't need to be about how they make the item itself it's how they did it that we might need to know. They also gave a better understanding to growing crops in the deserts and cliffs.            The Incas showed a better understanding to the making and building of bridges from being in high-altitudes. They had also developed their own arrogation channels to work on mountain slopes, and this is very helpful to the use of farms on the sides of mountains. The Incas also helped in the making of houses, pottery, and weapons.            These are the reason why the findings of these ancient ruins are so important and useful to modern day society. Also descendants of these ancient civilizations like to know more about their ancestors. And to most people these findings are invaluable. This is why the finding of these ancient ruins are so important to find.

Item_Response: The job of an archaeologist is to discover things from the past. They use these discoveries to Several of the things we know about our ancestors were learned by the work of archaeologists. Some examples of these civilizations are the Incans, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. Artifacts found from the Incans, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri help archaeologists piece together history.       Artifacts left behind by the Inca help archaeologists get an idea of their religion, art, architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Archaeologists study the clues left behind and piece them together to find out what the life of these ancient people was like. Things like pottery or clothing that were found tell archaeologists these things. Sites studies give archaeologists a good idea of what life was like in Peru in the time of the Inca. Bodies found in the frozen peaks of the Andes stay in good shape due to the ice. These bodies can be analyzed to found out how the lived and how they died. With all this found, archaeologists know a lot about the Inca 500 years after their civilization ended.       Archaeologists were also able to get a good idea of how the Puebloans lived by analyzing artifacts and structures. We know that they lived in villages. The baskets found show evidence in decline in quality, possibly because of the introduction of pottery. The structures found also show accumlated skills and tradition. Discoveries found by archaeologists helped us find this all out.       By exploring the reamins of the Pavlopetri, archaeoligsts were able to understand what their lives were like. Exploration revealed several buildings, courtyards, and religious places. Evidence also shows that the city was occupied 5,000 years ago. By exploring the remains of the Pavlopetri, not only did we learn how people lived, but the discovery also interested natural scientists.       The information pieced together gave the world a better understanding of our ancestors. It is important to know the history of the past so we can not make the same mistakes made before, and the discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri helped us understand a lot about their civilization.

Item_Response: The Greek city Pavlopetri                                                                                             A diver has now discover the inspiration of the fable city Atlantis in southern Greece. A team of archaeologists and marine geologists called thissettlement that dates back 5,000 years ago Pavlopetri.                                                     This site stradles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. Pavlopetri has believed to been under water around 1000 BC. Even do 40 years a British oceanographer had discovered the site. But only this year that marine archaeologists plus digital technology was able to survey the ruins of Pavlopetri properly.                                                                                                               .                                                 The shifting sands and settlement's enclosure in this protected bay revealed everything buildings, courtyard, main streets, and religious stuctures. This investigation also revealed 9,000 of new buildings. But there was something more surprising, amonumental with a large retangle hall. Pavlopetri might have been elite.                            The theories believed by marine geologists said that Pavlopetri was sunked by an earthquake or a tsunami. But this was a the inspriation for Plato allegorical tale of the lost city of Atlantis.

Item_Response: The importance of the Lost civilization's from south america is that they were very advanced for there time. They were completely forgotten about. They were also almost completely destroyed by spainiards. They also fill in a large gap of human history. Also, at the time they were probably the most advanced civilization obn earth when the started off. Then europe started to advance and sent explorers over to the incan empire, which was preceeded by peubloans and pavlopetri. The spainish were not highly interested in the mexicans culture and mainly just killed them off for their riches.    The ancient civilizations were, however, very interesting. They had made giant temples -for worshipping and giving sacrifices- that were made from perfectly square blocks. The tools theywould have needed for this were not have thought to have been made untill much later. They also had the first recordkeeping system of theirtime time, called the quipus, which used strings for recording.       They were masters of pottery and aiculture. The had made irrigation systems, that were ALSO very advanced. They left behind many artifacts that had been preserved by the damp soil. From these artifacts we have learned that they also had lots of plates bowls and gold. Yes gold.    Now you see that they were very advanced for there time. They were wealthy in gold, compared to Europe. They had made many of the first advancedments of civilization. They were very important.

Item_Response: There are many ancient things and places fromt he past. Whether they are old or new, many want to study and vivit them. But, archaeologists can have trouble trying to find the artifacts. Why is that? Possibly because they are underground, underwater, old, and broken. The artifacts we see in meuseams today are not even close to the amount of artifacts you can find in 1 place. The question is: are these artifacts going to be put together and fit to be studied?        In an article from the 'National Geographic', they explaint the Inca and where they lived. Also, in the article, they explain how artifacts can find inscriptions that aren't accurate or find cloth that is destroyed by dampness. Remember these artifacts have been there since possible 1000 years ago, probably longer than that.        Another example is from an article be 'National Parks', the article explains that there were a group of people called 'Puebloans'. These people settled in Mesa Verde, Spanish for green table. In the article they explain that artifacts can be bad quality and dug under the ground.         1 more article explains 'Atlantis'. If you haven't heard of Atlantis, it is a story about a kingdom that is under the ocean and is able to rise back above water. Many believe it is real, many don't . But, this article explains alot about how most artifacts are underwater(too far down) or underground.         Basically, there are many issues to finding artifacts. It is not easy nor are the artifacts in perfect shape. I am not saying you shouldn't be an archaeologist, I am saying that some artifacts can be very hard to find.

Item_Response: The world around us has advanced greatly since the ancient times, but without the simple ideas and ways of the ancient peoples, we could have never gotten this far in technology. The world would be very different then how it is now. The discoveries of Puebloans, Inca, and Pavlopetri peoples are very important to the modern day.             The Inca peoples opened the gateway to modern historical record methods. the Inca used strings with knots on them  to keep records of their calender and to keep track of livestock. This method, called quipus, shocked the first Europeans that they coulld run a huge empire with these colored strings. The final Inca king was murdered in 1532 when the Spaniards took over their empire.             Puebloans were excellent crafters, they were often known as Basketmakers. They formerly were nomadic, but began settling on Mesa tops. They first hunted with spears, that was called atlatl, eventually acquiring the bow and arrow for hunting.              Pavlopetri is the sunken settlement over 5,000 years old. It is believed to have sunk in 1000 BC. there was a world of buildings, rock-cut tombs, main streets, and religiuos structures.             In all, these three ancient peoples and civilization show us many new skills otherwise never know to the modern world.

Item_Response: The discoveries of all of these lost civilizations are important to history. It may fill in holes where something was not known, tell about the daily lives of the people that lived there, or it may just contribute to information already known.           The ancient empire of the Incas ruled for almost one-hundred years, but was then overthrown by the Spaniards. The origin of the Incas is completely unknown. Along with where they came from, their daily lifestyles are also not known well. What we know the most about is their stories, tools, and how they were overthrown. When archaeologists found the remains of an ancient Inca civilization, some new things were learned. They had worshiped some of the mountain peaks around them and they found what is called a quipus. It was used to keep track of days and many other things.           An ancient people known as Ancestral Puebloans inhabited an area called Mesa Verde. They had lived there for more than seven-hundred years then left everything they had and moved somewhere else. Where and why they moved is still unknown to archaeologists, but because they left all of their belongings behind, they could still learn about how they lived. They were mostly farmers but they would also hunt. The main weapon they used was the bow and arrow, which was more efficient than the atlatl, a spear thrower. The first lived in dug-out houses but then eventually moved to the cliffs. They only lived in cliffs for about one-hundred years before they disappeared. The only reason that archaeologists think that these people left is because there was a drought at about the same time.            In southern Greece, archaeologists found a sunken settlement that dates back about five-thousand years. It is the oldest submerged town in the world. How this settlement sank is still not known but  it is assumed that it is because of either sea level changes, ground subsidence or both. This settlement is thought to be the one that inspired the Atlantis myth. Not all of it has been searched yet, but entire buildings and courtyards have been discovered.            All of these discoveries are important to history. They give us insight to many ancient civilizations. We learn about the past about the people before us and where some of the myths and legends may have come from. To sum it all up, these discoveries teach us about ancient lifestyles, religions and the origin of legends.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important because, the ancient artifacts that the Inca, Puebloans and the Pavlopetri have are rare and Inca artifacts are sometimes made with gold or silver. They take notes, take a picture of the artifacts that they find.          Where it came from and what happened to it, are important things that it should be learned about. Incas lived high in the Andes. Most of the Incas lived in high places. For archaeologists to study these things, there are the high-altitude archaeologists, they climb mountains and high places with their equipment. The things that they find needs to be studied after they climb down the mountain for them to study it, that all makes it harder for them, and harder for the looters to find the Inca sites.           The Puebloans were called Anasazi which is from a Navajo word 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies' from the archaeologists. Now they are called Ancestral Puebloans. Mesa Verda, the place where the first Ancestral Puebloans have settled. The Puebloans lived in pithouses, instead of hunting, they farm.

Item_Response: The discoveries about the ancient civilizations like the Inca, Puebloans are important because they helped us know more about them. The way they live what artifacts they used and other things in their culture. All the discoveries about them, like the Inca, have let us know how they lived and where they lived. Which left the theory of Atlantis. The lost city left behind many artifacts that told what the people who lived there used at that time. The city is unique as it has remains dating from 2800 to1200 BC, long before they glory days of classical Greece.         Both of these civilizations are different, but they both give us things to learn from. The Inca were in their area a long time ago. The clues left behind the Inca show their art, government, transportation, religion, and way of life. The lost city also left clues that describe it. How it was, and when it was.        So this is why both this civilizations are important. Because of what we learned from them. It proves that they lived a different way of life than the one we live in now. Every civilization is important and we can always learn from it.

Item_Response: Ancient pasts are very important to scientists and archaeologists. It's important to find many old things about ancent histories. It's exciting too to find out what hey really mean, and it isn't always easy finding out what they mean.The ancient Inca is about the alphabet of writing. They created a different way of writing and letters than we do today. That's how the alphabet became started in our world. The Inca made knots in colored strings and they were called quipus. They recored calanders to keep the counts of livestock. The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed they could use strings to keep a calander of livestocks or records. Arechaeologists found the quipus. Which are the calanders they kept. No one today can read the colorful strings, so it's hard to find out what they meant back in the long ago past.       Most people don't know about the civilization back then, but that's what scientists and arcaeologists do. They discover where it came from and what it means. 1438-1532 ruled a South American empire that rivaled the ancient Rome. Clues were left behing by Inca froma portriat fromtheir living. The had a portrait from thier religion, art, and especially argicultutre. They were great at argicultutre back then. They kept their livestock well and had plenty of food from farms. By studying all these clues arcaeologists can put together details of the Inca lifestyles.       Some of what people know came from histories form the Inca. That was passed on from generations. Passing on these stories was important to have the community's history. We know some of the old stories from the Europeans. They written them down to be shared in the future. They also described the Inca in their diaries, and letters. Legends also tell what happened in the civilzation.The rest of the knowledge of  Inca came from artifacts that most likley may not be as true as the real stories from thier past.       The arceaologists also found out ways from their past by finding graves and their bodies to test to see what mgiht of lived back then. And what kind of clothing they wore. Some of their clothing has survived damanging weather. They still have peices of textile left that has also survived many things. More than just drawings has survived form the civilization.       Some Inca sites have been bothered by treasure hunters. They take anything they see that could be cherished for a long time, or something that is very strongly rich in their life. Arcaeologists protect them from finding something the might need to find out more about the Inca past. They carefully dig them up with out riping or tearing it. Whatever they find would be worth so much. They find anything form the past and report it to scientists who study on it and make a very well inference on whatis was or what it was used for.       The Inca lived in high mountains in the Andes. In fact, they may have worshiped the mountain peaks. The Andes mounains makes it harder on the arcaaeologists because it's such a highelevation sometmes they need to use oxogeyn for finding out about their past.       Puebloans are important to our history too. They first setteled down in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550 years ago. They are know to make baskets, that is thier skill of craft. They replaced hunting for farming and gathering. They lived in Pithouses which are small houses they would call them, but it looked more like a tipee. Pithouses sunk in to the gournd,a nd they had a living room and a small kithchen for cooking and eating food.They aslo learned how to make pottery and make bowls and arrows for hunting including spears too.       Their popoullation muliplied after A.D. 750. Then they began buliding housese above ground, with walls mad of poles and mud. The made many houses rowing against each other and going down curving along the road. They soon had stone walls as their protection of their house. They also made pottery out of stone.       These people all had an interesting past that scientists and arcaeologists had discovered. Some not yet. They take whatever they find and make it into a reasonable explenation on the civilitzation. The past they found out about has a lot more to it than this, but they will keep making new discoveries for the agriculture, livestock, farming, living, social, and religious views from these old civilizations.

Item_Response: Studying ancient civilizations are extremely important because they take away that sense of curiosity as to how the people back then lived. How did the Incans keep track of their livestock? Why did the Puebloans move to caves and alcoves? Is there really and underwater city called Atlantis? Researchers have searched near and far for these answers and now they have the answers.       Despite the fact that the Incans were generally less integent than us modern day humans, they had complex and amazing ways of doing things. They yse a quipus, which were colored knots made into a calender to keep track of livestock. But researchers don't know what the knots were for. Cool right?       Puebloans of Mesa Verde went from pithouses to caves. Why? Archaeologists think it's something that is pychological and might have to do with conditions of the elements and weather.       Atlantis is a myth, but researchers have found some debris of a torn up town under water. How is this? The marine researchers think that a tsunami might've hit or maybe an earthquake shook the town to pieces. But these myths keep underwater exploration going.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. All ancient civilizations that, believe it or not, have shaped our world to this day. As we keep discovering artifacts and information about these civilizations, we are able to further understand how they have effected are lives and why they are no longer with us.   To start off, the Inca tribe was a civilization for nearly a hundred years (1438-1532) that ruled a South American empire that rivaled the expansion of ancient Rome. Today we have been able to find artifacts, items that these people have left behind, to piece together a grand picture of the Inca religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. We can also thank the art of story telling for what we know today about this civilization. Stories passed down from generation to generation were an important way to preserve history back then. 'We know some of the old stories because they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The visitors were Spanish soldiers and priests. They described the Inca in letters and diaries.' A quote from Beth Bruber's Acient Inca: Archaeology unlocks the Secrets of the Past. Bruber also states that 'the most importnat things to learn about a civilization are where it came from and what happened to it.' The fall of the Inca tribe was due to the Spaniards murdering the last Inca king in 1532 and taking over the empire. To find out the origin of the Inca, archaeologists use some of the most advanced technigues in the world. Using aerial photography can help them see things such as patterns in ancient monuments,that they cannot see from the ground. This is also a good technique becuase the Inca lived high up in the Andes mountains, making the job of a archarologist much more difficult. From the Inca civilization we are even able to see bodies and learn about how these people lived, and how they died.   Now moving on to the Puebloans. About 1,400 years ago a group of people living in the Four Corners  region chose Mesa Verde as their home. For over 700 years these people flourished here, eventually building elaborate communities, but then in the late A.D 1200s, generations left and moved away. Today Mesa Verde National Park preserves a spectacular reminder of this ancient culture. From the first being known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft to the ancestral Puebloans being kniown as cliff dwellers, as that is where they lived. Through drout and crop failures,socail and political probllems, the people simply wanted to look for new opportunities elssewhere. Today we still do not know the exact story of these people, but 'whatever may have happened,some of today's Pueblo people,andmaybe other tribes, aredescendants of the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde.' a quote from Roy Anderson's Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World.    Finally the Lost Greek city. Could this be the city that may have unspired the Atlantis myth? Beneath the water off sourthern Greece there is a site of sunken settlement covering 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor. only this year were marine archaeologists able to properly ssurvey the ruins with digital technology. it revealed a wrold of buildings, courtyeards,main streets, rock-cut tombs,and religious stuctures. These artifacts opened up a whole other world of exploration. We could now see this once prospering city come to life again. Marine geologists have yet to work out why this settlement sank. ''It is signifact because as a submerged site it was never reoccupied.'' said elias spondylis, co-directer of the surveyand head of Greece'sunderwater antiquities department. Although there is much more to be found under the water this represents a frozen moment of the past.   Overall, all three of these civilizations that once propered as we do today are very important as each and everyday we are able to extend our knowledge with knew artifacts and information. should we be questioning our fate? what will happen to our mondern world civilization? Is it already crumbling beneath our feet?

Item_Response: Why are the  discoveries been made about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavelopetri people so important? Why does it matter how these people lived their everyday lives? This all happened in the past. Well, it matters because the artifacts and ruins of cities left behind shows how ancient peoples lived. All of the items found is history. Archeologists examine these and see what they were used for, what religion they practiced, how their government worked, what clothes they wore, and what foods they ate. Because of these discoveries we see that these peoples were more technologically advanced then we thought.                             Archeologists discovered that the Inca government kept records by the knotting of strings. They also learned by hearing stories told by people passed down from generation to generation and some written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. Although, some of these are legends, not real stories. Some Inca textiles and clothing were also found. Archeologists also dug up objects made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver that have been buried for a hundereds of years. Archaeoligists have discovered many new things thanks to all that they left behind.                                 The Puebloans kept no records. What they did leave behind was their homes that they lived their everyday lives in. Archaeologists found these and learned new information about these people. They were extremely skillfull in building and crafts. The information they have on the puebloans isn't very good. But, as they discover more artifacts they can find out more about them.                      What the archaelogists and scientist found was a city underwater in Greece. Now they can figure out the structures of their cities and what they consisted of. 30,000 square meters of ocean are covered by this city. People go down and examine the ruins. They figure out from the ancient artifacts that the city was extremely important.                       Artifacts of these peoples are extremely important. Without these how else would people today find out the past? They wouldn't. This is why artifacts of the Inca, Puebloans, Pavelotri are so important. Now we know more and more about them. We are learning more each day. It is important to know the past. With the artifacts of these three groups of people ,we now know more about how people lived without all the advanced technology today.

Item_Response: The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde (Spanish for 'green table') about A.D. 550. They are known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. Formerly nomadic, they were beginning to lead a more settled way of life. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on Mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower. These were fairly prosperous times for the Basketmakers, and their population multiplied. About A.D. 750 they began building houses above ground, with upright walls made of poles and mud. Pueblo people, and maybe other tibes, are descendants of the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde.

Item_Response: The Incas, Puebloans, and Greeks. These are some ancient civilizations that have thrived throughout the world. We know much about these people and their ways of life, but how? Through discoveries ranging from ceramic pots to sunken cities, we have obtained the knowledge needed to describe these groups.       The Inca had no formal alphabet or writing systems, so how do we know what we know? They left behind clues. Portraits were left behind by the Inca showed of their religion, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Oral stories have also been passed down from generation to generation, preserving a community's culture.   Stories written by early Europeans have also been found. Inca textile and clothing survived remarkably as well, thanks to the Peru's dry deserts.       About 1,400 years ago, the civilization know as the Puebloans chose Mesa Verde as their home. The first Puebloans were leading a 'more settled way of life'. Their first homes, pithouses, were shelters containing a firepit with air deflector, an antechamber containing storage bins or pits, and an entrance the home located at the top. Many of the Puebloans were skilled a weaving baskets and other useful items. By A.D. 1000, these people had advanced from basic construction to skillful stone masonry.       The myth of the Greek city, Atlantis, has been told many times over the years, but all it is is a myth. Marine geologists have used the information, however, to learn about and discover a sunken city. Off the coast of the Greek city Neapolis, the submerged city was discovered and its roots were amazingly traced back to some 1,200 years ago. Ceramic were found dating back to the stone age. This suggested that the settlement was occupied almost 5,000 years ago! The biologists have researched the 9,000 square meter city.

Archaeologists have found many ancient colored knots known as quipus but even today no one knows what the knots mean. Understanding the ancient Inca is like solving a very big mystery if no one can read the storys of the colored knots.         Peubloans abanded there home, Mesa Verde. Now it is a national park. Peubloans have lived there before the Europeans have came to the Americas. About 1,400 years ago. Puebloans built a elaborate stone community in the sheltered alcoves of the canon walls. They eventually left Mesa Verde in the late 1,200 A.D.

Item_Response: All over the world there are remains of ancient civilizations that archaeologists have found. In the ruins, many remains from the Ancient Inca's are found. The Inca's were very knowledgable by instead of creating a writing system they created a string system. They tie knots in the strings as a way of keeping a calendar. Archeaologists found ruins of the Inca architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and their way of life.                        Another ancient civilization founded by archaeologist is the Ancestral Puebloans. The Puebloans lived in the Mesa Verde region around A.D. 550-750 and lived in pithouses, later on they built stone communities. They were nomadic, moved around a lot, known as great basketmakers, and learned to make bows and arrows to hunt prey.                                               'The Lost City' is the ruins of a city that must have prospered long ago, but somehow ended up under the sea. Thses remains of the city is what inspired the story of Atlantis. The Lost City was found in the waters of southern Greece and was a setttlement about 5,000 years before it sunk. In the city marine archaeologists found ruins of buildings, streets, courtyards, religious structures, and tombs made of rock. Some marine geologists made theories of how the city sunk including: sea level changes, earthquakes, or tsunamis.

Item_Response: The Dicoveries of Inca                                                                                          Joey Sloan                        Well some people know about the Inca it comes far from oral history, and all of the stories get passed down from one another like generation to generation. Also some of the old stories have been written years ago! Over 400 years ago! Some Inca textiles and clothing have also survived remarkably well. Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness, but these have been preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes.         Some Inca Sites have been distrubed by treasure hunters or looters, who take anything that might be valuable. Some tresures were taken centuries ago, but looting still goes on today. Or others site would be reported to archeologist, who can dig them up carefully. They provide the best idea of all times about life in Peru before and during Inca rule. archeologists who study these sites keep careful records. They write down and photograph any artifacts that they can even find.         Among the most imortant things to learn about a civilization are where it came from and what happend to it. The fall of the inca is easy to date because the Spaniards murderded the last Inca king in 1532 and took over all of the empire. The orgins of the inca are more difficult to trace the area where they all lived had long been inhabited by all different peoples and races. Archeologists have to be careful and makesure exactly which people bult which site.         About 1400 years ago, lomg before europeans explored North America a group of people living in he four corners region chose mesa verde for their homes. For more than 700ntears they AND THEIR descendits lived in flourshed here eventually building elaborate stone communities in the shelterd alcoves of the canyon walls.

Item_Response: The discoveries of  the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because the are all pieces of history that scientists and many people are eager to learn more and more about each and everyday.          The Inca are extinct but yet still 'alive'. I say alive because so many people want to learn as much as they can about them. An interesting fact about them is that they took colored string and tied knots in the string to keep count of livestock and also used the string to record the calendar. They called the string 'quipus'. These people were smart enough to record the calendar, keep count of their livestock, and run a huge empire, with just a piece of colored string that had knots tied in it. That's pretty amazing!          Now the Puebloans. They were also smart. They chose a place called Mesa Verde for their home, and  they flourished there, and eventually built elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of canyon walls. But sadly, they later on in the late A.D. 1200's, they left their homes and moved away in the span of one or two generations.             Last but not least, the Pavlopetri. This place in a sunken settlement that dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heros and because of the size and wealth of details, it is unprecedented. This is the oldest underwater town without a doubt. This town has remains that date back from 2800 to 1200 BC. 40 years ago tis town was discovered by a British oceanographer, we have only resently been able to servey the ruins properly with the aid of digital technology. Due to settlement's enclosure in a protected bay and shifting sands, buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures were all revealed. In addition, thousands of shards of potery repleted the seabed.          That's my essay on why these three undewater towns are inportant.

Item_Response: The findings of the Inca,  Puebloans, and even the Pavlopetri have gave us views into many different cultures and even helped us understand them. But are they really important? If you said no i hope to change your mind and prove to you how very important these findings are!            First let's start with the Inca.Archaeologists found that the Inca used the quipus to record the calendar and keep count of the lifestock. This was an important finding because we had no clue on how they kept records. Also they have found many bodies of the Inca, preserved from the cold of the Andes Mountains. This is also an important find because it helps us see the how they died and also how they lived.           Now let's start with the Puebloans. We know, due to archaeologists findings, that the Puebloans main livelihood was farming. Archaeologists found that the people lived in pithouses. We know that as they went on that they changed how they lived, but at a time went back to how their ancestors lived. These are very important because it shows how they evolved and how they still kept a hold to their ancestors life's.            Lastly, let's take a look at the Pavlopetri. Archaeologists found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age. This in itself is an amazing finding because this suggested that it was occupied around 5,000 years ago. This was amazing because this was 1,200 years earlier than what they thought!           So as you can see, the findings of archaeologists are not just something you can look past. All of these findings prove something in its own way that we didn't know the day before. And as the saying goes ' you always learn something new each day'.

Item_Response: The Lost Civilizations                          First, im going to talk about the Ancient Incas. The Incas are from Peru and they had no formal alphabet or system of writing. The Inca mad knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed thay they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus but today no one knows what the knots mean. Without anyone being able to read the knots the Incas is more like a big mystery.             Many people find lost ruins fascinating. The fact that the ruins are really old many people wanna exlpore how the Inca lived. Some of what we know about the Inca comes from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation. Passing on the stories was an important way to preserve a community's history. The visitors who met the Inca were Spanish soldiers and priests. They described the Inca in letters and diaries. Historians have to be careful when they interpret these accounts. The Spaniards did not speak the Inca language well. The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts that were left behind by the Inca. Archaeologists can compare what they learn from artifacts and sites with the Spaniard's accounts of the Inca. Among the most important things to learn about a civilization are where it came from and what happened to it.             About 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They are known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops.             These were fairly prosperous times for the Basketmakers, and their population multiplied. About A.D. 750 they began building their own houses above ground with upright walls made of poles and mud. The people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Pottery also changed, from simple designs on a dull gray background to black drawings on a white background. Farming accounted for more of their diet than before. About A.D. 1200, another major population shift saw people begin to move back into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors centuries before.              The Cliff Dwellers is next on my list. Ever since local cowboys first reported the cliff dwellings in the 1800s, archaeologists have sought to understand these people's lives. We will never know the whole story: they left no written records and much that was important in their lives has perished. Yet for all their silence, these structures speak with a certain eloquence. The structures are evidence of a society that, over centuries, accumulated skills and traditions and passed them on from generation to generation. Based on modern Pueblo practice, Ancestral Puebloans may have used kivas for healing rites or to pray for rain, luck in hunting, or a good crop. Kivas were gathering places and sometimes also places to weave. Pilasters supported a beam-and- mud roof. Entry was by ladder through a hole in the center of the roof.               Using nature to advantage, Ancestral Puebloans built their dwellings beneath the overhanging cliffs. Their basic construction material was sandstone thay they shaped into rectangualar blocks about the size of a loaf of bread. The motar between the blocks was a mix of mud and water. Rooms averaged about six feet by eight feet, space enough for two or three persons. Isolated rooms in the rear and on the upper levels were generally used for storing crops. Underground kivas, ceremonial chambers, were built in front of the rooms. The kiva roofs created open courtyards where many daily routines took place. Ancestral Puebloans lived in the cliff dwellings for less than 100 years. By about A.D. 1300, Mesa Verde was deserted. Several theories offer reasons for their migration. We know that the last quarter of the A.D. 1200s saw drought and crop failures but these people had survived earlier droughts. Maybe after hundreds of years of intensive use the land and its resources soils, forests, and animals were depleted. Perhaps there were social and political probles, and the people simply looked for new opportunities elsewhere.                A diver explores the sunken settlement beneath the waters of southern Greece. The diver is exploring a myth called Atlantis. The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most largest search. The sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of  Homer's heroes. There is no doubt that Atlantis is the oldest submerged town in the world. The remains are from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of classical Greece. There are other sunken sites in the world but this one seems to be one of the biggest of all time. Atlantis is unique than other sites because its considered to be planned towns. This myth lays about 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese.               What they found in the ruins surpassed all expectations. It revealed a world of  buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. It was replete with thousands of shards of pottery. During this operation they also revealed over 9,000 square meters of  new buildings. More than any underwater site so far, the find offers potential insights into the workings of Mycenaean society. Elia Spondylis co-directed the survey as the head of Greece's underwater antiquities department. Marine geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank. Theories include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami. As the world's oldest submerged city it is truly amazing. It not only shows how people lived at the time is also of great interest to natural scientists.              Locals in the nearby town of Neapolis are delighted. It is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis. Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going. This is an extraordinary find but there is still a lot more down there that has to be found.

Item_Response: ancient Inca         Excerpt from national geographic investigates ancient Inca Ararchaeology unlocks the secrets of the Inca's past.The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing.The Inca made knots in color strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the colorful strings understanding the Ancient Inca is a lot like solving a mystery.Nearly a hunderd years (1432-1532) ruled a south american empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient rome. By studying these clues, archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca life.We know about the Inca comes from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation. We know some old stories because they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The visitors were spanish solders and preiest they described the Inca in letters and diaries.Some of the Inca stories were lengends rather than history. As in many ancient civilization,Inca artifacts might be objects made from stone pottery, gold, and silver. some treasures were taken centuries ago, but looting still goes on today.The fall of the Inca is easy to date because the spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire.The origins of the Inca are more difficult to trace. The area where they lived  had long been inhabited by diffrent peoples.The Inca lived high in the Andes and may even have worshipped some mountain peak. Some Inca were buried in caves in cliff faces, for example, on mountain tops. Anything they find has to be carried down the mountains for study. The cold mountains act like giant freezer. Bodies found  in icy Andes are in such good shape that experts can use modern medical scanning equipment to learn about how the people died. The bodies also reveal information about how they lived.        About 1,400 years ago, long before europeans explored north america,a group of people living in the Four corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. Then in A.D. 1200s, in the span of a generation or two, they left their homes and moved away. Mesa Verde national park preserves a spectacular rminder of this of this ancient culture.archeologists have called these people Anasazi, from a Navajo word sometimes translated as 'the ancient ones' or ancient enemies'.

some descriptions may have been inaccurate but they tried their best. another way they found out the Incas way of live is by their artifacts or objects they left behind. some artifacts they they mostly found was gold, silver, stone, or pottery. the Spaniards had murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire.the Incas lived high in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountain peaks. some Incas were buried in caves in cliff faces. or on mountain tops.       the second article ( Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebla and Their World)   this article is about a group of people living in the Four Corners region in Mesa Verde about 1,400 years ago before the Europeans had even explored North America. more than 700 years them and their descendants lived and flourished there. in the late A.D. 1200s they left their homes and moved away. Archaeologists have called those people Anasazi, from a Navajo word sometimes translated as the ' ancient ones ' or'ancient enemies '. the first ancestral Pueblos settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. they were known as the basket makers. for their skills at crafts. farming replaced hunting. they lived in pit houses clustered into small villages usually built on top of mesa tops but sometimes in cliffs. they learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a better weapon for hunting than spear thrower. by A.D. 1000 people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole- and - adobe construction to very skillful stone masonry, pottery also changed, and farming. between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300 during the classic period the population may have reached several thousand. people mostly lived in compact villages of many rooms often with eh kivas built inside the enclosing walls rather than out in the open. ( kiva- church or ceremonial room). fires were built in the summer mainly for cooking. in winter when the rooms were damp and uncomfortable people burned fires throughout the village. the smoke blackened walls and ceilings are reminders of how cold it was for several months a year.               the third article   ( lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secret)   this article is about a diver who has discovered an sunken settlement beneath the waters of southern Greece. the sunken settlement date was back some 5000 years ago, to the time of homers heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented. archaeologists say that it is the oldest submerged town in the world. it has remains from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the days of classical Greece. it straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, and it is believed to be consumed by the sea around `1000 BC. under the shifting sands and the settlements enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock- cut tombs, and religious structures. the archaeologists revealed over 9,000 square meters of new buildings. but what surprised the archaeologists the most was the discovery of possible megaron, a monumental structure with a large rectangular hall, which also suggests that the town had been used by an elite. ( a person of high authority). marine geologists have yet to find out the reason why the settlement sank. they believe that it could've been cause by sea level changes, ground subsidence, earthquake, or tsunami. the settlement is now known as the worlds oldest submerged city.

Item_Response: The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri disapeared many years ago. Archaeologists have made many important discoveries about these ancient discoveries. They have found evidence in Peru, Mesa Verde, and beneath the waters off southern Greece. Finding these artifacts are very important to finding about our past.              The Inca lived in Peru. They had a prosperous land until the Spanish came and conquered them. Because of the Spanish conquering the Inca, we know little about this lost civilization. It is very hard to learn the Inca's ways because they had no formal writing system. They made knots in colored strings called quipas to keep count of livestock  and to record a calender. No one knows what these knots mean so it is hard to learn about this lost city. Much of what the Spanish recorded could be inaccurate. Archaeologists have found many artifacts but a lot of the artifacts have been looted. We don't know much about the Inca, but over time we will find out more about this lost civilization.              A group known as the Ancestral Puebloans settled in a place called Mesa Verde. They lived in Mesa Verde for 700 years. They are known as Basketmakers because they were very skilled at it. They farmed and settled in pithouses. As time went on their population rose. Because of the population rose they moved into the cliff alcoves. Nobody knows why they moved and hopefully archaeologists find out in the future.             Alantis was a city in southern Greece that disapered underwater. This inspired one of the largest myths. The ocean has presereved many artifacts that we have today. Investigations revealed over 9,000 square meters of new buildings. Marine geologists have yet to find out what happened to this lost civilization. Many think it was a tsunami or an earthquake.              Many of these civilizations we at there peak when they disapered. There are many theories of why these people disapered. hopefully we find out what really happened to the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri soon.

Item_Response: Why discoverys have been made in the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.           What they have discoverd in the Inca are every many things. Like they did not have a aphelbet so they dident have a way of writing either. So when the Spaniards came over they translated what they were saying (or the best they could) and wrote it in their language. The archaeologist have tried to uderstand what the spaniards have written down but some of it is unaudible. Understaniding the Ancient Inca is like solving a mystery.       Some people may ask how we know what peoples life was like almost a hundered years ago. Well we dont know exactly what it was like but we get clues from their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. some of what we know comes from oral history or stories passed down from generation. Passing on stories was very important in the Inca because it was a way to preserve a community's history. The Inca had lived high in the Andes may have even have worshiped some mountain peeks. Some of the people died in the mountains that their body's have been frozen and experts can use modern medical scanning equipment to learn about how people died.           From there they went to the peubloans which settled in Mesa Verde about 550 A.D. They are known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. Farming had replaced hunting to lead a more settled way of life. They lived in these things called pithouses from about 550 A.D. to 750 A.D. as settled agriculter began. By 1000 A.D. the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. By the 1880's archeologist have sought to understand these peoples lives. We will never know the whole story: they left no written records and much of that was important in their lives has perished. Whatever may have happend, some of today's peublo people, and maybe other tribes, are descendants of the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde.           The lost city off of southern Greece is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world. It has remaines that date back to 2800 to 1200 BC, long befor the glory days of classical Greese. They have found things dating back to the end of the stone age. It ws significant because as a submerged site it was never reoccupied. Atlantis was a myth but it keeps underwater exploring going. Only 1 percent of the ocean floor hasve ever been surveyed. there is still tons of stuff to be found.       This is only a few discoverys that have been found and discoverd, and they still have tons to find.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations.            There are several lost civilizatons out there.  Some we have found and some still need to be discovered. One of them was the ancient Inca of Peru. They had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They made knots in colored string in order to record the calender to keep count of the livestock. They were called quipus. the first Europeans that they meet were amazed that they could run a huge empire just by keeping colored knots in strings as records. But still today no one really knows what the knots mean. the Inca and there knots are still a mystery.            Another example is The Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and their World. Around 1400 years ago, a group of people living in t he four corners region choose Mesa Verde for their home. For more than 700 years tey livied and flourished there. They even built elaborate stone communites in the shelter of the canyon walls. But in the late A.D. 1200s they left their homes and moved away. They left us there building to look and and tons of other stuff.       There were also Cliff Dwellers. They made kivas. Kivas are another word for cerimonal rooms. They were underground chambers. Many Ancestral Puebloans may have used these kivas for healing rites or to pray for rain, a good crop, or even luck in hunting. Pilasters supported a beam and a mud roof. The entry way was by a ladder in the center of the roof . Then the small hole in the floor is a sipapu, or also know as a symbolic entrace to the underworld.

Item_Response: The Important Discoveries of Ancient Civilizations                     The discoveries that archaeologists have made about these ancient civilizations like the Inca, the Pueblans, and the Pavlopetri are important to many people. Learning about the past and how they ran their city is very different and unique to the way we do it now. People believe that ancient civilizations have a lot of history behind it, that's why every discovery archaeologists make about these civilizations is important.                 The Incas ran their empire using colored strings to keep records. These colored strings were called quipus, the Inca made knots on them and also used them to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. Archaeologists found clues left behind by the Inca that form an amazing portrait of their religion, art, and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. With these clues archaeologists can put together details of Inca life. Some of the old stories we know of the Inca are because they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532, and also because of letters and diaries that described the Inca that Spanish soldiers had left behind. The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts, or objects that they left behind. The Inca artifacts might be objects made form stone, pottery, gold, or silver, these materials last a long time. Even if these things have been buried for hundreds of years, some turn up in the ruins of buildings, and others are found buried in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife.               The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde. They lived in pithouses usually built on mesa tops. The Puebloans began building houses above ground, from here on these people are known as Puebloans. Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300 the population reached several thousand, that is when they started to improve their houses. Instead of pole and adobe they started using stone masonry, walls of thick, double-coursed stone often rose two or three stories high and were joined together into units of 50 rooms or more. The Puebloans are known for there magnificence buildings and stones.               The secrets of the lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths, the fable of Atlantis has been brought to light form under the waters of southern Greece. What archaeologists found surpassed all expectations. The shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. They say the city sank in the sea around 1000 BC, and that the settlement dates back 5,000 years. Yet marine geologist have yet to find out why the settlement sank, theories say that it might be because of sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami. This is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis.              Don't all these civilizations have a lot of history behind them? Well they have more, and every discovery more that is made, they get even more history, that is why these civilizations are important. People find them important when they read their history, they become fascinated and begin to read more about them. Item_Response: The discoveries made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important in helping us learn how people lived in ancient time's. It helps us learn about their religion, architecture, agriculture, government, transportation and just everything about how they lived. Archaeologist find amazing artifacts that teach us about all these things about that time and place.        First off, the Inca, they ruled a South American empire for almost a hundred years. The question is though, how does historians know this? The answer is clues that have been left behind and studied by archaeologist. Some of what we know come from when the Europeans arrived in 1532 and wrote in letters and diaries about the Inca. Archaeologist have found bodies well preserved  thanks to the cold mountains.         Now, the Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde around A.D. 550.They are inportant to history because they began to have a more settled way of living. They farmed, lived in pit houses, learned to make pottery, started using bow and arrows and spears. The Puebloans built underground chambers that are comparable to churches called Kivas. In about A.D. 1300 they left and went to New Mexico.         Last, the Pavlopetri, their settlement sunk around 5,000 years ago. The bay was protected and left a whole city undisturbedm like everything was frozen in time. No one knows why it sank but it be sea level changes or a tsunami. These were all great discovers in history.

Item_Response: The discoveries made of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because of all the fascinating things that we can learn from them. We can learn things from these groups like how they lived their everyday life, how they built structures or homes, how they lived with no technology.      The discoveres found by archeologist of the Inca is that they had no actuall alphabet. The way that they took notes on how their crops grew or how much cattle they had was by using colorful string to keep records. The Inca was a South American empire that ruled during 1438-1532. Since some of the Puebloans liked to live in the desserts, some of their clothing has stayed tact because of the heat from the sun. With this we can learn what they used to make this type of clothing and how they made it. Since people have entered Inca sites some of the valuables have been taken, and we may never know what they were. Archeologists can easily predict when it was that the Inca empire fell, beause the Spaniards killed their king around 1532.      The Puebloans lived in the Four Corners region at Mesa Verde. In Spanish Puebloans means 'village dwellers' but the first Puebloans are known as Basketmakers because of their skill in craft. Since Puebloans were nomadic the only lived in this area for about 700 years. While they were there they flourished and expanded in family. Now Mesa Verde is a park that people can go visit to see how it was that these people lived. Their first homes were called pithouses.The Puebloans were very smart and knew a lot about architecture so by A.D. 1000 they went from buillding pole-and-adobe constuction to stone masonry. Most of their buildings went as high as two to three stories high.

Because this site was submerged, it hasn't been reaoccupied for a very long time. Item_Response: The past lives of the Incas,Puebloans and the Pavlopetri are all very important to humans today they help us understand how to maintain a healthy economy with little to no resources and the discoveries of these places make us strive for more evidence of more places. The Incas where able to maintain an empire while not even having a written communication. While the Puebloans maintained a healthy economy through farming and agriculture. Pavlopetri opens a new field of discovery to archaeologists because only one percent of the ocean floor has been excavated and this was found underwater.                                                      Incas existed from 1438-1532. This is a time before many technological advancements and the discovery of these artifacts help historians determine the lives that the Incas lived ,what diseases there where, what kind of farming and hunting they did and how they lived there life overall. The Puebloans where some of the first people to live a more settled way of life with farming and basket making being to of there main resources. Finding and researching there artifacts help us discover what where there ideas on religion, hunting and everything else that mattered to them at that time. The Pavlopetri find was extravagant in itself but the idea of there being a sunken city is way beyond one discovery. One percent of the ocean has been explored and we have found a city in it. If archaeologists were to explore the ocean more who knows what we would find! It also gives some sort of validation of the myth of the underwater city Atlantis.       In conclusion these discoveries and explorations open up a whole new era of archaeology and help us discover more about the past.

Item_Response: Recently and underwater city has been discovered. The lost greek city that archaeologists have found covered 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor. This discovery is important because there are other sunken citys but none have been as large and as amazing remains of a town as this one. Because of shifting sands archaeologists have found a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock cut tombs, and religous symbols.       Scientists believe that the city was consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Archaeologists have found over 30,000 remains and shards of pottery scattered arond the underwater city. The artifacts that scientists have found dates back to 780 BC to 1200 BC. No one fully understands how the city sunk yet. Less than 1% of the ocean has been searched, this was the first time a sunken city has been founded near greece. I think people are fascinated because the citys artifacts are different than what we have today and its interesting to learn what people used to live their lives back then.

Item_Response: Each and every artifact or building a civilization has left is important to find out how they lived and what kind of city they were. From those artifacts or buildings, historians are able to determine what happened to that civilization and why it fell.       The Inca Empire did not have any writing system, but their old tools and buildings clue the archaeologists on how they lived. Finding frozen bodies in an Inca civilization says that some deaths were caused from the climate. Arcaeologists were also able to figure that the Spainish wiped to the Inca from Spanish records. Those records also contained data on what they observed of the Inca themsleves. After the Spanish killed the Inca king, then came the fall of the rest of the empire showing that the rest of the civilization was dependent on a leader for survival.       When historians found the lost city of Atlantis underwater, they found that Earth's oceans used to be at a lower water level, leading to many theories about the Earth and how it changed over time.       Not only was these discoveries important to find out how the empires lived and died, it also clued us in to some scientific theories we may never have realized without it.

Item_Response: The discovery of the Inca, Puebloans, Pavlopetri is an important find in history.              One reasons why these were such important finds was because theses ancient societies had many helpful inventions to our community today. The Inca helped us with the idea of the calendar to keep count of the days, they also left many artifacts for researchers to study to learn more about there civilization. The Puebloans were the first ancestral community to live in mesa Verde. They were known for their skills at basket weaving, but they also had made pottery, bow and arrows, and more efficient weapons.               Another reason why these societies were such an important find was because how old they were and some being a mythical legend. The Inca society was found to be hundreds of years old from 1438-1532 ruling the South American empire. The Puebloans had settled in the year A.D. 550. They lived in pit houses clustered into small villages.          In conclusion, The discovery of these ancient empires is a great discovery and helps archeologists with their studies to find more and more historical information.

Item_Response: Archaeologists have discovered many different artifacts from many different places. They all have on thing in common though, they are ancient civilizations. Three out of these many civilizations are the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.       To begin, the Inca was an ancient civilization that ruled a South American empire for about a hundred years(1438-1532). Archaeologists found that trying to piece together this civilization wasn't going to be easy. They discovered a system of knots made with colored strings, called quipus, which was used to record the calendar and keep count of the livestock. Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus, but no one today knows what the knots mean. The Inca did however leave behind clues that helped give us a better understanding of what their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life was back then. The Inca lived high up in the Andes and they may have worshiped some mountain peaks. The sites were in remote, high areas, which made it difficult to reach them. Some of what we know came from oral history, but the rest came from the amzing artifacts that the Inca left behind.       Next, a group called the Puebloans, for more than 700 years, they and their descendents lived and flourished in Mesa Verde. The first Puebloans to settle in Mesa Verde were known as Basketmakers for their skill at craft. Farming then replaced hunting and gathering and became their main livelihood. These people live in pithouses which were cramped into small villages. Puebloans learned to make pottery and discovered the bow and arrow. They became 'smarter' and began to build houses above ground. Sadly though, the Puebloans left no written records and much of what was important has perished. Eventually the cliff dwellers left and traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona. Some of the Pueblo people, and maybe other tribes, are descendants of this interesting group.       Finally, the secrets of the lost city. Dr Jon Henderson once stated,' There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world.' Living in this town many years ago were people known as the Pavlopetri. This town was believed to have been consumed around 1000BC. Henderson found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age, but what really took him by surprise was the discovery of a possible megaron. Now you might ask what a megaron is, well its a monumental structure with a large rectangular hall. This is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis. This city has inspired one of the greatest myths of all time and to actually of found it was even better.       In conclusion, these three ancient civilizaions are very fascinating to archaeologists. Maybe one day you might discover something like this. It would be an interesting discovery dont you think? Maybe even one day, a hundred years from now, people will be learining about us and wondering what life was like when we lived.
