Item_Response: In order to understand and improve upon the culture that is used now, the past cultures need to be understood.  The past offers history that can be found no where else.  In all three of these civilizations: the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, history of all kind roams the areas.  Each of these locations lived in a different time, and had things that made them different, some better than others.       The Incans had a unique way of doing things that made them different.  Such as quipi which stood as calenders and planers for them.  Other places had different types of calenders , but they were all similar.  Incans were different from all of the other civilizations at the time, which is a huge reason arceologists took such a huge likeing to their civilization.  They also had good clothing and textiles that have lasted throughout the years. This shows that the Incans were good at making clothing and showed promising techneque. The Incans lived back in a time when there was not much technology, but the ways that they lived their lived make them a great civilization to study.        The Puebloans lived life in a way that made them different from others.  Their most known inventions are their buildings.  They started off with the pithouses, and got more advanced and made kivas.  Each of these places had different areas that were dedicated to certain things in their culture.  Including a hole that they said led to the undergrounds which is where they came from.  Each time something was built they became more advanced, showing that the Puebloans constantly grew as a group of people in technology and beliefs.  They were an interesting group of people who sent ideas and teachings into the future generations that have been shaped into how everyone lives now.        The Pavlopetri people lived the longest back, and now their towns and remains are under water.  Historians have found peices from their past time which has helped them to understand these amasing group of humans.  They had a possible megaron which supprised historians because that would automatically raise the status of the city.  This discovery has caused scientists to want to roam the seas more to try and find more underwater civilizations.  Everyone was really thrilled that history is really this old, and are glad that we can keep learning from it.        Finding old peices if history is important for all of mankind to continue to strive to improve.  Not only has the history from the past been interesting to study, but it has also shaped all of the countries into what they are.  Without the mistakes and great discovories from the past none of the countries in the world would be able to know what and what not to do.  Therefore, studying the past is important for the world to function and teaches us interesting things that shape who we are.

Item_Response: Throughout the course of history, there have been many important discoveries. The uncovering of the Inca, Puebloan, and Pavlovian civilizations were crucial for the understanding of the past. Each civilization has unique customs and traditions, some of which we still use today. They also created many useful inventions that we've elaborated on and use on a very frequent basis.       For example, the Inca tied knots in colorful strings called the quipu, which is a device for keeping track of things, such as livestock and calendar dates. No one knows exactly what the knots mean. This invention helped to create the idea of calendars, calculators, and public records.        One other important discovery was that of the pithouses and kivas. Pithouses were homes set into the ground with a covering overhead and they were about the size of a living room. These later became kivas, which were places used for healing rites or to pray for rain, luck in hunting, or good crops. These are present-day churches and houses.        These inventions were very important to the development of present-day technology. They shaped the way we live today.

Item_Response: Ancient artifacts, like those from the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, are important because they tell stories and give out information about humanity's early life and events. Murals and paintings can give us a sense of how things used to look when these civilizations existed. Buildings and other extraordinary structures show us how advanced they were architecturally and mentally. Some people don't understand the meanings of these spectacular artifacts, but we use many of the same techniques and styles they did now.

Item_Response: In the articles, 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the past' by Beth Gruber, 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World' and 'Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets' by Helena Smith in Athens, the authors reveal ancient civilizations contributions and their importance. The ancient civilizations of the Incas, Anasazi, and Greeks teach us what their lives were like back then and inevitably where we came from and evolved.       The Incas used a quipus in order to keep track of their lifestock. this shows us that even though they didn't have an alphabet, they had the brain power to count and record their number of lifestock.       The Puebloans built highly advanced buildings and were highly skillful when it came to stone masonry. as time goes on the people begin to evolve more and more, becoming more intelligent.       The ancient Greeks built huge sophisticated cities, but as time drew on most of these cities fell subject to a changing enviroment and inevitably sunk into the ocean.This helped preserve the town and showed how people lived at the time, and is of great interest to natural scientists because the waters around it are so shallow.       ancient civilizations such as the Greeks, Incans, and Puebloans showed intelligent life and has showed us where we came from and how much we have evolved.

Item_Response: If we do not learn about our history, we are doomed to repeat it. The Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are all societies that failed brutally. We must discover as much as we can about them so we do not make the same mistakes they did.       For example, in the passage 'Ancient India: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past', it states 'Historians have to be careful when they interpret these accounts. The Spaniards did not speak the Inca language well. They may not have understood what the Inca told them, so their descriptions might not be accurate.' If we were not precise in discovering this historical significance, our society could have easily failed. The Spaniards were revolutionary conquerers. If we didn't know that the Incas were conquered, we might not have been as well-prepared for people trying to wage war or take over our society.       Also, in a later passage, known as 'Mesa Verde National Park ancestral Puebloans and Their World', it states 'when the cliff dwellers of Mesa Verde left, they traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona, settling among their kin who were already there.' Had historians not found this out, Americans might not have known about the vast ancestral differences in their country, which could have led to major social differences. This could completely change how we look at society today!       Even furthermore; in the article 'Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets,' it is addressed that 'Explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri, the sunken settlemtn dates back 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts say.' Therefore, if we did not discover 'this site, which straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor,' we might not be as a ware of natural disasters and have the protection we need when a storm or flood comes.       Thanks to these historical evidences though, we can now live in a much, safer, well-protected, better inferred, and all-around happier society.

Item_Response: These discoveries where so very important because of all and ancient artifacts they found found over the past years.                  The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. they didnt leave archives for historians to to study, but the Icna made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the celendar to keep count of livestock. From this civilisation they have found many of things like people's coting and textiles, that has survieved remarkebly well. The clothing you would think to get weathered away do to the dampness, nut these have been preserved int he dry desert on Peru's coast or the cold mountains of the Andes.                     Mesa Verde was found about 1400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, the Mesa Verde lived in pithouses from about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750. the pithouse featured a living room sunk a few feet in the ground. Four coner timbers suppirted the roof. The firepit an air defector. About A.D. 750 they began building houses above ground, with up right walls made of poles and mud.They built the houses one against another in long, curving rows, often with a pithouse or two in front. In A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry.                      The Lost Greek city. The secrets of the lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring  myths —the fable of Atlantis— have been brought to light from beneath the water off southern Greece. The site, which straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Although discovered by British oceanographer some 40 years ago, it was only this yeah that marine archaeologists, aided by digital technology, were able to properly survey the ruins.                        Thanks to the shifting sand and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a word of building, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. In addition, the seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery.                         Marin geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank. Theories include sea level change, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami.                         It is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical table of the sunken continent of Atlantis.

Item_Response: The Lost City of Atlantis                 The lost city of Atlantis was believed to be a utopian society due to the fact it was planned.The city of Atlantis was explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archeologists. During this exploration these archeologists found many intresting artifacts of these ancient people.This city is the oldest submerged town in the world followed by the fact it is very unique in many ways.In October 16, 2009, archeologists went into the sea to explore this submerged city.In this exploration they found some qualities of these people.These people thought of the future when building this incredible city.They went above and beyond anything that has been created in the past because they built buildings that were meant to last for a long time.As you can tell these people were very smart and had a very unified society.Besides being very unified, this society was very large and were very wealthy.People can tell this because of the way they built their buildings.         The fact that the people from Atlantis thought of the future and strived to built this perfect society is a very smart idea.These people reached their goal but unfortunatley they never thought of the idea of creating a system to protect their land from natural resources. The city of Atlantis still remains under the sea 5,ooo years later. The interesting fact is that all the artifacts are still found today. By this fact  people can tell how skilled these civilized people were.         Dr jon Henderson stated 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world...'.Archeologists thank technology because it played a major roll in the discovery of this town. Even though the people from Atlantis did not have the advaced technology we have now they could still be able to construct sturdy buildings so they can last as they planned. The most important artifact they could have left for the future generation is the tools they used to construct their buildings. I support my thought by stating that if we did not watse so much money providing machines to build structures in todays life and used ancient tools, then we could use the money not spent on the machines to create a system securing our nation from the powerful forces of nature.The same thing that happened to Atlantis could happen to our nation.         When the archeologists explored the city of Atlantis they found a whole world of buildings. It is unimaginable how large this city was. Many people might have moved to this town thinking it is powerful and will never be destroyed.The fact that the people went ahead and thought of the future shows they were blinded and did not worry for the present. Due to this they were not prepared and were consumed by the sea. In my opinion if the town had not been consumed by the sea  the city would still be standing on ground today.The lost city of Atlantis is an important find because it shows it would have been a utopian society if they did not worry too much of the future. It is was a good move to think of the future but at the same time realize that the present could destroy what they had in mind for the furture.         The people from Atlantis are a good precident for our generation because it opens the people's minds and gives us a wake up call. It brings the question in mind 'Are we prepared for a natural disaster or any kind of desruction?'Our leaders should focus on the civilians safety and prepare us for a destruction. The people should be like the people in the city and become united in this plan of safety.I admire the people in this city because they did a beautiful job on creating this city. Peoplehave a glimpse of what they believed in thanks to technology. The technology may not be what the poeple now a days  consider technology but it is very helpful. We can know many intresting fats of these people due to the fact they worked hard on creating this city.People should worry about the present and future and should not get too carried away so we can have a united society.

Item_Response: Ancient Civilizations and Artifacts       As time has gone by, many civilizations have been taken over or destroyed. But as technology improves, we discover many artifacts, buildings, and sometimes even a whole city! We have recently discovered many civilizations, but the most important ones are the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri civilizations.       The Inca Empire has been known for many years, but some people do not know much about them. The Incas were very interesting people. They built their empire on the Andes mountains because they wanted their enemies to have a hard time reaching them. There are many places in the Andes mountains that are Inca sites for artifacts, but most of them have been disturbed. They have been disturbed by looters because the Incas people had many valuable artifacts.       The civilization that was once in Mesa Verde was known as Puebloan. The Puebloans were also very interesting people because they were very skilled people. The archaeologists who study artifacts from Puebloans have found many pottery. The shape of the pottery varies in different shapes and sizes. The archaeologists have also noticed that most pottery have paintings on them. The paintings are very detailed and precise. this is evidence that the Puebloans were very talented and patient.       There has recently been a new civilization discovered by British and Greek archaeologists. Its name is Pavlopetri. This civilization is so unique because it is completely underwater. Archaeologists have studied many artifacts from here. They have discovered that it is very well preserved. It is well preserved because the shifting sands and protected bay protect the city from much damage. The archaeologists have also discovered that the city was filled with shards of pottery. This it evidence that the people of Palvopetri were also very skilled at crafting.       These civilizations were very important to discover and study because they teach us about what ancient civilization was like. People are very interested in ancient civilization because it is very different from what society is today. It is also very interesting because as society changes, so does technology. People want to know what technology was like in ancient times.

Item_Response: Have you every wondered why Ancient civilization is so important? Well, this is why. The way we all live today came from the way they used to live. Think about this, have you ever thought what it would be like to not have your cell phones or internet. They never had Google to find out if they were doing something the right way, they had to hope for the best and go with it.             The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing so what they did was use colorful string. You probably are wondering how this worked for them, what the did was for an important event they would tie a new piece of string. They had certain colors for certain events. The Inca were very religious.               Clues left behind from the Inca from an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and the way of life. By studying these clues, archaeologists and others were able to put things together and figure out there past.              The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in mesa Verde (Spanish for 'green table') about A.D. 550. They are also known as the basket-makers. because they have such high skills in arts and crafts. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow for the help for hunting. At about A.D. 750 their population increased by a lot! Some of today's Pueblo people, and maybe other tribes, are descendants of the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde.               In my opinion people are fascinated by civilizations from the past because they are interested by how things have changed or how far we have come sense then. Maybe to know what they do or there way of living. The lost city is a very important find because now we have places to explore and there might be better resources on the city that we need. Its something new to study. Good things to study would be things that help us move forward such as, weapons, things to help find what race they are.               As i said, imagine living without the things we have now. Try thinking about what it would have been like living with them. The sicknesses that they most likely had and the way they mad a living. They didnt pay for the things they had. There was no money. There wasnt much to eat or drink. They had to fight for life. There are many more things that i didnt mention in this that they found. The way we live now is a blessing. They would have loved to be able to watch TV after a long days job.

Item_Response: Have you ever wondered about the past not just like 6 years back im talking about thousands of years all the way the the Incas. There were many things we never knew about the Incas but there's more than you think. People who never heared about the Incas just think there a bunch of indian's or savages but they were more than just that. They were a civilized people and hade a lot to show for it. The Incas hade there own specilized calender that only they understood and they had an empire that lasted from (1438-1532).           Anothor Tribe that lasted many years was the Puebloans. They settled in Mesa Verde at about A.D 550. They were known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. They were Formerly nomadic, they were brginning to lead a more settled way of life. They weren't big on hunting but mostly farming, that was there main livelihood. They lived in Pithouses most were usually clustered together and were built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff revesses. By A.D 1000 th epeople of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole- and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Between A.D 1100 and A.D 1300, during the Classic Period, the population may have reached several thousand. About A.D 1200, another major population shift saw people begin to move back into cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors centuries before.

Item_Response: There have been many discoverys in our world. Discoverys about the earth, and our solar system. There are certain discovery's however that I find very important. The discoveries in Inca, Pauebloans, and the Pavlopetri discoveries are so important. People might think that things found here on this Earth are not as interesting as things up in the sky. However, we as humans did not just get here on this Earth. Finding discoveries of our for-fathers are what is so important, discovery's that show us the way of life and living before we even thought that time existed. Clues that were left behind by the Inca form the ideas of their religion; culture, art, and architecture.Culture's pass down information and ideas from generation to generation. Finding these different dicovery's in vast regions shows us how we came to be who we are today. If artifacts and objects from times long ago were not found then we would have no clue or ideas of how people lived befor us.

Item_Response: There are so many lost cilvilizations in the world. Geologist are now trying to find out why and how these civilizations were losted. The three main lost civilizations were going to talk abbout is the Ancient Inca, Ancestral Puebloans, and the lost city of Atlantis. These three things will grab your attention and hopefully get you thinking about the world! There are also there type of people, which is the Inca the Puebloans and the Pavlopetri.          The first thing were going to talk about is the Ancient Incas, the geologist that have studied all that happened in the past know that the Inca had no alphabet or system of writting. We know that the Inca used some type of system to keep a Calender for there live stock. 'The Inca made knots colored string called quipus' (Sorce 1) Geologist find many quipus but, since we have no one who can read the knots, their language is a mystery. The Inca lived in the high Andes, many of the Inca sites were in relativly high places. The Inca went so high up so they could avoid the looters.          The next type of people were going to visit is the Ancestral Puebloans, 'About 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Coners region chose Mesa Verde for thier home.'(Sorce 2)  You could say that these people are natives who needed there own place to live. In the late A.D 1200's within the span of a couple genarations they left theit homes and moved away. The park preserved a reminder of the culture the Eurapeans had. The Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde at about A.D 550.(They were know as the Basketmakers)As they settled they began to liver more of the human life we live now. They stopped hunting so often and farmed there food. They lived in things called Pithouses. Puebloans built their dwellings beneath over hanging cliffs. The way they would keep their homes together was a mix of mud and water. These people were so important becasue they helped create some of the frist civilization.           Last, is the Pavlopertri, the suken settlement. This settlement dates all the way back 5,000 yuears ago durring the Homer's heros time. This is one of the oldesdt suken settlements. This dates all the way back to 2800 to 1200 BC. What geologist found prooved that there was a suken city. They found: Buildings, courtyards, main streets ETC.  There is a chance that this is the lost city of Atlantis. This is so important because it is dating back and showing us how our ancestiors lived.

Item_Response: Ancient Civilizations        By: Harlie Sell              In acient civilizations like the Inca of Peru, and the Puebloans of Mesa Verde; the artifacts and cities themselfs help archaeologists learn how the people of that time and place lived, thrived, and how they died.       The Inca people had no formal alphabet and they made nots in colorful pieces of string to record information, and these colorful pieces of string are called quipus. The Inca used these qiupus to record the calender and to keep track of livestock. The only written information that archaeologists could find was the journal entries of the Spanish Soldiers and priests that came to Europe in 1532.       The Puebloans of Mesa Verde lived in pithouses from A.D. 550 to A.D. 750. The pithouses had a living room that was sunk a few feet in the ground and had timbers to support the roof. At about A.D. 750 the Puebloans started building their houses above ground, with upright walls made with mud and wooden poles. The Puebloans then started making these homes in long curving rows,( often having a couple pithouses in the front) and these homes gave the Puebloans their name.

Item_Response: Lost Cilvilizations                  The discoveries that had been made from the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetris are imprortant because they were ancient civilizations that were here a long time ago.          The  Incas were important because they were very well known for their homes and great arcutectures. They were often found in the Andes and may have worshiped mountain peaks. They lived in high remote places like in caves in cliff faces or on mountain tops. The icy cold mountains acted like a gianted freezer by preserving their bodies for pber 5,000 years. Scienctists use modern medical scanning equipment to reaveal how they had lived and died.          The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They were known as Basketmakers because they had good craft skills. They farmed instead of hunting and gathering. The first Puebloans live in pithouses, which included a living room and a sink a few feet in the ground, a four corner timber suppoted roofm a firepit and storage bins or pits clustered into small villages usually built on Mesa tops but also sometimes in cliffs. They learned how to make pottery, bow and arrows, and a spear thrower. They soon multiplied, about A.D. 750.          All of the ancient civilizations were very important for their agriculture and their way of living.

Item_Response: The discoveries made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important, because they uncover the secrets from the past and solve many doubts archeologists had about these cultures.       After the Spaniards arrived to South America, they recorded their days in their diaries. Here they wrote about their experiences and stories they heard as of every day. Although inaccurate, archeologists have used these writings to record Inca history and myths. This is due that Incas had no formal alphabet or system of writing. Inca artifacts and objects are used to find clues on Inca daily-life. Inca artifacts might be made of stone, pottery, gold or silver. Some of these are found in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife. Inca sites provide the best idea of all about life in Peru before and during Inca rule.       The Pavlopetri city, recently found underwater near Neapolis, is about 5,000 years old. The find offers potential insights into the workings of Mycenaean society. It is significant, because as a submerged site, it was never reoccupied. Theories of how this ciy sank include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquekes, or a tsunami. It is very likely a combination of the first two. It is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plate wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis.       The Puebloans first settled about 1,400 years ago in the region of Mesa Verde. Here, they began constructing homes and farms. The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They are known as Basketmakers for their skill in crafting. They lived in pithouses and they learned how to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow. About A.D. 750 they began building houses above ground. By A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300 the population may have reached several thousand. About A.D. 1200, another major population shift saw people begin to move back into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors before.

Item_Response: The acient Inca of peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The inca made knots in colored called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The first europeans to meet inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Some of what we know about inca comes from oral history , or stories  passed from generation to generation.               Archaelologists have found many acient quips but today no one knows what the knota mean. Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the colorgul strings, understanding the acient inca is alot liek solving a mystery . We all know some of the old stories because they were writtewn down by the europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The vistitors were spanish soliers and priests . They decribed the inca letters and diaries. The spaniards did not speak the launguge that inca spoke. They may not have understood what the inca told them, so their descriptions might not be accurate . And some of the inca stories were legends .                     When the cliff dwellers of mesa verde left , they traveled south into New Mexico  and Arizona , settling among their kin who were already there. Whatever may have happened , some of today's Puebloe people , and maybe other tribes , are descendants of the Ancestral Puebloans of mesa verde.The structures are evidence of a society that , over centuries , accumulated skills and traditions and passed them on from generation . By the classic Period A.D 1100 TO A.D. 1300 , Ancestral Pueblans were heirs of a vigorous civilzation , whose accomplishments in community living and the arts rank among the finest expressions of human culture in North America.

Item_Response: Discoveries about the Incas, Puebloans, & Pavlopetri.            Ancient Inca had no formal alphabet or how they write. Incas made knots in colored strings which were called quipus in which they used to record the calendar to keep track of their livestock. Some knowledge of the Incas came from artifacts, or some objects that they had left behind. Incas have lived high in the Andes & had worshiped some mountain peaks. Incas had mostly lived in high places or caves & the faces of cliffs.        The Puebloans chose Mesa Verde for their homes. Archaeologists have called the Puebloans as the Anasazi, which means, 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies. Puebloans lives in pithouses clustered into small villages. The Ancestral Puebloans learned to make pottery & use weapons such as a bow & arrow, and a spear. Puebloans have used Kivas for healing rites or to pray for rain for their luck in hunting, or to have a good crop.        Pavlopetri was a sunken settlement dates back over 5,000 years ago. Archaeologists believe that Pavlopetri is one of the most oldest submerged town in the whole world. The exploration of Palvopetri revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, & religious structures.        Overall, this is all the discoveries archaeologists have found about the Incas, Puebloans, & Pavlopetri over the past few years.

As one can see these ancient civilizations are very important to learn about. Without knowing about them, we might not have learned about some of the things we have today.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations           You may be wondering why discoveries about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important. Well, for starters, it all dates back to ancient Inca.                                                    The Inca            Although the ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing, they did make knots in colored string to keep record of livestock. If not for the clues left behind by the Inca , we would not known about this civilization that ruled the South American empire that rivaled the expense of ancient Rome for nearly a hundred years. These clues that the Inca left behind showed their way of life, transportation, government, religion, agriculture, and art and agriculture and with the knowledge of this, archaeologists pieced together the details of the Inca lifestyle.                                                All of what archaeologists know not only comes from artifacts of this civilization, but from the passing of stories from generation to generation.       The Puebloans              The first Puebloans were Ancestral and were known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. They settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages that were sometimes built on mesa tops or cliff recesses. Since they didn't hunt or gather as much, farming became their main way to food. They also took the time to make pottery and developed a more efficient weapon for hunting by replacing the atlatl with the bow and arrow.       The Pavlopetri           The Pavlopetri were explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists. The settlement was sunken and dated back to the time of Homer's heroes about 5,000 years ago, and in terms of wealth and size of detail is unprecedented.           Said to be the oldest submerged town in the world, Pavlopetri has remains dating back to 2800 to 1200 BC, years before the days of classical Greece. Archaeologists know that there are older, undiscovered sites in the world, but none can really be considered a planned town such as the Pavlopetri.           Lost Civilizations (cont.)           The discoveries of these lost civilizations are very important in history back then, and even today's history. Most of what archaeologists know about today's history comes from the discoveries of these lost civilizations, so before you think to yourself how boring early civilizations are to you, remember that these lost civilizations play a big role in our way of life.

Item_Response: The Ancient Incas:       The Artifacts are important because it can help the Archeologists figure out how the Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri lived.  The Incas lived high in the Andes and may evem have worshiped some peaks.  Most of the Incas sites are in high places.  Living in high places preserve the sites, because looters cannot easily get to them.  The rest of our knowledge of  Inca comes from artifacts, or objects that they left behind, and from the sites where artifacts are found.  Some Inca Textile and clothing survived remarkably well.  Ancient material like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness, but these survived, because it has been preserved in the dry desert of Peru.       The Puebloans:       The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde (green table) about A.D 550.  The Puebloan are known as Basketmakers for their skill and craft.  The Puebloans lived in Pithouses from about A.D 550 to A.D 750, as settled agriculture began.  Pithouses have a living room sunk a few feet in the ground.  Four corner timbers the roof.  The firepit had an air deflector.  Pithouse will later on evolve to Kivas.  From here on these people are known as Puebloans meaning 'village dwellers.'  The Puebloans never left any written record and that was important in their lives perished.  The Puebloans has turned pithouses into kiva's.  Kiva is a Hopi word for ceremonial room.  The Puebloans were able to build and evolve/change pithouses into a Kiva throughout their lives.       The Pavlopetri:       The fable Atlantis have been brought into light from beneath the waters of Southern Greece.  The secrects of the lost city has been explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologist and marine geologist known as Pavolopetri.  The site so far offers potential insights into the workings of Mycenaen society.  The Marine geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank.  Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going, said Sakellariou.  The myth of Atlantis has the archaeologists and geologists searching and trying to figure out why it even sank.       Having artifacts would make it easier or would at least give the scientists, archaeologist, and geologist a clue of what has been there.  Potteries, tools ect could help by telling how long they have been their and what sort of materials were used in order to build anything or make anything.

Item_Response: Thoughout the years, archaeologists have found many ruins of what used to be villages and towns of the ancient civilations. Every finding is important, it helps learn more about their way of life. Some of the most importanat findings archaeologits have made are about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. Each one showed archeologits many different things about how the ancient people lived. Each one has its own meaning in the rare discoveries of archaeologits.           The Inca left behind many clues as to how they lived life. Due to the passing down of storeis and myths, archaeologists have found out their 'history'. Also, with the 'clues' the Inca left behind, we may be able to find out their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. For example, their way of keeping records was to tie knots in colored strings. Though no one knows what they mean now, it is proof that they kept records, and didnt' have a writing language or alphabet. What they also left behing was ruins of old buildings, textiles, and clothing, which in another way of figuring out how they lived. Archaeologoists have also found bodies in the ice of the Andes. With these bodies, which are well presevered, scientist have somewhat figured out how the person lived and died. The Inca discovery was very important because it not only showed how the people lived in their 'houses' and that they hunted and gathered, it showed they they kept recoreds, and they had stories and even history.           The Puebloans were/are known as basketmakers. They are also known for their houses, known as pithouses, and as they evolved into better structures, kivas. Puebloans were also one of the first tribes to also evolve from hunting and gathering to farming and having weapons for both. As they evolved into better structuers and better at farming, they learned to make pottery and more efficient weapons for hunting, like a bow and arrow. As they kept evolving, the houses evolved along. With the population growing, they startin making their pithouses above ground. They built houses one against another in long, curving rows, often with a pithouse or two in the front. Then they started making the houses of thick stone, often two or three stories high. Pithouses were now called Kiva. Now, this source was very important because it explained their living. Not just they lived in something called a pithouse or a hut, etc. This explained how the houses were build and how they evolved from underground made of dirt or above ground made of stone.           The Pavlopetir was dated from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the 'glory days' of Greece. Now this city is underwater. The site covers 30,000 square meters of ocean floor, and contains many artifacts. It has revealed building, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. Due to it being underwater it was presevered some iteams, and has shown different iteams of pottery. It not only showes ruins and what is left of the city unlike the other two, but it actually shows a city with has been dived underwater due to a natural cause. That's why it's important. It shows how the city was structured and placed, and how the streets looked. It was also a great finding because it is of the few underwater.           These places that archaeologists find are all important. They show a bit of history and something new in all of them. These three places were important because they went and explained a litte more than any other one of the ruins did.

Item_Response: There have been many ancient discoveries in the past couple of years, namely Incas, Puebla, and Greek. These have all been made quite recently and shed insight on some of these cultures. More importantly however, it shows the ancient ways of life and tools of these groups, and may even develop our government even further than it is right now.       These groups may all be ancient, but what they lived in and where they lived was most certainly unique. Puebla Kivas might give us information about their past. These kivas obviously show us that the Puebla were religious, enhanced by the fact that they contained an 'entrance to the underworld'. As we can see from the Greeks, some chose to live in towns. Some of the Incas preferred more privacy, and chose to live in the mountains. Possibly more important than the shape or community these civilizations chose to live in are the locations. The Greeks lived near water. This means that they probably were not as worried about war, and might have lived off of seafood and foreign trade. In sharp contrast, the Incas lived in the Andes mountaintops and the deserts surrounding. Having the higher ground is an unmistakable advantage, which means they might have feared war more than starvation or running out of water.       Some of the tools made in each of these communities are still used today. The Greeks developed beautiful pottery, which has evolved into the plates and cups we eat and drink out of every day. The Puebla evolved the atlatl into a more complex, yet easier weapon to use, the bow and arrow. Archery was a typical war factor all the way until medieval times. and is still practiced for recreation and food today. Perhaps one of the most unique items developed in this time period was the Quipus. The quipus was developed by the Incas and was a way of keeping records by simple knots in string.       Can you imagine how much simpler life might be for government officials if we just did records in string? They would not have to worry about foreign countries seeing them, and we could put less time into preventing computer hackers and more time into working Obama's sixteen trillion dollar deficit down. This isn't the only thing we could learn, as we excavated the Incas, we learned that dry weather and freezing work very well for preservation. This has lead to more advanced coffins and chryrostasis. We could learn from their houses, for all the homeless people in the world. The ancient houses might be a good, affordable substitute for a modern house.       These advancements have all came from history, quite great accomplishments for people living in what we might consider the stone age. It is time for us to finally recognize that these ancient achievements are important; that they do really matter. All of these give us insight on what life might be like in the past, and possibly the future.

Item_Response: Do you know what happened 10 years ago? 50? 100? 1,000? That's what archaeoligists are trying to figure out. For years, the have studied the lost civilizations of the world; the Inca, the Greek, and the Anasazi. The archaeoligists are exploring many sights to link the past to the present. It hasn't been easy though.           The Incas were all wiped out by Spanish conquistadors in the 1500's. Extremely wealthy, everything in their society had a lot of value, so it was taken by the Spanish and looters. This makes it hard to find objects to deduct what happened. When an archaeoligist does find something, it is photographed and documented, dusted off, but not moved. The location is essential to proving historical accounts true and to deducting what the item was used for. The mountainous terrain and dangerous jungles also make it hard to access. Event though most artifacts were stolen, the Incans left more clues behind then the Anasazi.            The Anasazi were a group of Native Americans living in the southwestern USA. The only clue left behind from this group were many structures and some hunting weapons. The structures indicate that they were a religious and creative group of builders. One such structure is called a kiva, a ceremonial room for religion. is Little is known about the Anasazi. With Greek society, we have a lot more to go off of.           The Greeks were a prosperous empire until the Romans came and took over, destroying most of their culture. A Greek city said to have inspired the myth of Atlantis is currently underwater. The city is called Pavlopetri and it's the oldest submerged town in the world. It has many artifacts because being covered in water makes it hard to loot. The shifting of sand in the currents has revealed a huge planned city with streets and everything. Marine geoligists and archaeoligists are using the latest digital technology in exploring Pavlopetri.            The Incas, Anasazi, and ancient Greeks are cultures that are lost to us. We can still explore the buildings that survived what the people did not. Geography has gotten in the way and often, things have been stolen from the site. Though it's been no cup of tea, archaeologists will not stop until they have put the lost pieces of time back into the puzzle.

Item_Response: Around 500 years ago, a group of people lived who were called the Inca.  They ruled a large chunk of land.  Around 1400 years ago, a people called the Puebloans lived.  Around 5000 years ago, a people called the Pavlopetri lived.  I find it amazing that we even know this, but I find it even more amazing that we can know all their ways of life.  Without discoveries by archaeologists, however, we wouldn't.  They are the ones who search through ruins of ancient communities, looking for artifacts.  Without their work, history class would be a lot more boring and pointless because there would be no information that was more than 100 years old.  Without the discoveries that have been made about the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri, we would have no knowledge of what happened in South America and elsewhere long ago.        Some of the people who lived long ago were more technologically advanced than we think, and we can learn and use some of their ideas because archaeologists study artifacts and ruins.  Some of the discoveries made gave us valuable bits of information that are interesting to know.  For example, the Inca made their items out of materials like gold and silver, and we had yet to discover gold in 1800.  Also, the Inca ruled South America for around 100 years.  For this information, archaeologists had to find written records, and more importantly, interpret them.  It is harder than you think to understand ancient languages, especially the ones that are not in use today.         Without the discovered information, there would be gaps in our history of the world that would be awkward and strange.  But archaeologists are here to fill these holes with their discoveries of ancient civilizations.  These discoveries are some of the most important things to ever happen, so that people now can draw conclusions about what happened long ago and see the similarities and differences between their lifestyle and ours.  It is important to know about the way of life of civilizations long ago and also very interesting to know about civilizations long ago.

Item_Response: Ancient civilizations are found because modern people want to learn about their past and how did they end up extinct. If nothing is never found then how do we know what happened back in the olden days. Like in Inca, Peru had know alphabet or system or writing . But some stories were passed from generation to generation. And some more knowledge of the Inca comes from their artifacts or objects that they left behind. Many artifacts were made from stone, pottery, gold or silver. The Inca lived high in the Andes and may have worshiped some mountain peaks.       The Puebloans were a group of people living in the four corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home.They lived in pit houses clustered into small villages. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow. Their were known as Basket-makers or their skill at the craft. Their population multiplied in A.D. 750 and started building their homes above ground made of poles and mud. By A.D. 1000 the people had advanced construction to skillful stone masonry. Their pottery also changed from simply designs to black drawings on white backgrounds. They used nature to their advantage building their homes beneath overhanging cliffs.       The Pavlopetri a sunken settlement that dates back some 5000 years to the time Homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented. Their village is 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to be consumed by the sea around 1000 B.C. Palvlopetri was once a thriving city but now, its at the bottom of the sea being eroded away.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri empire was an important discovery founded by archaeologists for them to know how they lived from the time back then. They all provided what kind of buildings they lived in, the clothes they wore, the weapons they used, and what they did to survive.      The Inca was a civilization that for nearly a hundred years ruled a Southern American that rivaled the expanse of Ancient Rome. The Inca used a piece of string called a quipu. The Inca weren't very known, so the very first Europeans to discover them were amazed at how they could run an empire just by using a piece of string.      The Puebolans settled in Mesa verde in A.D. 550. They are known for making baskets, pots, and used the bow and arrow at their time. They lived in what was called pithouses that sunk a few feet in the ground. Many generations have lived in Mesa Verde from around A.D. 550 to A.D. 1300.      The Pavlopetri was a sunken settlement beneath the waters off southern Greece. The settlement dates back to 5000 years ago to the time of homers heroes. It's no doubt that its the oldest submerged town In the world with remains dating back from 2800 to 1200 BC. The empire contained a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets,  rock-cut tombs and religious structures. Archaeologists still aren't sure why the city sunk.       These 3 empires are important because it shows how technology was back then and how it went from back there, to here.

Inca            Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art, and ,architecture , agriculture,government, transportation ,   and way of life.Inca could run a huge empire using strings to keep records,but today no one knows what the knots mean .Without anyone who understands the the string Ancient Inca is a lot like solving a mystery.Later Archeologists found many of the quipus .some of the Inca's textiles and clothing survived very well.Inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunter hunters or looters.spaniards murdered the king in 1532 and took over the empire.                                             Puebloan's      The ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa verde about A.D.550. Item_Response: The discoveries pertaining to the Incans, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri hold great importance in the world of today.        Knowledge of the past world helps us better understand the world of today. Take, for example, the Inca quipus. It was a tool of string used to record the population of a Inca empire. It helped the rulers in understanding just who it was, and how many it was, they ruled over.        Ancient sites also tell us what the world was like at that period in time. Graveyards housing the dead show us how long Incas lived on average, which can help us determine fatality rates for generations after. They also show us diseases that may have killed off many civilizations, which we may link to some diseases today, and in turn ay help us find cures for those said diseases. Buried sites also show us what weather patterns may have been like, which may aid us in figuring out how civilizations may have effected the environment around them.        Discovering these ancient empires also shows u the mistakes they've made so we can learn from them.          Some mistakes may include improper civilization placement. Civilizations built high up in the Andes Mountains were prone to rockslides. The cave that many lived in were susceptible to collapse. Another mistake would be abuse of the land. The Puebloans faced this problem.        The over use of land led to less fertile soil. Improper use of water led to droughts. These are thing one must avoid when part of a rapidly growing empire.        These are several things that the world has built on or improved Without the important discoveries of past societies, what would our be like today?

Item_Response: Lost Civililzation the Inca of Peru had not formal alphabet ot system fo writing. The Inca's did not leave archives for historians to study. The inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the caledar to keep a count fo livestock.The Inca's had many recordings that they made and all the recording that the Inca's made were put in a calender.       The Inca's lived in Pithouses from about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750, as settled agruculture began. The pithouse featured a living room sunk a few feet in the ground. Four corner timbets supported the roof. The firepit had an air deflector. An antechaber might contain storage bins or pits. The sipapu was a hole for passage to the underworld, from whick the people had come. Pithouses later evolved into kicvas.       Using nature to advantage, ancestral puebloans built their dwellings beneath the overhaging cliffs. Thier basic construction meaterial was sandstone that they shaped into rectangular blocks about the size fo a loaf of bread. The mortar between the blocks was a mix of mud and water. Rooms averaged about six feet by eight feet, space enough for two or three persons.       The secrets fo a lost city that may have inspired on of the world most enduring myths the fable fo the atlantis have been brought to light from beneath the water off southern Greece.       The found creamics dating back to the end of the stonage. Which suggested that the settlement was occupied some 5000 years ago, at least 1200 years earlier than originally though.Who codirected the underwater suvey was a man named Henderson.

Item_Response: These artifacts are important to this type of history because if we didn't have these artifacts, we wouldn't know what life was like and how we have improved life. The incas also started building shelter that would protect us from weather, intruders and animals. Some of the construction used by incas gave us good ideas for the tools used today.             The life people lived back in the 1500s was a base for how we live today. People built shelters for protection, they gathered plants for medicine, animal leather for clothing, and sharpened sticks and stones for weapons. Now we improved our ways and now use cotton or wool for clothing, framed wood for houses, and projectiled type weapons.             We usually find these artifacts in caves up in mountains, called dwellings, which tell us that people lived here in these conditions, where it was cold. It makes it hard to get these artifacts because people would have to climb these mountains which was hard thing to do, especially back then. People built something like churches. They were called Kivas. Kivas were used for healing rites, luck on hunting, good crops, or praying for rain. People built fires in summer for cooking. In the winter, they were built for warming up the cold villages.               The worlds oldest. City lies under water known as the sunken settlement in Greece and it had been here since 1500 B.C. Many ancient structures were found here and were worth so much money at this time. No one knows how this city shrank, but theories have suggested that it were sea level changes, and ground subsidence as a result of earthquakes or tsunamis.                 Today, people know so much of what happened a long time ago because of primary sources, ancient artifacts and homes left behind. But there is a lot of evidence that is unanswered about these artifacts and resources. It is quite interesting in my opinion. That is how some of the things from ancient times could help us out.

Item_Response: Importance of the Discoveries Made about the Inca/Puebloans           For years, scientists and historians have been busy making educated guesses and conclusions about the ancient civilizations. As fascinating as these time periods were, there was scattered information. Sometimes, archaeologists would have more information on one subject than the other. This made it difficult to figure out all the pieces of the puzzle.       Archaeologists had a really difficult time deciphering the Inca's language, as they barely had any written information or records. Something that was an astounding breakthrough however was a quipu. This was a 'device' that the Incas made and used. This wasn't any particular was of writing or keeping track of events, but it was a number system. A quipu had a bunch of different colored strings that symbolized many different numbers. The quipu was extremely vital and important because it showed that the Incans were capable of inventing their own number system.       In Mesa Verde, Puebloans were shown as intelligent by the important findings made by archaeologists and historians, as well as scientists. The Ancestral Puebloans found out their own unique way of building huts, or 'Pithouses'. These living spaces were extremely important findings because it showed how the Puebloans lived. Soon, Pithouses became even more complex when they evolved into 'Kivas'. Kivas were made of a more solid, almost stone-like, clay. Not everyone lived in a Kiva as they were used as a ceremonial room and often held rituals for healing or praying. Shortly after Kivas were made, people called Cliff Dwellings started appearing. As their name states, they lived in cliffs. The first reports of Cliff Dwellings were made by cowboys in the 1880's, and this is when archaeologists started getting interested. These cliff homes were very sturdy and provided excellent protection from weather and other dangers such as enemy tribes or wild animals.       If you've ever heard of an ancient civilization called Atlantis, you might recall hearing somewhere that it had been submerged into the ocean and renamed 'The Lost City'. For years on end, divers and archaeologists have been trying to uncover secrets and other information about this sunken city. Though it still remains a mystery, the finding that have been made so far are extremely important to uncovering a truth. In source #3, 'Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets', the author states that a monumental structure consisting of a rectangular hall called a megaron was discovered. This means, that the settlements status was raised because these were usually used by an elite. Not only was a megaron found, but ceramics dating back to at least 5000 years ago were uncovered as well. This means that Atlantis would have been submerged a full 1200 years earlier than scientists originally hypothesized.       As mentioned thoroughly in all 3 sources, archaeologists made some extremely important findings that helped historians and other experts find out the real truths along the way.

Item_Response: The Ancient Past of Inca and Archaeologists!       Have you ever thought about the myths in our and about how,well what if they arent myths? Well im here to tell you about the great Ancient Inca! Im here to tell you about the secrects and facts of Inca, and how much Archaeologists have found. Historians have been very careful when they interpres these things in Inca. The knowledge from Inca comes from artifacts, or objects that the people of Inca left behind. Also some of the knowledge comes from sites where some of he artifacts were found.       Inca of Peru had no formal alphanet or a way of writing. They didnt leave archives for historians to study either, it was their home. Inca used strings to keep records of things and the first Europeans to meet them were amazed by it. Some of the imformation that comes about Inca is from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation. The Spanish soldiers and priests thsat met Inca people described them in letter and diaries. Some clothing and textiles have also sruvied as a part of the Inca history.       Archaeologists are afraid that treasure hunters have taken some valuable things left from the Inca people. Though the things that were left provied some quiet eye grabbing attention to you. Archeologists have to study real hard on the detail of the sites and who they were built by. We learn about the past of Inca with the help of Archaeolgists, without them we wouldnt know half the facts and resouces we have to stand up from the myths. All in all discovers about places like Inca, the Puebloans, and Atlantis may all seem as myths to you but, in this world all these myths have came true by the help of Archaeologists.

Item_Response: Inca History:         What I learned about the Inca was their past. the Inca had no certain way of writing for archeologists to study, for their calendars, they made knots in colored string called quipus and to keep up with livestock.            Clues were left behind by the Inca for a portrait of religion art agriculture, etc. that's a way for archeologists to find out how the inca lived. Some things that we know are mainly from the Inca. Like for history for example, Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532, wrote them down.            Most of the history of the Inca comes from the knowledge of how archeologists discovered the artifacts and etc. such as stone gold pottery silver clothes also still exist from that time most was destroyed by dampness.       Puebloans History:             The first Puebloan settled in Mesa Verde, in 550 A.D. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, to use for hunting.When they settled they began creating their shelters known as Pithouses.             In A.D. 750 they began making houses above ground, for there on they were known as the village Dwellers. Between A.D. 1100 & A.D.1300 during the classic period the Puebloans population grew, their was about several thousand. About A.D. 1200 some people began  moving back to the cliff alcoves. The alcoves were a more safe place to live away from the elements.           Local cliff dwellers were reported by local cowboys in the 1800's.           Lost Greek City History:        The Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists back 5000 years ago. The Greek city was 30,000 sq meters of the ocean floor off the Southern Peloponnese.A British Oceanographer 40 some years ago, discovered it.  Atlantis was a myth that keeps under water explorers going.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are all very important to understanding how ancient life was lived. These ancient civilizations have provided sufficient information about how life was lived beofore modern times.        The Incans had no sort of system of writing or alphabet, but they did have a kind of number dvice called a quipus. This device was used by tying knots onto a rope, and using that to keep track of numbers. keep track of livestock and to record their calendar. This early system of record keeping was useful in the Incan empire, and showed us how advenced they were. Humans today have still never decoded the system, this shows how advenced they must have been to be able to come up with a complex code that only they could understand.        A group of people called the Puebloans were very helpful in understanding the weather and way of life these people had. They lived in 550 A.D. and were well known for being amazing basketmakers. This shows us that they had makings and certain plants that allowed for this. They also were very early farmers, instead of being hunters and gatherers. They were very advanced and built pithouses gathered in small villages on mesa tops. They were amazing engineers in the way they mastered making houses and basketweaving. Their techiniques of basketweaving are still used, and since they were so durable we have some today!        There is a legend of an underwater city off the coast of Greece. It is the oldest submerged city in the world, it is 30,000 meters of ocean floor. Though some people want to believe it was built underwater, it was really just sumberged much later after it was built, caused by earthquakes. Archaeologists ahve found ceramics and ruins, believed to have belonged to an ancient group of people called the Pavlopetri. We have learned taht they had pottery and an advanced social hierarcy, which is amazing.

Item_Response: Through archeologists we have discovered many differents things that have happened in the past. The ancient civilizations that used to occupy the land we live in today we have little knowledge of. Part in because of the inaccurate records and geographical difficulties. So archeologists go back to where it all originated from to see what happened and how these people lived.            The Inca who lived in present Peru did not use a letter system but instead used pictures and specially designed calendars. Some knowledge we have today comes from the oral stories that have been passed down through the generations. However many of the things we know about ancient civilizations comes from artifacts found in the cities of origin.            The people who lived in all these tribes lived in special ways unlike each other and constantly changing. Many archeologists are still learning and gathering information about these lost cities in ruin. They can determine how many people lived in the city, the conditions, and how they lived their everyday lives. Many old Spanish records are inaccurate due to the difficulty of having to learn the language of the people and not always understanding what they were saying.           Thanks to archeologists we have learned many things about the past and all the things that happened.

Item_Response: Archeologists over the years have been studying the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri for varius reasons. One of the biggest things we look at in their unique civilizations are the buildings. We study how they were built, and what they are made of. Sometimes these buildings have writings on them that state certain beliefs and/or cultural differences.       Many archeologists study cultural systems such as religions, the arts, clothing, and rituals (if any). Every society has their own culutural differences making them unique, like how the Inca used colorful rings as an alphabet, or the Navajo and their pottery. Most of the native civilizations also had interests in the arts wether it be the musical art, theatrical art, the written word, or even as basic as a drawing on a wall.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calender to keep a count of livestock. The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using string to keep records. Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus but today no one who knows what the knots mean. Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the colorful strings, understanding the ancient Inca is a lot like solving a mystery.

Item_Response: Have you ever wondered if their are any lost cities out there in the world? Well, there are three recently discovered civilizations. There are the Inca's, the Puebloans, and the Palvopetris. These three cities are such an important find, because it links us with the lost past and inspires archaeologists to search for more lost lands. The Inca's used no form of writing, nor did they have an alphabet.     First, the Incas were a civilization that lived in the Andes. The Inca's were a civilization that had no alphabet or writing. The Inca's us quipus, or colored string, to record their calendar to keep count of their livestock. Noone still knows what the knots mean. We discovered about the ancient Incas by their clues left behind with architecture and paintings. We also know some about the Incas from stories past down from many generations, and Europeans wrote down about them. Since the Inca lived high in the Andes the dead bodies were frozen which helps us learn about how they died and lived.     Next, the Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde. They lived there for about 700 years until they left their homes and moved away. The Puebloans were very skilled at basketmaking and they were formally Nomadic, until they began to lead a more settled way of life. They farmed more than they hunt for food. They lived in pithouses that were clustered into small villages. By A.D. 1000, the Puebloans used stone masonry. In A.D. 1200 the population began to shift and they moved back towards the cliffs. They lived in these cliff dwellings for about 100 years until they they left.     Finally, the Palvopetris werew found in the ocean. They sank 5,000 years ago. It is the biggest submerged town in the world. It straddles 30,000 meters of the ocean floor. They had buildings, courtyards, mainstreets, and rock cut tombs. They had ceramics dating back from the end of the stone age. They had a town hall and the city was never reoccupied.     These civilations help archaeologists figure out about the past and inspire them to find more. the Incas, the Puebloans, and thePalvopetris were such an important find for archaeologists and helped ancient discoveries.

The Inca lived high in the Andes and are thought to have worshipped some mountain peaks. Bodies found in the Andes were so preserved scientists scan the bodies with modern day technology.          The first ancestral Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde. They were skilled in crafts. They farmed and hunted. their homes were called pithouses and the villages were small.          Atlantis was a lost city that has sunk underwater. It is one of the oldest lost cities.         All these places and groups of people are thought to be interesting because people are intruiged by the things that have been found and the information that has been collected from the past.

Item_Response: The Incas used many strategies to keep its empire and culture going. They used Quipus or colored strings to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. They also kept a portrait of their religion. They also had art and archetecture, agriculture, government, and their way of life. They also passed stories from generation to genaration. They know a little about Ancient Inca.       Ancient Puebloans lived like the Incas but, they had a different culture. Before the Puebloanss were hunters and gatherers.Then they became successful and changed their culture. They made baskets and pottery. One day the Puebloans moved, maybe for defence or religious reasons. Their homes were small, and inside holes back then, and they were called pithouses. Then they started making houses above ground. The houses were made out of poles and mud. They built houses agaist another in long, curving rows.  When they joined the houses together, they had at least 50 rooms or more.

Item_Response: The dicoveries made of these ancient civilazations are very important. The inca are important because the form an amazijng portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and the way of life. Archeologist can compare what they learn from arifacts and sites with the spaniards accounts to confirm historical records. They find out where it came from and what happened to it and how did the civilazation came to an end.             The pueblanos are very important too. The mesa verde national park preserves a spectacular reminder of this ancient culture. We can learn of how they started making their homes out  of poles and mud. Them moving gave rise to the cliff dwelling for which mesa verde is most famous. Their lives is very intresting but we will never know thw whole story. Some of today's pueblo people, and maybe other tribes are descendants of the ancestral puebloans of mesa verde.                  Lastly, theres the pavlopetri, that may have inspired one of the worlds most enduring myths. The site was believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Thanks to the shifting sands and the settlements enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, ruck cut tombs and religious structures. Eventhough alot of this civilization still remains a mystery it has become an very important and intresting place to keep discovering.

Item_Response: The reason the discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are so important is because people would like to know about the past and how we got here today. There are things in the past that arent here today or that have got us where we are by new writing or languages that werent known things before. Its important because as a submerged site it was never reoccupied. Which means it was a one time deal. People lived there and made lives there and as it sunk there was no life to be found. Nothing existed there anymore and maybe someone would like to know why.            The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the worlds most enduring myths - the fable of Atlantis - have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece. It not only shows how people lived at the time is also of great interest to natural scientists because the waters around it are so shallow. Meaning there must have been life there. They would like to know all about it at one point. How it got there and why it sunk. If they can figure that out than the importance would be finding more and more.               Older generations always knew it was there but they had no idea about the extent of it. Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going. So with them finding it so late in time they had even less time to really study it before it was washed away by sand and water. Less than one percent of the worlds ocean floors have been surveyed so there must be more but they wont know till they look. Atlantis is an extraordinary find but there is still lot more down there that has to be found. Other artifacts and places may be down there and Atlantis will help find them. With them finding Atlantis it may lead to more submerged towns if they can study this one to full extent and find its all true values.            They say it remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of classical Greece. This is before christ and some say nothing existed before christ so with this there is proof that things existed. There are older sunken sites in the world but none can be considered to be planned towns such as this, which is why it is so unique. It is also said to be the oldest Submerged town in the world which makes it very important to our world history and how we came to be. Maybe its not the real important parts of history but we wont know that until they actually fully investigate it.            In the future i think it would be good for people to know about the past and things that took place in the past. They might want to know about the past places and past people, but in my opinion i think it would be amazing to know about a sunken place such as the lost city of Atlantis. There might be more to Atlantis than we know and have found but we they will never known because of the never ending amount of sea levels and ocean floors. The importance is the past and how it effects the future.

Item_Response: Explanatory Article!            The discovery of the Inca and The Puebloan's are very important, because many important and fasanating facts were revealed. We learn about how the people lived in the ancient civilized times. How they survived. And what they went through. It show's us the Uniqueness in these towns. There different cultures. In some cases you can even see what kind of diseases and illnesses where in the town if theres human remains. Lots of things get discovered. Thats why there important. These towns are important to our history. All these facts discovered helps us understand how kife was back then. It also helps us value what we have, because they didnt have what we have back then.       In the 'Ancient Inca' they found many artifacts such as preserved clothing. Clothing usually is destroyed by all the dampness but these clothing were preserved. It's very odd and fasanating. Some Inca artifacts are made of stone, pottery, gold, and silver. Pottery is a very good artifact, because they probably wrote stories on them and there pattern designs are fasanating, there awsome. They even found bodies in the icy Andes. They ran medical scanning to see how the people died. It also revealed to them how the people lived.       In 'Mesa Verde(Puebloan's)' they found out how people lived and what they lived in. The mesa verde peole lived in pithouses. Pithouses are small houses that have a sunk living room about a few feet in the ground. And it has a four corner tombers supported roof. But then later on pithouses evolved in to Kivas. Kivas were a gathering place, much like a church. Pilasters supported a beam and mud roof. And the entry was a ladder through a hole in the center of the roof. You see that it shows us that they had different entries then now. Now we have doors, we dont have to climb a ladder just to get in a building through a small hole in the roof.       Now the discovery of Atlantis was inspired, because of all the other discoveris that had been made. Atlantis is a unique town. It also has different cultures. They found many pottery and religous buildings in it. Which is great. Atlantis is found in southern greece underwater. Atlantis was discovered 40 years ago. But is older than 40 years. Atlantis straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. Atlantis is the oldest sumereged town. It has so many secrets. All those secrets need to be revealed. Atlantis is a myth                 Imagine if  we wouldnt of found these towns. We wouldn't of known all the facts that we know now. We wouldnt know that even existed. That wouldnt be good at all. All those extrodinary facts unknown.
