Item_Response: All of the discoveries made in ancient civilizations were very important. They help teach us about the past and what people did to survive in ancient times. The Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri all help support the information we use to teach kids all over the world today.       In ancient Inca, there was no alphabet or system of writing. The times have changed from way back then until today. Imagine your life today without the alphabet, it would be pretty hard. There definitely would not be texting. How did they survive? Archaeologists believe that they used knots on colored string to record the calendar and keep count of livestock. This seemed to work for them at the time, but without any other real form of recording things, understanding the Incans is like solving a mystery.       The Puebloans were very skilled. They invented many types of houses and are considered very good basketmakers. They also created farming to replace hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. Life would be very hard these days without the help of the Inca. We would not even know how to produce our own food. How would we have adapted to the old lifestyle?       Without the devastating blow to the Pavlopetri society, we probably would bot know how to predict disasters such as the weather. We also wouldn't know how to react to things such as earthquakes and tsunamis. This ancient ruin has greatly helped influence our warning system to help avoid people in the way of danger.       All of these ancient discoveries helped us gain the knowledge we have today. It has helped us to invent things such as computers and cars. Without the knowledge of how these things worked in the past, we gain no skill of building things for the future. So, thank the people who made these discoveries, because without them who knows where we would be today.

Item_Response: In this artical is about the Ancient past, Of Peru, North america, And in Sourthern Greece.    In Peru They had no formal alphabet or system of writing. The Inca made knots in colored strings called Quipus to record the calender to keep count of livestock. Nobody can treally understand what there knots means. They made some object from, prottery gold or silver. They whorshiped some mountian peaks. They were buried in caves in cliff faces.    In North Amereica long before Eurpoens explored there, a group of people living in the four corners region chose Mesa Verde for there home. Mese Verde is spanish for Green Table. Farming replaced Hunting and Gathering as their main livelihood. they lived in pithouses.   In Southern Greece the fable of the lost city or as we know Atlantis, Have been brought to light from beneath the waters of southern Greece. They have found ceramtics dating back to the end of the stone age, which suggested that the settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago.

Item_Response: The discoveries made about ancient civilizations can be really important to us today. The discoveries made about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri can show this.       The Inca kept track of multiple things using nothing more than tied knots called quipus. They used these for everything from calendars to keeping track of their livestock. The Inca ruled South America for about 100 years, and their expanse rivaled that of Rome. While many sites have been looted for valuable items, many remained hidden. This is partially because many Inca cities were built up high on mountain tops. This keeps the looters from getting to them, so archaeologists have been able to find them undisturbed. They find many artifacts to show the history of the Incas and how they lived. These range from scraps of cloth to diaries that Spaniards kept when they visited them. All of these things contrubute to seeing the rise and fall of the Incas.       The ancient Puebloans are still shrouded in mystery. While much is known about them, such as the homes the lived in, there are still a few questions. However, scientists have learned much about them. They adopted an agricultural lifestyle at Mesa Verde. While there, the quality of their homes increased until they were building multiple-story buildings with intricate stonework. They were also know as great basketweavers, and archaeologists have found examples of changing the way the made pottery. Eventually, they moved to the space under the cliffs where they lived and learned for a while. Then, they went off south, to families in new Mexico and Arizona. The reason is still unknown, but there are theories. One is that after hundreds of years the land was depleted. This may still be in speculation, but there is a great many things known about the ancient Puebloans, and they were a great race.       The secrets of the sunken city have been partially brought to life, thanks to a team of Anglo-Greek archaeologists and geologists. For a long time, people have been told the myth of the lost city of Atlantis, and they may now be revealed as true. Protection form the elements has revealed a large city, full of buildings, and even shards of pottery all over the seafloor. These ruins date back to possibly 5,000 years ago, 1,200 years farther back than scientists previously thought. While these ruins were discovered 40 years ago, not until recently were they showed in such detail. Scientists think that it may have once been above ground, but sunk due to rising sea levels, earthquakes, and other natural events. Thanks to the astonishing discoveries of archaeologists, the myth of Atlantis may no longer be a myth.     In conclusion, many of us have a fascination with the people that lived long before us. The hard work of archaeologists have uncovered many secrets of the past that have quenched our thirst for knowledge. There are still many things to be learned, and one day we may finally learn all we want to know about those who lived in the past, such as the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri.

Item_Response: Ancient Civilization of Inca is very interesting. In the writing to the left, it talks about many different discoveries that they have either dug up and found, stories past down  from the Inca people in the past, or just simply looked around for items left behind.           For example, ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing, so because of this they made knots in colored strings called Quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. Archaeologists have found many of these ancient quipus, but today no one knows what the knots mean. Since nobody knows how to read or interpret what the colorful strings and knots are or stand for, it is very much like a mystery to the archaeologists.           Also, clues left behind  by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art, and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of  life. By studying these clues that they left behind, archaeologists can put pieces and details together to form what the Inca life was like.           Some of the Inca's history came from stories past down from generation to generation. Passing on the stories was a super important way to preserve a community's history. Archaeologists say that some of what we know are from stories that were written down by the Europeans in the 1530's. They wrote the Inca's stories down in diaries or in letters. But some of the Inca's history may be thought of as legends, because the Spaniards didn't speak the Inca language very well so some of the stories may not be true.          What we know today are very important facts about the Inca history found by are Archaeologists that work very hard to discover them. We now know their way of  the Inca living and life styles that are very important to history. The Inca people lived a interesting life and are still remebered to this day.

Item_Response: Archaeligists like too follow up on lost civilizations . Therefore , they keep records on lost civilizations so they can study about them in the future. That is a very important thing , too keep track of their health & their stabilization. Without keeping track of their things , we would probably not know one thing about them. Keeping track of them , is actually very very important. It shows how they are,what they have been doing. Its just simply their records. The record is imporant though. Say if they were too get stolen or ripped or anything. That would be a very bad thing. You would probably have too pay a fee or serve some time for doing something like that too it. Lost civilizations are usually what people learn in history about. Archaeology unlocks secrets of the past. The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus but today no one knows what the knots mean. Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the colorful strings, understanding ther Anicent Inca is alot like soloving a mystery. So how do we know about a civilization that for nearly a hundred years ruled a South American empire that rivaled the exspanse of ancient Rome? Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, argriculture,goverment,transportation,and the way of life. By studying these clues, archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca Life. Some of what we know about the Inca comes from oral history,or stories passed from generation to generation. Passing on the stories was an important way to preserve a community's history. We know some of the old stories because they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The visitors were Spanish soldiers and preists. They described the Inca in letters and diaries. Historians have to be careful when they interpret these accounts. The Spaniards did not speak the Inca language well. They may not have understood what the Inca told them, so their descriptions might not be accurate. And some of the Inca stories were legends rather than history. The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts, or objects that they left behind, and from the sites where artifacts are found. As in many ancient civilizations,Inca artifacts might be objects made from stone,pottery,gold, or silver. Such materials last a long time, even if they have been buried for hundereds of years. Some artifacts turn up in the ruins of buildings. Others are found buried in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife. Some Inca textiles and clothing have also survived remarkably well. Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness,but these have been Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes. Some Inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters, who take anything that might be valuable. Some treasures were taken centuries ago, but looting still goes on today. Looted sites often do not tell archaeologists very much. Other sites are reported to Archaeologists, who can dig them up ccarefully. They provide the bestidea of all about life in Peru before and during Inca rule. Archaeologists who study these sites keep careful records. They write down Photograph any artifacts they find, and note the exact positionin which they find them. They need too learn as much information as they can from every single piece of evidence. Archaeologists can compare what they learn from artifacts and sites with the Spaniards accounts of the Inca. Sometimes archeology confirms historical record. Amoung the most important things to learn about a civilization are where it came from and what happen too it. The fall of the Inca is easyto date because the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king and took over the empire. The orgins of the Inca are more difficult to trace. The area where they lived had been inhabited by diffrent people's. Archaeologists use some of the most advanced techniques in the world too discover more about the Inca's predecessors. You'll see how aerial photogrtrapghy can help them find patterns in ancient monuments that they connot see from the ground. The Inca lived high in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountain peaks. Many of their sites are in remote, high places. Some Inca were buried in caves in cliff faces, for example, or on mountain tops. This has helped too preserve the sites, because looters cannot easily get to them. But it also makes the job of the archaeologist more difficult. High-altitude archaeologists are expert mountaineers. They have to carry all their equiment up a mountain for study. The cold mountains act like a giant freezer. Bodies found in the icy Andes are in such good shape that experts can use modern medical scanning equitment to learn about how the people died. The bodies also reveal information about how they lived .

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations                                 There have been many ancient civilizations that have dispersed or have been lost in modern society. In this article there will be information about three different lost civilizations, the ancient Inca tribe, the ancestral Puebloans, and the lost city of Atlantis. They were all once great communities, but they all were lost.               The Inca were once very powerful, they, at one time, controlled most of South America. The Inca tribe had no real way of writing, there was nothing left behind for the archaeologists to study. There was a colored knot system that kept record of the calender to keep count of the animals. There have been archaeologists that have found this ancient knots, but have never been able to understand what the knots mean. Since nobody can read the stories left in the colorful strings, figuring out the way that the Incas lived is much like solving a mystery with no clues. There are still clues left behind by them, like portraits of their religion, art, and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Using these clues many archaeologist are able to interpret what some of their daily life routines were like. Some things that historians know comes from oral history, and stories that had been passed down from generation to generation. Europeans, who had arrived in 1532, had written some of the stories down and had described the Inca in letters an diaries. It is hard for historians to really know what to understand, because the Europeans did not understand the European language well. Their descriptions of them probably would not be accurate either. Everything else the archaeologist know comes from the artifacts that they find in excavations. Many of the artifacts are mad out of stone, pottery, gold, or silver, and many of them are found in ruin of the building, or in a grave for the dead to use in the afterlife. There are som sites that do not help the archaeologists, because of looter, or treasure hunters, that had gotten the artifacts first. But many other sites are first found by the historians who find artifacts and may be take to different museums. The historians can differentiate the differences between the artifacts and the Spainards descriptions of them.               A long time before the Europeans explored North America, there was a group of people living in the Four Corners region, who chose Mesa Verde as their new home. For over 700 years generations lived and made their lives there. But in the late 1200s the moved away. The first Ancestral Peuebloans that lived in Mesa Verdewere known as Basketmakers, for their superb skill at the craft. They had begun to live off farming instead of hunting and gathering. There was a time that their population had multiplied, and houses had begun to be built above ground. After this occured, they had begun to be known as Publoans. Back to the former statement claimed, the Puebloans had begun to move from Mesa Verde, and go to the cliffs around the late 1200s. Nobody knows exactly why they had done that, but all that is known is that there was a drought towaards the end of the 1200s, and that they would not be able to do anymore farming. Nobdy will ever know the whole story and the Puebloans because most of what was important to them perished long ago. When the moved to the cliffs, they used them to their advantage, they had begun to make their homes under the overhanging cliffs. But they only lived there for around 100 years.               There are many stories to a submerged city, and about 40 years ago, it may have been found. The lost city of ATlantis was just a myth, but because of that myth many people kept searching the bottom of the oceanfloor for this grand city. It is believed that this city had been under water for about 5000 years, many experts say that in terms of size and wealth the amount is unforseable. There are other sunken cities around the world, but none seem to be as modern as this city, which is what makes it so unique. The reason that historians believe it was submerged 5000 years ago, is because some of the ceramics found dated back to the end of the stone age, this was over 1200 earlier than they had once thought. This city is very significant because as a submerged site, it had never been reoccupied, unless by fish. Many marine geologists still wonder why the city sank, and they are still trying to figure out why and how. It is a theory that the sea levels had changed, or ground subsidence, which could have had and outcome of a series of earthquakes or tsunami.                   There are many different reasons why archaeologists would be so interested in the past. All that we know is what they have figured out.

Item_Response: Explanatory Article           The reason that some of the discoveries that archaeologists discover are  important is because they are historic and sometimes have meaning to some cultures in the world. Other reasons are because some things might have an explanation for something. I think that some of the discoveries that they make are very important and have a significant meaning to people and are also fun to look at. There a lot of reasons why some of these discoveries are important and mean a lot to some people in the world.           For example some things that they find are historic things that are over hundreds of years ago and are interesting to look at. There have been cases where  archaeologists have discovered things from the dinosaur era to the era of the Mayans. Some of the discoveries they make sometimes have meanings to many cultures and religions. they might have a meaning to one of the gods they believe in or something to do with their religion. Other discoveries have things to do with ancestors of people and how they used to live back then or what they would were.            Archaeologist have been making lots of discoveries for over many years. Discoveries sometimes have an explanation to something like why something occurred, how someone became a ruler, or maybe how something was invented. In my opinion I think that's how information is gathered from the past events and how they occurred is from the discoveries archaeologists make that support the event. Archaeologists discover things that have symbols and pictures that represent something but are written in many types of languages that people used to communicate in. The languages or symbols are hard for them to understand and sometimes miss out on things that might be important or interesting.          Some discoveries that are found by archaeologists are fun and entertaining to look at. Archaeologists sometimes find statues, paintings, cloths, utilities, and sometimes toys that kids used to entertain each other with.  Statues are interesting to watch because you get to see there artistic view and the details they put into them. Their paintings were also a pleasure to see because you would get to see the portraits they painted and wonder who it was. They would also paint symbols that represented their tribes or cultures.The toys that the kids used to entertain each other with are also interesting to look at because you would get to see how their toys were back then.Another thing is that you would get to see how artistic they can get when it comes to entertaining each other. They would use anything they could find and build a toy. They would sometimes even play with rocks and sticks.          Archaeologists work very hard to discover new things and to entertain us with the things they discover. They have made a lot of amazing discoveries that amaze people. Today they are still out in the desserts, mountains, and oceans hunting for new discoveries. Some archaeologists have to survive any type of weather that hits them because they wont give up until they find what they are looking for.

Item_Response: Why do we study history? We study history for one thing only, to learn. Over the past years,     we have come apond many ancient civilizations. Three in particular are the Inca, Mesa Verde,  and the lost city nicknamed Atlantis. Now the question is what have we learned from them.       First up we have the Inca. When studing the Inca civilization, we have discoved that this small place has been surviving for around a 100 years based on a system called quipus. This is their way of keeping records and making calenders. The incas also used this method of recording for counting cattle and for keeping a diary. So far after many years of studing them we still havent figured out what the colored notes on the quipus represnts, making this civilization more interesting and mysterious. I doesnt really help either that its on top of a dangerous mountain       Next is the MEsa Verde. THe thing about there little world is that it was astablished in AD 550. When claering the sight, arcutecs found many ancient tools, writings, pottery and weapons. They also learned that these ancient people lived in structed pithouses that were clustered together like a community. the mesa verde people lived roughly for 200 years but why. scientist found that they lived so long because of there variety of weapons they have to kill. they taught them selfes to use a bow and arrow and how to throw spears creating a longer civilization.       Lastly we have the alantic city. It was said to be a myth but it turns out it was true. although there isnt any mermaids discovered, there was a discovery of structures  and pottery. Why this ancient greek city sank to the ocen? we might never know, but with the knowlege and technology we have  we might dicove why and be ably to ee why.       All in all, history is something we learn from. It also helps us learn from our past history. So next time you think history is stupid, remember this.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans and the Pavlopetri where important finds because all of them help us understand how they lived and how we can improve their ideas of technology.           Like the Incas invented the quipus that is made of knotted colored string calendar to keep count of the live stock. When the Europeans found that the Incas had their own calendar they where amazed that they could keep control of their large city by keep records with the calender.            Also, the Pueloans where a very important find because they where the first people to settle in houses with poles to hold the building up write and mud to make the walls. The why they built their technology help us under stand the way to make a simple house. Like in the present we have house with metal poles to hold the building up right like the Pueloans and make the walls out of cement. We took their good ideas on how to build house we just made it modern. Without the Pueloans we would know how to build houses.              The Pavlopetri people built the largest city that was later sunken under water that is almost built how we have our cities today. The Pavlopetri people had a period of exploration they started to build buildings, courtyards, main streets and religious structures. This find was very important because it helped us find a way to build a city.           The Pueloans, Inca and Pavlopetri people was a very important find to help us advance in technology today. We look at their technology and made it modern.  With out them we wouldn't have the technology we have today

Item_Response: Thousands of years later, archaeologists are yet to discover several abandoned civilizations that lie all over the world. Every past or future ruin can teach incredible amounts of information to archaeologists. In the Inc-an civilization, bodies and artifacts were skillfully preserved, providing awaiting knowledge. Another civilization, the Pueblo-ans, are from thousands and thousands of years ago. The Pavlopetri show insight on the Earth's past geological structure. Whether it be satisfying curiosity, discovering the human roots, or tracing back past landscapes, ancient civilizations contain the necessary pieces to complete history's puzzle.        The Incas were helpful to have kept their civilization in such a condition that benefited archaeologists. Much of there clothing, bodies, and architecture was buries by vast snow up in the mountains. Their clothing speaks of past weather patterns and perhaps extinct animals. Their technology used to produce such may have been more advanced than others around the world. Their ruins inform archaeologists of neighboring regions that left behind nothing. Medical advancements can only be displayed in the form of performed bodies or documents. Their success attempts and past living population helps calculate the number of people today with Inc-an roots. In general, art tells us about their lifestyle; entertainment, responsibility, agriculture, etc. The study of their preserved culture fits the Spaniard and Inc-an puzzle pieces.        As with the Incas, the Pueblo-ans and Pavlopetri were vital to tracing back human roots and evolution. As these civilization began to break tradition and begin new, nomadic lifestyles, archaeologists can further understand the technology advancements of mankind. Rocks used for weapons and other household items hint towards common rock features of the past. The number of bodies and artifacts discovered help historians study the growth of the human population. However, most importantly, is what the Pavlopetri civilization was able to teach. Never had archaeologist been able to discover underwater civilizations, but they did. This drastically changed views of the changing water level in the world. Scientists were now able to study more geographical features and access the climate of the areas. Unlike the Incas, who provided a cultural view, the Pueblo-ans and Pavlopetri informed archeologists and geologists of past climate, weather, landscape, and rocks.        The puzzle is yet to be completed. Upon more advanced technology, the puzzle will continue to grow, as will our history. What will future civilizations think about today? What artifacts of ours will be used? The Incas, Pueblo-ans, and Pavlopetri preserved their culture and way of life for geologists and archaeologist to discover thousands of years later.

Item_Response: Throughout the course of man kind people are always fascinated by the past. Architecture, economic system, government, clothing, entertainment are some of the many things that people examine in the past. People evolve and become more efficient when studying and understanding the past. In the three following sources, Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past, Mesa Verde National Park Puebloans and Their World, and Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets archeologists learn about ancient civilizations and in these sources its extremely apparent that the discoveries made by these archeologists are important to human society.           In the first source written by Beth Gruber archaeologists in Peru learn more about Inca culture which is very important. For instance, Inca's managed to produce textiles and clothing that were very sturdy. This is important because it allows humans to see how their ancestors dressed in the past as well as give modern day cloth makers techniques on how to make more durable clothing. Another example that leads people to believe the archeologists discoveries in Peru were important is that they found preserved bodies in the Andes mountains. This is important because it allowed scientists to learn how people died back then and prevent it from happening now.           In the second source that was illustrated by NPS and Roy Anderson archeologists learn many things about the Puebloans past which are very important today. For example archeologists found that the Puebloans and their descendants lived for seven hundred years building elaborate stone communities in canyon walls. This is important because it allows people to witness how people can settle virtually any environment if they try hard enough. Another instance of archeologists findings in an ancient civilization being important is when they found the kivas. Kivas were very important in Peuoblan culture and it lets people of today see how intelligent the Peubloans were because they were able to create rooms dedicated to worship.            In the third source by Helena Smith archeologists divers explore the ruins of a sunken settlement in Greece which is very important. One reason its important is that the whole settlement which was once on dry land is now underwater. This is important because it inspires more people to explore the sea and believe in myths such as Atlantis. Another reason why this settlement is important is because it lets scientists observe how water could be so dangerous and lead to destruction of entire cities. The settlement for very large so seeing that the whole thing was under water makes scientists want to know how and why.           These discoveries in Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past, Mesa Verde National Park Puebloans and Their World, and Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets are very important to human society. They allow people to understand the past and make improvements for the future. Which is the reason why people look study human history and look for signs of the past.

Item_Response: No doubt the discoveries of these ancient civilizatons have   been, are, and always will be very important. These findings are important because it reveals the way of thinking that these people had. Everybody has a different perspective and way of thinking. By discovering these civilizations, everyone is able to explore their cultures and have a different way of looking at ideas.   These civilizations had very basic architecture. Architects have   now evolved their ways of creating complex, stable structures.Not only were their buildings basic, but their building materials were also low-tech. Building materials have converted from weak substances like adobe to more sturdier materials like metals, stone, and asphalt. Many advances in architecture have been made since the fall of these ancient civilizations.   The ancient civilizations had created a different religion based   on things they depended on to survive. By finding artifacts of the past, explorers can tell or come up with something to explain some of their religion. If Catholicsm were to end now, one could find a rosary or a cross and assume that they believed in the story of Jesus Christ. If Judeoism were to end now, people could find religious objects like jewish stars or manorahs that help determine what someone's religion was, what they celebrated, and what they believed in. Finding artifacts of these civilizations are important so that people can learn about someone else's views on things such as religion besides themselves.   Finding these artifacts have helped for people to look at things   differently and create thoughts of their own. If humanity was never able to find any of these objects, there could be a chance that everybody would have basic beliefs thoughts and ways of thinking.

Item_Response: Learning about our origins and the places we come from is very important.  Many archeologists study past civilizations like the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.  When we study these civilizations we get to learn many about our past life.      Many artifacts found at these sites can tell us a lot about ways of life back then.  They can tell us whether ancient people had a religion or certain traditions.  The Inca's had a different life style.  They had a complex language and advanced agriculture.  Since the Inca's lived in the high Andes they had a different way of farming. The Inca's had a very interesting culture and the things we learn about it gives us an idea on how things advanced.      The Puebloans also had a unique culture.  The lived in small communities with elaborate buildings.  They did many things like hunting and making necessities like tools and home goods.  They lived in huts called pit-houses, which had the floor sunken in a few feet deep.  Because of there good works with their architecture they were called Basketmakers.  Like most ancient civilizations, the Puebloans had a religion.  They practiced their rituals in temples with chambers for certain things.  Many would go in certian rooms to pray for luck, healing, rain, or a good crop.  The Puebloans with their great architecture and ideas influenced many things from buildings to life skills.      Another important civilization was the Pavloperti.  They were believed to have come from the ancient myth of the sunken city of Atlantis.  Greek mythology says that there was a city that was consumed by the ocean.  Many people today are searching for an answer to see if this legend is true.  So far they have said that they think they might of found the ''lost city of Atlantis''.  Off the coast of Neapolis oceanologists have found ruins of what might be from the sunken city.  The Pavlopeti are believed to be the citizens of the ''sunken city''.      All of these civilizations may not seem that important. But once you discover the secrets and ancient stories you learn about how life was before our time.  Many artifacts show how much we've advanced in our technology and our cultures.   Learning about previous civilizations is very important for everybody to know about where they came from.

Item_Response: In the sources one, two, and three, it explains findings about ancient civilizations. These discoveries have been very important for many reasons.                  From source one,about the Inca civilizations, it explains how they have found many quipus which were used to record calendars and count livestock. This is an important find because it shows how even back then they would keep track of things. Clues that the Inca have left tell us of their life, religion, art, agriculture, and more. This information lets us know how they were before and what kinds of things they did, like if they did any rituals or how they built. We also find out more about the Inca from oral history that is passed on, that can tell us things we don't know and also preserves its history. Artifacts and any other objects they left behind tells us more like objects that they buried in their graves. Finding bodies from the Inca that are in good shape can be scanned and reveal how they died along with how they lived.                In source two, about Ancestral Puebloans, Mesa Verde National Park preserves this ancient culture. This helps so that we will always have that reminder since it's being preserved. They lived in pit houses, which were usually built on mesa tops or cliff recesses. This shows how they built and maybe their reasons why they built it. The Ancestral Puebloans made pottery, baskets and used the bow and arrow to hunt. This shows that they are artistic and good at making crafts. The structures show evidence of a society  that learned different ways to do things, different traditions, and that they are skillful at building. We also find out other things, like how we know that they had to deal with very cold winters because they had blackened walls because the smoke.                          Source number three tells the reader about  a lost Greek city, and archaeologists amazing discoveries. It has remains from 2800 to 1200 BC, and 'We found ceramics dating back from the end of the stone age, which suggested that the settlement was occupied some 500 years ago...........' said Henderson. The settlement was preserved because it is in a protected bay, and because of shifting sands. There have been many buildings, courtyards , religious structures, pottery, and maybe a megaron, in the sunken Greek city that have been found. This lost Greek city is thought to be Atlantis, and even if it's a myth it is what encourages underwater searches.                        The sunken city, the Inca finds, and the Ancestral Puebloans finds have all been important. They all give us more information about the past to learn about and be amazed of. They Inca discovery told us more about their life religion, and more. The Ancestral Puebloans lets us know more about where they lived and what they made. Lastly, the lost Greek city is a great discovery since it was a planned town, and it had artifacts that let us know when it was occupied.

They also made knots in colored string to record the calender. Inca comes from oral history and the stories are passed from generation to generation.The Spaniards visited, but did not speak the Inca language very well. Some materials lasted a long time and some artifacts were in buildings or buried in graves with the dead people. Clothes were usually found and some were in perfect condition but some were water.        The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde. Mesa Verde means 'green table'. Puebloans means 'Village dwellers'. The are know as basket makers. While they were traveling they would hunt instead of farm. They also learned to make pottery and bows and arrows. They also learned to make a spear. In A.D. 750 Puebloans built houses above ground. A.D. 1000 they advanced in adobes. They also advanced in pottery because when they verily started it, the designs were simple. Now they were so detailed.         The Pavlopetri also known as marine geologist have discovered the lost city of Atlantis. This is probably one of the oldest cities to be discovered. Its 30,000 square meters of ocean floor that is taken up by this city. The Pavlopetri has discovered building, courtyards, main streets, tombs, churches, and some pottery. They think an earthquake or a tsunami occurred Atlantis to fall.Atlantis is still a myth, but people are still trying to discover it.          There was a source about the Incas, about the Puebloans, and about the Pavlopetri. I learned that the Inca made some of the stuff that we now useful today. The Puebloans learned how to make houses above ground. The Pavlopetri are still trying to discover the long lost city of Atlantis.

Item_Response: The discoveries involving the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, have helped scientists understand more about the past. Artifacts, written languages, and textiles have provided us with knowledge about these ancient civilizations.? Archeologists keep careful records, and get as much information out of the evidence as they can.                                           The Inca of Peru had no form of writing, thus not allowing archeologists to study. By finding out clues from artifacts and their way of life, maybe the archeologists can piece the Inca life together. The Inca artifacts left behind might be objects made of stone, pottery, gold, or sliver, and may be found in buried graves for the dead. This allowed us to research the life style of the Inca.                          The Puebloans chose Masa Verde for their home in A.D. 550. Their skill at craft gave them the name, Bastketmakers. They learned to make pottery, and a more efficient way of hunting, the bow and arrow. Around A.D. 750, they began to build their houses above ground. These homes were build out of poles and mud, often with pit houses. They soon evolved into fifty rooms of stone masonry. The architecture was not the only thing changing. The pottery developed into more intrecut, black designs on a white background. Using the landscape, Puebloans built their dwellings beneath overhanging cliffs. They lived underneath the cliffs for less than one hundred years. They then left Masa Verde and traveled south, leaving their ancient civilization behind.                         The Puebloans society may have been abandoned, but a city has been sunken underwater for a some five thousand years. The secrets hidden in this lost city have inspired the myth of Atlantis.This city was found beneath southern Greece, covering at leas thirty thousand square meters of the ocean floor. The seabed held thousands of shards of pottery and a whole settlement of buildings, courtyards, streets, tombs, and religious structures were discovered.Many of these artifacts date back to the stone age. ''Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going.''-Sakellariou                         The three civilizations have played an important role in keeping our history alive. It provided us with information on life in the past, letting us know what life was like. The ancient artifacts held within are the key to new explorations and discoveries.

Item_Response: Their was several reasons why the discoveries were important. There was the Inca, Puebloans   and the Palvopetri.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              First, the Inca made knots in quipus, which was the first 'counting of livestock.' The Incas left clues behind which helped shape their religion & culture. So the scientist can piece together how their life was. Most of what we know comes from oral history or stories passed down through generations.Most Spaniards that found the Inca civilization could not understand them. Inca's main artifacts were stone, pottery, gold, or silver. The Inca had lived in the high Andes which protected them from other civilization.       Next, Mesa Verde National Park preserves some of the areas where the Puebloans had once lived. The first Puebloans settled there in about 550 A.D. They were best known for their basket making and incredible craft skills. Most of them lived in pit houses. These were house that sank into the ground that were built using mud, wood, and other supplies. In 1000 A.D. they finally started building better structures. Also there were cliff dwellers which lived in the side of a cliff.       Finally, the Palvopetri lived in Southern Greece. They once lived where there is now an ocean. Scientists are still trying to find artifacts to complete there research. There is no doubt that this is the oldest submerged city in history. This site of where they lived straddles 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor. They have found buildings which help them find more artifacts about this civilization.

They find notes or dairies that they have discovered.They find out what it was like back then and how it effected them and what we can do to not have history repeat it self.                To begin, in ancient Inca of Peru they discovered that they didn't have formal alphabet or a system of writing. The Inca recorded records by using knots in colored string which were called quipus. We've know some of their old stories because the Europeans wrote them down. They also revealed that the Spaniards did not speak the Inca language very well. Our best knowledge on them comes from artifacts and objects left behind like textiles, clothing, and ruins of buildings. Most Inca sites were disturbed by treasure hunters and looters who took anything that they thought was most valuable.              Then, the first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde and that's Spanish for 'green table'. Their skill of craftsman ship brought theme the name Basketmakers. The people who lived there changed pole-and-adobe to stone masonry by the time of A.D 1000. The most famous were the cliff dwellings. Cliff dwellers left no records but they also were very skillful at making a living from a difficult environment they were in. Their structure, skill, and traditions were past from generation to generation.             In addition, the secrets of the lost city enhanced myths. There was shiffting sands and the settlement enclosed. This revealed buildings, courtyards,and tombs. There's also thousands of shards of pottery. This Atlantis myth is located near Neapolis in Greece. We still do not understand why this settlement sank but they are still researching it and trying to discover new things.            All and all, these different amazing sites have many different artifacts they found and still looking for. Maybe the Lost City of Atlantis isn't true but we still have yet to find out. In a matter of time we'll know more about this planet and what used to be here.

Item_Response: Archeological Finds: Why So Important?          Throughout the years, people have been fascinated with ancient cultures. People dedicate their whole lives to learn about them. These people look for, and find, ancient sites in the most remote places and make important discoveries.         The ancient Inca people settled in the Andes mountains, it most of their history was recorded only orally, so historians weren't sure if they were true or not. According to Beth Gruber, 'The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts.' These objects tell us how the Inca lived, what they believed, and how they survived. Without these important archeological finds, we may have only known what happened to the Inca by false tales.            Another ancient civilization, the Puebloans, strived in Mesa Verde. When scientists discovered the remains of their living arrangements and other buildings, they were amazed at their 'advanced...pole-and adobe construction [and] skillful stone masonry,' according to the National Parks Service. From these sites, archeologists were able to determine the Puebloans were skilled basket makers and potters. They dug up beautiful ceramics created by these ancient people and were amazed at their ability to make these amazing artworks. The Puebloans left no written records, but scientists were able to piece the puzzle together one step at a time, thanks to archaeological sites.              One of the most lasting of all Greek myths, the story of Atlantis has intrigued many. Therefore, archaeologists were delighted when a sparkling city was found underneath the waves of Greece. What they found amazed them. The city was much older then Plato's Atlantis myth! The city was extremely advanced for the time it was built, and made scientists reconsider the intelligence of ancient peoples. 'We found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age.' says Dr. Jon Henson, co-director of the underwater survey. This suggests that the people of the past were much more advanced than historians originally believed. '...It represents a frozen moment of the past.' said Elias Spondylis, the other co-director of the survey.              Without the help of these archaeological finds, ancient peoples may have remained a mystery forever.

Item_Response: The Discoveries about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important in helping people understand history from many years ago. The Inca were a civilization of people that lived about a hundred years ago. Puebloans were a group of people that moved to Mesa Verde long before the Europeans explored North America. The Pavlopetri was the name for the sunken city explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archeologists and marine geologist           Discovering the Inca society helped us learn about them more and about their way of life compared to ours. We know about them by artifacts that they left behind. The Inca lived high up in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountains peaks. Inca lived high up in mountains some even lived in caves, and this helps to preserve sites because looters cant get to them because they are high up in the mountain. The Inca fell in in 1532 when the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king and took over the empire.           The Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They are known as basket makers for their skill to craft. Formerly nomadic they began to settle down and started farming which then they didn't have to gather and hunt. They lived in pit houses clustered into small villages sometimes built on mesa tops, but mostly on cliff recesses. The population had multiplied, and by about A.D. 750 they began making houses above ground with upright walls. By A.D. 1000 the people from Mesa Verde had advanced in their skill of construction. They began making more villages, but by A.D. 1200 the puebloans moved back into the cliffs we still don't know why but the archeologists are still looking for the answer.           The pavlopetri was a sunken settlement beneath the waters off southern Greece. This settlement dates back to 5,000 years to the time of homers hero. '...this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' said Dr. Jon Henderson. The theories made by marine geologists include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami.        These discoveries helped shape history and show what is still there from billions of years ago. The Incas, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are examples of what show people the past. History has a lot in its past.

Item_Response: It is very important that we know about the discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetric. One reason it is good to know about your history is that so it does not repeat itself and we make the same mistakes. We could even get some ideas from them. They have learned to adopt just like modern day people.          Some things that we have learned about the Incas are that the clues they left behind form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. By studying these clues, archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca life. The things you will learn will fascinate you.          Some of what we know from Inca history is from oral history. Europeans who arrived in their empire in 1532 described the Inca in their letters and diaries. The rest come from artifacts that could be made from gold, silver, or pottery even if they were buried for hundreds of years. Archaeologists who study these site keep careful records. Among the most important things to learn about a civilization are where it came from and what happened to it.            About 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verda for their home. For more than 700 years this civilization occurred and archaeologists have the artifacts to prove it. We have learned what kind of houses they had, what weapons they used, what they learned to make all from the stuff that people find.           Over the years civilizations begin to change and adopt to their surroundings. One example of this is the Puebloans who change their houses and their scenery. They made new houses that were more stable and livable. They went to the cliff dwellings and then they completely deserted it. Archaeologists are unsure as to why. We will never know the whole story, but we do know that they adopted to whats around them.           An incredible discovery that was made by archaeologists was a city that was submerged completely in water. It is off the coast of Neapolis. They have found ceramics that date back to the end of the stone age, which suggests that the settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago, at least 1,200 years earlier than originally thought. The marine geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank. Because of the conditions around it the city is basically a frozen moment of the past.            So as you can see history is very important to the modern world. In a very long time from now people will be learning about you in the same way. Clearly, people need to kno what happened years and years ago.

Item_Response: Discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri           The Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri all left ancient artifacts, yet, how do we know so much about them? Well, archaeologists can do that job for people who just like to learn about them. Archaeologists search the earth for history that could change our minds about the continent we live on, people, or perhaps the whole world. Archaeologists go from the bottom of the sea to the very top of the earth like the worlds tallest mountain or something you think that is the tallest land form you've ever seen. When you look at the earth you step on, do you ever get the urge to know what happened here 5,ooo years ago? I sure do! You can find out if you keep reading on.       I am going to talk about the Inca first. The ancient Inca came from Peru. The Inca had one of the biggest empires of the world. The Europeans were so amazed at that sight. The ancient Inca's left behind clues that archaeologists can study from and see what the Inca's form of religion was, their way of art and architecture, way of agriculture, how they managed their govenrment, how they transported, and finally, their way of life. We know some old stories because they get passed on from generation to generation.           No I'm going to talk about the Puebloans. Puebloans were from Mesa Verde. The Puebloans are 1,400 years old. They even lived before the Europeans explored North America! For about 700 years, maybe more, the descendants lived and flourished in Mesa Verde. Mesa Verde means green table in the Spanish language. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops and sometimes built on cliff recesses.       Finally, I'm going to talk about the Pavlopetri. People have secrets passed on that the Pavlopetri are from Atlantis. Atlantis is supposed to be sunken from many, many years ago. It's located in the waters of southern Greece. It is 30,000 square meters ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. It was descended from 1000 BC.       Well, I hope you enjoyed my little article. I hoped I somewhat inspired you to look up these places. And I hope your interested in the whole archaeologist thing. I actually would have a lot of fun being an archaeologist when I grow up. Maybe that's what I'll be!

Item_Response: A lot of people question why history is so important. It happened, it's in the past, let's move on. But, really, history is extremely important to our future. The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important because it shows us how ancient civilizations used to be.   From the Incas, we have learned how they kept their records, with knotted string. These knots of string were called quipus. Though, not many can read the colored string, we know that they were used to keep the calender and keep count of livestock. We have learned that many artifacts that have been found were buried with the deceased, these have provided the best idea of the life in Peru before and during the Inca rule. We have also learned how many of them died, due to preservation in the icy Andes. The bodies of the Inca were preserved in caves in cliff faces mainly, so looters could not get to them. The mountains, with their icy cold weather, can act as a freezer, leaving the bodies of the Inca in such good shape that experts may use modern medical scanning.   From the Puebloans, we have found how they lived in places called pithouses, a living room suck a few feet in the ground with four corner timbers supporting the roof. Later, around A.D. 750, the Puebloans began constructing houses above ground. The houses were built wall to wall in long, curving rows, often with a couple pithouses out front. The walls of the houses/buildings are known as the finest built in Mesa Verde because of the straight edges of the carefully shaped stones. For a time, the Puebloans were known as the Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. Later on, pottery became more popular and baskets made a decline in quality. Mesa Verde had two major population shifts, one between A.D. 1100, and A.D. 1300, the other in A.D. 1200. The latter caused people to move back into cliff alcoves, though the sure reason is unknown.   The discoveries of the Pavlopetri are also significant. Evidence has been found on the 'oldest submerged town in the world,' and it's still the most well preserved. This town is expected to be the home of an elite, which raises the status of it exponentially. The submerged 'frozen moment of the past' has baffled archaeologists with how much information has been preserved. Only just recently have we been able to survey the ruins of the ancient city. Ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age suggests the settlement was occupied around 5,000 years ago. Many discoveries offer information about when the settlement was above water, and tells of possible other groups, for example, the Mycenaean Society. Not only is this underwater city an intrest because it reveals how people lived back then but it also intrigues natural scientists because the waters around it are so shallow. Also fascinating, this area predates Plato's writing of the sunken continent Atlantis.   In conclusion, all of these discoveries are extrememly important by telling us of the past. By learning from the past, people can predict more about the future. All of these ancient civilizations failed in some shape or form and we could avoid these same mistakes by studying them.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations                  Why is it so important to learn about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri? It is important to learn about all of the ancient civilizations because when we learn more about the ancient civilization we can understand more about how we came to be or how they lived.                  When we find out more about about how the people of the ancient time lived we can put the pieces together so to speak and discover how our ancestors came to be and how the minds of people changed. In source one the Ancient Inca used string to record days and any kind of counting. The string was knotted to count days or to just keep track of counting for math. So in this ancient civilization math grew and prospered.                   In source number two archaeologists discovered buildings called Pithouses. Pithouses featured a living room, some might have contained storage bins or pits. The sipapu was a hole for a way to the underworld, from which people had once come from. Later on a Kivas was built, the Kivas was a ceremonial room which was built as underground chambers that later where churches.Ancient Puebloans might have practiced healing rights or to pray for rain, luck in hunting, or for a good crop. The religion and buildings where what prospered.                   In source three the thing that prospered was findings that helped rebuild a city. The ancient Greek city that had submerged beneath the Atlantic Ocean. The city is said to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. The city was well kept by shifting sands, and the protected bay help archaeologists find buildings and roads and all kinds of structure along with many shards of pottery. The site had 'potential insights into the working of the Mycenaean society.' 'It is significant because as a submerged site it was never reoccupied.' So the city was never reoccupied was sea life or any life at all. Marine geologists still do not know how the city sank. Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going.'                     In this passage I have explained what prospered in different ancient times and how each of the civilizations prospered. But also how the civilizations affected us or our time.Each time before our own has a story and that story can be lost but could also be found. History affects us even today, what ever happened long ago still has effect today.

Item_Response: Many poeple don't take any interest in history, because they don't see how important it is, but I do. If it wouldn't be for the artifacts found from people many years ago, we probaby wouldn't know as much as we know now. Artifacts from the past life, tell us how people lived. Scientists studied artifacts found, for a very long time to learn as much as they could about it. We've learned about how people hunted, and lived just from buildings, clothes, bowls, and even journals found. Journals have told us stories about peoples lives and stuff they made, but sometimes it was in a language that nobody could understand. We have learned a lot more about the alphabet and who has started many things like pottery, bows, and arrows. If it wasn't for the people before, leaving their stuff beind, we wouldn't know anything about history and there would most likely be a lot more world problems. There were artifacts from farming left behind, that probably taught more and more people how to farm. Legends were passed on, which makes you wonder what is true, ad what is added on everytime someone tells the legend. People from the past have taught scientists many things and caused many mysteries that may never be figured out, but they're all very important. I believe that just knowing about history and civiliazations is just a good thing to know about.

Item_Response: I beleive that these discoveries were important. Why do I say this? well without the discovery of these civilizations there would be a huge gap in history. The discoveries may have filled in those gaps of time. These civilizations helped us understand more about them. They could also possibaly help us learn more for future discoveries.        The Inca lived High in the mountains and prosbered. They lived so high in the Andes that the bodies could be preserved by the cold conditions, and looters could not reach the bodies so the bodies were undisturbed. Most of the Inca civilization was left undisterebed and that means that todays archaeologists could observe how the people lived. This means that they can learn about past history and things created to help every day live.   The Puebloans also showed us how they lived. The information and objects they left behind showed us a lot about them. By the information given from the article 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World' we know that the were nomadic people. The were nomadic for a little bit, but then they were trying a more settled way of life. They built Pithouses to support them selfs in their enviroment, these Pithouses later became Kivas. So without the Puebloans Kivas would never have been made. They learned how to make pottery and soon made weapons that we all know today such as bows and arrows.        These are reasons why the discovery of these civilizations were important. These civilizations helped with todays tools and weapons. They also help identify different ways to look at how people prosbered and lived.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca are important because there are a lot of old stories they left written down for the European who arrived in 1532. The Inca's left many ancient artifacts such as stone, pottery, gold, or silver that last a long time even if they been buried. Archeologist have found bodies in the icy Andes that are in good state that they can learn how the people lived, and how they died. Incas left many interesting items for archeologist like art, agriculture, government, transportation, and the way they lived this tells you on what they had, and how there culture may of been. The Incas made a quip's that records a calendar to keep count of there livestock no one really uses one today since no one may know what the knots mean.Though it seems like it could be a regular calendar only without the livestock and colorful strings.   The discoveries that the Puebloans made were on how they made things or buit them. Puebloans built houses out of mud and poles that were up against each other. Later on by A.D. one thousand people started to advance on how they built there houses. They used stone masonry, and wall that were thick, double coursed stone that were often up to two or three stories high. Though something changed in A.D. twelve hundred people started to move back into the cliffs that sheltered their ancestors before. We don't know why they moved for any reason but it did make the Mesa Verde most famous.

Item_Response: Many discoveries are very important but discoveries about the human culture are the best because nobody in the world knows all of the things that have happened to us. In this article will be information on three very important human civilizations; the Inca, the Puebloans, and what many think could have been what inspired Homer to create his lost city of Atlantis.          One of the three ancient civilizations is the Inca. The Inca were important because they were a giant civilization that according to the article 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past' by Beth Gruber on paragraph 2 'For nearly a hundred years (1438-1532) Ruled a South American empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome'. The end of the Inca empire is easy to date because the Spaniards killed the last Inca king but the beginnings are harder to date. In that time period the Inca lived high in the Andes so many of the artifacts are well preserved and we can learn many things from them.          Another ancient civilization were the Ancestral Puebloans who left great reminders of their civilization in Mesa Verde. The Puebloans started out in little cliff alcoves but little by little they started developing pithouses that changed to kivas eventually. The Ancestral Puebloans were skilled basket makers and created great houses on the Mesa Verde. At about A.D. 1200, for reasons unknown, the people moved to the cliff alcoves that had sheltered their ancestors before.          The lost city of Atlantis may be fake but one thing we know for sure is that it could be based off of a real city that sunk. The city Pavlopetri has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 B.C. and is off of the coast of southern Peloponnese. The city is believed to have sunken at about 1000 B.C. and was never reoccupied so the houses and everything else is frozen at that time.          All of these societies are important because they all have something that they can contribute to our world history. these cities can show us what life was like back then and can help us understand the world around us.

Item_Response: I think the discoveries about ancient Inca and Mesa Verde are very important. I think that because we don't know much about their civilizations. The artifacts help us know: how they lived, what they hunted/ate,and maybe how they died.       By finding the Inca and Mesa Verde civilizations we can learn where they lived,and how their houses were built. The artifacts found help us greatly to learn about the people of Mesa Verde, or the life of the Inca. That is why the artifacts found in the ancient ruins of the Inca and Mesa Verde are important.       Some of the major artifacts we have found about the Inca are: Textiles and clothing, and knots in string for counting livestock or used as calenders.       Some stuff we found in the Mesa Verde places are: The baskets that made them known as 'basket weavers', pottery, bow and arrow, and the atlatl (spear thrower).       Another ancient civilization is the Ancestral Puebloans or 'Cliff Dwellers'. They left no written records and much that was important to their lives has perished. We have however found their structures that have helped us learn about their lives.       Kivas were the ancient Puebloans ceremonial rooms or churches, they used them to:   pray for rain, used them for healings, Prayed for luck in hunting, or a good crop. These structures help us know a little about their daily life.       The artifacts we find are very important in learning about the Inca, Mesa Verde, and Puebloans are the only things we can use to learn about them. These people left no written records, so how else are we to learn about them? The artifacts they left behind are all we have in learning about them.

Item_Response: Why Ancient Civilization is so Important    By Emily Irvine        Ancient Civilizations are very important to us because they're the base of what we know now. They created our language and created our religion. Without ancient civilizations we might be the ones to have to create everything. I don't even know if we'd be living had it not been for ancient civilizations. In this article I'm going to be talking about 3 important ancient civilizations: the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.        Would you ever like to live on a mountain with a very cold climate? I didn't think so, but the Inca thought differently. The Inca lived in the mountains of the Andes, and that's how we know so much about them. The freezing weather has preserved artifacts and even bodies really well- so well that we can use modern medical scanners to learn how the people died or even how they lived. Some of what we know, though, has come from stories passed from generation to generation. Since they didn't have any archives or even an alphabet for that matter, historians don't really know much about their civilization except for what's in stories and what the artifacts show.        The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. But, now, nobody knows the Inca language so nobody knows what the knot means and nobody can read the stories tied into the colorful strings. Ince artifacts might be objects made from stone, gold, or silver. Some archaeologists have found artifacts in the ruins of buildings but, others were found buried in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife. That is important because it gives historians an insight on their religion, and what kind of lives the Inca might have lived to be able to make things out of gold and silver.        The Puebloans of Mesa Verde, were very good at basketmaking. They also replaced hunting and gathering with farming. This is very important because it tells us a little bit about how they lived, or what their lives were like. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops. Puebloans also learned to make pottery and they acquired the bow and arrow, which was a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower. That is important because it shows that they don't spread out, and they were all just one big heard of people- they were nomadic afterall. Some historians might also find their pithouses important, because their was a hole for passage to the underworld called that 'sipapu.' That gives insight on their religion and on, once again, how they lived.        The findings of the Pavlopetri are very important. Geologists have found a megaron, which is a monumental strucure with a large rectangular hall, which means that the town might have been used by an elite. That tells us that the people who lived their were probably high status or were rich in some way. Geologists have found ceramics which dated back to the end of the stone age, and from that we can learn in what era these people lived.  That gives us an idea of how their life was like or how they lived.

Item_Response: The discoveries that archaeologists have made about the Inca, the Pueblians, and the Pavlopetri are so important because if they haven't made their discoveries we wouldn't be where we are today. The ancient civilization helped improve on how we live, starting with where is the right place to build your house. You couldn't just make a house where ever you want. You have to have the right level and far enough from water. if your hows was too close to the water your house would be flooded every time it rain. Us today didn't discover that. People in the ancient civilization discovered that. The Inca lived high in the Andes and worshiped some mountain peaks. Most of their sites are in remote high places. The Inca lived in high places because it was harder for enemies to get to their houses and attack their families.   On the other hand, the Pueblians were an amazing discovery. The Puebloans learned to make pottery and the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting than a spear. The Puebloans made a house called the pithouses. The pithouses, people lived in pithouses from A.D. 550 to A.D 750. The living room sunk a few feet in the ground. Four corner timbers supported the roof. There was a fire pit had an air deflector. The people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and -adobe construction to skillful stone. The walls were thick, double-coursed stone often rose two or three stores high and were joined together into units of 50 rooms or more. Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300, the population may have reached several thousands. ABout A.D. 1200, another major population came, and people begin to move back into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors centuries before. Archarologists still don't know why they moved, they thing it could of been for defense; or it was for religious or pshychological reasons; perhaps alcoves offered better protection from the elements.

A lot of people would like to find out who their ancesctors are, without the discoveries found about the Pueabloans, many of today's Puebloans wouldn't know why they live where they do, how their ancesctors lived, or how to preserve many of the things they did, such as being able to construct ' skillful stone masonry', and their pithouses.

Item_Response: The article talks about Ancient Civilizations and how archeologists began to find new things about them by searching from high mountains to going under water. Archeologists wanted to know more about them and find how they died, how they lived, and even how their system worked. They searched in various places and by different ways. They mainly looked for things from the Ancient Incas, Ancestral Puebloans, and the Lost Greece City.        The Ancient Incas were the a bit different then the other civilizations. For example, they didn't have a written language , they lived high in the mountains , and used colorful knots to keep track of dates. Bodies of the Incas were also found in large ice caps because of the weather. Archeologists used modern scanning equipment to learn how they died. In addition , bodies were not the only things found, they have gathered some of Incas textiles and clothing that have survived extremely well.        On the other hand Ancesternal Publoans were from Mesa Verde 'green table' and lived in a deserted area. Also , they found that they have had traditions and had been accumalating many different skills. They also lived about 1,400 years ago. Their homes were pithouses and they usually began to do agriculture.         Lastly, the Greeks, gathering things to know about the greeks is different. The reaserchers have to go under the sea to look for different things. They have found ceramics that date back to the stone ages. Also, without a doubt it is the oldest submerged town in the world. Sadly, we now know that their is no such thing as Atlantis but the great myth still holds. In conclution, The three civilizations greately differ but archeologists and many people have managed to find different ways to look back into the past and see how they lived.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopeti are important because it shows you how people in the anciant times used to live. The Inca did not have an actual way of writing, they would make knots in colored strings called quipus to keep count of the livestock. Archeologist are able to know what years the Inca ruled because they were able to find information such as religion, art, transportationa, and other things too. Understanding the language of the Inca was difficult becasue the Spaniards didn't understand the language very well, which made it hard for the archeologist to know what it ment. Materials such as clothing and textiles helped archeologist know what type of clothes they would wear. The weather helped to preserve many of these objects. In mountains, bodies were found in well shape because caves worked like freezers that kept everything as it is. Any object that archeologists would find helped to find out any information about the Incas.                 For instance, Puebloans were the first to settle in Mesa Verde. The discoveries that archeologist found in Mesa Verde are important because it shows how things used to work out back in time. Pithouses were the places were the people lived. Pithouses consisted of  a living room sunk a few feet  in the ground, four corner timbers to support a roof, a firepit, and a sipapu that was a passage to the underworld. Kivas were Hopi word for ceremonial room. Kivas were gathering places and sometimes also places to weave. Fires were built in the summer were mainly for cooking. Cliff dwellers left no written records so it was a little difficult to find a lot of things.                 Pavlopetri was explored by  an Anglo-Greek team of archeologist. It is 30,000 square meters and it was consumed around 1000 BC. Archeologists were able to find buildings which was a way of knowing how and what way they lived. The bulidings helped to find out the stucture of how they would build their buildings. Marine geologist are still tring to figure out wht the town sank. Some reasons archeologist thought that the town sanl was because of the cange in sea level, earthquakes, and tsunamies. Under thet sea there are many things that are yet to be found,but archeologists are tring there best t try and figure out why the towns, cities fell.
