Item_Response: This world is ancient, more so then human records can tell us about.  As such, several civilizations have existed that now are gone.  These civilizations had existed mostly without contact from other groups of people.  The rediscovery of these unfamiliar tribes had shaken the way that scientists think about the past.  The discoveries made about the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have shown us the past itself.   From studying the Inca, archeologists have learned that they lived in different climates, from the desert to the jungle or mountains.  Scientists have found out that Incan tribes kept records with string, as they had no alphabet.  The archeologists who have studied the Inca have found out the Spanish conquerors killed the last king of the Inca's, leading to the destruction of the empire.  To the north of the Inca, the Puebloans had lived for nearly as long, and for hundreds of years before North America was colonized by Europe.   The discovery that the Puebloans had been living in the side of a cliff had shown scientists how people without the 'modern' knowledge had lived.  Based on what was left in the cliff dwellings, archeologists have made several discoveries.  One is that they both hunted farmed for their food.  The pottery depicted the everyday life ofthe Puebloan.  One last discovery was that the Puebloans moved several times in their history.  One century, they lived in undergound house, the next was above ground, a few centuries later they lived in a cliff.  The next civiliation has had a major relocation, more so then the Puebloans.   The discovery was a huge discovery for underwater explorers.  This sunken Greek town has given light to how the culture lived before there was knowledge of the Greece known today.  Pieces of pottery, tons of building and more have caught the eye of many explorers.  Scientists believe that a large earthquake or tsunami sunk and/or flooded the city.  The discovery of this city has gotten scientists thinking of cenarios of what happened.  Hopefully scientists will continue to explore and discover the past.

Item_Response: More then ever before, archaeologist have been discovering artifacts from several different civilizations. Three prominent civilizations that archaeologist have been collecting information about, are the Incas, the Puebloans and the Pavlopetri.  These discoveries made about the civilizatons, are important because they help archaeologist learn more about the past world.            Incan artifacts perserve really well, thanks to the freezing temperatures in which they were buried in. 'Some Inca textiles and clothing have also survived remarkably well.' (Source 1) Through these clothes we can see what the climates of the past were. We can also see when certain kinds of materials were discovered. ' As such it represents a frozen moment of the past.' ( Source 3). All of these artifacts help them. Since thee Incans lived up high in the Andes, some bodies have been perserved. these bodies can help them know how they lived. (Source1 ) ' ...are evidence of a society that, over centuries, accumulated skills and traditions and passed them on from generation to generation' ( Source 2) When archaeologist found puebloans houses, they compared them and found that the houses were increasing in stability. through this we can see how skills were passed on.            As  you can see, these ancient artifacts have taught us alot about the people who handled them and the they lived in.  We can learn about how they lived, the climate, and much more.

Item_Response: In this essay I am going to talk about ancient civilizations and how important they are to humanity. The Inca, the puebloans, and the pavlopetri. I believe that the ancient civilizations were important because it helped explain to humanity how life and the culture was back the in the past.         The Inca were a proud civilization and lived in harsh climates in the mountains. Many of its artifacts have been found high in the andeas mountains where the incas used to live. Matierials such as gold and silver were looted by grave theifs. the last inca king was killed and the inca civilization was extinct.         The Puebloans were called Anasazi. They were modern descendents now call ancestral. They were known for basket making and very skilled. They lived in small villages and small clusters of people. Puebloans were hunter gatherer societies and their advancements in life taught them how to make bows and arrows and pottery.          The Pavlopetri were Greeks who lived in this great city that was believed to sink to the bottom of the coast of was is southern greece. The city was near Neapolis and was very wealthy. The seabed of the ocean was scatterd with pottery and graves.           In conclusion the Ancient civilizations helped us make our techonological advancements.

Item_Response: The discoveries the puebloans,and the pavlopetri made are so inportant because the ancient inca of peru had know formal alphabet or system of writing so they made knots in colored strings called quipus. present day no one knows what they mean.Among the most important things to learn about a civilization are were it comes from and what happened to it. the fall of the inca is easy to date because the spaniards murdered the last inca king in 1532 and took over the empire. the place were they lived had long been inhabited by different peoples.      About 1,400 years ago long before europeans explored north america,a group of people living in the four corners region chose mesa verde for their home.For more then 700 years they and their descendants lived and flourished here, eventually building elaborate stone communities in theltered alcoves of the canyon walls. then, in the late A.D 1200s, in the span of a generation or two, they left thir homes and moved away.      the pavlopia is a sunkin settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented,experts say.   there is now doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' said Dr jon Henderson, associate professor of under water archaelogy at the university of nottingham. 'It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of classical greece.

Item_Response: Have you ever wondered why we learn stuff about our history? We learn history for many different reasons. One of the main reasons is to learn what our ancestor did and use it in our daily lives. Some ancient civilizations that has made an impact in our lives are the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. We learn what they have done and try to fix their way of living into our lives. During the time we try to discover these civilizations, we also need to edit what we do to handle the situation. Discoveries like these can help us determine our understanding and thinking of our ancestors.       Our ancestors have always had an reason in order to do something. For example, the Inca never really had a formal alphabet or system of writing, but instead they used knots to keep track of stuff. And still, they could run a big empire. But why knots? They could have used anything else but they chose knots as their communication. Also, how did they ever become a big empire without the use of words. If archaeologist had known the reason why our ancestors did this, we can use it to also have a big strong community or country. Another example are the Puebolans in Mesa Verde. They left for a strange reason in 1300 A.D. There are many theories why they left, like a drought and crop failures; but they have already survived many droughts. Maybe the soil depleted and they had to leave. Whatever the reason we can still learn from their mistake. If the soil had depleted, we can tell scientists to find ways for the soil we have now not to deplete too. We can prepare for a drought and crop failures. There is so many things to learn about our ancestors, but we can never learn it completely. Like for the discovery of the Pavlopetri. Though they made huge discoveries, archaeologists still haven't discovered even 1% of the ocean floor. Because of this, people are more eager to discover more about our world. To do that they need the technology. We now have scuba divers and submarine to explore the vast ocean. So as the demand for new discoveries increase, our technology will also dramatically increase. So curiosity has driven our world forward.       For now, we literally don't know anything about our ancestors. We can only guess what they did.  So, we need the technology so we can be most accurate as we can be in our theories. The discoveries we make can ultimately determines what our society will be like. If we had not even bothered in finding out about our ancestors, we wouldn't know a lot of our basic methods until we have to find the solution ourselves. So why are our discoveries of ancient civilization so important? It is because we can learn from them and use them in our daily life.

Item_Response: History teaches us about why things are the way they are. Almost every history section you learn about you can make connections with your own life. That's what makes history so exiting!       The Inca is a well known ancient civilization. They are known for living in the harsh climate of the Andes. But unfotaintly we don't know much about this tribe. Mostly because when white settlers came there the killed their whole tribe. Most things we know about them is though the word of mouth. Which is always bended and stretched. But recently we discovered many things about the Inca. The Inca ran a whole tribe ran by knots in colorful stings. That is how they counted and kept track of everything. They also praised and looked to the mountain peaks as a religious symbol. For important rulers they made graves and buried them high in the mountains. This makes it hard for grave robbers to reach and destroy.       The Peubloans lived in the Mesa Verde and made their lives there. They were known as Basket makers, because of their skill at the craft. They lived in Pithouses in crowed villages on the top of mesas. The bow and arrow was their main weapon and hunted skillfully with. The Peubloans were a very strong tribe that their story will live on.       Finlay the Pavlopetri. The lost city of Atlantis is a myth that many people know about. But its just a myth, right? Well maybe not. Recently explorers found a underwater city off the coast of Greece. With stone walk ways, churches, pots, and more maybe they really did find a lost city. They say that a high tide or a tinimi submerged the city under. This is a big find and  I'm sure this isn't it.       All this history and we are just scratching the surface. In the future we will lear more and more about the Earth's history. It's very extincting learning about all this.

Archieologists still discovered  many things about the Incans way of life because all of their things were so well preserved. Everyday textiles, clothes and potery. Item_Response: The Incas, Puebloans, and Pavelopetri are all very different culteres. Archeologists have had to find many clues and peices of materials to determine how they lived. The Incas lived in pithouses and kivas, that were found in peices by archeologists who determined what they looked like. The Puebloans lived in the cliffs and later evidence was found that they lived in villages before. Paveloptri civilizations were sunken underwater and rubble and fragments of buildings were found but archeologists do not yet know why it was sunken. All of this information was given by materials found by archeologists and studied to determine how theese civilizations lived.       The Incas were a very sophisticated civilization. The used colored rope to tell time, as calacalanders, and as a language of history.  Other Europeans wrote about theese peoples stories and some ways of living in diaries. Most of our knowledge of the Incas is from artifacts. The artifact that are most common are stone, pottery, gold, and silver, sometimes found in graves buries whith the dead for afterlife.  Some clothing has survived dampness in the dry desserts of Peru. Also, archeologists have uncovered frozen, well preserved bodies in the Andes mountains and can use medical equiptment to learn how they died.       Puebloans are a little different. They built homes in pits called pithouses, that later became kivas. Their ways of living were not entirely based on hunting at first, but later they used bows and arrows. They also used a spear called a atlatl. Most of their land was cleared for crops. Later, theese people built buildings made of stone with up to fifty rooms. MOst archeologist cannot figure out why but later theese people moved to the cliffs and later left there to new homes elsewhere,       Pavelopetri civilization was sunken in water. Archeologists do not know why. But with new technology they can explore this civilization. Rubble Shows where buildings were built and there is a monumental structure. Ceramics were found from the stone age and up to 5,000 years back. This civilization is a start of underwater discoveries of lost cities.       The Incas, Puebloans, and Pavelopetri are all very different culteres. Archeologists have had to find many clues and peices of materials to determine how they lived. The Incas lived in pithouses and kivas, that were found in peices by archeologists who determined what they looked like. The Puebloans lived in the cliffs and later evidence was found that they lived in villages before. Theese civilizations have been clearly drawn out in explanations by archeologists and sceintists for us to understand what life was before us.

Item_Response: Many civilizations and all the walks of life has been introduced into our world as early as 550 A.D.           The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about that time. Their main craft was as basket makers. They started of nomadic, but as they grew and their culture matured they begin to lead a more settled life. A lot of  other things changed also including their means to get food. Farming replaced hunting and gathers their main source. They learned to make pottery and the bow an arrow replaced their signature tool of a spear thrower to hunt the atlatl. Most of their houses and living areas were found in cliff recesses, but sometimees mesa tops clustered with small pint house villages.       In times like these they lived a fairly prosperous and decent life as basket makers. Their population multiplied and their living resources expanded. They began building houses above ground with supported upright walls made out of poles and mud. the houses were built right next to each other. From here on these people are known as puebloans, a Spanish word meaning'village dwellers.'       As with and group or walk of like the only thing left to do was to succeed in more growth. Between A.D. 1100 and 1300 which was known as ' The Classic Period' the population increases to the thousands, and a more advanced home was created. It consisted of compact villages of many room, with the kivas built inside the enclosing walls instead of out in the open. The stone walls of the large pueblos are  regarded as some of the finest.       since the beginning of times we as a people have known what to do in order  to survive , what to in order for our world to become the great one that it is today. We have done nothing more than what we set out to do in ways that is good and others that are not. All we must do, out common goal as a people is to grow and prosper in life.

Item_Response: There have been many historical discoveries made in the ruins and areas of the acient Inca, Puebloans, and Greek. They have made dicoveries such as a system using rope to tell of history and dates, housing used by ancient civilizations, and even a lost city. These discoveries have been made by archaeologists traveling the world to find the artifacts needed.   While exploring the area where the ancient Inca lived, archaeologists discovered some amazing things. They discovered that since the Inca did not have a language or writing system, they made knots in colored strings to keep a count on livestock. The Inca also left behind clues as to how they lived. Textiles and clothing survived by being perserved in dry deserts and the cold mountains of the Andes. Even though some artifacts have been stolen by treasure hunters or looters, archaeologists still managed to find these clues to the ancient Inca.   The ancient Puebloans lived 1,400 years ago. They were mainly basketmakers. They lived in structures called pithouses. These structures had four corner timbers that supported the roof. They eventually advanced to skillful stone masonry instead of pole-and-adobe construction.   There have always been many cities n Greece, but when archaeologists dove under the surface of the water, they found something that no one had ever seen before. They discovered a lost city! This lost city was probably the exact city that inspired the Atlantis stories that people tell over and over again. The site of the city is about 30,000 square meters. It is located off the southern Peloponnese. Archaeologists believe it was consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Marine archaeologists had to find help in technology to survey the city. This may be a huge discovery, but there is still about 99% of the ocean floor to explore.   Archaeologists traveling the world have found so many discoveries. They travel from the tips of the Andes to the bottom of the ocean floor. The clues that these civilizations left behind are going to be giving us glimpses into the past for years to come.

Item_Response: I am going to explain to you why Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important. There were many civilizations that were formed thousands of years ago. So I am gonna tell you how important they are and how they survived.          The first reason why Inca's are so important because they have a lot of legends left behind.The Inca's were very working people; they would built stuff, make stuff and were very good at some stuff and not a lot of other people could do. The Inca lives high in the Andes and they might of owned one of the mountain peaks.Europeans were the first people to discover them. The Europeans arrived in the empire in 1532. They described the Inca's in letters and diaries.          The second reason why Puebloans are important because they had an interesting life.   Archeologists called these people Anasazi, it means the 'ancient enemies'. But we all call them Ancestral Puebloans because of their modern descendants. They first settled in Mesa Verde; and they are known as basket makers because of their skills at the craft. Farming was replaced for hunting and gathering as their main live hood. They lived in small villages, usually would built stuff. Puebloans use to built their houses under ground and from there on theses people were known as Puebloans, which means 'village dwellers'.         The last reason why Pavlopetri are important is because there were a lot of secrets left and you would wanna know how those secrets inspired many people. Secrets under water were found; dates back from 5,000 years ago. Archaeologists found many stuff from the past. Marine geologists have been working out there to know why the settlement sank. This was the first time a city has sunken and has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical story of the sunken continent of Atlantis.         Now you know why the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important. As you can tell they had a ruff life and it wasn't easy. All of these places are still important specially to the people that had family members or have lived there before.

But on this article I've learned about things they encounter before they get what they want. I also learned about the past.        On the article, 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secret of the Past' that ancient Inca of peru had no formanl alphabet or systemk of writing. They did not leave us archives for historians to study. Some Inca textiles and clothing have also survived remarkably well. Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness, but these have been preserved in the dry deserts of Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes. Archaeologists who study sites keep careful records. They write down and photgraph any artifacts they find, and note the exact position in which they find them. they need to learn as much information as they can from every single piece of evidence.        On the second article, 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World,' the discover that about 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde abput A.D. 550. However, by A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole and adobe construction to skilful stone masonry.        The last artuicle was 'Lost Greek City that may have Inspired Atlantis Myth Gives Up Secrets,' the secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths is the fable of Atlantis. The site, which straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC.        These articles have been proof that a lot of archaeologist have encounter a lot of problems but they didn't stop to find all they want. They must have been suffer but they put their heads up and continue to finish what they started.

Item_Response: Every discovery is important. It allows us to see how life used to be. It shows us where we came from. The Inca, Puebloans, and the Palvopetri discoveries were no exception. They were also important discoveries.           Discovering the Incas was a very important discovery. The Incas lived in Peru. They had a very big empire. This was an important discovery because it tells us about how life in Peru used to be. It also gives us ideas about why some of the traditions in Peru are like that. The other reason that it was an important discovery is that it tells us that sometimes the simplest things can be used to tell are story. We see this because the Incas kept all of there records by tying knots.           The discovery of the Puebloans was very important. They lived in Mesa Verde. They were good at making baskets. They really started the idea of settling. They had better weapons like spears. They started to grow there own food. They built pithoses and Kivas. They built there towns on the sides of cliffs. These were new ideas to most people.           The most important discovery was the Palvoperti discovery. Polvoperti was a town that was sunken in Greece. This discovery was very important. It sparked the myth of Atlantis, the sunken city. It was sunken due to change in the sand. Everything was well preserved. Looking at the items found we could tell what Greece was like.           All discoveries are important. We can tell are past.  We can look at how life was. Discoveries can even sometimes spark myths. Every discovery can teach us something new.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and the lost city of Atlantis are all places that archeologists hunt for clues. Here they examine artifacts and/or ruins to find out how ancient civilizations lived.       The Inca was a Native American tribe that resided in the Andes mountains in South America. Archeologists have asked people with Inca blood to tell stories about their traditions. By doing this, they have learned a lot about the Inca's ways. Second, archeologists have examined ancient artifacts and belongings. This suggests that they can learn about what the Indians used as tools. Finally, archeologists use satellite imaging to look at ancient ruins. Like the Inca, the puebloans have some archeologists of their own.       The Puebloans lived in the Southwest in places called cliff dwellings. Cowboys first stumbled upon these ruins  in the late 19th century. The puebloans had ladders to reach their homes, which held a couple thousand residents. Pottery was also beautiful, with lots of drawings and decorative designs. The homes also had chimneys and air vents, which were very advanced at the time. In the next paragraph, archeologists may be on the brink of uncovering Atlantis.       Atlantis is a lost Greek city buried beneath the water. Taken by the sea in 1,000 BCE by an earthquake or tsunami, it is the oldest lost city in the ocean.  Archeologists flocked to the area when ruins were found by an oceanographer making depth charts. The tides, which caused sand to shift, revealed many artifacts and city ruins. There was even pottery which dated from 5000 BCE, a lot earlier than the archeologists thought. Today, the exploration is still going on, and there is a lot more to uncover.       The Inca, Puebloans, and Atlantis all keep archeologists busy. Whether it's exploring underwater temples, looking at graves, or exploring homes in cliffs, archeologists are digging more clues every day!

Item_Response: Clues left behind by the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life.Without anyone who experienced these ancient civilizations, understanding them is like solving a mystery. However clues left behind allow archaeologist and others piece together details of ancient life.           Some of what we know about the Inca comes from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation. We know some of the old stories because they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. They described the Inca in letters and diaries. The rest of the knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts, or objects that they left behind, and from sites where artifacts are found. Inca artifacts include objects made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Some Inca textiles and clothing have also survived remarkably well. Archaeologists who study these sites keep careful records. They write down and photograph and artifacts they find, and note the exact position in which they find them. Sometimes archeology confirms historical record, only making fact, more true.           About 1,400 years ago, the Puebloans chose Mesa Verde as their home. They flourished here, and eventually built elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. Then, in the late A.D. 1200s, they left their homes and moved away. Puebloans are known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower. Archaeologists and others have been able identify all these attributes due to artifacts left behind and preserved.           About 5,000 years ago, a group of people know as the Pavlopetri strove. They lived in an area of about 30,000 square meters in southern Peloponnese. Today that sight has been found underwater, and has allowed marine geologists to study the ancient civilization.           Discoveries about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important because it has allowed people to understand how civilization has evolved. Civilization started small, but grew and grew until what it is today. These ancient civilizations show that and tell a tale of how they lived.

Without them, we probably wouldn't have an alphabet, or a money system, or be able to communicate. They lived in pit houses, and came up with the bow and arrow, a much more efficient way of hunting thank the atlatl, a spear thrower. Some lived in cliff dwellings, and it was super cold. So, to keep warm, they lit fires in their places, in return, making the walls blacken with smoke.       The lost city of Atlantis.... There is tons of stuff down there! Item_Response: Ancient Civilizations           The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavolpetri are all ancient civilizations that   have helped shape our world today. They have given us insight on how certain myths and legends came to be, and they introduced many innovative inventions and customs into our world.       Every child has been told myths and legends before. Hercules, David and Goliath,    and another important one is the 'Lost City of Atlantis'! All these stories must come from somewhere and a team of Archeologists and Divers think they have uncovered the origin of this story. Explored by an Anglo-Greek team known as Pavlopetri, the sunken settlement is assumed to be dated back about 5000 years ago. in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts say. Dr Jon Henderson claims, 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' whom is associate professor of underwater archaeology at the University of Nottingham. 'It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, which is odd because that dates back long before the illustrious days of classical Greece. The site straddles 30,000 square meters on the ocean floor just off the southern Peloponnese, archaeologists assume that the town was submerged around 1000 BC. It was not until this year that researchers have been able to study the town despite it being discovered some 40 years ago simply by chance by an Oceanographer.

Item_Response: Archaeologists have spent centuries trying to figure out lost civilizations. How they were formed, what it was like to live there. But one of the main questions is: What happened to it? The Incas, the Ancestral Puebloans, and the city of Atlantis (Pavlopetri) are a few of the lost civilizations that have yet to be fully discovered. The discoveries about the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important.            The discoveries of these civilizations are important because it increases our knowledge of ancient history. The Incas where a civilization in Peru. They had no alphabet or system of writing, and they used strings to keep records. No one today knows what the knots mean, so we do not know what really happened. But, we do have clues. There is history passed down orally from generation to generation, and there are stories written down by the Europeans. The rest of our knowledge comes from artifacts, such as objects made of stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Inca textile and clothing has been preserved because of the deserts in Peru. These clues can help us compare the Spaniards' accounts of the Inca.            The discoveries of these civilizations are very important. Archaeologists have aqquired artifacts and information about these settlements, and are learning more and more about it everyday. There are some issues when it comes to searching for clues, like people stealing artifacts, weather conditions, and even geopgraphical conditions. In the future, we will probably discover more and more lost civilizations and will discover more and more about them.

Item_Response: The reason why the discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans,   and the Pavlopetri are so important is because learning about the history/legends about them can tell us, people, answers about how Earth was originally made.        The discoveries of the Inca's are important because they let us know about how they keep track of everything and how early inventions was made. They used knots in colored strings called Quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The Inca's used stone, pottery, gold, or silver to make artifacts. Archaeologists had been told about the life before and during Inca rule by the different artifacts that they all found.In the first source I read called 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secret of the Past' it states that it's important to know the discoveries of the Inca's because we should know about how a civilization formed and what happened to it.        The discoveries of the Puebloans that I read about are also important to know about because we should learn about how they lived and how difficult things were back then. The source that I read about the Puebloans stated that the Puebloans lived in hand-made homes called Pithouses which was later made into Kivas. Kivas are named by a Hopi word meaning Ceremonial Room. Underground chambers was turned into churches. Puebloans used Kivas for healing rites or to pray for rain, luck in hunting, or a good crop. The sipapu hole would allow them to go to the underworld. They mostly built sandstones as big as a loaf of bread to make a building. Fires would burn throughout the village during winter, leaving the Puebloans suffering in the cold. The way Puebloans lived was terrible compared to the present day.        It is important to know about the Pavlopetri because it is good to know about how cites are lost at sea. The city that I read about was the city of 'Atlantis'. The myth was sort of true but wasn't exactly accurate. The settlement sank by possible earthquakes and tsunamis. Because of the shifting sand, the remains of the city was roaming around the sea which sort of makes it harder for archaeologists. The city of Atlantis are yet to be fully discovered.        In conclusion, the discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri because we should know about how the ancient people back in the days lived and how we are trying to find answers about lost things. So basically, the history of the past is very important to present day.

Item_Response: There have been many discoveries about ancient civilizations. There were Incans, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri. We need to discover things about them because they can show us things that are bad in history. We don't want to make the same mistakes.           Firstly, the Incas tried to fight people with better technology. This meant instant death. If we went to war with some people with laser guns and antimatter rays, we would be dead in seconds. The Incan story is just a way to tell us what not to do. If we don't bother, then we could become just like the Incans and die out. But if we try to be smart, and look at the past, we can actually live for our full life.       Secondly, the Puebloans. They lived in a cliffside manner. This meant that they could be easy target, because they are already cornered. If you lived in a cliff, then you are impossible to sneak up on, but then you will be easily killed. This means that if we can find more strategic, safe places to dwell, then we will not be repeating history. Also, the Pavlopetri are a good example of geographical placement. If they had decided to live on some dirt, not sand, then they would not have drowned. This is a good example of geography playing a part in history. If they had been higher up, they would have a city full of people and a bunch of descendants.       Some may say that there is no way that there is any place more advanced then America, and that cities nowadays don't fight each other. But Hitler in world war one is a great example of history's part in modern time. If Hitler had read about Napoleon's march to Russia, and how it failed, then he would not have repeated the history and been defeated. He could have tried a different way, and probably succeeded.       These are all examples of history being useful. If we didn't listen to these 3 stories, then we would be part of England, or not exist at all. If history is useless, then why do people still listen? It can be interesting, and it can save lives. Where would we be without history?

Item_Response: Discoveries made about the Inca is important because when archeologists discovered their artifacts, they learned that the Inca made knots in colored strings to use as a calender and to keep track of livestock. These colored strings were called quipus. Archeologists also found artifacts that were made up of stone, pottery, gold, and silver. These objects lasted a long time which is why its still in good condition. They found other objects buried in graves so the dead could use it in it's afterlife. Inca clothing were still in good shape, although it should've been damaged by dampness it was preserved in cold mountains or in dry deserts. When Inca people passed away they would be buried in caves or on mountain tops. The bodies would be buried on mountain tops because the temperature helps preserve them, they act like giant freezers.       Discoveries made about the Puebloans is important because they are known for their skillful basket making art. They farmed instead of hunting and gathering. Farming also counted for their diet. They created the bow and arrow which was more useful than the atlatl which was a spear thrower. They built houses above ground with upright walls made up of poles and mud. There houses were built mostly by cliffs.There named after the spanish word which means, village dwellers. Their pottery upgraded from simple and easy designs on a dull background to black drawings on a white background. As the population grew, their houses and homes were being downgraded because there were more pottery which meant less work for the crafty work. Although, as centuries went by skills and traditions were being used and passed on from generation to generation.       Discoveries made about the Pavlopetri is important because it shows that this was how the fable of Atlantis began. This is the oldest sucken town in the world. The underwater discovery is 30,00 square meters off the southern Peloponnese. It was underwater since 1000 BC. Because of shifting sands and being in a protected bay area, archeologists dsicovered buildings, courtyards, main streets, tombs and religious structures made up of rock. There was also alot of broken pottery. The town was used by an elite, they think this because they found a monument with a large rectangular hall. It is believed that this town was part of the Mycenaean society. This was the first time that sunken city has been founded in Greece, they think that this was how Plato wrote the tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis.

Item_Response: The discovery of the Incas and the pueblaons and how they didn't have a formal alphabet or system of any writing. They told old stories about the europeans that couldv'e been passed down from generation to generation. The story about the Incas were more like legends rather than back in history at  the time. Clothing was remarkably well and ancient materials were destroyed by dampness.       Incas had lived in high in the mountains and worshiped moutain peaks and had a amazing portrait of their religion, art and argiculture, government, transportation, and the way of life. Some of the things that we know about the Inca come from our oral history. Passing on the different stories was an important way to perserve the community's history.The europeans were arriving in 1532 and vistitors had been spanish soldiers and some were priests.         Historians had to be careful when they interpret accounts. Some of their knowledge had come from artifacts from the differnt sites where are the artifacts could have been more than a hunndred years old. In ancient times the Inca artifacts could have been made of gold, different kinds of pottery, or just plain silver. Archaeologists wanted to compare what they had learned from the ancient artifacts an dthe sites with the group called the Spaniards. The spanidards had murdered one of the last Inca kings in the year of 1532and then took over the whole entire empire.       The different origins of the Incas are more and more difficult to trace. The area in where they lived had been long inhabited by the different people. Archaeologists had some of the most techiques in the world which they had discoverd more about the different Inca predecessors. Item_Response: Lost Civilizations   By Abhijith Badarinath               The lost civilizations of the Incas, the Puebloans and also the city of Atlantis has been found. Many archaeologists have found them. But even trying to find them has taken them years and years of hard work. These are extremely major findings in archaeological history.       Lets start out with the Inca tribe. This was tribe that lived near the Andes mountain range. There was lost until about 6 years ago in 2007, the ruins hold great mysteries. The ruins have been sculpted so finely. These Incas were masters of building and architecture.       Now to the Puebloans. Puebloans created the first pit houses. These houses were rather small in today's world, but back then they were huge for their standards. The Kivas were at least four times bigger than the pit houses.       Greeks made a huge archaeological discovery as well. Apparently off the coast of Southern Greece, there appears to be a sunken civilization. As said by Doctor Jon Henderson, 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world'. There were ceramics dating back to the stone age. This is probably where the myth of Atlantis came from.   Well, that myth is now officially one hundred percent true. There is more to be found down in the city of Atlantis.       In conclusion, the lost civilizations are not lost anymore. There are major findings in human history. All this came from years and years of hard work. These lost civilizations will never be lost again.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important because we can study about how they lived their lives and see how they lived back then. We can see if they lived differently than us or if they lived about the same. They all lived in different places, but they all lived way back then and had to survive the same way.       The ancient Inca of Peru are hard to study because they left no archives for historians to study because they had no writing system or alphabet. They lived up in the Andes where it is really cold, but they managed to live. They also had a huge empire using strings to keep records. Their civilization lived for nearly a hundred years, but later was taken over my Spaniards.       The Puebloans were people who made it on terrible land, but were the best basketweavers and house builders of their time. They learned how to plant and grow food, and they invented the bow and arrow, and easier way to hunt than the throwing spear. They had to figure out how to live on such bad land and they lived there for about 800 years. No one knows why they moved, but they think that the land was probably stripped of all the nutrients and they just deserted the area.       The Pavlopetri were the people who lived in the unknown underwater world called Atlantis. Archaeologists studied the settlement where they found new buildings and ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age. Atlantis is still a mystery and we need to still study to learn more about this mysterious underwater place.       The discovery of these people are very important because we are learning more about how the people used to live. We are still studying the sites and their settlements and trying to figure out more. But now we can see how they lived compared to how we live today. The archaeologists are doing the best they can and as fast as they can so that we can learn more about these people and how they survived and what happened to their settlements or empires. This is why the discovery of the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important to us.

Item_Response: The discover of many lost civilizations such as the; Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have helped us become the country and world we are today.  These discoveries can help us understand how life for them was like back then, and it also helps us know what we can do today to make like better or easier for today's people.  The Inca survived for many, many years in the cold Indie Mountains.  How did they do it?  By studying their houses and their way of life we can figure it out.       With the help of these former civilizations we can figure out what will happen to civilizations today.  In the case of land movements or even political problems, such as what might have happened with the Puebloans.  Also, like the Pavlopetri, land masses with civilizations on them might move or sink, which would make that place uninhabitable.  All of these reasons are reason enough for me to research these topics.       With the help of these former people, we can find out what we are doing wrong and what we are doing right.  With everything that they did, we can add onto it and make it something of our own, and you never know, it could just be the thing that changes our lives forever.

Item_Response: Why are the findings of ancient civilizations, such as the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetry that were once alive, so important?  The discoveries made from these once-empires are crucial for many reasons. By studying these civilizations, archeaoligists have figured out where many things we do originate from, how the different lifestyles differ from our own, and how these civilizations coped with life.               The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetry have helped scientists to know exactly where things came from.  It is important we know this type of information because we can see the changes that were made. Everyday activities such as hunting with spears have evolved drastically and we are able to connect these two.               How these civilizations coped with life, may help us learn how to deal with certain things we have difficulty with. Houses and shelters had a specific structure to deal with things, like heat, rain, cold, and critters. By lthe discoveries made, we are able to intergrate them into our everyday lives.                  Each empire had a different lifestyles. By learning about this, we learn how they differed from ours. Because of the location of their homelands, many important inventions were made. Today many of our modern day technology is based off of this.                   The discoveries made from the Inca, the Puebloans and the Pavlopetry are important. They give us ideas on how to improve our everyday society and to not make the same mistakes they may have commited.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have all contributed to modern archaeology and history in some shape or form. The Incans left behind the massive ruins of their civilization, the Puebloans left behind their small villages upon cliffs, and the Pavlopetri discovered the ancient Greek settlement entombed in water. The Incan civilization possesed no kind of writing system, but instead, a complex form of communication through an object called, a 'Quipu'. These were strings ordered in special fashion, and were basically a way of conveying a message without speaking.       Today, many archaeologists understand more about the Incans not only because of the Quipu, but becuase of the many ruins they left behind, an example the kingdom of Cuzco. The Puebloans left behind many small ruins of villages. Formally a nomadic people, they began to settel on cliffsides and hills. They learned how to create pottery sculptures, and they learned how to efficeintly utilize the bow and arrow, so that they would be able to hunt and kill their prey much easier. The Puebloans resided in the area of 'Mesa Verde', spanish for 'green table'. They were also skillful basketweavers. And third, the ancient sunken settlement off the coast of Greece. These ruins reveal to modern day citizens the elaborate architecture and the vast number of people the ancient Greek possesed. The settlement, now completely sumberged underwater, may have very well inspired the legend of Atlantis. This ancient settlement is nearly 5,000 years old, and has been well preserved under the water.

Item_Response: People lived in pithouses from about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750 , as settled agriculture began . The pihouse feautured a living room sunk a few feet in the ground. Four corner timbers supported the roof . The firepit had an air deflector An antechamber might contain storage bins or pits . The sipapu was a hole for passage to the underworld, from which the people had come. Pithouses later evolved into kivas

Item_Response: The idea of advanced civilizations being lost in time is a very fascinating one to humans. When we think of a lost civilization, we think of the Lost City of Atlantis, the mythical city that was sucked under the ocean in 'The Odyssey ' by Homer, a Greek philosopher. This is not always the case.           Let's take the Inca empire of Peru. They had no sort of alphabet or writing system.  They used colored and knotted string to keep records of goings on in their Empire. In fact, the first Europeans to meet the Inca were astounded that they could run an Empire rivaling the Roman empire just through knotted pieces of string. However, not much is known about the Inca empire. They left behind no archives or writings for historians to study. But, we mad with what we had. Clues left behind by the Inca put together a puzzle revealing the complex art, history and culture behind this great empire.           Atlantis was a city in the Greek 'Odyssey' that was swallowed by the ocean in one night. Now scientists believe it wasn't solely myth. A team of divers has discovered an underwater settlement that dates back 5000 years, back to the times of the Greek empire. The size and wealth of this city was supposedly phenomenal. 'There is no doubt that this is the largest submerged city in the world' said Doctor Jon Henderson, professor of underwater archaeology at the University of NoNottingham. It's oldest remains date back to 2800 to 1200 B.C, Long before the days of classical Greece. There are, however, older sunken sites, but none can be matched to a planned city such as this one.            An idea of lost civilizations filled with ancient undiscovered technology has excited humans since the first reading of the Odyssey. However, not all lost cities are as exciting as Atlantis. And not all can be found.

Item_Response: We all know there used to be ancient civilizations way before we were born. Take for example the Inca, or Puebloans, or Pavlopetri. They all have secrets to be discovered and most of it could explain alot.             The Inca didnt have an alphabet or system of writing so there were no archives for historians to study. The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that the Inca could run a big empire with colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. What the Inca left were clues like portraits explaining their religion and way of life. Since the Inca lived high in the Andes mountains they probably worshiped som mountain peaks. Some Inca were buried incliff faces or mountain tops so that helped to perserve the sites. the bodies that are found in the icy Andes are in real good shape. Eperts can use our modern medical technology to learn how these people died it also reveals information on how they lived!             The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde which in spanish means 'green table'. They are known for good Basketmakes because of their skill and the craft. They used to be nomadic but over the years Puebloans replaced hunting and gathering with Farming. Puebloans population multiplied about A.D.750 and they began building houses above ground. The population decreased after a while and began moving back into cliff alcoves. They used nature to their advantage and built their dwellings beneath the overhanging cliffs. They built 'Kiva' which were like ceremonial places you could think of it as a church in these times.             Have you ever heard of The Lost City of Atlantis? Well something similar was found and that could of started the whole Atlantis fable. explorers discovered a sunken settlement beneath the waters off southern Greece. It is know as the oldest found settlement. Local people in the nearby town of Neapolis are amazed. 'Older generations always knew something was there but we had no idea about the extent of it' said Neapolis`s mayer, Yiannis Kousoulis.            Now think about what would our world be like without these ancient civilization influences? Im sure it wouldnt be like it is now. We probably wouldnt have much fun without the fairy tale of Atlantis and we wouldnt be able to keep up with days without calendars. Thats why I beleive these civilizations were and always will be important to us.

Item_Response: Archaeologist can find amazing things about the past with just a few things.       The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. The Incas made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calender to keep a count of livestolks. Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of there religon. The falls of the Incas easy to date because the spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire.       The spainards did not speak the Inca language. So the historians have to be careful when they interpert these acounts. Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness. The area were they lived had long been inhabited by different people. The Incas may have worshiped some mountain peaks. This is what archaeologys can find by studying the things they studty.                   Ancestral Puebloans help us find out more about peoples life.       For more than 700 years they and their descendants lived and florished here. By A.D 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonory. Farming accounted for more of their diet than before and much mesa-top land was cleared for agriculture.       Ever since local cowboys first reported the cliff dwelling in the 1880s archelologests have sought to understand these peoples lifes. The structures are evidence of a society that over centuries accumulated skills and traitions and passed them on. Item_Response: The inca
Item_Response_Tag: DT NN

Item_Response: The discoveries between the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri civilizations are important in knowledge of the world's history. If we don't learn about our past and history, then we are either bound to repeat it, or if we went through an economic crisis, we wouldn't know how to restart or where to begin. By researching the ways of life of these different cultures helps our knowledge and understanding of survival and how civilizations came to be. My theory is that there are still thousands of civilizations that we still know nothing about. The Inca were a great civilization. Clues left behind from the Inca helped to form a better understanding of how they lived, such as religion, art, architecture, agriculture, government, and transportation. Little of what we know about the Inca comes from stories passed down through the centuries, but some of the information given were from the Spaniards, who did not speak the Inca language well, so it is not a completely reliable source. Some of what we know are from letters and diaries from the Spaniards, describing what they were like. Most of our knowledge, however, comes from ancient artifacts, like objects made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver, which last a long time, even if they had been buried. Some clothing and textiles have been surprisingly preserved over time, mostly because of the dry desert environment. One of the main reasons that their civilization had been preserved so well was from their location. The Inca lived in the Andes, and many of their sites are in high locations that are hard to get to. The cold mountains acted as a freezer to Inca bodies, making it easier for experts to examine and learn about how they lived, the health conditions they had, and maybe even how they died. It is hard to tell some details, however, because of their location being hard to reach. The Mesa Verde National Park preserves an immense amount of reminders from this ancient civilization. At one point, archeologists called these people Anasazi, meaning 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies,' but we now call them Ancestral Puebloans. The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde at about 550 A.D. They led a more settled way of life, like farming instead of hunting and gathering. They lived in built pithouses built on mesa tops or in cliff recesses. They learned pottery and acquired the bow and arrow. They were known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. They were fairly prosperous, and population multiplied. At about 750 A.D. they began building houses above the ground with upright wals made of poles and mud. Population continued to grow, and so did their technology and knowledge. Eventually, fires were built for cooking, houses became more comfortable, but they realized their living conditions were unsatisfactory, and around 1300 A.D., Mesa Verde was deserted. The last civilization is one that had been named a myth for thousands of years-- the sunken city of Atlantis. After researching the abandoned city on the ocean floor, archeologists found several clues preserved from the shifting sands in the ocean. The city had been planned out; a world of buildings, courtyards, streets, tombs and religious structure, along with many shards of pottery. Marine geologists still have yet to find out why the civilizations sand, and theories include many sea leven changes, ground subsidence as a result of earthquakes, or a tsunami. Less than 1% of the world's ocean floors have been discovereed, and there may still be a lot more down there that is waiting to be found.

Without this information given on previous civilizations we would not have the knowledge we have today.  We would lack the knowledge of our ancestry, world creation, and past life and explanations on earth.          From all the research done on the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri we have gained knowledge on how the world was made. Also, from this research, many myths and tales were made up giving those with superstitions and questions an answer to our world today.  Additionally, some of these myths were created to shelter those who were young of knowing the harsh truth of civilizations falls to destruction.  Without this research we would have lacked the protection of harshness and cruelty that keeps children happy, good, safe, and pure.          Additionally, our lives have been greater knowledge by the truth and reason behind the worlds marks.  By finding the lost civilizations , sunken cities, and ancient ruins we have found the home of the generations from before us and where they came from.  Also, the sight of what their knowledge was from their time has also been shared with archaeologist of whom has passed down their wisdom to us.           Without the research of all of the architects our history would be gone and our intelligence shrunken. As, it is only the problems of the past that grow our future so we could push on to our future.          With result to all of this research, the investigation of these civilizations has held our world and level of intelligence.  Also, this will continue to help explain our world and history for years to come.

Item_Response: Many years ago there were many ancient civilizations.  Only their writings, tools, and buildings remain today.  Their achievements captivate people to this day.  Three of these ancient civilizations stand out from the others.  They are the Incas, Puebloans, and the lost city of the Greeks.           The first is the ancient Inca of Peru.  The Incas were a great people with an empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome.  Archaeologists have discovered amazing clues left behind like their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life.  They were able to thrive in their unforgiving land.  These artifacts left behind are amazing because are the only things that are left of the once great empire that rivaled the Romans.           The second in the Ancestral Puebloans.  They were once a nomadic people who made great baskets, but traded that life for a one of farming and permanent settlements built on high place like a mesa.  Their population prospered, so at about A.D.750 they began to build houses with upright walls made of pole and mud.  Between A.D 1100 and A.D. 1300 their population reached the thousands.  They built compact villages to house the growing population.  These buildings were carefully crafted with well cut stones.  In A.D 1200 another population shift occurred.  They moved back to the cliffs for unknown reasons like maybe the alcoves provide better protection from elements, religious reasons, or even psychological reasons.  Whatever the reason it gave rise to the cliff dwellings for which Mesa Verde is most famous.  This is important discovery because the shows a group of people who were once excellent basket makers and became a great group of people who lived on high mesas and alcoves.            The third is the lost Greek city.  This ancient city is covered with great amount of ocean water.  This might of been the city that inspired the myth about Atlantis.  It is not the oldest town, but it was the first to be planed.  The underwater city holds great submerged buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures.  In addition, the seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery. This is an amazing discovery because less than 1% of the ocean floor has been surveyed.  This find was like finding a needle in a hay stack.  Also, the relics are in good condition and haven't have been looted.  This just adds to the great find.           These three ancient civilizations are important discoveries because they give great glimpses of the past.  These discoveries could lead to an idea or invention that that we could only dream of.  The people may not be alive any more, but their items from their daily lives on and serve a reminder of those whose time has passed on this Earth.

Item_Response: The discoveries made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very significant in the world of archaeology. These civilizations have provided new knowledge to archaeologists about their rich culture and history.       In the article, 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past', written by Beth Gruber, Gruber exposes how the Incas are a very mysterious civilization that archaeologists yet have much knowledge about. The Inca 'made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calender to keep count of livestock'. These colorful artifacts are of no meaning to archaeologists. They have no clue about it, but these knots yield the answers to all of the Inca's history because the quipu was their only form of records. The Inca history archaeologists know about comes from 'oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation'. This means that the Inca remain mysterious to this day. The human race may never find out the Inca's culture. Yet, the desire for knowledge keeps archaeologists searching for more Incan artifacts.       In the article, 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and their World', it is revealed to the reader that the Puebloans are very significant at keeping archaeologists doing their job. The Puebloans built 'stone walls of large pueblos that are regarded as the finest built in Mesa Verde'. The Puebloans must have been very creative people because their constructing methods are elegant. Archaeologists have discovered their beautiful building and have learned that they are great builders from just looking and examining their architecture. The Puebloans later 'traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona, settling among their kin who were already there'. The Puebloans remain one of the most fascinationg civiliations ever to have lived, and having living descendants of them today gives archaeologists a huge help in finding out more about this unique ancient civilization.       In the article 'Lost Greek city that may have inspred Atlantis myth gives up secrets', by Helena Smith in Athens, Smith describes how the Pavlopetri might have been the people living in the famed 'Lost City of Atlantis'. This lost city found beneath the waters off of Greece may have inspire that infamous myth. Even if this city is not the genuine Atlantis, it still remains 'the oldest submerged town in the world'. This city, doubtless of being Atlantis, is still a huge archaeology discovery. This city provides new information about what kind of culture the Pavlopetri people had. In addition, this city may be the city of Atlantis, but regardless of that, Atlantis 'is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going'. Whether or not this city is Atlantis, the town just pushes underwater archaeologists to push harder to try and find more artifacts and more knowledge. To find out that a myth truly is real by using hard facts would be amazing. It would feed some of the human desire to gain more and more knowledge. The Pavlopetri people, having have lived in Atlantis or not, have provided a huge find for archaeologists everyewhere.       The ancient Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have given archaologists around the world so much to study and so much more knowledge. These ancient civilizations have given the us their rich culture and history to examine, and the human race is both grateful and thankful for the huge amount of knowledge that they have recieved about these mysterious people.

Item_Response: Why are the discoveries of ancient civilizations so important? The discoveries found from ancient civilizations are important, they are important  because we can use them to understand the past, and how much we have advanced in technology today. Some ancient artifacts that help us understand the past of ancient civilizations include the quipu from the Inca empire, the pit houses from the Puebloans, and lost sunken Greek city believed to be Athens.         Quipu used in the Inca civilization helps us today understand how the Incans kept track of numbers without an established number or writing system. The quipu was a long colorful string attached to a stick with knots in it. Each knot was used to keep track of anything from money, to food, to cattle.         Pit houses from the Mesa Verde community were being occupied by Puebloans from the year A.D. 550 to A.D. 750 when people began to ditch hunting and gathering to a settled farming community. The pit houses were held up by timbers in each of the four corners of the structure. The pit house also contained a living room which was sunken in a few feet from the ground. A fire pit was also included in the pit house and had an air shaft to release smoke from the fire.         The sunken city in Greece, believed to be Athens, tells modern day archeologist and scientist much about the ancient civilization. Since it was so well preserved by the sand in the bay, Anglo-Greek scientist can survey through to find main streets, buildings courtyards, and even religious structures. This sunken city helps us today by showing us how technologically advanced the ancient Greeks were.         Quipus, pit houses, and sunken cities all are important to the discovery of our past. All of these artifacts help us conclude information to the development of our ancestors in the advancing civilizations they called home.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the ancient civilizations of the Inca, the Mesa Verde  Puebloeans, and the discovery of the city of Atlantis. The ancient Inca civilization was a very important discovery because we could see how advanced they were during their time compared to the other civilizations. Incas have taught us by leaving artifacts behind that they showed us what games they played and what kind of tools they used to cook and the weapons they used to hunt with. They also showed us how they kept records with quipos. The Inca left many clues behind including religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and a unique way of life. The bodies scientist find can tell how they died because the bodies are in good shape which allow scientist to use modern medical scanning equipment.                 The Mesa Verde Puebleans are another ancient civilization that we have discovered. The Mesa Verde people lived long before explored North America. The Mesa Verde people lived and flourished here and built elaborate stone communities.First Puebloans were known as basket-makers for their skill in craft. Farming began to replace their nomadic way of hunting and gathering food. They lived in small villages made of clustered pit houses. Pit houses were like tents only made of wood and had four support timbers that held the whole thing up. The pit houses later in time evolved and became known as kivas. By A.D. 750 they began to build houses above the ground. These houses had upright walls made of poles and mud. The houses were built right next to each other in long curving rows. The Mesa Verde people, due to their new housing methods, started to be known as Puebloans.                    The ancient underwater city of Atlantis was a huge discovery to  all the people around the world. Some of the remains found were dated long before the glory, golden age, days of Greece. The famous city takes as much as 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. It is believed that the city was consumed by the sea around 1,000 BC. Atlantis was found with buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. The sunken city of Atlantis dates as far back as Homer's heroes and as far as to when Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis. Experts say that the knowing of size and wealth of detail is unprecedent. The city of Atlantis also provides potential insights to the workings of a Mycenaean society. That is why the discoveries of the ancient Inca society, the Mesa Verde Puebloans, and the discovery of the ancient myth of the sunken underwater city of Atlantis were a great discovery and influenced us in many ways. The Incas left behind their quipos as calenders, the Mesa Verde Puebloans left the houses they built above ground that sound a lot like an apartment complex, and the underwater society of Atlantis left their buildings and many other important artifacts to show us how advanced they were during and before their time before being underwater.

There way of life in history was amazing and we would have never of known if they didn't keep any of their records, documents, and structures of how they lived. This helps and gives us our history that we wright down and what we study in school, we have history so we don't make the same mistakes as our kind has done in the past. Their artifacts help us understand them more and see how smart they were with technology and other things we would have never known about if there was nothing left from their time period. This helps our way of society to understand each other and bring us into one union.          In the book, Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past, by Beth Gruber, explains how the Incas lived their way of life. The Incas were hard to learn about because they didn't leave any archives, which made it a little more difficult to understand their way of life. They did leave knots on a string and that was their calendar, they were called quipus. To this day scientist still don't know what the different colors on the knots represent. Later in years we were provided with amazing discoveries they had left behind like, portraits of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. From the left over artifacts, scientist are able to identify their way of life.          In the book, Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World, by Roy Anderson, explains how the Ancestral Puebloans lived their life. The Puebloans had settled in Mesa Verde (Spanish for 'green table'), they had settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They were very skilled at crafting and were called Basketmakers. They were formerly nomadic, beginning to settle in their lives normally, civilized. Instead of hunting and gathering, they took over farming, they also lived built their homes on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses in pithouses. They had also discovered pottery and making arrows for hunting in stead of the atlatl (a spear thrower).          In the book, Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets, by Helena Smith in Athens, explains how the Pavlopetri lived their way of life. The Pavlopetri lived in the lost city of Atlantis, on the southern side of Greece.

Inca came from South America that rivaled the exanse of Ancient Rome.           Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They left no archives to historains can study. Inca made knots to keep count of livestock. The first Europeans were amazed that they run a huge empire. Today no one knows what the knots means. Inca left clues behind that formed an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, transportation, and way of life.           Old stories have been told by Europeans. But it was good for them as well. They cold mountain top made the dead bodies in good shape. That made it easier to learn how the people died.             There are no more Inca living in the present time. Most Inca sites have been cleaned out from looters, archaeologist, and treasure hunters. We also wouldnt know how to do alot of the things we know how to do today, like alot of the architectural styling many people enjoy today. Item_Response: The Incans, the Puebloans, the Pavlopetri these are all ancient clans, races, and families.   They are dated back to 1438! They are very important because they could have started the whole human race. We don't know that for sure yet but that could be true. I don't even have a thought about it.         We have found many artifacts frm them and the most commonly known ones are the calendars. Yes, I know they don't sound very interesting at all but the are. he Aztec calendars are what some people think is the countdown to the 'end of the world.'       The Inca lived high in the Andes Mountain Range. Some think they worshipped the mountains thinking they were gods and goddesses.They even buried the dead in caves or at the top so looters couldn't get to them. That just made the job harder for the archeoligist. We scan and anylize the bodies for information about how they lived.         Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde in pithouses, 'houses in the ground.' They went from building with pole-and-adobe building to masterful stone masonry. They would join together alot of units that had more than 50 rooms.         They had churches or Kivas.This is where they worshipped and weaved. They would make fires in summer mainly for cooking and in winter mainly for warmth. They then made a city that is now under water. That may be where we got the idea for Atlantis, but I still think Atlantis is real.      Well I hope that you enjoyed my article about ancient civilizations. I have always loved learning about this stuff because of the mystery behind it. Well this raps up my presentation so until next time.

Item_Response: Did you know that there is an entire city underwater, and dozens of artifacts buried under layers of sediment? All this precious history is preserved by nature. In this article I will be telling you about the well preserved artifacts that were left by the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.       First, the Incan empire ruled from 1438-1532. Although some Incan tablets have been looted, we still have learned a great deal about the Incan life from other Incan tablets. From these tablets we have learned that the Inca lived high in the Andes mountains, and that they may have worshiped some mountains.  We have also learned that the Inca sometimes buried tablets with the dead. Although the Incan ruins had many records looted, they wrote such thorough that we still learned a lot about their lives.       Secondly, the Puebloans ruled from 550-1200 a.d.. They ruled for over 700 years. The Puebloans lived in Mesa Verda, in North America. From records, we learned that they Puebloans created the bow and arrow, and pithouses. The bow and arrow was a weapon, this  weapon was a long piece of wood that had a string that ran from the top to the bottom of the wood. Pithouses were created when the Puebloans settled. These were holes dug a few feet into the ground with four corners of wood that provided shelter. Altogether, the Puebloans were people that adapted quickly to their envirement.       Third, the lost city, also known as Atlantis, ruled from 2800-1200 BC. This city is located 30,000 square meters away from Southern Peloponnese. This lost city was preserved by shifting sands. These shifting sands covered up the city, therefore preserving it. Some believe that Plato, a very famous Greek writer, wrote about this city in his tale called'The sunken continent of Atlantis.' We will never really know if his writing was based off of this lost city. Furthermore, this lost city has been one very big mystery.       Lastly, these empires and cities have left many written records. Through these records, we have been able to see through the eyes of the people of the past.
