Item_Response: Did it ever occur to you why ancient civilizations are so important? There have been many discoveries made about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri that reveal most of the answers to your questions about their lives back then.               One of the first discoveries that were found was about the Inca. They lived in the years 1438-1532 in a South American empire. What clues did they leave behind for us to study how they lived? Researchers pieced together amazing puzzles of their religion, government systems, art and architecture, and many details of the Inca life style. Their stories were also passed down through generations and generations by oral history and important stories. However, most of these stories were legends rather than historical facts about their past. Another part of our knowledge comes from the Inca's well preserved clothing and some bodies found in the mountaions from the Andes. Even though some sites were raided by treasure hunters long ago, archaeologists can still uncover some truths about their past.               Another reason why we can learn from ancient civilizations is through the Pluebloans. This group of people lived in Mesa Verde in about A.D. 550. They lived sunken houses a few feet in the ground called pit-houses.They were known for making baskets and were very nomadic people too. We can learn from this because it shows how much we have changed from back then. Also,when they built fires inside their houses to cook and keep warm, they cut a hole in their roofs to let the smoke out. This reveals that they were not only good at doing things, but they were also smart too. Eventually they figured out how to make potery and better houses made out of stones. There population may have reached around several thousand during the classic period which led to bigger towns and cities.               There were also many discoveries made about the Pavlopetri. The only thing different about this ancient civilization is that is was underwater in southern Greese. The water really helped preserved the 30,000 square meter city considering it has remains dating back from 2800 to 1200 BC. In this sunken city they have also found many artifacts buildings, rock-cut tombs, and religios structures. This reaveals a whole new world of exploration for archaeologists.              ? Do you now know why ancient civilizations are so importatnt? It is because of some groups like the Inca, Pueloans, and the Pavlopetri that we now have less questions to answer about life back then.

Item_Response: ?                    Archaeology Helps Discover Lost Civilizations                                      Many historians  have contributed to discovering and studying objects obtained from areas where ancient civilizations once prospered.This practice is called Archaeology.Archaeology has led to the discovery of several lost civilizations.                In ancient Inca of Peru, archaeologists discovered that the people did not have a written record system during this time period. Instead, the people of Inca made knots in colored string called Quipus to record dates and to keep track of the amount of livestock.They also discovered stories written by Spanish soldiers and priests telling about the Inca when they arrived at the empire in 1532. However, most Spaniards didn't speak the Inca language and could have misunderstood the culture.Most of what archaeologists learn from the lost civilization of Inca is from the artifacts discovered .Some of these artifacts include, clothing, pottery, building ruins, bodies, and weapons.Bodies have been found in the Andes mountains and are in such good condition they can be studied with modern medical equipment to show how they died and how they lived.                Another society archaeology helped us discover was the ancestral Puebloans. They lived in Mesa Verde,Mexico(now a national park).Archaeologists discovered remains from homes that were called pithouses, these houses consisted of a living room sunk a few feet in the ground and four corner timbers supporting the roof.People lived in these houses until A.D. 550 to A.D. 750.The people who lived during this time are referred to as Basketmakers for their skill in weaving baskets . In the year A.D. 1000, people's homes had evolved from pole supported homes to walls of stone holding fifty or so rooms.The populations continued to grow and in some of the artifacts observed from this time a noticeable decline in quality is seen. The people appeared to be moving into cliff alcoves that had previously sheltered their ancestors. These people became known as the cliff dwellers. They built their homes under overhanging cliffs with sandstone shaped into rectangle blocks.However, ancestral Pueblans only lived in the cliffs for less than a hundred years.Several theories were made about their migration. For example, crop failures, drought,or land resource depletion may have caused the people to migrate. Studies from archaeologists have shown when the cliff dwellers left they traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona.               Archaeologists have also discovered a submerged city that was  off the southern coast of Greece. This lost city  could have inspired one of the world's most legendary myths,the fable of Atlantis. The sunken settlement was explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists .They discovered the settlement was as old as 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes.The site covers 30,000 square meter of the ocean floor and is believed to be consumed by the sea around 1000 BC.Arcaeologists  have studied building structures, pottery, rock-cut tombs, and religious a monuments. By finding the lost city Arcaeologists have allowed historians to discover how many people lived in this time and what their religious beliefs were.They  also can use this information to compare modern day lifestyles to the ones our ancestors lived by before.                As you can see, Archaeologist work has allowed the world to discover and better understand how different our lives are from lost ancient civilizations.

Item_Response: Have you ever wanted to know what it was like to live in a foreign land way back when. Well with today's advances in technology you can. Archeologists have discovered many things about living conditions in the past from 3 main civilizations.            One of the civilizations is the Inca. The Inca had portraits that left behind amazing accounts of their religion, art, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Also archeologists have learned many things about the Inca from reading accounts of Spaniards that were left behind. We have been able to piece together enough data to know what happened to the Inca up until they were slaughtered by the Spanish.            Another civilization was the Puebloans. They used many advanced things for their time period. Some of these thing were basket weaving, bow and arrow hunting tools, and pit houses. They also lived in cliff dwellings. All of this archeologists were able to learn by careful studying, and meticulous deciphering.            The Pavlopetri civilization was found submerged by using modern day sonar. This ancient civilization is the oldest submerged city currently found. It was also thought to inspire the myth of Atlantis. Due to shifting sands and a protective bay most of this civilizations artifacts are still intact today. Archeologists have been able to discover many interesting facts about this civilization because of this.            As you can see archeologists have been able to uncover many helpful things about the Inca, Puebloans, And the Pavlopetri due to modern advances in techology.

Item_Response: Archeaologists have been around searching for clues on acnient societies. They searched at the Incan civilization, the Pueboloans, and the Pavlopetri's civilizations.    As they looked around the Incan civilization, archeaologists discovered that Spaniards murdered the last Inca king and controlled to empire. They believe that this is important to know because it tells us how the empire ended. But discovering its origin is more difficult to know. Archeaologists need to know why did they build their civilization on the mountains, but the area where they settled had been long inhabited by other people.   When arhceaologists were at the Puebloans society they discovered that the people who lived there were mostly basketmakers.They think that it's important to know why they were basketmakers because it can show us that they were skilled craft workers.   Finally the arhceaologists discovered that the Pavlopetri's had a society underwater. As they studied their sunken city, they discovered that the people who lived there regular ancient citizens that regularly had courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures in their civilization. But the main reason archeologists investigate the society is because they wnat to find out how the city sank.   Some people think that searching around ancient cities is a waste of time. But archaeologists discovered new things around the civilization that can introduce new secerts in human life.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca people had no formal system of writing or letters, this had made it very hard to track down facts. Some of their religion, art, architecture, agriculture, transportation, and ways of their lifes had helped us figure out why Inca ruled South American empire for over a 100 years. From generation to generation stories have been passed down, but since the Spaniards counldn't speak the Inca language well it was very difficult to pass on the stories. They were very talented people for their time, they made thinks out of stone, pottery, gold, and silver. These artifacts helps us discover Inca past history, as well as weather and other natural conditions. When archaeologists go to a site sometimes they discover tht stealers and looters have been their and have disturbed them. As archaeologists go to site the most important things on their mind is to fine out what happened to a civilization and where it had came from. These are the importances of the discovery of Inca and how.        The Puebloans lived in stone houses for over 700 years. Archaeologists call these people Anasazi, which is a Navajo word meaning 'The Ancient Ones or Enemies.' They were also known as basketmakers, for thier good skills at crafts. They were settled back people, after many years they lived in pit houses. Their population had been multipling quickly, so they began making houses of uprights walls made of poles and mud. Fromm generation to generation over centuries structure skills had changed, they started to built their dwelligns beneath the overhanging cliffs. They had lived in them for less than 100 years. These are the importances of the discovery of the Puebloans and how.        The Lost City may have inspired one od the worlds most enduring myths, this is the oldest submerged town in the world. Do to weather and shifting sands the bay was protected where the Lost City was. They had found 9,000 square meters of new buildings, all under water. This is very different because a sa submerged site it was not reoccupied. They think it was a combination of two towns at the start, this is the first time a sunken city had been found in greece. These are the importances of the discovery of the Lost City and how.

Item_Response: Ancient Discovery                                                                                                                                             The ancient of peru had no fomal system or alhabet of  writting. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The first europeans to meet the inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records.                                                                                                                                         Ancient Rome left clues behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. By studying these clues, archaeologists and others can piece together detail of the Inca life. The fall of the Inca is easy to date because the Spainards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire.            Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness, but these have been preserved in the dry deserts on peru`s coasts or the cold mountains or the andes. Some inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters, Who take anything that might be valuable. Some treasures were taken centuries ago, but looting still goes on today. looted sites often do not tell archaeologists, who can dig them up carefully. They provide the best idea of all about life in peru before and during Inca rule.               Mesa Verde National Park preserves a spectacular reminder of this acient culture. Archeologists have called these people Anasazi, from a Navajo word sometimes translated as ''the acient ones'' or ''ancient enemies.'' We now call them Ancestral Puebloans, reflecting their modern descents. The first Ancestral puebloans settled in Mesa Verde (Spanish for ''green table'') about A.D. 550. They are know as basketmakers for their skill at the craft. Formerly nomadic, they were beginning to lead a more settled wayof life.              The structers are evidence of a society that, over centuries, accumulated skills and traditions and passed them on from generation to generation. By the classic Period, Ancestral Puebloans were heirs of a virgorous civilization, whos accomplishment in community living and the arts rank among the finest expressions of human culture in North America using nature to advantage, Ancestral Pueblanos built their dwellings beneath the overhanging cliffs. Their basic construction  material was sandstone that they shaped into rectangular blocks about the size of a loaf of bread.                    The secret of the lost city that may have inspired one of the world`s  most enduring myths the fable of Atlantis have been brought to light from beneath the waters off  southern Greece. Explored by an Anglo Greek team of archealogists and marine geologists and known as pavlopetri, the sunken settlment dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer`s heroes and in term of size and wealth of detail is unexprecedented, experts say.                There is now a doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world. Inspired one of the worlds most enduring myths. Atlantis was a myth that keeps underwater exploration going. said Sakellariou. Less than 1 percent of the worlds ocean floor have ever been surveyed.

Item_Response: The Find of Lost City       The lost city people were fascinated because the secrets of the lost city have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths. The enclosure in a protected buy, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. The lost city is important find because its very big and very old. It's also been there for many years. It was very replete with thousands of shards of pottery. The fable of Atlantis have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece.       The site, which straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. It was revealed over 9,000 square meters of new buildings. THe sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of details is unprecedented, experts say. There was many things found in the lost city like old tools, weapons, money, coins and old pottery. There are older sunken sites in the world but none can be considerd to be planned towns such as this, which is why it is unique. More than any other underwater site so far, the find offers potential insights into the working of Mycenaean society. 40 years ago it was only the year that marine archaeologists, aided by digital technology, were able to properly survey the ruins. Theories include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or tsunami.       The Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going. Greece was the first time that a sunken city has been found that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis. One percent of the world's ocean floors have ever been tested. The lost cities extraordinary found is still a lot more down there that has no been found yet.

The lost cities we found were called the Inca, Puebloans, and Peru. these cities are very old they are about 5,000 thousand years old.        Also the Inca city did not leave any alphabet or systems for use to study on now. The Inca city made knots with colors on them so they could recorded the calendar and keep a count of the livestock. The first Europeans that meat the Incas were so amazed that they could run a huge empire with just using strings. But we still don't know what the knots mean or the colors that go with them. Also the Spaniards did not speak any of the Inca language. Also some of the Incas stories were rather legends than history. The Inca artifacts were objects made of stone, pottery, gold, or sometimes silver. These materials that they used last a very long time even if they have been bared for a hundred years.        The second city we are gonna talk about is the puebloans, this city was long before the Europeans explored north America. Also the first ancestral puebloans settled in Mesa Verde. Also these cities were frozen and they started to unfreeze when it hit the water because the sand was helping it dissolve.Also our investigation revealed that 9,000 square meters or new buildings were built.We also found out that when earthquakes and tsunami's hit.That the cities would sink in deeper. Item_Response: LOST CITY OF ATLANTIS           When archeologists finnaly found lost cities they were facinated with all the artifacts they had found.One of the lost cities that archeologists found was named Atlantis.This lost city happens to be the biggest lost city in the world.It has ben sunken for over 5,000 years up until archeologists discovered it.So now we and acrcheologists know that Atlantis was never a myth.        .It has been underwater of the dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of greece.There might be older cities sunken but none of them may be claimed to be as a planned town, wich is why it is unique.The site which is 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese.Is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 100 BC.What they have found surprassed all of the expectations.For shifting sands and settlements enclosure in a protected bay.But then the exploration revealed the world of buildings.It revealed courtyards,main streets,rock-cut tombs and religious structures.       Archeologists found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age.Wich suggested that the settlement was occupied soem 5,00 years ago, at tghe least 1,200 years earlier than originally thought.Then other investigations revealed 9,000 square meters of new buildings. What really took the, by surprise was the discovery of a possible megaron,a monumental structure witha large rectangular hall.       While marine geologists have to yet work out why thesettlement sank.Some theories include sea level changes,ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes,or a tsunami.Its very likely a combination of the first two,' said Dimitris Sakellariou,at the Greek institute of oceanography.'As the worlds oldest submerged city it is truly amazing.It doesnt only show how peolpe live at the time is to has a great interest to natural scientists because the waters around it are so shallow.       It is the first time a sunken city has been found in over 5,000 years in Greece.It predates the time that Plato wrote his allegrical  tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis.Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going.Less than 1% of the world's ocean floors havre been surveyed. This is an extraordinary find but there is still a lot more down there that has to be found.

Item_Response: Lost civilizations          These are some reasons why these ancient civilizations was important. First the Inca they used color strings to record the calendar to keep count of livestock. The first Europeans were astonished how the Inca could run a large empire using strings to keep records. Some of what we know is from oral history. We also know them because the Europeans that arrived in 1532 wrote them down.        Next the Pueblo-ans. They settled in Mesa Verde in about A.D. 500. They were skilled at making baskets so they were known as basket makers. The types of houses they lived in were pit houses which were clustered into small villages. The cliff dwellers left and settled in New Mexico and Arizona settling with their kin who was already there.        Finally the Pavlopetris. They are a Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists. There investigation led to a discovery of over 9,000 square feet of buildings.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca didn't have a have system of writing . They made knots and colored strings , quipus . It recorded the calender to keep count of the livestock . The Europeans were impressed . Archaeologists found a lot  of the colored strings , but to this day no one know what they mean . Some clues were left behind by Inca's amazing portraits of their religions , art , architecture , agriculture , government , transportation , and way of life . That's how we know about the civilization that ruled a South American empire that revealed the ancient Rome .               Stories from Inca were passed from generation to generation and it was important so we can learn about our communtiy's history in the future . We know them today because Europeans wrote them down in 1532 . They were described as Inca letters and diaries . The discriptions might not be accurate and some of the history were legends . The rest that we haved learned are from sites where artifacrts are found . They might made of stone, pottery , gold . or silver . Many are found for the graves for dead people and ruins of the buildings . Some of the sites were disturbed by treasure hunters or looters ,  and they take anything that might be valuable .            The Spaniards murdered the last king in 1532 and that is when they took over the empire and the fall of the Inca . Archaeologists were really careful to make sure who built each site . They used the most advanced technology in the world to discover more on Inca's precedecessors . We can see how the photos and can help us find the patterns in the ancient monuments . The Inca lived in the Andes and worshiped mountain peaks . Many of their sites are in high places , some of the Inca were buried in caves in the cliffs , mountain tops . This helped the archaeologists perserve the sites , so looters won't get them so easily . It also makes a a little diffucult for the archaeologist because it's a high altitude . They have to carry equipment before they start to go up the mountain . It's really freezing cold up there . The studies of the bodies revealed information about how the Inca lived .

Item_Response: How Archaeologists figure out Lost Civilizations             The ancient Inca of Peru was a advanced civilization that ruled for nearly one hundred years.  The question is how did the archaeologists know about the civilization, what made there civilization fall, and how they kept record of livestock?  I'll explain that just continue reading.                     First of all how did the archealogists find about the civilization their were clues left by them like the portrait of their religon.  So how did the lnca kept track of livestock and used as a calendar?  Although  the Inca also had no formal alphabet or writing system.  They used something called a quipus which was a colored strings with knots that indicated the value of the number.  The archaeologists have found many quipus they still don't know what it means (what it was used for).                     Archaeologists need any information they find to study the Inca.  Every single artifact hey find is very important, they have to photograph the artifact and note the exact position.  They need to learn as much information from every piece of evidence/artifact.  The mountains act like a freezer that keep the bodies in such good shape so experts can research them and find the cause of their death.                 The fall of the Inca was on 1532, archaeologists know that because thats when the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king and took over the Inca empire.  For the archaeologists finding the origins of the Inca is harder because the area they lived in was inhabited by many different people.  The Inca lived high in the Andes and have worshiped many of their sites in high places.  They made pottery, artifacts made of gold, silver, and stone which they found. Item_Response: This findings are very important in many ways, like the fact that now we know how their lives were back then, and how they did everything in their everyday lives. Finding the Lost Greek city was very important because it tells you that people lived long ago. Finding it shows you how they built their walls, how they made their homes. Finding that city tells us how life was for those people in their everyday lives                          Studying the Incas shows us how they recorded data, how they communicated, and lived their lives everyday. Finding artifacts will tells us what they used to cook, hunt, bathe, and use the restroom. Studying the Incas shows us how we improved, how they improved, how they survived, and how they lived. Studying their lives may show us how they worked, what kind of jobs they had, what kind of buildings they lived in, what their homes were like.                         Mesa Verde National Pak Ancestral Puebloans and their world is very important too. Finding this tells us how long people were in North America before Europeans. Finding and studying their lives tells us how they lived and worked to improve their lives. Studying their lives tells us they lived in pithouse from A.D 550 to A.D 750. Studying their lives tells us just how much life has changed since they were around .

Item_Response: The Importance on our Past                There are many different cultures and groups that are important to learn throughout history.  Many people could learn from them and see how we humans have evolved throughout the years.  I am going to explain why it is important using the Inca and the Puebloans as examples.            The Inca of Peru, were known to rule a South American empire for almost a hundred years.  They do amazing art work and are very imaginative.  For example, the Inca have created a record calendar using colorful strings to help keep count of livestock called quipus.  You can also see by the way they do their architecture, agriculture, and government.  Some of what scientists know about them have come from stories that have been passed down each generation to generation.  They are still trying to uncover their past by looking at the many artifacts that have been left behind, though some have been stolen, because of its value, by treasure hunters and looters.            The first ancestral Puebloans, meaning 'village dwellers' in Spanish, were found in Mesa Verde at around A.D. 550.  They were known as skilled basket makers that lived in pit houses.  These people have been evolving themselves by changing the way they do things over time.  For example, the thing that they have changed the most might have been their houses and how they would build them differently to make more efficient for living.  They went from the pit house when they first started out, to the kivas in A.D 750, back to the cliff alcoves in A.D 1200.  We can look at them as an example to try and make our lives better by evolving in our own lives and not having to do the same thing over and over again.            History isn't just reading about the things people have done in the past.  I have been hearing students say over and over again, why we have to take it as a class.  It is so we can learn about those people and try not to follow their mistakes if they have one any.  Anyway, history can be fun and see what kinds of things have been improved over time.  Everyday, people have been thinking of great ideas on how to make our life easier, safer, and, and more efficient.  For example, the Inca were smart and imaginative group of humans that used things in a way that we wouldn't have, like the knots of string.  We can see all around us that we can be just like those people that we have learned today to make our future generation better than what we might have now.

Item_Response: Have you ever wonder what our ancestors were like? Or how they lived, how civilized were they? Well archaeologist have studied many different tribes. One of them were the ancient Inca of  Peru. They are kind of  a mystery archaeologist were very interested in their history. The Inca once ruled an South America empire. The Inca left many clues of their art, architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and their ways to live. Most of what found came from stories they left.                            Archaeologist found many clues that the Inca left behind. One of the were quipus. Quipus knotted colored strings used to keep a record of livestock. One of the first Europeans to them were shocked that they used strings to keep their empire going. They also found letters and diaries from Spanish soldiers and priest who went to visit them in 1532. The archaeologist had to be careful when they read them because they had to remember that the Europeans did not speak the Inca language nor did the Spaniards. Also most of the stories were more like stories then history. Archaeologist found a lot about their religion. They say that they left a beautiful portrait of their god. Some also say that they lived in areas so that could worship they may have praised some mountain peaks.                            The Inca live high up in Andes. They were buried in caves in cliff faces. Some Inca's were buried with their treasure. Some of the Inca believed that what ever they buried them with would go with them to heaven. Many tomb did not fall apart. Most of their thing were in good condition because of the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or maybe because of the cold mountains of the Andes. Archaeologists got most other studies from artifacts. Inca's made most of their artifact out of stone, pottery, gold, or silver like most ancient civilizations archaeologist think. Now it come to the end of the Inca fall.Although they were not able to find the origins of the Inca archaeologist found the fall of the Inca's empire date easily. The Inca empire ended in 1532 because the Spaniards killed the last king of the empire and took over.                               I learned lots about the Inca empire. How t e lived. And their way of life. I think that the way the atchaeoogits describe them they must of been fasinated by them. I would like to know more about the Inca empire.

Item_Response: Lost civilizations are often difficult to find, learn about, and share. Three of these 'lost civilizations' include the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. These three civilizations are significant because they all contributed something important to the human race and proof is rare.        The Inca worked well with things normally used for a simple task such as string. This was very important because this enabled them to make knowledge of a simple resource and use it to their advantage. This civilization was able to keep count of livestock by placing a colored string on them. The Inca also left pottery, stone, silver, and gold behind. This showed that they were skilled enough to find valuable materials, create art to trade, and hide their important things. Inca people were often buried with their belongings. This helped prevent stealing to a certain extent as well as confusion and fighting amongst the other Inca members.        The Puebloans were very skilled builders who built very detailed stone communities. This allowed them to stay safe from outside attacks and were able to move easily and resettle. Having this skill might be important because in case of emergency, they might have had to know an easy way to save themselves. This was also very helpful in the sense of outdoor materials. This lead them to know what they could or could not make a community out of, how well it would work, and how durable it would be. Puebloans produced the finest of expressions of the human race and that made them well known and admired. Kivas might helped the citizens to find an easy place for hunting/fishing which made it easy to feed their community and families. These members were able to make fir which was important because it allowed them to stay warm and welcome the village (source #2).        Finally, the Pavlopetri were skilled in areas such as ceramics and monument structures. Source #3 states: ''We found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age, which suggested that the settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago, at least 1,200 years earlier than originally thought,'' This, to me, means that this civilization was very experienced in trade and elegant forms of art from that time frame. This was important because that meant the Pavlopetris were able to trade and move around as much as they wanted. Since the 'ceramics' were found in the sea, that obviously meant they were strong, durable, and hefty which was important for carrying and transporting goods.       For these reasons and many others, I believe the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri were important civilizations.

Item_Response: Information and artifacts found throughout the years at different sites help us learn about how we used to live and how we would've lived if the city's still lived.The three different sources I'm learning about are the Incas, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. They have so many similarities and differences. Learning about the past could help you with your life today. The Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are three very interesting groups and I'm glad I got to learn about them.                                                                                                                                  The Inca were very interesting people. They did not have a formal alphabet or system of writing. They kept records with knots called quipus. They made a lot of pottery and art decorated with pictures and colors. The Fall of the Inca was in the year 1532 when Spaniards murdered the last Inca King and took over. The Inca lived high in the Andes and worshiped some mountain peaks. Most of their sites were in remote, high places. This helped preserve the sites because it was more difficult for looters to get to them. It makes it difficult for archaeologists to get to it though. They have to carry their equipment up and down the mountain, and they have to carry artifacts down the mountain for study. Bodies found in the icy Andes are in such good shape, the archaeologists could even figure out how the person died!                                                                                                                                                 The Puebloans lived about 1,400 years ago, dating long before Europeans explored North America. Puebloans chose Mesa Verde for their home at around A.D. 550 and lived there for more than 700 years. They made elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. They made pithouses In the late A.D. 1200's, they left their homes and moved away. They are known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood.

Item_Response: Have you ever wondered why archaeologists take there job so seriously or why they believe it is so important to find out about the past? Why do they even bother trying to uncover ancient secrets about people living in the past? Is it really that important?                 During the A.D period things were both physically and mentally challenging for the Inca's and the puebloans because they didn't have the advanced technology we have today. During their period of time they had to rely more on nature and outdoor resources versus the food markets and clothing stores we use. The reason archaeologists want to know about their past is because they want to uncover how they lived and what life was like for them.                 First, to discover more about the Inca's or Puebloans land they might visit their ancient homelands to discover what kind of terrain they lived on, how good the soil was for farming or they might even try to find any old ruins they left behind long ago. Just from one visit from their lands archaeologists can discover a whole lifetime of unknown secrets .                 Next, archaeologists find it important to discover the past because they want to know the tools they used or to see what materials they used for houses, clothes, and art such as pottery. Again by visiting their homelands if they find any broken pieces of pottery or any tattered cloth they can learn all the materials they used and how advanced their economy really was.                 In the end an archaeologists job is very important because without them we would not know anything about the past and its people. Although, archaeologists have uncovered a lifetimes worth of secrets, their is still so much that needs to be learned.

Item_Response: Why are the discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri so important? They play a huge role in discoveries of ancient civilization. The Incas had no formal alphabet system or system of writing. Puebloans are known as basketmakers for their skill at the craft. The marine geologists that studied the Lost City of Atlantis are known as Pavlopetri.            The Incas did not leave archives for historians to study. Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. By studying these clues, archeologists and others can piece together details of Inca life. Passing on stories was an important way to perserve a community's history. The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts, or objects that they left behind, and from the sites where the artifacts are found.            This was a very important time for the Basketmakers, and their population multiplied. They began to built houses above ground, with upright walls made of poles and mud. From here on these people are known as Puebloans, the spanish word for 'village dwellers.' By A.D. 1000 the peopole of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful masonry. walls of thick, double-coursed stone often rose two or three stories high and were joined together into units of 50 rooms or more.            Explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archeologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts say.

Item_Response: Discovery of the Ancient cities          How do we know about a civilization that for nearly a hundred years ruled a South American empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome? The Inca left clues behind that form an amzing portrait of their religion, art, and architecture, agriculture, goverment, transportaion, and a way of life. Archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca life by studying these clues. Some of the stuff we know about them, comes from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation. We know some of the stories because they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1852. The rest of our knowledege comes from artifacts and from the sites where they found. The artifacts were made out of stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Such materials last a long time, even if they have been buried for hundreds of years. Some of the textiles and clothing have survived remarkably well. Usually they would have been destroyed by dampness, but they were preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes.             About 1,400 years ago, before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home.Archeologists have called these people Anasazi, from the Navajo word sometimes translated as ' the  ancient ones' or ' ancient enemies.' The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They were known as the Basketmakers for their skill at the Craft. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usuall built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff reccess. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl. About A.D 750 they began building houses above gorund,with upright walls made of poles and mud. By A.D 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry.             The site straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the Southern Pelloponnesse, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Although discovered by a British oceanographer some 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine archeologists, aided by digital technology, were able to properly survey the ruins

Item_Response: Finding new ancient sites are amazing. They can help us learn about how people lived in the past, learn about what they wore and how they lived, and they can see where they lived. The discovery of these Ancient Civilizations will help us learn more about them.       The Incas were a civilization that lasted from 1438-1532. They lived in the high mountain tops of the Andes. They also did not have a writing system, but made knots in colored string called quipus. Their ancient clothes have been preserved by the dry deserts and the cold mountains.       The Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde and lived in pithouses. The puebloans were very skilled basketmakers. They were formely nomadic, but began to have a settled way of life. They used farming a lot more than hunting. They also aquired the bow and arrow, which was more efficient than the atlal, a spear thrower.       The Peloponnese people live in southern Peloponnese. They lived in a world filled with courtyards, main streets, buildings, rock-cut tombs, and religious. They also found many shards of pottery. They from around 2800 to 1200 BC. The city was then submerged around 1000 BC.

Item_Response: For hundreds of years people from all over the world have been searching for lost pieces from the past to learn more about history. Because of those findings we have gotten pieces or starting points for the basis of our technology. Without some of the Incan's highway system we would not have long highways or messaging systems, and without the Puebloans we would not know how to make sandstone or adobe bricks with a unique morder. History has gave us many reference points and examples to show us how to live our lives and advance beyond our technology.   In 1438 to 1532, the Incans ruled most of what is now South America. They made different veriatys of textiles, pottery, jewelry, and buildings. Later in 1532, when the Spaniards arrived, most of the Incans' stuff where looted or disposed of. Now when archaeologists find these, they can understand more about the Incan life styles. Even now we not only get information about the Incan from their stuff, we also get it from Spanish journals or letters. Thanks to the Incans we got a base for our technology that we have now.\   About 1400 years ago, before North America was discovered and explored, people known as the Puebloans inhabited the four corners. They lived in an area known as Mesa Verde (now Mesa Verde National Park). They mostly specialized and are known for their building methods. They built huge walls, diverse housings, and different types of bricks. When a cowboy discovered these structures, study began on it. Now we understand how they made these bricks and what they used them for.   Poeple form all over the world spend their lives searching and studying different artifacts from different civilizations, trying to unlock their pasts. Most of those findings served as a basis for our technology we have now. Without some of the Incan's highway system we would not have long highways or messaging systems, and without the Puebloans we would not know how to make sandstone or adobe bricks with a unique morder. Thanks to the past we have a better view of the future.

Item_Response: The world has changed in many ways thanks to othere cultures and what they have left behind and done for us. They show us many diffrent things in many diffrent ways. Here are three examples on how the world has changed and how they have with the ruins and artifacts of ancient cities.                      The ancient Inca city is very important to show what we have evolved from doing and how we have changed. First there from the same place were are in North America. So they show us a lot about ourselves. They were an ancient city that was conqured and vanished into thin air. They left behind many ruins and artifacts about what they did. It gives us history and facts about what they did and how they did things. They sacrficed people for the gods and they worshiped the gods. They showed us how skillful they were and how they made beautiful crafts and showed us languages they spoke and how there everyday lives were.                     They Peubloas showed us a lot too. They were an indian tribe in North America. They lived in buildings know as pithouses. They traveled a lot and hunted for food. They hunted with a bow and arrow. Which is where we get it from today in our lives. They also gathered food. They were skilled pottery makers and still have art in our lives today. They left no written records but there structures are still meaningful and shows there skillful crafts and how they lived on the difficult land. There are still descendants of the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde in todays life.                       The ancient lost city of Atlantis still haunts many archeologist. They found an under water city and still today they think its Atlantis but are not 100 percent sure. They do however learn a lot from the culture. They have many things like artifacts and crafts that show the life before us and show what and how they did things. They left behind buildings, paintings, documents and many other things that are useful to ourselves in todays life. They also showed daily life and how to not make mistakes twice. As you can see there are a lot of things we learn from other ancient cities that aren't even here anymore. All you have to do is open your eyes and look for them.

In Inca they found very old cloth preserved by the cold mountains of the Andes. Item_Response: The history of these people is amazing. The Inca of Peru had no record that we could understand or read. They didn't have a writen laungage. The Europeans that had came for rthe first time were amazed how this empire could run of nots in string. The important clues that they had left behind are very important because then we have some kind of an idea how these people lived and goverened themselves. The Inca had lived in the high tops of the Andes mountains in very remote places, making it hard to find and have excavation camps. bbut the good thing is that in the colder climates helps presever people that have died and artifacs.      The ancestral Puebloans where masketmakes and very good craftsmen. They lived in Mesa Verde by the four corners. they lived in pithouses and much smaller villages than the Inca did. These people had reached in population to several thousand between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300 they than bagan to make bigger houses because of the so many people they had in a village.      In the 1880's many local cowboys had reported cliff dwellers. Archeologists have wanted to better understand these people but the remains are alittle sketchy. Many say that we will never truely know why, and how they lived there, but people still today are looking of answers.

Item_Response: Inca of Peru had no actual form of alphabet or writing systems. But there is one downside to this. They didnt leave any archives for historians to study. One of the things the Incas did was they tied knots in coloresd strings called quipus, This is the what they used as a calender and they also used it to keep track of their livestock. someof the first people to meet the Incas were Europeans and they were amazed at how huge their empire was and all they did was use strings to keep track of the days and their livestalk. the quipus have been found by many archaeologists but they still to this day don tknow what the knots mean. The reason why is because there is no one that can read how the knots and colorful strings are used to keep the track of time.   A lot of what we have learned about the Inca have come from stories passed on thropugh generation. Some say that the passing of the stories was a way they think that kept the communtiys history. Other then the stories a lot of other things we know about the Inca is from the artifacts that they left behind. Lot of what we have found they think is made of stone.   High in the Andes is where most of the Incas lived. IF not located there then they are located in other remote high cliffs. They found many bodies of them burried in cliff faces. The only bad thing is this brings the job of the archeaeologist up to a more dificult level. The reason why is because they have to carry all of their equipment up the mountain with them making it more dificult to climb.

Item_Response: Archaeologists are very interested in the ancient civlization of the Inca empire and their ways of life. Livivng in the high Andes Mountain in Peru was a smart idea because no one could get to them and they were isolated until the Spaniards came and took over the empire. The Inca were very smart when in came to keeping track and keeping a good empire; which is why archaeologists are so interested in their civilization.        The reason archaeologists do what they do is because they love finding more out about the past because we can repeat the past but under certain cercumstances we don't because it could put the United States in trouble. The Inca ran a well organized empire and thats what  make them so interesting because they didn't use techniques like other civilizations used in that time period. The Inca tied knots in string to keep track of cattle, crops, food supply, money and many other things, but archaeologists dont know what the knots mean. No one today has any thing to do with the Inca or have any Incan blood in them to help find out more about them.       The Incas aren't the only civilization that archaeologists are interested in finding more about. There are the Puebloans are also another civilization that archeologists are still finding more and more about eveyday. The Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde, which means green table, in about A.D 550. They were also known as Basketmakers for their skills and craftsmanship. They did the usual, farming, hunting and gathering as their everyday routine; they lived a more settle way of life. They lived in villages and in those villages were their homes that they called pithouses. They're called pithouses becasue their living room sunk in a few feet into the ground and four corners supported the roof. The firepit had air deflectors and the house alose had antechambers.       These civilizations are all important to archaeologists to uncover the past and the help see what we have in store for the future.

Item_Response: The past of humanity all leads up to the ancient civilizations of the past. By understanding the ancient cities and looking at their articrafts, we have unlocked so many secrets from our past. Whether its finding temples or lost articrafts, to finding out  how our past generations lived in this world.                One of the biggest purposes of finding ancient civilizations is by learning the ways of our past generations.In the past the Incas knots in colored strings called quips. It was a calendar to keep records of events. By investigating our ancestors methods of living a daily life, we have figured out how we have evolved from that and how we have changed our world.The same with human evolution. We got from apes to educated humans.                 Another reason for finding civilizations from the past is for learning the techniques they once used. The ancientt humans back then didn't have any technology. Today, all we rely on is on technology. For having cars, phones, computers, and you may even be using technology when you don't realize it. But back then how did they survive without using any technology. They used baskets for getting food, spears for weapons, ropes for specific use, and gold for treasure. In Mesa Verde the puebloans used pit houses for relaxing. It was more of a living room for most of them.                  So as we know more about our past, we know more about ourselves and how we evolved from that. Revealing the past is like uncovering the secrets of humanity, and yet humanity is still evolving each day.

Item_Response: We may not think of it very often, but without the discoveries we have made about the Inca, the Pueblos, and the Pavlovian, we would not know how technology has evolved or where it came from. Each ancient civilization played a very important key role in the change we have had in technology over time.             The ancient Inca of Peru lived high in the Andes mountain range where the climate would get extremely cold. Each civilization had their own ways of worshiping and had their own beliefs of what one should do with a dead body, whether they believed in the concept of the afterlife or not. In the Inca's case, dead bodies were simply buried in the surface of the mountains where they were well-preserved. When experts discovered these bodies in such good condition, their first question was how these people died and were able to use modern medical scanning equipment to figure it out. This way, medical experts can discover what diseases may have hit the Incas.             The First Ancestral Pueblos of Mesa Verde were formally nomadic but began to lead a more settled lifestyle. They were originally hunters, but evolved to farmers. As they settled, they began to adapt to their new lifestyle and started to build houses called pit houses in small villages and got more crafty since that they had one place to be. They were known for their skills in basket making, making pottery, and acquiring the bow and arrow and spear. By archeologists discovering these ancient artifacts, we piece together how we got the structures of our homes today; where they evolved from and maybe even where we got the idea from to make the modern weapons we use today.            The discovery of Pavlovian, the sunken city beneath the seas off of southern Greece also know for the fable of Atlantis, dates back to at least five thousand years ago. This once lively city takes up 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor and is thought to have sunken around 1000 BC. While marine archeologists dove down to search this city for any lost items that may still be in good enough condition to study, they found roads, thousands of broken pieces of pottery, religious structures, ceramics, and courtyards. These findings can help us understand the religion that the ancient people followed and the use of technology that they already had before us.            Our discoveries of the ancient Inca, the first ancestral Pueblos, and the Pavlovian helps us to figure out where all of our modern day technology started from. Without our findings of all the ancient artifacts, we would be lost in thought about where it all came from. From the way that dead bodies were buried to how their architecture influenced our modern architecture today, the ancient people really did play a key role in history.

Item_Response: Have you ever wondered how do we know so much about the past? How is it thats archeologists make these predictions about the past? First, archeologists are people who study ancient artifacts. Know that you know this, archeologists get sent to a specific location where ancient civilisations were located at. Now they dig up objects that give them clues about how that specific civilisation lived. They look at the material they are made out of, how they are made, and why they are made. Once, they obatain this information they will get how they lived.             Let's take a look at how the ancient Incas lived. Some of these civilisations were located at the mountains or at the coasts of Peru. Knowing the location of the civilisation will give up information about what they coulod've eaten or harvested. also this can explain how they got their materials to creat their clothes and pottery.            Also, another great ancient civilisation was the Puebloans. This civilisation was known for its hunting skills and because they were nomadic. They created an efficient weapon for hunting called the atlatl. This weapon was also know as a spear thrower, which made catching their pray easier.             Finally, an important civilisation thought of as a myth is Atlantis. this civilisation was thought of as a myth due to the fact that people thought cities couln't be floating water. But scientists have found walls and even buildings under the deep, deep ocean. This has many people amazed at how this city was created there, how did they live there and what did they do, and why it end up in the bottom of the ocean.              To sum up, archeologists are making new discoveries on ancient civilisations and will keep finding more. Archeologists might even end up lokking on how our culture worked and what our life styles were like.

Item_Response: Each civilization is unique and explains an old way of life that was once very modern. The discovery of the ancient Inca, Puebloan, and Pavlopetri civilizations are important because they provide a look at our past and how people lived thousands of years ago.       The Inca civilization is important because from it, archaeologists can learn about why they lived in the Andes mountains and how they used to adapt to life. The incans were good farmers and weapon builders. Archaeologists have found well preserved bodies, artifacts, weapons, and evidence of crops and farms. From this, the world can learn about how the past used to be and how different we are today.       The Puebloan civilization is a unique discovery and is important because it used to be a well developed and successful society. Puebloans had great arcitectural achievments and tools. Archaeologists have found many artifacts and clues to allow them to be able to solve the mysteries of other civilizations.       The Pavlopetri civilization is a huge deal because it proves that there may be other underwater cities and societies. The civilization is still preserved and allows a look at an old Greek way of life. Archaeologists can relate this civilization to other Greek civilizations and solve clues that they were unable to do before.       The Inca, Puebloan, and Pavlopetri civilizations have allowed archaeologists and the world to know more about our past and what we can do to make our future better.

Item_Response: In the articles, ' Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past by Beth Gruber and 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World' by Roy Anderson, we, as a socitey can thoroughly understand the importance of found discoveries made by Archaeologists and Historians.           Artifacts founded by archaeolgoists have greatly impacted our society today. As we look back on past civilizations that have come before us, we can identify that some of things that we do to this day have originated from such societies as the Incas, the Puobelans, and the Pavloetries. For example, Incans made knots in colored strings to record the calender and keep count of their. Little dow e know, we could have been using the exact same stuff as them, but in a more advanced and technological way.         In addition, in the article 'The First Ancestral Puebloans in Mesa Verde' the author states that, 'They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow.' We have taken some of the Puebloans' ideas and ways of life and used it in our own lives in a more advanced way that can be more beneficial towards us and what our society consists of.         Another way that we, as Americans have accustomed some of the tools and crafts made by past civilazations are things like houses. In about 750 A.D., Incans began to construct houses of their own by building them above ground with upright walls made of poles and mud. Becoming more and more advanced, the civilazations' homes were constructed in a similar way as ours are today. Meaning that we most likely have used their ideas and ways of life and have gone based on that but more advanced in new ways.         All in all, the fact that Historians and Archaeologists have been continually discovering more artifacts and past civilazations is a beneficial thing for our socitey so we become more aware and knowledgable on where we jhave accustomed some tings that we still use today.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavloperti and very important for several specific reasons.         The Inca civilization gives clues about life today. They had many different artifacts such as quipus that are important because we have evolved from that and developed a number system to keep track. However, the ancient Inca's did not had an alphabet or a number system.         The ancient Puebloans built houses that probaly have influenced todays house building. Todays homes are made up of several differeent materials, but they used to be made up of poles and mud. We may not have shelters today if the Puebloans hadn't began making these houses.        The Pavloperti was an extraordinary towm with buildings, courtryards, tombs, streets, religious structures, and pottery.

Item_Response: The ruins and remains of civilizations which lived thousands of years before modern times can help teach scientists and archaeologists about life in those times. Ancient buildings, pottery, and clothes can help us learn about the religion and life of those times. When archaeologists discover artifacts and ruins, they can find their depth in the ground to see their age. The deeper the object, the more time dirt and sand have to cover it. Therefore, the object is older. This is called carbon dating.        Ancient artifacts and ruins help us learn the lifestyle of the people who lived in them. Archaeologists can learn about the general life of people, their government, religion, and the roles of different classes of people.        Ancient ruins may help humans in the future, as we can learn from the mistakes of past civilizations. We may learn both the actions we should make, and how they may help or hurt society.
